author: {'steamid': '76561198041183873', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2048, 'last_played': 1690029377}
review:
basically mount and blade if it was space ships, only downside is that because the game is all singleplayer, the AI calculations are screwed in the computers favour, for example, it gets free fleets in systems at game start that defend it as well as entire fleets of ships when the AI faction performs an invasion or at random points in the game for no cost, has no limits on its fleets and any combat between your faction and an AI faction that does not include you have major disadvantages for your faction, even when fleets that are supposedly similar ships wise, go against each other its likely the AI faction wins.

what is supposed to offset that are warlords, collectable named AI ships in the game you can rebuild in your capital system when they die, they also get better ships as they level up and dont count towards your capital ship limit, not much help when the AI can field dozens of capitals if it so desires for no cost and can get more for free, you will be on the backfoot for most of your play through just trying to amass enough ships to do anything meaningful while the AI sends wave after wave at you to reclaim what it has lost, dont even get me started on planet conquest, apparently that can only be done by having a doomsday weapon, like, has no one heard of transport ships or drop pods? i mean that sounds significantly cheaper than a doomsday weapon, 

do i recommend? yes, its good and you will enjoy it until the mid game grind starts when you have a decent ship but it and your AI fleet are still to weak to fight anything so you slog levels and grind missions like no ones business, then end game is more of a waiting game while defending your territory for resources to come in to replace capitals that you WILL lose every engagement unless you play on easy mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045595247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 631, 'playtime_at_review': 4409, 'last_played': 1711798406}

author: {'steamid': '76561198089350994', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 24, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1711389367}
review:
Didn't even finish the tutorial given the control.

Imagine playing with a 3rd person view point while needing to shoot behind (on top or under gives the same problem) you and drive at the same time, not easy in fact apart with two view point it's impossible or pretty hard and since the whole game will be based on this shitty mechanics welle that's not even worth a try.

I know the game is not recent but even in 2017 I think I can find space game with better control.

The worst is the way the game present itself, it's feels like it's trying many things while also saying that the core gameplay should be atrocious. Man, I'm a spaceship if I was a really big one, the control are ok but you don't start as a really big one you're a small or medium one so you're gonna move to chase and dodge (if you can call it dodge) so those type of control will obviously make the game horrible to play.

If you can pass such a turn off or you like this type of unnatural controls, give it a try, maybe you'll like it buyt I don't have the time to try to understand the sick brain of designer who never play their game.

review:
I allowed mixed and limited reviews to deter me from buying this game, thinking it'd be rubbish.

I've actually had fun, 60 hours in a week and a half! It reminds me of Freelancer.

review:
1) This is not a spaceship combat game:
     A) Ship maneuver is too agile and firing rate is too fast; it's more a fighter than a ship.
     B) No momentum; in Space, there is nothing to slow you down, yet in this game as soon as you shut down the engine you are stopped right at that spot.

2) Confusing controls, strange UI, weird camera controls.

Not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066029800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3232, 'last_played': 1710166995}
review:
X4:Foundationsと比較して
1宇宙船:デザインは良いものも多い、ステッカーなどの素敵カスタマイズはこちらの勝利。
操縦性はX4のフリゲートぐらいの機動性を空母でさえも発揮する。これは賛否分かれそう。
また、タレットはX4ほどではないがどこに何を配置するかは選べる。それぞれのタレットやエンジン、航空機格納庫に好きなカスタマイズパーツを装着できるが効果が丸被り、なんなら別のバフ効果も付きつつ数字も高い完全上位互換みたいなパーツも多い。

2戦闘:自分より先に上位艦に乗りやがる味方のネームド様が集中砲火に耐えてくれる事を祈りつつ、姑息に殴る以外に生き残る方法はない。
また、空母の艦載機はX4では自分でも操縦できるような大きな戦闘機を数十機搭載して戦わせる事もできたが、このゲームには戦闘機、迎撃機、爆撃機の3種類のドローンもどきを1枠３～６機程度の3枠しか搭載できない。
そして戦闘機が敵の爆撃機を倒して母艦を守ってくれるとかはない。全部対艦攻撃機みたいなものである。
対空砲も無いので透明になれるスキル持ち出ない場合、死ぬまで敵航空機にハチの巣にされるしかないのだろうか。
3建築:これは建築とは呼べない。MAPは固定で、既存の構造物の配置もおそらく固定。自分の拠点は資源を使ってアップグレードするだけにすぎず、X4のようにモジュールを組み合わせたり、好きな場所に建築することはできない。
4戦略:味方艦隊を別動隊として動かしても、主力艦の所有数制限（なんとたった5隻！）のせいで烏合の衆と化しやすく、結局自分に追従させてワープ（消耗品のワープアイテムでゲートじゃなくてもどこでもドア可能）しまくればよく、戦争時でも攻守共にワンマン経営でなりたってしまう。

総評
X4に比べてチープな操縦性、戦略性、レベル制限のおかげで何度も周回したいとはお世辞にも言えないゲーム。
X4が難しかったり、PCスペック的に厳しいという人になら、おすすめできない。やめておけ。

review:
Salut
Oui Mais ... le jeu en mode histoire est pas mauvais car on y trouve un narratif pas trop dégueu

Il y'a un truc vraiment NUL dans le jeu et ca c'est ce qui m'a fait arreter d'y jouer

2 - Hors Histoire le jeu n'a aucun sens
voilà un 11/20 max car on y passe quand meme quelques bonnes heures
a 10€ ca vaut le coup

author: {'steamid': '76561198054972917', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1708304229}
review:
If you're looking for a relaxing, not overly complicated Eve offline, this may be what you want.
There are a ton of ships to fly, ranging from smaller gunships all the way to titan class vessels. 
The backdrops and environments are varied and beautifully rendered, and the fleet management system isn't complicated at all. 
Once you get used to the controls, which can be a bit jarring at first, this game quickly becomes great, and always gives you something to do. 
Highly recommended for people who don't want to pay for a subscription and just want to fly massive ships in fleet battles, or even doing solo missions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028985024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1704506167}
review:
I love space games ... but not this one.  The controls are abysmal and it takes a tremendously long time to load your game. 

I think for me it's the horrible controls and the amount of time I spent trying to make them work for me not against me that really bothered me.  I couldn't get it even close to correct.  The loading sucks for the obvious reasons.  Dying because struggling of the controls.

The game has potential ... but not for me like this.

review: very disapointing.. perfect example of what happens when you pay 30$ to your cousin to do voice over acting. every interaction feels cringe. the controls are awful and clunky. I have no desire to follow the story as it drags on and I still have no understanding of any of it after 2 hours of gameplay. The customization choice are extremely limited. the ships designs are ugly and limited, their customization is useless. The only good thing is that I paid only 5$ for this game.. but I somewhat regret it anyhow. So many other space games out there where they could have drawn inspiration from. missed opportunity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073001105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 5812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5802, 'last_played': 1706466554}
review:
This is not a difficult game to review. Controller support is broken and they still haven't fixed it after all this time. The game is unplayable because of this. It also means that this game is lying on steam that it has full controller support. It is not reliable enough to make that claim.

Just about every other game can implement controller support that just works out of the box. The developer really should revisit the code but I suspect they simply won't due to a bad attitude. It is unfortunate because to my recollection the last time I could get the controller to work well enough the game didn't seem all that bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198230516088', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1704062605}
review:
For some reason the devs just didn't put in headlights, it's dark as heck in space how do you expect me to see what's in front of me? I shouldn't have to rely on my humanly senses in space if the technology is already there, it just isn't for some reason. I don't recommend using controller unless you're fine with swapping input every time you wanna do something that's not mapped on, I mean it's just not really that fun on the sticks. Camera and movement controls are wonky as hell, you're fighting your ship's positioning while trying to get the camera a better view of the battle.

5̶/̶1̶0̶.̶ ̶g̶e̶t̶ ̶i̶t̶ ̶o̶n̶ ̶s̶a̶l̶e̶.̶ ̶P̶l̶a̶y̶,̶ ̶1̶0̶0̶%̶ ̶a̶n̶d̶ ̶s̶h̶e̶l̶f̶.

1̶/̶1̶0̶,̶ ̶a̶n̶ ̶o̶b̶j̶e̶c̶t̶i̶v̶e̶ ̶b̶u̶g̶g̶e̶d̶ ̶(̶D̶e̶p̶l̶o̶y̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶P̶r̶o̶x̶i̶m̶a̶)̶ ̶a̶n̶d̶ ̶I̶ ̶s̶p̶e̶n̶t̶ ̶a̶b̶o̶u̶t̶ ̶3̶0̶ ̶m̶i̶n̶u̶t̶e̶s̶ ̶k̶i̶l̶l̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶u̶n̶l̶i̶m̶i̶t̶e̶d̶ ̶O̶a̶t̶h̶ ̶r̶e̶i̶n̶f̶o̶r̶c̶e̶m̶e̶n̶t̶s̶ ̶l̶o̶o̶k̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶f̶o̶r̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶"̶S̶u̶m̶m̶o̶n̶"̶ ̶t̶h̶a̶t̶ ̶d̶i̶d̶n̶'̶t̶ ̶s̶p̶a̶w̶n̶.̶ ̶Y̶o̶u̶ ̶c̶a̶n̶ ̶g̶e̶t̶ ̶a̶c̶h̶i̶e̶v̶e̶m̶e̶n̶t̶s̶ ̶w̶i̶t̶h̶ ̶m̶o̶d̶s̶ ̶o̶n̶ ̶-̶ ̶g̶e̶t̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶c̶h̶e̶a̶t̶s̶,̶ ̶s̶p̶e̶e̶d̶-̶r̶u̶n̶ ̶a̶n̶d̶ ̶d̶o̶n̶'̶t̶ ̶l̶o̶o̶k̶ ̶b̶a̶c̶k̶,̶ ̶l̶i̶k̶e̶ ̶y̶o̶u̶'̶r̶e̶ ̶f̶l̶y̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶t̶h̶r̶o̶u̶g̶h̶ ̶s̶p̶a̶c̶e̶.

I take my positive review back, bro. Too bad this never had physical copies, I would have used a disc for my coffee mugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026328168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1039, 'last_played': 1702662128}
review:
Wasn't a fan of SPG2 - clunky controls, warping into planets. But Warlords seems to have been refined. Its a good game overall. There is a lot of empty space and lots of time spent going from A to B. The combat system is still clunky at first and not anything like a typical space fighter shoot em up (e.g Everspace 2, SPG3 etc). However, once you figure things out, its an ok system. 

Story isn't bad, granted I'm still playing through it when I have the time. Mission running gets repetitive which seems to be par for the course with a lot of games these days along with the grind. I ended up cheating and changing my save file to have more money in order to progress in game b/c honestly, I just don't have time (nor the inclination) to turn a game into a second job. 

Had I known this game would've gone on sale for $5 bucks I would've waited. Its a good game to pass the time, but just didn't hook me for much further investment. It does have some depth to it via the tactical map and managing your fleet and taking over territories, so I'll give it that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075527937', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1701886786}
review:
Less than an hour of playtime and I can already tell I want to refund this game. The space combat is very lacking, and not super interactive. Since you are going to be relying on turrets most of the time to aim for you since everything will be off camera. Space combat is the core of the game, so I can see myself getting bored before even reaching the 4X elements which seem to be pretty tedious on top of the already lacking combat and shoddy story.

I was really hoping for more emphasis on the 4X system but it seems I am left disappointed. 

Overall I wouldn't really recommend this game to anyone. I think there are similar games out there that do a better job of what this was trying to achieve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033060110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2942, 'last_played': 1700775955}
review:
Starpoint Gemini Warlords is a space shooter with a third-person view of your spaceship plus other features. There is a tactical management part to the game and a minimal form of RPG. The problem is that it tries to do many things but ends up not excelling at anything because every aspect is treated in a little in-depth way.

[h3]Game Camera (4.5/10):[/h3]
The view, as I wrote, is at a fixed point at a short distance from your spaceship, too close to it, and there are no other views. You can rotate the camera around the ship or move the ship and the camera will follow you. The problem with the camera is that you will often end up not understanding which direction you are going, the only certain reference is the light coming from the engines to know which part of the spaceship you are looking at. I played both with keyboard and mouse and with the joypad, the latter in my opinion is the best solution.

[h3]Space Combat (5.5/10):[/h3]
Whether you're on your own or within a fleet as a leader, you'll feel like you're doing almost everything yourself. It's not that the others aren't there, but you don't feel them fighting, it feels like you're inside a bubble where you can only see your actions. In combat it is better to use automatic turret fire, manual fire is not recommended. You can use four abilities (with cooldown) based on your character's class (which you choose at the beginning), attack with turrets or try to board an enemy spaceship. Being able to capture one depends by skills, research, the equipment of the soldiers, and the class of the two ships. Everything looks good, but if you play it, you will soon understand that after so many hours the combat will become boring, and being an important part of the game, you also understand that the game also becomes boring.

[h3]Tactics/Resource Management (4/10):[/h3]
There is a huge game map (too big) with fog of war. On the map are planets, structures, and military forces. Each facility can give one of the three existing resources (ore, gas and scrap) or something else on a weekly basis. Let me say right away that resources are very scarce, to build and research you need a lot of them; so, the grinding is very high and expect a long time to be able to actively do anything. In the meantime, follow the main campaign or explore to make money and experience... Sounds like fun... True, at least until you reach so many hours in the game that make everything extremely repetitive and therefore boring (like the fight). The resources are used to build facility upgrades, for research, and to build spaceships. All of this is done with a game interface that is too simple, all aspects are treated in a rough way, there is nothing that will make you say that you are playing a AAA game.

[h3]Main plot (3/10):[/h3]
I think that is the worst element of the game. I've done a lot of space games, from the various Wing Commanders, Freespace 2, all the various Xs (from X2 onwards). I think this is one of the worst storylines I've ever seen. Not only is it not believable how it develops, but then they force you to go into enemy territory at the beginning when you don't even have a proper spaceship. Generally, the plot develops with missions of increasing difficulty, but here you immediately start and have to do actions for which you have no chance of success. From the beginning you start to see the level of grinding of the game.

[h3]Character Abilities (6.5/10):[/h3]
The RPG part is developed on skills that you can choose, they are used to be able to use certain phrases in the dialogues that unlock bonuses in missions, for tactical management or for combat. I think it is the only part I could give a grade higher than “ok”.

[h3]Game Duration (?/10):[/h3]
I have no idea, I managed to do 49 hours, I couldn't play it anymore; I got nauseous if I thought I had to play this game again. In my opinion, you could do 150 hours or more, if you want to conquer the whole map and only if you want to use your time with a poorly made game like this.

[h3]Final verdict (5/10):[/h3]
From the earlier ratings, it was clear that this game would never get a pass. I recommend to not buy it even with discounts of 80% or more, then everyone is free to do what they want with their own money and time. My experience with this game was a disappointment, I expected it to be like Starpoint Gemini 2 (which I finished), but it is definitely not the same type of game.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198137276185', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1559, 'last_played': 1699106649}
review: I purchased this game at a discounted price, which seemed appropriate given the current state of the game. The gameplay feels quite unrefined and could use more polish, and the user interface follows suit, presenting a rather raw experience. The controls are a particular point of concern and could greatly benefit from more customization options to enhance playability. If these areas are improved, I believe there's potential for the game to be great. As it stands, I'd rate it a 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035010616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 3412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3412, 'last_played': 1698027097}
review:
I really Tried to play this.

It's possible if you just use the map for 90% of it once you get fleet commands. (While you basically do nothing with your actual ship etc.)

However because the controls are so Janky and outdated, actually playing the game is damn near impossible. The developers need to seriously look at a decent game in this genre, and fix their controls. 

The game tries to control like "Freelancer", and Play like a 4x real time. 

Unfortunately, it fails at both, and miserably.

My concensus, is:

"Barely Playable" 

Mainly due to the control schemes and so many other options missing from the game itself, which are all found in other games like this, around the same release time.

The story is also janky, and seems half assed. Even the writing doesn't seem to have been reviewed as there are grammatical mistakes throughout, and while you can follow the story and understand it, it's just in general bad writing.

3/10

I wanted to like the game, I really did. But the Janky Controls and Janky Story ruined it for me.

These developers should have played the "Homeworld" Series, and "Rebel Galaxy" before making this to see how this is supposed to be done.

review:
商店页面显示有中文，就先好评，看卖相可以，估计不赖。

202211下，t a o宝，支付宝红包，杉果，本平台，本平台充值折扣掉卡，indie gala，fanatical，humble，daily indie game，loot boy，它处自定义包入的本体加全dlc约3元。爱人如己，目前就这，看以后追评。有中文的游戏请耐心自研体验乐趣，攻略指南尽量不用。不建议使用外挂，插件，作弊之类的，游戏都要这样搞，那现实里那更是如此了。兄弟萌，强烈建议不要第三方平台的小店买y u额，通过饰品等挂steam市场转的，高概率red信乃至封号，且行且珍惜。

review:
So, great game, can easily lose yourself in it for hours to days at a time, great graphics, the different genras of game tie in well together, my only complaint is how smaller ships are completely redundant, as every ship uses the same weapon sets there is no purpose to the smaller craft existing at all, as the larger ships simply get more of everything, except speed, and that's the same across the board, some balance work to ensure all ship sizes had a role and purpose would be a great thing, maybe in the next title, if there ever is one.

That aside though, it's a good game, go grab it.  ♥

author: {'steamid': '76561198010541939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 777, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1694270086}
review:
Даже в Star Conflict играть интереснее.
Что бы лететь прямо надо опустить нос корабля вниз, если нос будет смотреть прямо то корабль будет лететь вверх.
Что там летает что то там мельтешит, а что ты тут делаешь и на что влияешь не понятно. Какого-либо ощутимого импакта в происходящее не вносишь.
Нет масштабов космоса. Вот ты был у космической станции, вот отлетел немного и уже через десять секунд какой-то квест делаешь. Ощущение что ты не в космосе, а в аквариуме.
Поиграйте лучше в X3 или Starsector.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009449688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1694301466}
review:
This is a terrible, dull, boring game.  I kept expecting it to get better, but it doesn't.  Somewhere around mission 3-4 you have to capture a science station ... except you can't, it's not possible.  A bit of research suggest there is some sort of scripted solution, but good luck figuring it out.  In additional, to an unclear script, you apparently have to have a ship several levels above what you are given.  So, go quest, "go fetch", "go fetch", boring until your eyes bleed.  So maybe you can, hopefully, get the right script elements to pop to get to the next mission, at that point, I assume everything repeats with the next mission.  If you have a kid that hates to do their homework, force em to play this for an hour, they will be begging to do their homework, anything to escape the monotonous boredom.  Supposedly, there is all sorts of "content" here, but it's unavailable.  I tried to explore, but that's forbidden, try to go anywhere and the ship starts to fall apart.

Even better, there doesn't seem to be a way to go full screen, so if you move your mouse too far, it stops registering (still shows, but doesn't move, maybe you get two mouse cursor, or maybe not).  After you play the game (NO MATTER WHAT RES), all your other desktop Windows are resized to what looks like 640x480 (I was playing 1920x1080 on a 4K screen scaled 200%).  The game plays in what looks like a standard window (frame and taskbar visible), but resized all your other windows.

I spend three hours hoping something would get better.  That is apparently 1 hr longer than Steam allows for returns.  I guess Steam reviews are about as useful as Amazon reviews.

If you want a move sand from one hole to another with a teaspoon game, with a closed narrow broken scripting system that fails out of the gate, this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039520093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1690762990}
review:
Not for me. I tried playing both the campaign and a conquest game. The controls are clunky and unintuitive (maybe I would get used to them if I played more). The tutorial in the campaign was alright, though it throws some concepts at you rather quickly, and doesn't seem to explain others (unless I didn't get that far). I got killed in the first chapter after the prologue and wasn't sure what I could do to avoid that happening again. The conquest game was confusing, I didn't know what to do in it (again, maybe I needed to play more of the tutorial). It seemed like I didn't have a goal or a task to complete (maybe you're supposed to make your own?)

On the plus side, I liked the visuals and the sound design. I was also getting into the campaign's story a bit. It feels more like an RPG than a strategy game. Space battles looked cool when I wasn't flinging my ship around wildly.

The learning curve seems to be rather steep at the beginning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198373019882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 99581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 159, 'playtime_at_review': 59281, 'last_played': 1712411661}
review:
Most features of the game has been expressed by other reviewers, just adding how I feel and a little guide regarding the battle controls.
SPG Warlords is an amazing space sim. It is not dog-fighting style flight sim but capital ship with auto-turrets. The game even has in-game video tutorials in its Geminipedia. It is a wonderful game once properly learned.

[b]The Controls:[/b]

People expecting dog-fighting may find it confusing / outright hate it.
1. Toggle to Turret mode. Drag left mouse to change camera angle.
2. Zoom out.
3. Try out vertical inversion & set to your preference.
4. Left right turns.
5. Up down for pitch.
6. Mouse scroll to set speed.
7. Use enhancements to improve speed and maneuverability, mod recommended.

[b]The Battle[/b]

1. Turn on turret Fire at Will.
2. When enemies show up, cycle through enemies with Target Previous Enemy, then hit Target Nearest Enemy. Check ship class, ship number, distance & flight path to decide fight or flee.
3. To fight, pick an enemy, Mark it, your turrets & fleet ships will prioritize it if within range.
4. The idea is to maneuver with the side of your ship of your choosing, usually the side with most number of turrets, to face the enemy ship while keeping optimum distance for your weapons.
5. Switch to a different side to face enemy from time to time to avoid that side of shield to be completely depleted, in which that side of shield will take a few seconds before it can recharge shield again. This also avoid the side of turrets battery from being completely depleted, which also causes that side of turrets to time-out.
6. If enemy ship is encircling you and you could not keep up with changing camera angle to look at the enemy, your ship is either moving too fast or too close to the enemy. Slow down or speed up to steer away to one direction then slow down & turn for second approach.
7. A simple solution to targeting fast moving ships is by grappling them. If your mouse has extra buttons, I highly recommend bind one of them to Grapple.
8. Looking at enemy is not mandatory, your auto turrets will fire at them as long as your are in optimum range by looking at target info on top right and target cursor. So focus on maneuvering, keeping distance and use skills & equipment when necessary.
9. If one side of shield is low, steer away while rolling so that the other side takes the hits.
10. Enemies normally attack the one nearest to each individual ships, by moving away, you let your ally ships share the burden. Like wise, if you want to save a dying allied ship, move in so that you become the nearest ship to that enemy, or use gravity push or pull, or grapple either the enemy or your ally to change the distance.
11. Pick off one enemy at a time. ships with 1% HP can still dish out the same amount of damage of a 100% HP ship (of the same type).
12. Know yourself, know your enemy. Understand the numbers & characteristics of your ships, skills, perks, weapon types, equipment, and try them out at an enemy satellite.

The game is readily moddable and has great replayability with mods. I personally find more than half of the fun & satisfaction is coming from modding: creating new stuffs and making alterations / fixes. [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/starpointgeminiwarlords/articles/1]More on this[/url]

All in all, love the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050554036', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1680709269}
review:
É bom mas tudo é muito Básico

Motivos positivos:
- Cenários bonitos
- Tem uma certa liberdade para montar a sua nave ( Bem limitado )
- Mistura RPG com Estrategia básica

Motivos Negativos:
-  O game é um 4X que falha miseravelmente em entregar algo mais solido, ele tem o 4X mas tudo é muio básico e sem profundidade
- Sistema de RPG tem porem tudo é muito básico e sem profundidade
- Arquivo de ogg da musica de batalha trava o game, tem que fazer maracutaia para não deixar as batalhas com 5 FPS, devs falharam em arrumar algo tão básico
- Os recursos levam horas para se acumular e começar a fazer alguma armada
- Upgrade de recursos totalmente raso e sem noção que no final nem vale apena gastar recurso para ganhar somente 50 a mais em alguma coisa
- Diplomacia é patética ao ponto de nem valer apena o esforço, melhor invadir tudo e já era mesmo que seja " aliado "
- Sistema de Trade entre facção é patética e totalmente básica ao ponto de nem valer apena perder tempo com isso
- Construir gunship, corveta e fragata é perda de tempo, qualquer tier é muito superior ao outro ao ponto de simplesmente valer apena vc estacar o tier mais alto para uma batalha

Minha Conclusão:
Cuidado com analises dizendo que o Game é um " mount and Blade do espaço " porque não tem nada disso dentro do game, não é um game tão ruim assim e até que é legalzinho de jogar porem falha em entregar um 4X/RPG com profundidade e por isso eu vou negativar tendo em vista que a proposta seria essa.


Especificações do meu PC no qual estou jogando esse game:
- 2x16 GB 3600Mhz T-Force Vulcan
- AMD Ryzen 5 5600
- B450 AORUS M,2
- RTX 3060 12GB GALAX
- SSD 250 KingFast
- SSD 1TB X-Ray
- HD 750 Toshiba
- SSD 512 NVMe

author: {'steamid': '76561198096779563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 11834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 974, 'playtime_at_review': 6899, 'last_played': 1712153576}
review:
Man kann in diesem Spiel seine Basis- Raumstation für Schiffsgarage, Erzabbau, Gassammelstation, Handel, Forschungsstationen, Flotte,  Außenhandel und weiteres ausbauen. Seine Erz, Gas, Recycling, Forschungsstationen 
und weiteres bauen und erweitern. Verschiedene Schiffe erwerben. Man kann auch Schiffe kapern. Material sammeln, Aufträge erfüllen, Geld verdienen um neue Waffen und Ausrüstungen zu erwerben. Man kann taktisch mit seiner Flotte andere Territorien einnehmen, um noch höhere Erträge und andere Schiffstypen,  Waffensysteme und Ausrüstung zu bekommen. Es gibt mehrere Fraktionen mit denen man Entweder kämpfen muss oder friedlich bleiben kann. Nur mit friedlichen Parteien kann man Handeln. Das schöne an diesem Spiel ist seine Vielfalt und alle Möglichkeiten die man offen hat, um seinen eigenen Weg zu gehen und seine eigene Strategie erarbeiten zu können. Strategie und Rollenspiel zugleich.

Spieletechnisch läuft alles Einmannfrei.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098677132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1904, 'last_played': 1679297616}
review:
[b]レベルスケーリングと戦力制限が足を引っ張るX4系[/b]

X4: Foundationsをややカジュアルにしたようなゲーム
内政や貿易はおまけ程度に抑え、マップ開拓と部下を率いての艦隊戦をメインに据えている。
そのため宇宙での戦闘を楽しみたいという人にはおすすめ……できないんだなこれが。

問題点
１．[b]レベルスケーリングシステム[/b]
このゲームはレベル制を導入しており、依頼をこなしたり交易で利益を得たりすると
経験値が入りレベルアップし、レベルが上がると艦種が解放され上位の船を購入できるようになる。
[b]だが同時に敵もこちらのレベルに合わせて強化されていく。[/b]
最終的には辺境の海賊の拠点ですら
ドレッドノートや戦闘空母が当たり前のように出てくる修羅の世界と化す。
強くなる敵に対抗するためこちらもより強い船や装備へのアップグレードを常に強いられるので
お気に入りの船でのんびり遊ぶ、等という事はほぼできない。

２、[b]戦力制限システム[/b]
プレイヤーだけが強くなっても数で囲まれて集中砲火を受けるとあっさり沈む。
なのでこちらも艦隊を用意して対抗する必要があるのだが
なんとこのゲーム、ステラリスのように戦力制限が設定されている。
これはアップグレードで拡張できるからまだいいが、問題なのは[b]主力艦制限[/b]
この世界ではプレイヤー勢力は戦艦以上の大型艦は五隻までしか製造してはいけないという
謎のルールが存在しているのだ[strike]なんでそんなルール守らなきゃいかんのよ[/strike]
この主力艦制限を緩和するにはプロキシマという惑星破壊砲みたいな超兵器を開発して
敵対勢力の惑星を制圧して滅亡させる必要があるのだが
そうすると[strike]アメリカみたいな[/strike]正義の超大国みたいなところが
「そんな非人道的な破壊兵器の製造を見過ごすわけにはいかない」とか言って問答無用で宣戦布告してくる。
……いやどうしろと。

総評
常に自分側に重しがつくので互角或いは劣勢の殴り合いを楽しみたい人にはお勧めのゲーム。
[b]俺は戦うのが好きなんじゃねえんだ…。勝つのが好きなんだよォォッ！！[/b]という人にはお勧めしない。
私は頑張ったけれど合いませんでした。

author: {'steamid': '76561198052770789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 4921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4367, 'last_played': 1705296259}
review:
This game is fantastic. If you are a fan of games like Homeworld, Eve, the X-series (though I was greatly disappointed by 4), etc- You will like this game. 

This is a true sandbox experience (with optional story line). You start out with a bare bones station next to a planet, a few defenders, some money and a ship. From there, the massive open Universe is yours, complete with factions, hazardous zones, planets, asteroid fields that range in danger, pirates, cartels... the list goes on. 

From there, you can approach the game however you want. You can be a freelancer who completes missions for pay, with increasing payouts as you upgrade your ship, mine for resources, you can do supply/demand trading in an open and changing economy, you can sit back and broker trade deals as a politician while sending your fleets to secure your borders, hunt bounties, assist other factions, complete hostile take overs and just buy area's of space that you want!.. you never even have to fire a shot if you dont want to- just send your fleets to do the work for you! There's a full battle system in place on your interactive map that will allow tactical analysis of battles that you can send orders through and strategize to your hearts content. 
Or you can work your way up to being an admiral with your own Capital ship (destroyer, drednaught, titan) who leads the charge yourself. You can manually fire your weapons, or set them to auto fire with you just controlling the heavy weapons! The point is that you are free to do whatever you choose in this game.

Alternatives to combat are:
Mining
Shipping
Trading
Smuggling
Salvaging
Missions
Repairs
Exploring
Diplomacy
The list goes on and on, and the modding community makes the options endless. 

This is a wonderful game and deserves a look if space action/strategy is your thing!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992024674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 2743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2743, 'last_played': 1544364465}
review:
It's a bit of a mid game, let that be perfectly clear, but i really enjoyed it. It's a starship game with some 4X elements tacked on that mostly act as a sort of secondary skill/upgrade tree. The story is nice, though some missions are certainly more interresting than others. The ship variety is pretty good and it gives you that nice tiny ship to massive capital ship progression. Overall a very compact, generally well made experience.
If you're like me and looking at the X4 station designer gives you a headache, this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134473555', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1936, 'last_played': 1679837997}
review:
Globalement un très bon jeu. 

Beau, riche en possibilités de mener sa partie (rien que par les choix de talents et dans les discussions) et en customisations de notre vaisseau.
Longue durée de vie, peut être recommencé plusieurs fois pour tester avec les différentes classes.
Le vol est agréable et je me surprends encore après déjà de longues heures sur SG2 à contempler le décor.

La dimension macro-gestion des zones sous contrôle est un peu pour faire joli parce que sans grand intérêt de gameplay. On fait des clicks et ça donne des récompenses. Voilà.
Le choix dans les vaisseaux est un peu plus restrictif que dans SG2.
Quelques bugs désagréables, qui disparaissent en rebootant le jeu.
Manque un peu de tutos ou d'indications pour savoir comment avancer plus vite, être plus efficace dans sa progression. Les "quêtes" de la storyline ne suffisant pas à tout comprendre. Mais on apprend sur le tas au final.
J'aurais apprécié avoir des touches sur les appuyer pour lancer les compétences plutôt que cliquer.

Si vous avez joué aux précédents Startpoint Gemini ou êtes en quête d'un simulateur de vol et de combat de vaisseaux spatiaux, c'est définitivement le jeu qu'il vous faut.

Merci de m'avoir lu et bonne bourre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075465560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1523, 'last_played': 1678056627}
review: A very cool mix of RTS or 4x depending on how you look at it, and in cockpit space combat. it's rough around the edges and combat was frustrating for me until I changed my view of what I was supposed to be doing. It's not really a dog fighter where you are lining up your shots and taking things down. It's more of sit and let the auto cannons do it's work while you manage your shields and speeds. Your not going to be steering the ship or doing risky maneuvers to avoid fire. Once I figured this out it made the game much easier to play and understand. It's a management space sim (like stellaris)  of sorts with a third person view instead of managing from the top down. You are actually in combat assisted by your fleet and I love that. Forgot to add, it is VERY GRINDY.. OMG IS IT GRINDY.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987292682', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 320, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1187, 'last_played': 1668914719}
review:
I don't mean to trash this game, as it has many good aspects, but the gameplay didn't click with me. The game claims to be a "simulator", but it isn't. It's a space themed RPG with 4X aspects, but the way you control your ship doesn't feel like a simulator at all. Combat is awkward, you really can't aim or control what you're doing, the maximum camera distance is too close to the ship to have any tactical understanding of what's going on, and the way the player impacts the outcome of battles is by activating rpg like "powers" (cloaks, killer shots, doubles of your ship that will attract enemy fire, all "magical" and nonsensical). Combat, to sum it up, is more similar to WoW, where you didn't need to aim your blows and everything was stats related, than to anything that can be called a simulator.

As another negative aspect, one of the coolest parts of the gameplay, the fact you can board and take over enemy ships, is hampered by the general messiness of combat, it's really hard to see what's going on with your marines, and give orders to them, while at the same time flying a ship that's firing its turrets to enemies out of your field of view.

The amount of control you have over your fleets is also lacking, you can order them around in the map, but you really can't give them orders while in ship view, and then the only orders you can really give your fleets is "go here and fight anything you encounter". You can't tell your fleet to prioritize what enemy to attack, you can't give different orders to different classes of ships, just blob and send them to fight. Numbers always win.

However, if you enjoyed previous Starpoint Gemini titles, or like a light real-time space 4X, this game might be up your alley. The 4X also has some issues, there are many better examples of the genre out there, but the fact that you can pilot a capital ship, do missions like in freelance (or any other similar space game) and manage a faction in a complex, "alive" universe, really is compelling. It's just that the ship control and rpg, skill based combat, kills it for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016822174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1676681882}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997782129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 1035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1035, 'last_played': 1675246587}
review:
In an endless sea of games reminiscent of the 'X' games and Freelancer, you'd expect Starpoint Gemini Warlords to try something daring and new, but after a while it all becomes too repetitive. Sure, there're plenty features, but they never feel fully realized. While I appreciate the thought put into the trading system and the many ships that can be traded, however, the game falls short of actually giving an in-depth experience. 

Can you buy new weapon systems? Yes you can. Can you transfer modifications from an old ship to a new one? Absolutely not. Can you create a fleet to escort you on your missions? Of course! But when they ultimately get obliterated in one unfortunate combat with poor planning, it's gonna take you hours to get that fleet back.

Is the space combat fun? Kinda. Is is worth the time spent on it? No.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995896403', 'num_games_owned': 3052, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 1389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1298, 'last_played': 1675303900}
review:
okay, an easy one...
My first few hours with the game was played with a controller. The Controller feels terrible, and all the adjusting in the world wont change that. I put the game down, suuuuper annoyed for a while. Buuuut as I tend to do, I came back around and decided to give the game another shot, but with Mouse and keyboard this time.

It feels awesome lol.

This gme is no X4, but it's still very much worth your time. There is a lot to do here, including a "Conquest" mode which I am always a sucker for in various games that offer it. As I said before, it's no X4 buuuuut it definitley holds it's own, being a varied unique experience as a "third person shooter" mostly, but it does also provide the command abilities that you would expect from a "freelancer-esk" experience.

To sum it all up, this is very much a you play as a freelancer taking various jobs, leading to you building up some sort of business. It comes packed with pretty extensive story campaigns that kind of play as tuorials(just as Full fledged campaigns based around various characters and goals).

HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963792671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1674310601}
review:
This games.. mid-game? End-game? Whatever.. is just a boring grind. It starts off strong with a story that sends you places to do this and as you upgrade your ship you feel you're progressing. But then it just runs face first into a wall at the point where you're supposed to build the big planet destroying ship. The amount of resources that things research takes is mad. I'm pretty sure I'd be able to conquer half the map before I had enough resources to finish it. But I'm not even going to bother as that's far too much effort.

Also I quickly read up on what the next story steps involve after this maddening grind is finished and that is just lazy.. The game might offer some enjoyment as you build up. But once you enter the stage of the game where it should open up it just serves up an endless boring grind. So maybe worth it at a steep discount or if you want to do something utterly monotonous for days on end. Otherwise meh..

author: {'steamid': '76561198142361346', 'num_games_owned': 789, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3416, 'last_played': 1684310437}
review:
If you love playing Freelancer, you might like this game. I have been searching for a game that come close to the standard that Freelancer set years ago. This game did just that with some flaws. I am very hesitate to give this game a thumbs down because it did tried it best. It was a great attempt and I am looking forward to more improving in the next one.
I wanted to make a pros and cons list but every good thing about this game comes with something bad. So here is the run down:
- LOVE the idea of boarding an enemy ship and having a chance at capturing the ship for resource, money, or to build one yourself. Hate how tedious it is. The boarding process is a minigame itself, and you have to be close enough to do it. Which means you have a choice: Enjoy the cool space battle or board the ship. Boarding ship takes time during a battle and distract you from the battle. And after a while, it really gets super board-ring and made me wish there is an auto boarding option so I can spend more time fighting and less time boarding. (You don't have to always board during fights, but you miss out on resources, new ships, etc.)
- LOVE the idea of capturing planets and turning it into something similar to Sins of a Solar Empire where you capture sections of the map for resource, build buildings in them, and contest them. Hate how weak the mechanic is. Fleet limit so small that in high difficulty, you spend more time defending your many fronts than you do expanding your empire. It doesn't helps that "quick travel" using gateways aren't that useful because the game choose where you can build them. It hard to enjoy a large map when it takes so long for your ships to move any where on it.
- LOVE the more detailed equipments. Similar to Freelancer, you can upgrade your grabling, your engine, etc. But all equipment upgrades are so shallow and vague. Half of the stats on the equipments aren't listed. For example, take 2 railguns, one of them have a higher dps listed than the other. So naturally you would want the one with higher dps right? Well.... if you look at the game file, you will see the higher dps gun have lower shield dmg than the other one. So realistically, the other one is a better gun. But there is no way to tell in game. The gun list 1 single number and does not break down shield vs hull dmg. Same with enhancements, not enough varieties. In Freelancer, every station sells a different equipment, ship, weapon based on their location, type of station, and faction. In this game, you really don't care about any station or planets. There is none of that fun feeling of discovering a new planet and getting excited to dock so you can look at the cool new things they offer. Because at the end of the day, your HQ have everything you captured. Took the fun out of finding new planets.  And to make it worst, all the endgame weapon you can have from just doing endgame research that takes a ton of resource. There is no need to go find endgame weapon in dangerous areas through enemy drops or docking into a station/planet in high level area. In the end, there is only 1 right way to build your ship (no matter which ship you choose to fly). Absolutely no room for creative build.
- Leveling sucks. But not the way you think. The game give you experience for anything you do, from making money, to doing repetitive quests, to killing random enemies. On my first playthrough, I went for a couple trading runs and found I can shot up in level very quickly. Why is that a problem? Because in most games, when the enemies get tough and you have a hard time progress, you take a moment to do some resource farming so you can buy better equipment, but not this game. Your money making will level you up. So enemies continue to scale a head of you and there is no way you can catch up to it. Because if you farm money to buy better ships and equipment, guess what, that money caused you to jump in level and now enemies are now stronger than the upgrade you were planning to buy for yourship. So your best bet is to do trading runs until you can get the best endgame equipment before you starts some real space fights.
- Space fights. I wanted to love it but man does it suck. The mechanic of this game made the spacefights into a war of attrition. Your ship piloting skill will not let you win against a strong enemy. You simply cannot take down a Dreadnought while flying a gunship. The shield, hull, etc scaling is too strong. Which is realistic, but also means that in this game, you can't choose between which ships you want to fly, eventually you will have to go with the tankiest, most weapon slots ship if you want to progress. Although there are a variety of ships, in the end you really only have 2 or 3 choices. And if you google what is the best Dreadnought, there is one clear answer. I wish the fights were more interesting, more dodging, more skill, but it pretty much just line up and spam heavy weapon until someone go down.
- Looting is by far the worst thing ever. When ship dies, it drop loots. But sometimes it also drop derelic. and if you want to loot the derelic, you have to buy and equip a consumable item. So, here is how tedious the process is. Imagine going into a nice large battle against say, 30 enemies. After they all dies, there are around 10 derelic floating around for you to get. Mind you, this is the only way for you to have a chance at getting whatever weapon those ship was using (which isn't much, you get better weapon at your HQ). for each derelic, you need to get in range, select it, activate your consumable, watch the stupid animation of your ship sending out the salvaging swarm, and then you need to wait a few seconds before the derelic is consumed and you allow to loot it. so imagine doing that 10+ times. each battles. In a game that focuses on killing ships and looting. THAT, is tedious.
But wait, there is more! They give you a Titan ship that can "auto" loot. So what that means is that whenever derelic drop, the ship auto send out the salvage swarm for free (as long as you are in range), and then after a few seconds,  you can loot. Sounds good right? No more individually selecting derelic and sending salvage swarm out. Well, they screw it up. There is only 1 ship that can do that. You HAVE to be piloting it (can't let an AI fly it), AND THAT SHIP IS THE WORST THING TO PLAY WITH. it is large, slow to move, and overall makes the game less fun if you want to use it. So now the choice is between making the game less fun by the tedious derelic looting or making the game less fun by flying that autoloot titan ship.

I can go on. But the review is long enough. Every mechanic in this game is cool, until you play it enough and you realize how dumb the execution was.

Overall, a great attempt at a space game. TONS of good idea. just poorly execute.
I do have to give points to the devs for staying active in forum an make changes constantly based on player feedback. But boy, does this game have some fatal flaws.
I really wanted to like this game. I played 50+ hours but still can't like it. But they have a good thing going and I look forward to the improvements in the next game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057152752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 11723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2343, 'last_played': 1705772163}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024327278', 'num_games_owned': 1612, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1673883983}
review:
Ok so I've got 1 hour of playtime and I'm getting absolutely crushed by bugs.  This game is unplayable, steer clear.  

* First the UI was screwed up by having a widescreen monitor.  I found that disabling the 4K UI resolved it.
* Next I dropped hard on FPS during combat and found a post that said the combat music was the culprit so I disabled all music for that fix.  
* Get to the part in the prologue mission where I have to transport something.  When I get to the strategic map after clicking to transport there are zero options on the map.  I can't select anything.  I can't even close the map.  Escape doesn't work.  Clicking on things doesn't work.  Finally drag my hands across the keyboard and the game exits fullscreen mode and punts me back into the game.
* Configure a new character.  Finally, I can do something.
* Then I fly around with "Contact Raynor Trace" as my prompt and this dude is NOWHERE.   Visit every single location in the immediate area.  There's a little "go to" icon on the map but when I go there nothing.  Nobody.  Nothing happening.
* Reload the game from the combat portion again and get stuck at the transport part again.  Hit one of the F keys and it starts a cutscene where an escape pod is found with me in it.  Never saw that before.  
* Prompts me to make my character again but this time I have NO CURSOR.  Fumble through trying the UI trying to rebuild my character and hit finish on accident because I can't see anything and get some character I don't want.  

That's when I said screw it, clearly this game isn't functional and attempted to exit the game which soft locked my PC forcing me to force quit / sign out of Windows entirely.  There's absolutely NO WAY I can risk investing time in this game after my first hour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026348852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 2858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1686779319}
review:
Game is good, dont get me wrong
But the sheer amount of bullsht, technical anomalies and game AI difficulty and balance is absolute mess.

-Regular SGW experience:
1) complete the painstaking campaign intro
2) start the freeplay, capture the first 2 regions hinted in the tutorial, get few small companion ships follow u
3) next mission is hella far and when you poke your nose out of your territory, youll encounter 25+ ship clusters that erase you before you can do a U turn to flee back, any stations nearby have 25k + fleet power, you have 4k
4) farm salvage missions like a slave to buy a frigate and fit it with good weapons 
5) try to expand on the other side
6) capture new region
7) fly to the next sector to capture another base, enemy starts to siege the first sector
8) you rush back to save the sector only to find out its a battleship and cruiser both level 50 (youre level 15btw)
9) you barely manage to kill the battleship, but all your ships are erased by now, so you save atleast your ship and escape
10) lose the sector and farm for approx 1 real life day to buy new ships for your squad....
11) rinse and repeat, never move anywhere further than the starting zones....

-The technical side of the game is a random "bug" generator. I play the game the first day, everything is OK, game runs flawlessly, my chroma keyboard chagnes colours, for example when you scan and charge your engine. I turn the game on the next day, and the cursor get some visual bug, whenever i select allied ship or debris it shows some glitchy symbols above the cursor all over the screen, after 30m spent on the net looking for solution i try to verify the cache. IT helped BUT now whatever resolution i select in the launcher, is now ignored and the game is launched in default 1920x1080, even if i repeatedly select 2560x1440, i even put in the work and found the .cfg file and verified the correct resolution is written there. -Solution: after hour of random clicking in the launcher setting, it seems that theres some "4k resolution tool enabled" setting checked by DEFAULT and it fcks everything up. -great feature devs-

-Theres bunch of equipment you can use, mostly just supportive or utility things like, mining torpedo, gas extractor, salvage drones, repair drones, theres a lot of this, game for some reasons offer you only 4 hotkey slots for this equipment. You can swap these on the go, no need to go to hangar, but you have to go through roughly 5 menus to get there, so i dont understand why theres no hotbar with 10 sots, so that you can put whatever you want there without constantly having to switch back and forth....

-Downloading any mod from the steam workshop apparently bugs out chroma compatiblity and you can no longer see the light effects on your razer products.

-Theres no HUD slider, so your ship and hud elements take 1/3 of your screen even on 2560x1440

-I dont understand the difficulty, even if i set it to easy, the campaing is rip fest, some missions are ridiculously hard, after you finish the quest line and you go after your first open world quest, the enemies just evaporate, even before you actually select them, while in the campaign you were dying half the time....

-I refuse to believe someone uses the manual fighting in this game, all the ships have 100% accuracy, so theres no point disadvantaging yourself, also the power consumption of the weapons is laughable, you cannot upgrade the power generation in any way, so you can fit the ship with tooons of greaaat weapons, but expect them to shoot like 2-4 salvos and then only 1 turret will continue firing as rest of them doesnt have enough power.

-AI is extremely agressive even on easy diff, so youll be constantly pending between attacked zones, as your stations are uncapable of any form of defence on their own..

-Stations are pointless, their own defense is ridiculous, even upgraded, the station will never be able to defend themself, because AI flies Carriers, Battleships and Dreadnaught(3 biggest classes in game) Which makes defending your terrirory absolute chore, youre gonna be flying from one end of map to antoher.

-Balance is thing of dreams here, you can have enemy fleet of 20k, when you arrive its a 30 tiny ships, that youll literally decimate with one single discharge (AOE skill), and you can also encounter 15k fleet, with Dreadnought and Carrier which will erase you, before the rest of your fleet catches up..... You are limited to 5 capital ships, IN YOUR WHOLE EMPIRE, enemy flies willy nilly endless amounts of 2 dreadnoughts, carriers and battleships fleets....

-You are totaly grindwalled from capturing planets, to capture planet youll need to build proxima, this nonsense needs to be researched first, consists of 12 researches, costing various ridiculous amounts of resources and credits, first one is like 60k ore(my income with several captured sectors and fully upgradedmines is around 6k/week) not speaking about the 10M credits, so i have captured third of the galaxy, but there are still these patches of uncapturable regions. Cuz those are tied to planet which you cant capture, untill you grind the resources...

-Capping enemy stations is like taking lolipop from kid, stations usualy have around 5 gunships as defense(the most basic junk fighter) Unfortunately it goes the other way too, your bases are easily taken too

-Campaign is a chore, youll literally gonna be a glorified messenger. You would think that in an age of dreadnaughts and wormhole traveling, theyll find some way to send a simple message. NOPE 90% of the missions is "go talk to xyz" "inform xyz about your findings", 5% is go and kill this, 5% is go and scan this

author: {'steamid': '76561198124702545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1577277761}
review:
Gemini Warlords propose une approche novatrice de ses prédécesseurs.
Il est désormais possible de conquérir et de suivre des campagnes de conquête forts intéressantes pour dominer la galaxie.
C'est un gameplay dont l'accroche est quelque peu difficile mais elle peut devenir très vite gratifiante une fois qu'on en a saisi les principes.

Le seul reproche que j'aurai à faire sur ce jeu est l'aspect redondant qui arrive très très vite.
Sinon, c'est un excellent jeu de batailles spatiales.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967471651', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 12165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9957, 'last_played': 1672148420}

Fly around, blast stuff, trade, upgrade your ship. Conquer territory to gradually paint out a map while keeping an eye to ensure the enemies abounds aren't doing the same to you. Good stuff.

SPG:W - a game that severely lacks much polish but nonetheless comes out far greater than the sum of its parts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198815748328', 'num_games_owned': 2991, 'num_reviews': 710, 'playtime_forever': 2335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2335, 'last_played': 1666374549}
review:
Much more fun if you choose "Ninja" instead of "Sniper" at the start, because the stealth button is great for both "stop shooting me while I warp away from an unwinnable fight" and "stop shooting me while I wait for my boarding party to take your bridge".

I don't think Starpoint Gemini series is supremely balanced, or polished, or fun.  I've played some of all 4, but for some reason this is the one I played through to completion.  Maybe just because everyone else hated it so much.  It reminded me a lot of playing Escape Velocity on a Motorola Macintosh back in the 90s.  Start with nothing, cheese/cheat your way to the point where your unofficial end goal becomes "conquer every planet on the map".  This takes a long time, though, even if you're cheating as hard as you can.

The biggest ships are just too goddamn big for the default shoulder-cam view.  That and the lumbering meant I stayed with the destroyer, then dreadnought, even after unlocking titans.
This game is probably [b]technically[/b] playable with a controller, but only if you already know what you're doing.  I ended up sticking with mouse and keyboard.

Dispatching fleets on the map worked but... I can't really put my finger on it, but it never felt quite right.
I liked the interactive boarding concept, but having the marines stop and wait for orders is too slow.
Instead you should be able to just say "until further notice, you should retreat/loot-the-advance/advance".

I definitely would recommend Rebel Galaxy over this, but it's kind of on par with Rebel Galaxy Outlaw in terms of fun-to-jank ratio.  https://store.steampowered.com/app/290300/Rebel_Galaxy/

author: {'steamid': '76561198076663032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 3607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3607, 'last_played': 1617891910}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048724674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1670166839}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970080475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1666022665}
review:
This is actually a really good game.

It's one of those indy games that not many people know about, but once you find out about it you realise it's a bit of a hidden gem.

Its a bit like Rebel Galaxy mixed in with Eve, mixed in with some Freelancer, mixed in with some X4. It doesn't excel in any area, a lot of it is dumbed down, but that's what I like about it, you can play it like Freelancer if you want, or like X4 if you want, but it doesn't take up days of your life to do it.

The combat could do with some tweaks, the camera is a nightmare to control during combat. The best mode seems to be turret mode, but the camera doesn't track your target so you have to manually move the camera with the mouse AND steer the ship with WASD< FIX THIS PLEASE, the camera tracking the target would be such a huge improvement!

The other camera modes are useless since the ships have weapons in front and on top, so you have to angle your ship to the enemy target, ensuring your top turrets have a firing arc, meaning the front and Normal views leave you at a disadvantage.

Definitely worth trying though, get it on sale if you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020390476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1663696457}
review:
I only have 11 hours on record as of writing this review, but that should be more than enough for most games to convince me and draw me in - and this one hasn't. SG:W is, to put it succinctly, unpolished. Looking for a new game to play instead of wringing even more hours out of Discovery Freelancer, I acknowledge that my standards are somewhat high when it comes to space combat sims, but this game just doesn't hit the mark.

First and foremost - flying your ships is unsatisfying, and this is probably the #1 experience killer for me. There's barely an engine noise, ships don't seem to have weight to them - the game is part strategy, after all, and unfortunately the ships also fly like they would in a strategy game. Combat is also somewhat unspectacular, or maybe I just haven't bought big enough guns yet.

The game is also very blatantly part of an established series, offering very little in the way of explaining the starting premise, or anything really outside of the mechanics (which it does teach adequately). Instead, you get flooded with tons and tons of lore entries in the ingame pedia - which is nice to have in and of itself, and probably a goldmine for an established fan of the series, but is not a great way of drawing in a new player.

There are also relatively minor QoL issues that, nevertheless, contribute to the unpolished image the game presents. You can paint your ships, but the paint tool is so primitive it's not worth the hassle, you're better off painting some tabletop minis IRL and that's probably easier too. You can put custom music into the game, but it's a whole ordeal and a half, and the game handles music in an asinine way anyway - the interrupted ambient track restarts every time you leave combat, the tracks always play in the same order albeit with random skips... it just feels really half-assed, and it's a damn shame, because the game and the setting do have potential.

If there's gonna be a next game in the series, I would check that out, but I'll have to pass on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317129044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3384, 'last_played': 1664376958}
review:
56時間ほどで最初のチュートリアルからDLCの一部をクリア。一部MOD有でプレイ。
かなーりゆるく遊べるSF。
戦闘はそこまで難しいものではないが、単純に大きければ強いのでガンシップで戦艦を落とすとか無理ゲーなので素直にレベルを上げて大きい船に乗ってください。下手にメインを進めすぎると戻れなくなるので（敗北からのレベリングに入ろうとしても戦場離脱扱いでゲームオーバーになる場合もある）地道に進めてください。
敵を倒したり、クエスト受けてレベリングやお金を集めるより大型貨物船に乗って貿易するほうが早いのでお金稼ぎついでにやるのがおすすめ。

残念なのはある程度進むと鉱石もガスも原料も余って特に使い道が無くなること。売ってお金にもできるが、数が固定でしかも毎回面倒な交信をして売るので手間がかかる。しかも売る資材を選べない。でもタイタン級の装備を整えるには結構な金がかかる。
まぁそれも一度お金貯めれば終わりなのでそこまで苦ではありませんが・・・。
後半はのんびり宇宙遊泳するか、適当な国に喧嘩売って領土広げましょう。そこまでメリットはありませんが。

私は一度クリアでお腹いっぱいになりました。
セールで購入したので値段分は遊べたと思います。

深く考えずにSFゲームで領土拡張して艦隊作って遊ぶならおすすめ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198032164620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2891, 'last_played': 1663356263}
review: For the most part the game is not too bad. Little too much resource gathering required for the end mission but once I had a freighliner and was hauling in major resources that seemed to do the trick. Biggest reason I have to thumbs down it, is too many times you get punted out to desktop or auto death on a mission and then you loose the mission if it was a freelance. The final straw was I just finished the campaign mission, i'm assuming was to head back home for final hurrah and all that and of course, dump to desktop. Got the badge for finish but of course no auto save so was looking at another 30+ min final battle and just said pfft that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035665270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2575, 'last_played': 1663467984}
review:
So, I'd definitely say this is worth buying if it's on sale. The game has a few issues though.

Firstly, it's cool. You get to fly around in various ships, slowly amassing a fleet after you take control of your faction's space forces and spread your rule across the Gemini star system. The campaign, while not exciting, serves as an effective tutorial guiding you from your first days running freelance missions in a gunship for credits to commanding a mighty dreadnought and besieging planets with a supercannon. The strategic layer is relatively shallow, which might frustrate strategy gamers but is good for people who aren't as into that genre. The game may not have the most cutting-edge graphics (even for its time), but you do definitely feel like you are traversing a huge star system full of natural hazards, anomalies, ship graveyards, and outlaws.

Now, though I like the game, it suffers from two primary broad flaws.

The first is the UI and controls. The game could have used some dedicated quality of life updates to reduce the need to constantly enter and exit the menu to switch between basic equipment and make the minimap more informative (it doesn't even come with a key/legend). You also have to do some trial and error to figure out what hotkeys map up to different abilities, and the game neglects to provide key information like what stations you can dock at or not.

The second issue is repetitiveness. The freelance missions become repetitive quickly, but you escape the need to do them rather quickly. The game feels at its best in the midgame, when most of its mechanics like civilian missions and salvaging feel useful and you have a lot to do. The lategame, like many strategy games, stagnates when your ship is unassailable and most of your tasks no longer provide enough benefit to be worth the distraction. Writing this, I'm 75% done conquering the map and I don't really have any drive to finish.

I'd say this is a solid 7.5/10. It'd be a bit better (8-8.5) if the devs had sat down to polish the game up by improving the UI and UX, but it's still fun to play for a while and I don't regret buying it. I'd check it out on sale though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001865314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2656, 'last_played': 1662909514}
review:
Nette Abwechslung zu anderen Spielen des Genres. Nach 45 Stunden ist der Spielspaß jedoch spätestens um.
Wer was kleines für mal eben sucht kann hier mal reinschnuppern - In bestimmt 30 der gespielten Stunden war das Geld/die Zeit gut investiert.

Die Story ist kaum nennenswert, das Spiel auch jetzt noch ultrabuggy (manche Missionen macht ihr deshalb mehrfach..). Steuerung ist ok, viele Dinge werden nicht gut erklärt aber da wächst man rein.

Diplomatie, Wirtschaft, Taktik - nicht aufzufinden. Ihr nehmt das jeweils nächstteurere Schiff und die Waffen die greifbar sind und kämpft irgendwo gegen irgendwen in immer gleicher weise um mehr der gerade mal drei Rohstoffe sowie Credits zu haben um mehr zu kaufen. Thats it: mit Freelancer, Star Trek Bridge C., Freespace, Edge of Chaos und anderen des Genres nicht zu vergleichen.

Pro - es ist mal was anderes mit Großschiffen rumzudonnern auch wenn das "ich flieg dahin und das Ding ballert von allein" bei diversen Aufbauspielen im All ebenfalls erfahrbar ist. Bei Langeweile dennoch ganz nett - eben was anderes als sonst.

Euer Macci

author: {'steamid': '76561197980568630', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4563, 'last_played': 1663498765}
review:
PROS
- Adictivo
- Mapa gigante
- Sistema económico y de recursos interesante, aunque fácil de romper dejando el juego encendido por la noche...
- Tropecientas naves categorizadas por tamaños y por facción
- Complejo sistema de customización de las naves pero fácil de entender
- Campaña-tutorial con historia típica y giros de guion deducibles pero correcto
- Barato, he pagado 3 pavos por el juego completo

CONTRAS
- Control un tanto precario/incómodo con gamepad, pero a la que te acostumbras funciona.
- He tenido que usar el mando de Xbox One (ya no lo uso habitualmente), uso el 8bitdo SF30+ pero no me lo pilla bien y me mapea los controles fatal, entiendo que no es culpa del juego al 100% sino de 8bitdo.
- Las DLCs no son todas para la campaña, hay escenarios, a mí esto no me gusta, es muy rejugable pero yo quiero ir con la mega partida
- Single player, aunque entendible, y casi preferible
- Facciones todas iguales
- Tu facción principal tiene las naves más feas, aunque eso te motiva a buscarte las naves que te gustan capturándolas o conquistando los shipyards que las producen

author: {'steamid': '76561197993369926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1661124186}
review:
Updated review after 40 hours of play:

Game is still a solid 7/10. However, it has quirks I noticed that end up in disappointment after a while of play. Let me be clear I had fun with this game. Even picked up the DLC’s on sale. However it just falls short somehow overall. Examples:

-The Illusion of big fleet battles- The novelty is great until you start to notice something later in the game.

1. As your ship gets bigger everything gets smaller. Battles degrade into Square indicator boxes smashing together with an unreadable radar. 
    The worst offender is how you can’t make out any turret fire unless you zoom way in. At that point you can’t see your ship's stats and it takes up so much of the screen you can’t watch any dog-fighting. Speaking of…


2. I noticed that it doesn't seem like ships do any actual fighting unless you are within a certain distance of them. I’ll watch in the distance as a tiny gunship is surrounded by much larger ships but does not take any damage. As soon as I approach, it's like the AI turns on and the tinny ship MELTS in a second. The ships are not that far away and you notice it worse when attacking stations. It’s as if only things within a radius of your ship partake in combat. It makes you have to lug your ship over across the battlefield to take out smaller ships surrounded by your fleet not doing anything.

3. Let's go back to the turret fire. I spent a few hours trying to mod this into the game but I’m not a modder. I just WISH the plasma, and railgun rounds were more visible when you get bigger ships. You can see the beams but I mean the whole idea of a giant battleship is watching the show as you broadside other ships. Sadly, you end up having to guess if your ship is firing or angled right with any other weapon beside beams. You also can't see a fun lightshow as your army clashes. You also can't tell whats hitting you unless its a missile or a beam weapon.

Conclusion: Pick it up on sale and have some fun for a dozen or so hours! I recommend the base game first. If you like it the DLC goes cheap too but I found that lackluster as well. No harm picking it up if you're interested like I was!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------
SG:Warlords does space battles well. It could use more feedback for what exactly is wrecking your ship before you realize you’ve been destroyed, but you can quicksave anywhere and try again so it’s not that bad. 

Some say the combat is simple. I find the fact you can actually watch all the beams, missiles, and explosions without gluing your eyes to the HUD a big plus. One big reason is a killer “fire at will” toggle that auto fires at enemies in range. There is an optional pause while in the context menu that I appreciate. You can use this to focus your autofire on one target that can be fired upon and the ones that can’t shoot at said target will auto fire at something else it can. The only thing you gotta learn is picking your targets and orienting your ship well.
      
There are three classes with four abilities each that can be mixed and matched five minutes into the game with some money. They are so-so and kinda miss the mark with all playstyles but I’m sure you’ll find a few you like. The real letdown is the main class skill. It basically boils down to: More damage at long range, more damage at short range, better chance to crit. I feel this could have been better with options for defense but it is what it is.
    
The storyline is insufferable and I’m sorry to the devs for saything this. After I did the first 30 mins of a tutorial I had to back out and start a new game on free roam. Even then the gemini pedia can answer all your questions and it even has in-game videos you can watch. Really helps the game out. I implore anyone who finds the story impedes the gameplay to stick out the first 15-30mins and then switch it up to free roam.
       
As for free roam. It’s an odd start without the story as you can’t get a feel for your spot in the universe yet. Once you start operating your starting zone and flying around trading or freelancing quests, that's when you can start to establish a feel for the game. There is still a little story to be had as you can get officers to chat with. As far as I've seen there are no event stories for free roam, but I also didn’t get any DLC which seems to add a crap ton more content.
        
For a little north of $7 with tax (on sale) the base game is a steal. BEWARE: I found the controller experience to be horrendous. K&M works well but I did initially want to use a controller. You will probably have to tweak things to your liking in the options but it’s a one and done thing.
I’ve seen this on sale a bunch and hope it goes on sale again soon ‘cause I’d love to get the DLC. Solid 7/10 with a loss of one point for the story. Of which I’m again sorry for being so harsh on but I just could not stand.

review:
controls are a mess. too many things/functions/feature which need an extra button which probably should have been cut or simplyfied into one button.
but I was willing to learn and adapt....until I had to look up which is the DIVIDE button on my german keyboard and switched out of the game to look it up.
upon re-entering the game, the game wasn't fullscreen anymore, but windowed and the cursor was (visibly) gone, but still noticeble from the mouseover effects of the button. I tried to switch it back to fullscreen ingame and with key combinations, but no luck.
That was it for me. Because I know I would switch out of the game for different stuff from time to time and I don't want to deal with the windowed headache.

author: {'steamid': '76561198985082935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7469, 'last_played': 1654020251}
review:
打折时只有20块，如果是以这个打折价来说，性价比会相当不错。原价不推荐。好评是以20块的角度来给的。

要说明的是，它本质上是一个单人的RPG游戏，换句话说，你的个人经营是游戏的主打内容。然而，宏观系统上是一个4X游戏的样子——阵营众多，宇宙不小，有各种空间站星球，队友和敌人RPG元素很少，但是做的都很简单（游戏标签里并没有4X，这点倒是很实在）
这就是为啥我不推荐原价入——瓶子是奢侈瓶，酒是普通酒，不搭配。但是能喝吗？能。
好处也是有的：画质尚可，非机翻的中文，整体体量还行，节奏较快不繁琐不烧脑不难，无缝开放世界且不会用主线卡你自由度，百科里教程完善，有创意工坊（想开挂的话修改文件也很方便，都是txt），bug基本没有——除了，别接阵营任务，有bug会导致读档后你的船库和仓库被清空（反正阵营任务又麻烦报酬又不行，就当没这回事吧）。

我再举几个游戏的几个方面做例子

从人物属性上，你有职业，有主动技能（包括大招），有技能点，有天赋，有从好到坏的武器/飞船（基本遵循贵的大的就是好的这一原则，和RPG里的装备等级如出一辙），有各种消耗品可以用，可以到处接各种任务练级……

从日常飞行上，你哪怕是毫无目的地到处飞，你也会频繁遇到刷出来的各种事件，两队飞船在打（野怪），残骸/集装箱（路边资源），神秘信号（有限种的随机事件），让人怀疑这宇宙里是不是到处都塞满了东西，这和什么武侠RPG里你在大地图上走着走着就蹦出个什么玩意儿来也是如出一辙

从经济系统上，游戏里所有的星球物价都是固定的，完全没有任何动态经济（这意味着你只要稍动脑筋研究下物价，就能无脑地按照一条固定的路线开着货船来回刷钱刷等级，这倒是不怎么肝和受苦），也没有任何的商品生产线（顺带一提，游戏的商品种类和双子座百科里倒是有不少东西可以阅读，然而游戏深度完全配不上这么多字），这和普通RPG里商店定期刷新完全一样（甚至没有随机的神装刷……好处是你只要有钱，知道卖的地点就能拿到神装）

所谓的领土征服，发展建设更像是个噱头：这么说吧，多数情况下你一个人就是一支军队（后期花钱洗点成狙击加霰弹加破防加斩杀的或大爆炸的技能组，基本就是无双了），你手下所谓的舰队基本都是撑场面和打下手的（不仅没啥输出，而且距离稍远，炮弹子弹什么的就完全不显示了——真要带小弟建议全带航母，不要指望什么大规模舰队战的宏大场面了，比较适合的团战规模基本也就是LOL的级别），所谓的攻打领土更像不同等级的副本（哨站/空间站/星球），还很同质化。

从操作上，就跟我说的一样，本质是一个RPG游戏，所以什么严谨的舰船/舰队的操作还是别想了（好消息是这里面的大飞船相比同类游戏相当灵活，倒是不会出现太笨重的问题），飞船的武器和护盾分成四个方向，这其实就跟在实时RPG里你需要各种走位一样，只不过这对战斗影响并不大，在数值要求满足的情况下，你只需要原地停车，锁定最近目标，然后放技能就行了

有不少人诟病操作问题，其实没那么严重，我补充一些：按空格即可切换为鼠标控制方向，键盘控制油门的比较正常的操作模式；加号减号键可以调整视野远近；战斗时开半速即可，这样就不容易绕晕了

总体而言，喜欢太空开飞船到处开炮又不喜欢系统太复杂的推荐打折入。

author: {'steamid': '76561198047707864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5242, 'last_played': 1660958962}
review:
A interface é simplória, mas a jogabilidade é ótima, as naves são bacanas, os efeitos sonoros são ótimos, a história é bacana, mas não é apresentada de uma forma fluída, se os desenvolvedores fossem menos preguiçosos e fizessem uma interface melhor, e colocassem algumas cinemáticas, ficaria mais bacana ainda.
Mas oque importa são o porrilhão de naves que você pode pilotar, de humildes fragatas até fuderosas Batle Cruizers, ou até titans (se você comprar a DLC, e a DLC vale muito a pena)...
No resumo é um jogo antigo, mas ainda muito bacana.
