author: {'steamid': '76561198032880777', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5436, 'last_played': 1708399961}
review: So much better than Starpoint Gemini 2. I like the touch of having your own space station and being able to upgrade it as you progress through the game. I've seen some say in their reviews that the game levels you up faster than your ships upgrade. But I actually managed to get around that by doing a lot of side missions along with capturing side territories to build, capture or upgrade different resource centers to keep my cash flow high enough, so that it doesn't take as long to build my bank high enough to be able to buy new ships appropriate to my current level in the game. I'm presently at the point where the missions have turned toward being able to construct the big flagship in the construction site outside the home base. So I'm now grinding through the side missions, battling it out to capture new territories and upgrading resource centers so that I can work through the research of all the technologies of the flagship and finally start up its construction. There's definitely enough to choose from to keep things interesting enough to structure and adjust your gameplay to fit what goals you set your mind to while playing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035454570', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1652437165}
review:
You know the X series of games?
X3: terran what ever the hell?

Yeah, SGW tries to be that with NONE of the complexity. Can't even do trade routes. No manufacturing. No turret defence. Not even an invasion mechanic.

Just get one of the old games and mod it to hell and back.

It does look pretty though. And plays smooth. There is just nothing to do other than grind money and wait for resources.

review: 直说了吧，我是挂逼。这个游戏从我一个不愿意体验难度的玩家来看，操作确实不舒服，但是打了mod后确实具有一定的可玩性

author: {'steamid': '76561198012807542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1275, 'last_played': 1690903181}
review:
game is pure headache

1) way too many aspects of the game are not explained and not even the internet is helpful (ie you find out, on the internet, how to connect to satelites to clear fog of war, but it is not working and you cant find out... until few missions into the main story)
2) mission design is questionable (ie sometimes a main mission have a time limit, that is spot on on the second, you do one turn wrong and its game over, way too often the game does not even tell you what to do and you repat the mission a dozen times until you figure out what to do and how to do it in order to stay in the time limit)
3) the engine is questionable... the game does not bother the gpu at all, so it seems all goes through cpu, but the cpu is bored and runs at 20%, but the game is full of freezes, long and heavy ones, during battles, most times you enter a battle with your ship, 10 enemies start shooting at you, game freezes, and when it unfreezes you are down to 10% shields. and when you lower the settings, it actualy gets worse not better. no idea what intern made this)
4) you can take only one freelance mission at a time (lol sorry)
5) you can not abandon/cancel a freelancer mission, but you can take another one, which automaticaly abandons the last one (thats important because the game is bugged and you cant just finish the mission)
6) well game is bugged... like on one mission I had to defend another ship, but that ship kept circling around a station, and the enemies kept circling around the station, and the AI is like 10000000x better and doing it then you, and so I fired 90% of my shots into an indistructible station and failed and failed and failed and then decided not to take missions of this type.... and that type doesnt work also, and that, and that, and that,... and you are stuck with just one mission type that works: search & destroy. way too often the scripts of the game fail to trigger and spawn the stuff fo complete the mission)
7) oh did I mention the missin design is questionable?... like you are send acroccs the map to do this and that and you actualy have to do it, in order to make some important stuff in the game, like linking to satelites, but the far reaches of the map are full of high level enemies... like I only have a frigate, the concord fleet is at few gunships... and you are ordered to fly through an enemy zone to a friendly planet, but that enemy zone is full of dreadnoughts that destroy everything within seconds.

I gues I will keep playing for a bit longer until I can not take it anymore, but a word of advice: if you are new and looking for a game, skip this one, look for something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973581446', 'num_games_owned': 665, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1651349034}
review:
Ce jeu de simulation spatial est bien plus intéressant que Star point gémini 2 et ça tient à deux choses à mes yeux:
- la vitesse des vaisseaux est supérieure, et on perd moins de temps à attendre en vitesse subluminique (trajet entre objectifs)
- on a enfin quelque chose à faire qui consiste à gérer une flotte et construire des stations, posséder des zones d'influence.

L'un dans l'autre, je trouve ce jeu vraiment très fun dans son style!

review: A great, casual open universe game that has a surprising variety of things to keep you occupied. Has elements of several genres that are simple enough to entertain and complex enough if you want to dig deeper. Not a space dog fighter game, as things are on a grander scale, yet does have that feel when you get into the battles in any ship of your choice. A definite recommendation!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008926989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 5220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5220, 'last_played': 1648356037}
review:
tldr: at the end

i give it a yes because it's entertaining
the graphics hold up ok
sound and music are good
plot, ok. interiging but very moderate writting. it is very little reading.
would have been better with voice overs.

game play, mixed really.... 
the stratigic play works well enough and is the meat of the game. the tactical battles are fun but as the battles get bigger it becomes more of a numbers game... you perticipate with your own ship when you choose, but the tactics themselves are left up to mediocre AI bots that pretty much just go to the nearest target. theres no control over npc ships in tactical battles.
first parson ship control is more involved than say Eve online and it works for the most part until you get to the capitol ships which ends up just selecting target and mashing you abilities buttons 

play for the campaign at first. only build up what you need to complete it, it makes the stratigic game better if you havn't expanded a lot yet.

i played as a sharp shooter after domination, but there are other roles to play. i expect this was to recreate freespace in a sense but the other play styles are a little thin...

the lack of cockpit views for flight controls is quite noticable at first and seems to start slow, but it picks up and makes more sense when you have a fleet with you.

tldr: not a first person sim, it is a stratigic game. it's pretty good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053522664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 5170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4030, 'last_played': 1644691321}
review:
I only give a review of No as the endgame content is broken, and some achievements are not triggering. Once you get to a point your supporting fleet no longer assists. they are indeed.. space whales..

Review Edit: Was able to get all achievements though a workaround.. This said.. I still really enjoyed the game and content, just know that if you want to 100% the game you will have to play with no DLC and/or edit the save file.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003026615', 'num_games_owned': 1273, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 4593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4593, 'last_played': 1642201949}
review:
[h1]Welcome, Admiral[/h1]
Starpoint Gemini Warlords (SGW) is a 4X, real-time strategy, with role-playing elements tied into a space simulator, where you command a fleet of ships to do as you please with the sector of space you’re given. Your colony is known as Solari Concord, which resides far from Imperial space.
 
[h3]+Pros+[/h3]
+Side missions
+Bounties
+Personalized fleet
+Multitude of ways to customize your ship
+Multiple genres that work – well enough
 
[h3]-Cons-[/h3]
-Resource management
-Tedious late game
-Not much of a story
-Alien bugs
 
[h3]Who’s in this sector, Boss?[/h3]
There isn’t much of a story to this game. No background lore, no mention where your colony came from, who the other nations are, or why they’re fighting over this sector when an alien force just wiped out much of their Imperial space. I’m not sure if these factions care or not, but not enough information was given to explain the situation at hand. 
 
The character (that you create) will be working on a new battleship when, all of a sudden, a squadron of ships assaults the prototype. This is where your story begins. You’ll be blamed for this atrocity and will be given a small Warband to rectify your wrongdoing. From then on, you’ll explore a vast sector of space by doing missions, quests from your council members that represent not only your faction but other colonies, bounties, gathering resources, and so forth. 
 
Bounties are the big, bad people that rubbed your ship the wrong way in orientation at work. These contracts pay a good amount of credits, but they will make your life a living nightmare the higher you go up on that bounty list. Befriending your neighbors or warring on them is up to you - this is YOUR story (for the most part).
 
Since the story is more about you and your accomplishments with the Solari Concord, most of the characters you interact with are forgettable. You’ll have a few allies that ‘ride or die’ with you as you venture across the sector, but the interactions are not there. Most of the time, members of the council will tell you to do fetch quests. 
 
[h3]We’re under attack![/h3]
As mentioned earlier, you’ll be provided with a small Warband that eventually will turn into an armada. To do so, you’ll need to eXplore, eXpand, eXploit, and eXterminate (4X). When exploring the vast darkness of space, you’ll come to find derelict ships, containers, and bands of pirates as you reap the rewards. Leveling up your captain will give you a limited amount of skills and a multitude of perks. These perks can help you barter more from trading, take less damage, have people align with your diplomacy, and many more options to give you your sense of role-playing. The skills are abilities that can be used with your ship: shielding from energy beams, ramming the enemy, or firing a barrage of kinetic weaponry, to name a few.
 
Eventually, you’ll be entrusted to build outposts, manufacture additional ships, research technology, upgrade multiple aspects of not only your ship but the ships under your command, and many other options to improve your quality of life. Resource gathering is important because without it you cannot construct a navy, research higher-tier weaponry and ships, or maintain control over new sectors that you conquer. To establish influence throughout the sector, you’ll have to build outposts, radar sites, and have a second small fleet to keep pirates and other hostilities out of your region.
 
The one problem with resource management is how you acquire materials. When comparing it to gas or ore, it’s so slow that I’ve gone idle in the game for several hours to play something else, only to come back and be able to purchase a few ships. In my story, I’m not the bad guy, so I’m not trying to conquer all the planets. Yet, this game either forces you to do that to obtain more materials or have you idly sit by waiting for weeks to pass. My guess is that I progressed too fast for my own good, thus with all the baddies either dead or allied, and with most of the bounties done, there isn’t much to do. This has made the later portions of the game rather tedious, doing the same missions over, and over, and over again! You come to a point in the game where you have to spend tens of millions of credits to fix up this weaponized space station. Cool. If I spent a lot of that money on a Titan class ship with all the bells and whistles, how am I going to spend the rest of my night? Grinding, and rather slowly at that. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2727272419
 
[h3]We’ve been hit, Sir![/h3]
The UI can be confusing at first, with information regarding shield, hull integrity, ammo usage, cooldown rates, abilities, and so on. You can steer the ship manually, or control it from the sector map by right-clicking on the map – the latter being applied to your fleet and breaking them down into multiple squads or as one armada. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2727272276
 
The combat is nothing to write home about. At times, it’s annoying to have your fellow crewmen doing their own thing instead of concentrating on the biggest, baddest ship around. This becomes a headache when you fight against huge contracts such as the ‘Deadly Dozen’ or ‘The Liberated’ when they have their men pitted against your fleet. Unless I missed something in the tutorial, I don’t recall how to attack a specific target which would have been a blessing at times. 
 
There are a few bugs within SGW that can be game-breaking if you don’t have prior save files handy. Certain quests of the main storyline will not trigger. These are due to expanding too fast to other zones or because the game didn’t process the event at all. I would recommend placing a few saved files on standby.
 
[h3]Darkness with a pinch of Stardust[/h3]
The game’s visuals from the stars twinkling in the outer reaches of space, to the guns blowing up an enemy ship, and the fine details of every flying chunk of metal, look amazing. They didn’t hesitate to put some time and effort into making this game look stunning. Even if customizing your ship only improves the look of it (though you cannot add any details to your allies' spacecraft) they did an astounding job to make them stand out from your enemies and your armada. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2727271970
 
The audio, from the pew-pews to the boom-booms, sound amazing. The limited amount of voice acting that does happen has emotion, and gets the point across. 
 
I did not experience any lag, audio or visual hiccups, crash-to-desktops, or anything of that nature. The game runs smoothly at a consistent 144 FPS. 
 
[h3]Armaments[/h3]
OS: Windows 10
CPU: i9-10900k
GPU: GeForce RTX 3070Ti
Ram: 32GB
Storage: Evo 870 4TB (SSD)
 
 [h1]The Gemini’s Embrace[/h1]
For the first few dozen hours that I put into this game, it has been a blast. I enjoyed the encounters, the missions, quests, the storyline, and even the overpowered bounties at times. I’ve had to reload multiple times, but I’m fine with that because no one can hear you scream in space. Unfortunately, if you play a certain “good” character, then expect to be bored out of your mind and be forced to do the same tedious missions over and over. With a game that supports role-playing elements, the characters that you interact with were forgettable and this shouldn’t be the case when you have allies within your fleet. The developers could have added a backstory or added additional content to know who some of these individuals are that serve within your armada.
 
The game is a solid piece of work and for the most part –besides the bugs here and there- enjoyable. If you’re into 4X with some RTS and RP elements, I would give it a shot, but do save occasionally.

review:
ok with 150 h+ on record i think its safe do a review ,  its a what older game "so i am a bit behind schedule shall we say . notheless its such a great game it desevers a review.

ive played spg 1 (liked it)
spg 2 (loved it )
spg warlords (frakking amazing) i give it an 8.7 

to me it feels that war lords is how spg 2 should have bin for example : fallout 3 vs new vegas
its an space sandbox open world played as an mix of rts/arcade flight /3rd flight sim rpg
plus with the workshop there are some really good content that just makes this game nearly perfect 
tought try not to get tempted by the cheats and tweaks in there on first playtrough because it really spoils the immersion (not sure if that is the correct word for it but i think u know what i mean) 

 own the universe take the galaxy under your control trough means of warfare , diplomicy , or trough proxy like wars by destabelizing faction controlled areas (taking over factories or buying shipyards , depleting there resources , manipulating them to go to war with another faction ,you can do this alles yourself or let one of your fleets do it for you , capture ememy ships to be sent to you reasearch team so they cn be reproduced build and put to war (or fly them yourself) make trade deals with faction or make use thier servescis (example weaking partols in other faction controlled spaces .

thats just a few feats game pointed towards the rts elements of this game the rest you need to experience by yourself .
some may say that this is incorrect but it something most peolple missed this depth of rts element in this game caus its not explained in the game its self plus the game is setup in such a way that its more forthcomming  to do it all your self gunsblazing (wich will make the game fell repetitive very quick)
excuses for text erros english not my native thong

author: {'steamid': '76561197994792550', 'num_games_owned': 1005, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4890, 'last_played': 1612890090}
review:
It’s a solid space sim and mostly plays the same as SPG2. BUT here’s the big selling point: I loved the fact it’s almost a grand strategy game, but as a space sim (some X mods did that, too). You can build or otherwise acquire a big amount of ships (although the limit is too low, but for balancing reasons I suppose), take over sectors, build resource and defensive buildings. The story is more of a vessel for the gameplay, honestly, but it’s okay.
It has some issues: boarding ships is a menial task and you basically just sit around, clicking buttons. The bigger problem are quest triggers – sometimes they just don’t go off and one time I basically messed up my save game by conquering too much space as a quest trigger required virtually defeated enemy factions to take over each other’s territories so I couldn’t progress the story. Frustrating. The DLCs give some variety, but don’t really change up the game. Get them if you want to play the game a lot. 7,5/10

review: Starpoint Gemini... Easy games too zone out for hours in. Very nice graphics, very good sound design, controls aren't bad once you get accustom too them. I mean it's not Elite Dangerous level of ridiculous controlling. These devs obviously have a love and appreciation of the classic space games like freelancer and startrek fleet command and the influence shows. I'm a big sci-fi fan, but don't have the patience for the SUPER deep space sims like X3-4 so this is perfect if you want a well-rounded space experience, with piloting capital ships including super-capital ships like dreadnoughts! I mean look at these ship designs, this game series is a work of sci-fi artistry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103192156', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1639054969}
review:
Starpoint Gemini Warlords -  это:

1) Когда старший научный сотрудник руководит боевыми миссиями.
2) Когда после получения HQ (штаб-квартиры) весь твой флот сопровождения состоит из угнанных кораблей.
3) Когда собрал флот и попёрся мочить первого засранца из списка засранцев, за башню которого дают 1 лям кредитов и... Банально слил весь флот. =)
4) Когда летаешь по космосу от "нехер делать", любуясь видами и попутно угоняя корабли у всех врагов, которые попадутся, сбагривая их потом куда-нибудь либо пополняя свой флот.
5) Когда отправил свой корабль в точку, до которой лететь туеву хучу времени и поплёлся в магазин за пивом.
6) Когда для постройки модуля HQ не хватает пары тысяч единиц ресурсов и ты самолично поплёлся добывать их, вместо того, чтобы захватывать сектора для расширения могущества "империи".
7) Когда захватил вражеский корабль с 1% шанса успешного захвата.
8) Когда отрубил игровую музыку и полетел захватывать сектора под тяжелый металл! =)

Классная игрушка, рекомендую!

author: {'steamid': '76561198289726363', 'num_games_owned': 468, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1649144262}
review:
Imagine Mount & Blade but with spaceships and PVE like mining, and the Gemini solar system is one giant map that scales midway between the battle and world map.

The visuals are great, lots of places to explore and exploring them is fun and visually immersive. Managing your faction is great as well and the game doesn't tease you with it. I love how you can also start as other factions and engage in different starting conditions.

I love the ship design arts and details and how Solari ships somehow look futuristic compared to Baeldor or even Gemini ships and it sets the atmosphere that despite your very small numbers, your faction is awed and feared to the point of triggering a lot of troubles.

There are a lot of ships but essentially one for each faction and they are really just troop tiers. You can outfit ships to deal/block damage to/from all ship classes so once you can buy fleets of battleships there is no point building smaller ships and they simply become obsolete.

It's a story driven RPG in a very well constructed environment but it does have it's limits. It's important to remember the goal of the game is to deliver the story through the environment and the devs were kind enough to make the environment somewhat playable in itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972457108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 13624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13520, 'last_played': 1639148589}
review:
An interesting mix of player-centric game play from earlier Starpoint games that is combined fairly decently with empire building and management along with fleet command.

The empire building is quite nice and some of the equipment that you can produce greatly enhances the capabilities of your own ship, eventually turning it into a powerhouse.

The fleet command aspect is somewhat mixed as the ships that are part of your own fleet are tricky to effectively manage. However as general support ships they do come in useful and, particularly for some specific encounters, having a sizeable fleet is quite useful to keep attention off your personal ship.

The original campaign I found to be quite well done if a bit slow in the later stages.
As for the various DLC:
- Deadly Dozen adds additional bounties and some very difficult fights with nice rewards.
- Titans Return adds titans and a fairly neat yet compact storyline to follow, eventually giving you access to Titan class ships of considerable power.
- Cycle of Warfare adds a range of additional sandbox starts and I particularly liked the A'shriari and Pirate challenge campaigns.
- Rise of Numibia adds more sandbox starts and some new ships, decent enough for a change of scenery due to the different map however little change to how the game plays out generally.
- Endpoint is its own campaign with some new ships. The campaign has its moments yet also seems to be lacking refinement. If you do play through it I suggest going through the entire campaign first, before exploring the map, as I ran into an issue where the campaign wanted me to visit a jail that I had already cleared and the campaign promptly broke. This is avoidable if you don't clear the jail before the campaign sends you to it, and the campaign then continues on to completion.

Overall I enjoyed Starpoint Gemini Warlords and its DLC and I recommend it to anyone looking for a game that combines action-oriented space flight, empire building, and fleet management.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008939270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1637908484}
review:
I really wanted to like this game. It sounded cool.

Unfortunately the control setup doesn't work, and the 2nd thing you are told to do in the first mission will cause you to fail it. It asks you to turn on the auto pilot, and then the ship just into sub-light drive and the manual controls are not disabled, so the change in mouse position (while using a context menu) causes your craft to go off course all crazy when the mouse reappears on the regular game view.

The entire time this is happening there is this bitchy and condescending voice actor yelling about how you are not in formation.

This was a very bad first impression and experience. Thumbs down. Refund requested.

author: {'steamid': '76561199070773425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1637759527}
review: 垃圾游戏操作极其不舒服

author: {'steamid': '76561198041020525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1399, 'last_played': 1637050264}
review:
ТАРАН - ОРУЖИЕ ПОБЕДЫ
Итак. Почти сутки общего времени я жевал этот кактус. Не скажу, что игра мне не понравилась, но от игры 2018 года ждешь все-таки чуть больше, чем от Фриленсера восемнадцатилетней давности. Хотя он, в чем-то даже выигрывает. Итак. Начнем, как обычно с минусов
1) Локализация. Игру просто перевели промтом и закинули текст как есть, даже без вычитки. Сразу вспоминаются пиратские переводы Фаргуса и 7Волка начала нулевых. Но, черт побери, сейчас не нулевые! Заказать грамотный перевод текста у хорошего переводчика можно за совершенно смешные даже для меня деньги. У студии они наверняка есть, но почему-то разрабы положили большой и мохнатый болт на русскоязычных игроков. Не удивлюсь, если перевод на другие языки сделан так же.
2) Экономика. Она есть, но зачем, не очень понятно. все равно 80% ресурсов добывается наглым пиратством и абордажем. Такое ощущение, что изначально была идея сделать игру про пиратскую республику, но что-то пошло не так
3) Боевая система. Ну, как я уже писал в названии, таран - оружие победы. На больших кораблях за одну активацию этого скила можно снести 30-100% прочности корпуса противника. Ну и абордаж. После прокачки всей ветки абордажа и всех апгрейдов, вражеские корабли даже на класс выше захватываются быстро, стремительно и с вероятностью почти 100%. Комбинируя эти два нехитрых приема, вместе с самонаведением легких орудий, сдувающих всю мелочь, в одиночку выносится почти любое количество противников. Главное следить за щитами.
3) Корабли. Они статичные. Нельзя отстрелить крыло, турель. двигатель и т.д. Но ладно. Может это ограничения движка и на нем это не реализуемо? Фиг с ним. Корабли никакие. Даже на линкоре ты не чувствуешь корабль. Нет ощущения того. что ты управляешь тысячетонной громадиной. Ты просто сел на более медленный ганшип.
Пожалуй, хватит с минусами, хотя их еще есть в количестве. Попробуем перейти к плюсам.
1) Дизайн кораблей и станций. Тут ничего плохого сказать не могу. Похоже, только общая убогость графики начала нулевых не дала развернуться художникам на полную.
2) Система апгрейдов корабля. Помимо банальной замены одного модуля на другой, к ним можно прикручивать всяческие апгрейды, что кардинально сказывается на их эффективности.
И, внезапно, пожалуй, все. Нет, в целом, игра оставляет после себя приятное впечатление. Но в 2018 году уже совершенно не смотрится.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119381307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 6168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3742, 'last_played': 1637057621}
review: И так по сравнению с предыдущей частью игра одназначно лучше и интереснее,  как и по сравнению с последней частью которая вообще полный отстой. Те кто пишут что нужно летать флотом, нет не нужно весь контент кроме одной миссии где тебе навязывают взять с собой флот силой 25к в последней миссии основного сюжета проходится соло без напряга.   Оптимизация прихрамывает но в целом техническая составляющая  игры хорошая.  Одно раздражает это то что корабли которые спавнятся во время сюжетных миссий нельзя брать на абордаж  и это бред, то есть полностью прокаченная ветка абордажа как в личных умениях так и в исследованиях абсолютно бесполезны в сюжете.  Космос хорош, корабли выглядят душевно их очень много  и это здорово. В общем мне ещё нужно захватить всю систему целиком,  я прошёл только основной сюжет, а  есть ещё и дополнительные из длс. Короче игра на 3.5  из 5 балов. Скинул пол балла за искусственное растягивание времени вместо того чтобы задерживать игрока интересным геймплеем.

author: {'steamid': '76561199030220259', 'num_games_owned': 730, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1685977207}

author: {'steamid': '76561198083653883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 3055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3055, 'last_played': 1636084912}
review:
each ship type feels the same, also weapon upgrade is just some number and doesn't change visuals or give any feeling of progression
there is no passive income, so either grand missions to get to the next ship type or enjoy the game by doing exploration, doing missions for fun not for credits. there is only grind/progression OR fun
combat feels all the same, spam some weapon keys and skills. i figured out, the last, most dangerous opponent in the arena was easy to beat by turning in cycles so he keeps hitting another shield while the others are generating (and of course key spamming)
the map is a mess, it is impossible to find anything and I have to search each centimeter if there is a gate or grid or whatever
civil missions are tedious but necessary to do for ressources. I don't even know what each of those missions give but I have to search all map because they are random. trade missions are pointless, they don't last long and I have to click each offer to find the one I need
high ship types are always much superiour. even a barely equipped ship is better than the well equipped prev type. 
early in the game with my first fleet of mid tier ships and NPC companion, I was already strong enough to beat all enemy fleets and bases. Now I have dreadnoughts in my fleet and there is literally nothing that could stop me. Even there is nothing that threats me, no one attacks me in the main campaign.
the repeatable mission are cumbersome at most
and one of the side quests just broke the game for me. I have to keep enemy ships at one specific location while NPC is doing some research. But one enemy ship is staying at the NPC. I don't know how many time I towed one ship with the tractor beam to the location just to see another ship is with NPC. so back and forth until I got bored but guess what I cannot cancel or skip this mission anymore and I am stuck 
rage quit, uninstall, bad review

author: {'steamid': '76561198013136951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1024, 'last_played': 1635647658}
review:
This is a very accessible space RPG that progresses into an RTS. Trading, mining, mercenary-ing, and eventually commanding fleets and stations. It doesn't go into huge depth on any of its systems (except maybe the lore) so you're kinda free to pickup and play and find your way in this galaxy.

My biggest complaint is probably the grind level to get to the best ships (and thus unlock the last few story missions). Lots of repetitive missions at the end. Still, not bad. I plan to go back to this whenever I feel the itch. There's also good DLC, some of which give multiple starting options and others additional scenarios.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020584337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1635216489}
review:
I love the idea of this game but the execution is just not there: 
-I've spent most of my play time so far waiting for uneventful 5 min travel times between jobs. 
-The combat is awful, in part due to lack of camera controls. 
-The story/dialogue seems like it was written by someone who doesn't speak English as a first language, it doesn't matter too much but just adds on to all the other rough edges of this game. 
-A couple of the ships/ stations look cool but most of them just look like shoe boxes with engines. 
-Already encountered multiple bugs, including audio blasting my ear drums out ignoring volume settings and tutorial windows spamming the screen continuously blocking me from reading important information.

Starsector does what this game is attempting to do and much more, it may not have the best graphics but it has a better overall aesthetic. Go get that game instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996048374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1634917856}
review:
Adquirí el juego en oferta y vi que no estaba en español después de iniciarlo.

Despues de media hora jugando para poder hacer la reseña puedo decir que el juego parece que esta bien, buena trama, buen manejo de la nave......

Pero ya uno esta cansado de que lo tomen por gilipoyas, voy a devolver el juego simplemente por el motivo de no estar en español.
Y aunque esta en ingles bastante entendible, lo que no puedo tolerar esque una empresa como la de este juego te saque el juego base ingles y 6 traducciones, chino, entendible, mucho chino; ruso, me lo pienso, tambien hay mucho ruso; pero que me saquen traduccion del aleman y el frances que solo lo hablan en su pais, porque africa ni la voy a contar; pero lo peor de todo que te metan una traduccion al polaco, si señores, se han molestado en traducir al polaco el juego. Y el español que es uno de los idiomas mas hablados del mundo, ni se han molestado.

Lo peor aun que al parecer no tienen la intencion de hacerlo, si quieren que lo compremos, pero no quieren traducirlo.

En definitiva, de esta compañia (que ya se une a unas cuantas en mi lista negra) no pienso adquirir ni un producto mas.

Aunque hablo ingles, es de agradecer que este en tu idioma, pero lo malo esque se molestan en traducir en idiomas que no dan nada y los que son millones ni se molestan. Buena estrategia comercial, si señor.

Luego estan los subnormales españoles y latinohablantes que se quejan de la traduccion pero luego puntuan con buena nota el juego o les da un positivo. Pero tened un poco de cabeza so borregos. a todos estos juegos hay que darles un negativo aunque en la reseña pongamos que nos gusta. Somos mas que los que tienen traducido el juego a su idioma, vamos a dar ejemplo de union para que nos vayan teniendo en cuenta, si hacemos siempre eso que haceis, nunca se gastaran una parte del presupuesto en traducir nada al español.

En fin, que espero recapaciteis y cambieis a negativa la reseña. yo lo pondre en rojo y devolvere el juego. Ya estoy cansado de esta clase de compañias.

un saludo

author: {'steamid': '76561198013132245', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 3448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1635978654}
review:
Final Update:


The fatal flaw of this game is that every time you level up, the randomly spawned enemies level up well beyond your level.  So any feeling of achievement upon leveling up is eventually (at key level thresholds) overshadowed by impossible-to-beat enemies that will show up occasionally at key times right before battlefields, etc.  You feel like you're going backward - you level up and the game throws an order of magnitude beyond your current level.  Your new expensive ship suddenly feels puny - it feels smaller than your starter ship did because back then you could take on anything.

I still like this game because I can mod it for Star Wars.  It's an awesome mod - very simple - just the ships and sound effects are different.  But that by itself will keep me playing this.


UPDATE 2:

I've finally uncovered at least one problem the game has, which others explained in their reviews.

I'm not sure yet if this problem exists regardless of what mode you play in - there are several starting scenarios to choose from.  What happens, at least in one of the "starting from bare bones" scenarios where you have almost nothing to begin with and work your way up to larger and larger ships and economy, is that the game will often spawn an unbeatable enemy fleet.  It's huge.  Like 4 or 5 dreadnaughts and several battleships and carriers and a ton of frigates and corvettes.  This huge fleet actually once spawned by my base, and I tried to fight them and after dying several times and reloading the autosave, apparently the random # generator decided to forgive me and when I went outside this time that fleet wasn't there - it was just a little bit out of the way.

But I also noticed this fleet didn't seem to care about me as long as I didn't attack them.  It's like maybe it's a storyline or something.

Still this artificial spawning of enemies (most of the time they are smaller fleets that spawn in the middle of nowhere) breaks the immersion.

Some scenarios look like an RTS style of gameplay where you can start in 1 of 4 areas near the edge of the map.  If they also play with an artificial middle of the map, it's going to be the same story.

People complained about artificially difficult bosses in the game in some of the threads too - ones that are apparently unbeatable (even on easy) without cheating by using mods.

So... if you can forgive all that, I guess it's still a great game.  It's a shame it does weird things - it would have been really nice if it could just play like a galactic-scale RTS game - but the developers apparently had other ideas.

-- Also.. after asking on the forums, these fleets are completely optional - if you fly away they won't hurt anything and your original base can never be blown up.  These are like "flavor" - but can be ignored.  What can really get in the way is if you don't know how they work, so if you're trying to attack an enemy base and one of these fleets randomly shows up in the same battleground (and this happens often), you'll have bit off more than you can chew and lose the battleground.  Just fly away and then come back and the fleet won't be there the next time.

If you don't know these mechanisms, the game will be overly hard even on easy levels.  In this way it sort of cuts its own throat - making itself too hard for anyone to enjoy, so now nobody wants to play it.  :)  Oopsie!



UPDATE 1:

Ridiculously underappreciated game!

This is not so much a capital ship flight sim as it is an empire-building sim.  You start out with a basic base, which you can build up to have full fleet production capability, research and mining operations.

Yes this plays fantastically with the Star Wars mod too - as it adds to the immersion that you are building a budding Empire complete with Tie Fighters and Imperial Star Destroyers (among many many others)!

I have played it safe for the first several hours of the game, and suddenly a fleet of about 4 bigger ships (I thought they were destroyers or cruiser, but they may have just been well-equipped frigates) showed up at my base.  I died several times and had to reload previous saves before I found a strategy that allowed beating them.  Really a lot of fun and the whole battle was very immersive - just like being in the movies!

If you just want to go flying around, random quests get generated on the map, some of which are complete duds.  There's always something to do - and hacking radar systems exposes a whole enemy area so you don't have to fly all over.

I regret not having played this sooner - it's really quite good.



-- ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW --

I'm using a Logitech game-pad and it did NOT work at all right at first, until I flipped the underside switch to X (presumably to use XBox controller emulation) and now it plays just great!

I have a tendency to skip "Campaigns" on these sorts of games and go straight to the free-flight game-play, and this time I am glad I didn't.  Something about people's reviews and descriptions that this game is fairly complex and the controls are not simple drove me to playing the beginner campaign.  I'm 4 hours into the game and still doing the starter missions.  The controls are a learning curve and the missions do a good job of repeatedly providing practice for learning.  However, I found it better to take extra jobs before continuing on the story-line missions for the sake of boosting my ship's capabilities.

It might also help if you take the >> cloaking << option as a beginner, because NOTHING beats being under heavy fire, certain you're about to die, and then turning on the cloaking mechanism and allowing all the shields to regenerate.

Boarding and commandeering enemy ships is pretty fun too.

What got me playing this again after having tried it once a long time ago (I had 45 minutes of game-play already - maybe from a free weekend or something) was seeing that taking over sectors will provide additional income.  Though this won't compare to what is obtained by taking over ships instead.

I'll have to provide a follow-up review after I've played this a lot more - but I'm already convinced this is much better than Starpoint Gemini 2 was (which I'd given a mediocre review for).

However - you should be aware this is not exactly a dog-fighting game - even though the controls work sort of that way.  It's more skewed toward a capitol ship simulation game.  You *have* to get within close range to disable the enemy systems, along with boosting your shields and deploying nanobots - come prepared as the fights are pretty harsh.

The game also has mods - one is a Star Wars ship conversion.

https://www.moddb.com/mods/star-wars-warlords-of-gemini/downloads/star-wars-warlords-of-gemini-v012


Woohoo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065769676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1634662242}
review: Gra pomimo upływu ponad czterech lat od premiery zmaga się z tymi samymi problemami zgłaszanymi od samego początku, z czego tym, który zdecydował o zwrocie pieniędzy jest samoistne i stałe wariowanie kamery na kontrolerze. Jest on nieodzowny do czerpania przyjemności z tak prostej gry, która na klawiaturze wyda się już zbyt trywialna, z kolei po podłączeniu pada granie jest prawie całkowicie uniemożliwione. Z tego powodu nie dane mi było zaznajomić się z większością aspektów tego tytułu, choć jak wynika z krytycznych komentarzy, nie ma ich zbyt wiele i gra jedynie na pierwszy rzut oka udaje posiadanie jakiejś głębi. Gdyby jej zapowiadana i sugerowana przez autorów zawartość odpowiadała stanowi faktycznemu byłbym przez tę grę pochłonięty bo z pozoru zawiera wszystko co powinna zawierać gra moich marzeń. W praktyce  jest dosłownie pusta i nie oferuje niczego poza kilkoma najprostszymi rodzajami powtarzalnych czynności.  Odnoszę wrażenie, że ten wydawca wręcz specjalizuje się w wydawaniu nieudanych gier o kosmosie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137259712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1634710395}
review:
Hopelessly complex and unintuitive UI. Without deeply studying the 36 pg manual (.pdf) this is unplayable (and doing so would take days, or even weeks).

author: {'steamid': '76561198080308053', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1634093325}
review:
There are some great concepts presented in Starpoint Gemini Warlords, but its mediocre gameplay and bland presentation create a rather uninspiring experience. So many of the game's mechanics feel one to two iterations short of being satisfying. From the game's mostly tolerable soundtrack to its average visuals, there really isn't much that stands out. The combat is unexciting to the point that an auto-fire system can be turned on to do the fighting for you. Even worse, ships barely move during combat as it quickly becomes apparent that just parking and firing is the best course of action. Outside of combat, the same lackluster handling is found on every ship regardless of size.  As a result, little in the game's campaign compelled me to switch ships, outside of the required upgrades. The game's story and its implementation are definitely lacking as well. The campaign is comprised of repetitive tasks and the dialogue is extremely text heavy, though oddly there are some random voice acted snippets. Alone these issues aren't dealbreakers, but together they really break any immersion and for a game that relies on players to grind for resources immersion is paramount. Ultimately, I wouldn't recommend Starpoint Gemini Warlords especially at its full price.

+ Decent ship customization options
+ Satisfactory visuals and UI
+ Small learning curve

- Weak dialogue system (Text heavy, partially voice acted, etc.)
- Lackluster campaign
- Poor ship movement and physics
- Gameplay is a grind
- Poorly implemented fast travel system
- Rough combat

author: {'steamid': '76561198139666391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5058, 'last_played': 1691186779}
review:
A massive RTS to explore...one slow-burning hour at a time.

I'm not going to lie, this game isn't going to be for everyone but not for the reasons you expect. To start with, it is your normal RTS game with a twist. Guess what? You actually get to take a permanent active roll in all the carnage! Everything can be interacted through a 4X map where you can manage alliances, build up fleets, and send your own vessel flying into the void. Already taking active part in a massive RTS battle sounds right up my alley since it would add more depth to the combat.

Which is why it breaks my heart that this game is exceedingly slow. I don't know if it is to distract from the fact it basically ripped off Freelancer back in the early days and then strapped RTS elements on it. Hell, maybe it is because this is an RTS game in the loosest sense. What it does do is force you to spend a lot of time staring at the 4X map just enough to get tired of it...then a lot longer after that. Even though you are your own ship in the void and able to do what you want you will still be staring at that map for hours waiting for resources to come slowly pouring in. 

As I said before, this game isn't for everyone. What gives it the recommendation is how I like being able to take an active roll in a massive RTS fight that I ordered. But the slowness of the game really drags it down. Take your pick.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967437577', 'num_games_owned': 1390, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2625, 'last_played': 1630803974}
review:
Game has an interesting idea and format; but seems to fail to execute on all fronts.  4x strat, big ship combat, research, building, and so on...  All done very blandly.  Full of bug from years back that take minutes to fix on your own with a bit of research (combat stuttering -> Fix a bad ogg file; stuck on a mission -> reset it in the save game sgs file to work correctly, and so on).  Things the devs should have fixed in the four years since release, but I think they just gave up or started on their next project.

Its not a bad game, but its not a good game either.  Looks nice, controls are wonky as all can be, main campaign story is boring, there is no real challenge in the game.  Just get a bigger ship and you'll win.  Once you get to a titan, you can take on 50-60 ships at a time and barely lose any shields.

Save your money and find a different game

author: {'steamid': '76561198000651103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8102, 'last_played': 1691942275}
review:
イイゾイイゾ～
いろんな宇宙軍艦がたくさんでいいぞ～
『大航海時代』みたいな交易もできるぞ
日本語完備で安心ぞ～

ただ、全宇宙を統一するプレイなんかは、延々と相手の国力を見て倒せる相手だけ狙って戦っていくじゃないですか。KOEIの『信長の野望』や『三国志』をやってた人には、FCやSFCのゲームをやってる感覚に陥るかもしれん。
あと感情的なとこ言うと、ニホンズィンからすると戦略兵器ぶちかまして惑星併合ってのはいろいろリスクがあるんじゃないの？とか思ったり。
それと、囚人開放して得る僚艦が使い捨てにしかならず無常。とか言ったけど良作だと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561197968446250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1941, 'last_played': 1626726933}
review: This game is absolute garbage. The UI is terrible. There is no real tutorial or even an explanation for most of what happens. But the most frustrating thing is trying to figure out where everything is in their terrible 3D UI. Half the time you think you're shooting at a ship because your mouse is on it, but nothing happens. Turns out the ship is behind you and your ship is shooting forward. Quest calls for you to follow an AI ship? It goes from zero to lightspeed in a moment going the opposite direction as you and your ship can't turn around nearly fast enough before the quest fails. This game is just terrible, don't spend a dime on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016832572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1625518792}
review:
Je n'ai pas beaucoup joué à ce jeu et je vais le désinstaller pour 3 raisons que vous êtes libres de ne pas prendre en compte si ce genre de choses ne vous dérange pas.
Moi, ça m'exaspère au plus haut point.
Donc, du moins grave au plus grave ça donne ça:
1/Les missions ne m'ont pas motivé un seul instant et pourtant on comprend vite qu'il faudra en faire un nombre incalculable pour progresser.
2/J'aime pouvoir alt TAB pour démarrer une vidéo ou une musique en arrière plan quand je joue et revenir au jeu. Or ça fait planter le plein écran du jeu et je dois le redémarrer. Un jeu contenant des tâches rébarbative et peu intellectuelles ne me dérange pas tant que je peux faire ça toutes les 3 minutes en moyenne. Dommage, un mode fenêtré aurait réglé le problème je pense.
3/Les contrôles de base sont infâmes et ne sont pas modifiables. Les combats à mon sens sont une purge. Sans doute que les plus persévérants vont me dire qu'au bout d'un certain temps ça s'apprivoise. Oui mais voila, il faut que le jeu en vaille le coup. Faire 1000 fois des combats sans grand intérêts avec des contrôles qui devraient être illégaux tellement c'est désagréable... très peu pour moi. Les distances de tir sont importantes à gérer sauf qu'on switch en permanence entre contrôler le vaisseau et contrôler la vue. Il y a certaines conventions bien installées qui se retrouvent dans quasi tous les jeux. Tu ne peux pas décider que maintenant la touche saut c'est la flèche de gauche par exemple.

En conclusion je dirais que ce jeu pourrait être ultra plaisant dans l'alternance gestion/action/conquête mais là on cherche le fun, et l'ergonomie est trop aux fraises. Juste si les combats pouvaient avoir lieu dans des poches d'espace un peu variées ça serait chouette.
J'espère que ça aidera les gens à se faire un avis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053665511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5098, 'last_played': 1663569368}
review: The campaign had it's moments, even if it is entirely on rails and cliche. Completed it over a long weekend. Wasn't unhappy. There's a free-play mode I'll try next - no story. Back to the campaign - you're given some freedom to play sim-empire and that appeals. Don't ever bother with the Titan. It's unplayable because of how slow it turn. Huge negative points to the dev team for fleshing that out. It took hours and hours to finally get used the camera. For as little as the games costs now, it's worth a look as it fills a niche. Don't expect too much and you'll have some fun.

review: 可以替代X3的游戏，只是游戏依旧有不尽人意的地方，比如激光导弹打至护盾，会直接穿过护盾，不会与护盾有碰撞体积；另外，炮塔大小没有与舰船大小统一，小至战斗舰，大至无畏舰，都是同一炮塔，属性一样无所谓，但是如果炮塔大小跟随舰船大小变化，效果一定会更好；对于本人来说，以上两点便是最大不足之处了，同样，游戏依旧有BUG，可惜的是官方已经不再更新了，如果能够继续优化更新，这才是极好的，当然，游戏依旧是不错的游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970965696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 10030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10028, 'last_played': 1624302529}
review:
Durchschnittliches Weltraum-RPG-Strategie Spiel mit einigen Ecken und Kanten. Das Spiel orientiert sich klar auf Weltraum-Schlachten. Handel und RPG-Elemente sind sehr einfach gestaltet. Es gibt eine Vielzahl an Schiffen die allerdings sofort obsolet werden, wenn die Großen (Schiffe) kommen. Genau da gibt es meiner Meinung nach ein Problem, denn es fällt auch schnell das Strategie Element weg. Da das Spiel sich nach dem "bigger is better"-Prinzip orientiert sind kleiner Schiffe nach sehr kurzer Zeit nutzlos, da größere Schiffe genau die selben Tätigkeiten erledigen können. Nur besser, da mehr Waffen, Schilde, HP usw.!

Dies finde ich eintönig und nicht gut durchdacht. Zum Schluss besteht deine Weltraum-Flotte aus einen Haufen von Dreadnoughts. Warum nicht mehr an dem alten Spiel "The Jupiter Incident" orientieren. Da hatten die Schiffsklassen einen klaren Charakter und spezielle Aufgaben im Kampf. Wäre für mich wieder etwas interessanter. Es gibt einen kleinen Daumen hoch, da das Entwickler Team sehr klein ist und ich hoffe um einen Nachfolger mit neuem Konzept. Grafisch ist das Spiel sehr gut!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046500196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2740, 'last_played': 1625068350}
review:
好玩
但是2018年就有人討論的BUG，2021年買的，還是有該BUG。
物品倉庫和機庫的船不明原因消失。
BUG很久沒修~比如
1.倉庫和機庫的裝備和船都消失了。最好離開遊戲前都要保持在最好的船。或者手動存檔。
2.一台航母來打哨站，你去參戰後，他就亞光速飛行，追上他也是繼續飛行，打也不打，你也打不到他，呆了了5分鐘，我就離開，然後哨站就被打下了。遇到這種情況，放哨站重新打下!

author: {'steamid': '76561198106766914', 'num_games_owned': 663, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 7352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5377, 'last_played': 1628782920}
review:
警告：请不要做阵营任务，就是和友好的派系大使对话时接的相关任务，完成后，当对方定期给你捐赠东西时，有可能会触发保存游戏后再读取时库存和机库清空的bug。

游戏操作上手可能有一定困难，不过游戏配的说明书和游戏内的教程都很详尽，掌握后还是很顺手的。

游戏中的星云贴图很壮观，但是又很假，朝着星云贴图一直飞，飞到了地方远处的星云会瞬间散去，换成星空贴图，要是能换成真实的星云往进钻就好了。

游戏比前作增加了建设基地、培养舰队、扩张领地的内容，还可以用超级武器征服星球。较大规模的战斗场面也比前作多了不少。有很多种舰船，每搜船的结构、炮台配置等各有特点，不过游戏节奏推进比较快，可能不会去研究那么多。

剧情代入感比前作强了些，但还是有进步空间。推进剧情时可以看看新闻，就是人物日志里的x选项卡，那个读了档以后会清空。

游戏汉化质量整体还行，但是存在名词不统一的情况，比如亡魂又叫公约，堡垒又叫沃德，外域又叫奥特兰斯。

游戏百科做的挺好，对整个星系的各个方面都描述地很详尽。不过有个问题，玩家在探索游玩过程中会不断增加百科的条目，但百科里不显示新增了哪条，还得在一堆词条里自己找，很困难。

总体而言，虽然在很多方面都存在一些不足，但在太空里不断探索、贸易、战斗、征服的过程依旧很愉快，也很有成就感。

author: {'steamid': '76561198003174259', 'num_games_owned': 1741, 'num_reviews': 317, 'playtime_forever': 1159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1159, 'last_played': 1560831104}
review:
[h1] I'm a Nice Warlord [/h1]

[b] What I Liked [/b]

It's actually a pretty good space sim! It's not the best out there, but it's not trying to be.  The best part about the game though was the nice selection of ships and space combat.  Completely fun and worth trying for that alone.

[b] What I Did Not Like [/b]

While you do have a empire to manage, it's not too detailed and shouldn't be the main focus of the game.

[b] Why I Stopped Playing [/b]

A new game came out, so I went on to play that.  Still, I consider this to be a solid game.

[b] Disclaimer [/b]

I have been a gamer for over 30 years.  I tend to play mostly PC games.  I also bounce around between games A LOT.  I may purchase a $60 game and play it for 2 hours or spend $10 on a game and spend 50 hours on it.  Even if I played a game a short time, it does not mean it is bad.  It just means another game caught my attention.  I also complain about flaws in games a lot, even about the littlest of things.  Keep that in mind when reading my reviews.  If I do not have a complaint, then the game must be special!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004066506', 'num_games_owned': 865, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 1181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1622831663}
review:
Quick Edit: I was very negative in the original review but I want to reinforce the good parts of the game really fast. The Fleet battles are fun and interesting (up until you get titan) where positioning of your ship relative to enemies really matters. In addition the grind up to a point is actually enjoyable because the core gameplay loop is relatively enjoyable. Flying around doing repetetive missions and killing the same sets of enemies is fun purely because the combat and ship variety are what carry the game.

Welp. I finally purchased this game. I would give it a Meh. To sum it up this game has a decent single player campaign that is definetly worth 8 - 10 bucks but past that there is really no reason to keep playing. The "4x" elements are insanely barebones and the game is rife with issues from high levels of micromanagment to broken fleet ai. 

You will spend most of your time enjoying the grind to get to the Dreadnaught ships or the TITAN ships but in all honesty the Titan was the least satisfying ship to fly. It felt like it was a poor community made mod and did not feel satisfying when I unlocked it. It is so broken as a ship that you won't even be able to hear your light weapons firing because the ship is too large for the camera to be close enough for the sounds to actually be processed. In addition all of the other ships in the game have actual turret mounts that give you an idea of the firing arcs of your turrets but the Titan just doesn't. It is just flat textures with bullets and missiles appearing out of nowhere. The upside of this is that the ship is so powerful that it doesn't matter if you cannot figure out what is going on because you will hardly ever have your shields penetrated. Essentially the last 5 or so hours of the storyline I was just cruising around in this massive ship just melting any foes that got in my way.

Unfortunately the game is mechanically barebones and really doesn't make for an enjoyable strategy game. I recommend playing this as an RPG first and foremost and then expand your territories in between missions for fun little fights that you can enjoy doing before you get to the point of being OP.

I don't really see myself returning to this title ever for the freeroam modes, to purchase the DLC or for the post campaign "conquer the map" scenario. The grind just is too much for that. Every planet you conquer has a massive fleet battle that you have to participate in where the AI factions bring in roughly 100k worth of fleet power to counter your conquering while you are stuck with a measly 40k for most of the game due to the crazy low fleet capacity. You are only allowed to have about 35k max fleet cap without conquering stations which would be fine if the stations actually gave you more than just 2k fleet capacity. For reference the mainline cruisers are about 2.3k fleet capacity so what ends up happening is you just hit a softcap for fleet cap where you can only field 2 24k fleets while all the other AI factions on the map seemingly have an unlimited number of fleet cap so they will have 3-4 15k patrol stacks that are just a headache to kill more than anything else. The grind is there for the grinds sake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198858649072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3190, 'last_played': 1622877311}
review:
メインキャンペーンをクリアしたので記念レビューです。

もうすごく面白かったです。
自分の艦船と味方の艦隊を引き連れてのリアルタイムな立体360度の艦隊戦、資金や資源を集めるためのサブミッションと15以上の派閥との敵対or中立or同盟による領土の拡大という戦略シミュレーションとのバランスがとても良く、時間を忘れて夢中になって楽しくプレイしました。

自艦は立体360度で動かせますが、エバースペースのように素早く敵弾を回避するというよりは、(特に中盤以降で)巨大な戦艦級の艦船をどう立ち回らせるかが重要になるので、リアルタイムな戦闘中でも適宜戦略を立てて対処するのが好きな人はプレイに向いていると思います。
敵艦隊にフルボッコにされてゲームオーバーになったとき、次はどう対処するのか、私は悔しいながらも楽しみながら最善の戦略をその都度考えなおしながら取り組みました。

なお、本作の性質としては、
・力こそパワー(より強力な艦船が領土を支配する！)
・数こそパワー(敵艦隊は多数の艦船で挑んでくるので、こっちも多勢で攻撃だ！)
・開発こそパワー(より強力な何かを入手するにはこれも欠かせない！)
・領土こそパワー(資源がちっとも貯まらない？　なら敵領土を占領しようず！)
という感じなので、どうやっても敵艦隊に敵わないとなったときには上記を実践することで何とかなるでしょう。

という感じで、メインキャンペーン以外でも、様々なシナリオもあるみたいだし、追加のメインキャンペーンを楽しめるDLCも4つあるしで、かなり長い間楽しめそうなので、今後も時間を見つけてプレイを継続していくつもりです。

author: {'steamid': '76561197996930491', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 5005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3840, 'last_played': 1693640456}
review:
This is a bit of a niche title.
There really isnt anything else quite like it, it satisfies a particular itch for me, when I want to lead around ships and conquer planets and command an empire right from the get go, but I dont really feel like getting into something too complex. This is pretty much just mount and blade in space, except you start with your own kingdom. 
This will really satisfy some of you who are looking for the same type of game. But I can just see some people not enjoying this because it is pretty simplistic and not really close to a sim in terms of the complexity of the mechanics. But that being said everything just works, you get a big fleet and ships and go stomp your neighbors. 
There are pirates, dreadnoughts, auto aiming turrets which I personally find pretty fun. You have some level up and research as well as a doomsday planet invader. When the mood strikes this game perfectly fits what looking for.

review:
its good game if you dont expect too much out of it...

what really slows down the fun is 
1 that the story isnt too great nor is it told very well..
2 at a certain point when your empire has grown enough its just becomes a job to manage it since there is not streamlining in the mechanics you constantly have to order fleets and upgrades INDIVIDUALLY.. 
if someone added options to for example upgrade all of certain operation at once instead of having to go across the ap and do it all one by one that would massively help this game

overall if you want to play big ships and run a space empire its not so bad.. just read some reviews and understand what your buying before you spend your money

author: {'steamid': '76561198003213131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 592, 'playtime_forever': 1366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1366, 'last_played': 1616438391}
review:
Bon ... que dire de SGW ... 

J'avais commencé le jeu, et abandonné une première fois, puis, après qu'on m'ai demandé mon avis dessus en privé, me voilà donc à le recommencer une deuxième fois afin de poster ma recommandation.

Alors la page du magasin donne assez envie de jouer au jeu, il n'est pas moche du tout, il y a du "4X", pas mal de vaisseaux différents ... 

Oui, mais, car c'est une fois dans le jeu que les "mais" vont commencer à pleuvoir.

Mais les contrôles ne sont aucunement intuitif, je me rappelle en plein tutorial, une main sur le clavier en zqsd, l'autre sur la souris, d'un seul coup le tuto me dit, maintenant appui sur 'divide' alors que je suis en plein combat spatial. J'ai cru que mon cerveau c'était fait la malle sur le coup. Il m'a fallut un instant pour comprendre "/", qui évidemment n'était PAS DU TOUT à coté. 

Et tout est comme ça, au début on vous dit, ah c'est cool tu sais, tu peux arraisonner des vaisseaux pour les démanteler et gagner des sous, ou des technologies, ou même directement voler le vaisseau pour ton usage perso ! Tu te dis woaaa ... trop classe ! Donc une fois que t'as eut ta phase tuto, tu essaies. Et ... comment dire ... devoir utiliser la souris, pour cliquer en bas à droite dans un petit rond, EN PLEIN COMBAT, pendant que t'essaie d'éviter tout ce qui te canarde et que tu dois passer trois plombes à voir l'abordage ce faire ... bah c'est pas simple. Surtout qu'au début, des abordages t'en réussit pas des masses, déjà parce que t'as pas beaucoup de troupes à envoyer depuis ton vaisseau, ensuite parce que t'as pas les technologies pour. Et quand t'obtiens enfin les deux, bah même ainsi ça foire et pourquoi ? Parce que t'as pas les bonus de piraterie qui se débloquent au fur et à mesure que tu voles des vaisseaux. Donc tu te retrouves dans des batailles gigantesques à dégommer tout les mega vaisseaux en serrant les fesses pour pas péter tout les petits vaisseaux que tu devras aborder juste ensuite, afin de débloquer les fameux bonus à la con pour plus tard voler les gros vaisseaux ... Et tout ça pour quoi ? 99% du temps, des vaisseau de merde que tu utiliseras jamais, donc bon, tu les envoies à ton QG pour que leurs technos soient recherchés. Mouais. Puis tu te rends compte plus tard, quand tu commences à te démerder, que tout les vaisseaux que t'as envoyé peuvent être déverrouiller en version MK2. Faut juste tous les recapturer une fois de plus chacun. Et est-ce que franchement à sert à quelque chose ? Non, parce que les vaisseaux MK2 du QG que tu débloques avec les recherches sont déjà largement assez sympa.

Parlons ensuite des fameux vaisseaux que tu peux piloter, en gros tu montes de plus en plus jusqu'à finir par débloquer la classe ultime, un méga ultra super balèze vaisseau. Tu l'achètes, tu le prends, tu te dis que là le machin, c'est limite une station spatiale avec des réacteurs, grosso-modo, avec un bidule pareil, t'as plus jamais de soucis, t'as de l'espace en soute incroyable, tu dois avoir des milliers d'armes et de flottes de chasseurs, le rêve quoi. Puis tu le test. Et voilà la douche froide. Un machin ultra lent, avec pas des masses d'armes, très peu de soutes à chasseur. Le seul truc utile c'est qu'il recycle automatiquement toutes les épaves de vaisseaux autour. Donc bon ... Mouais ... Tu le prend par dépit car c'est un peu utile à la progression de ta partie. Mais franchement ça casse les couilles.

Et tout ça, pour l'avoir, faut que tu montes de level, que tu fasses des missions, que tu gagnes de l'argent, que tu t'occupes de ton QG ... Ouep ... sauf si t'es comme moi le genre d'adepte qui sécurise ses positions énormément et fait tout ce qu'il y a à faire AVANT de continuer le jeu. Donc grosso modo, peu de temps après le tuto, on te remet les clef du QG et démerdes toi, va chercher machin, fait venir bidule, va acheter la chose ... Ok mais les gars, vous vous êtes rendu compte qu'on se fait attaquer par des pirates là ? Juste pour savoir, hein, à titre de référence pour plus tard. Non parce que moi, si je dois sécuriser le QG, je vais pas aller faire vos missions à la con à perpette, je vais le SECURISER ce putain de QG de merde. Donc je vais dans les secteurs rouges, j'en chie, je dégage les pirates du premier secteur, et hop, plus personne qui m'emmerde par là, puis je passe au deuxième, troisième, quatrième ... etc. Je gagne des sous, je gagne des level, je me retrouve tout en bas de la map et je peux pas prendre le dernier secteur rouge puisque c'est une planète pirate. Bon, pas de problème, je remonte. Je retourne à mon QG, bon, j'ai tout débloqué, j'ai quasi finit toutes les recherches, ah tient, je peux enfin acheter le vaisseau ultime, je le test ... MOUAIIIIIIISSSSSS ... 

Bon, reprenons la quête principale. Je vous passe les détails, je roule dessus, en gros, je me fais chier et je me dit rien à foutre, je vais explorer. Et ... je commence à le faire, à bord du paquebot le plus énorme et le plus lent de la galaxie. Je gagne plein de ressources, je vend plein de trucs, je dégomme plein d'ennemis ... et je m'emmerrrrrrrrrdeeeeeeeeeee. Là je me dit au fait, il parait que je peux créer des vaisseaux, faire des escadres, les faire patrouiller, prendre des secteurs ... plutôt que de le faire moi-même, je vais regarder ce que ça donne. Je fais créer les vaisseau, je forme une escadre ... ah, non, j'essaie de former une putain d'escadre de merde. Bon, voilà ! Cinq escadres d'un seul appareil ! Allez zou ! Sur l'objectif ! Ils y vont, ils en chient, le combat stagne, j'enclenche l'hyperdrive, je déglingue tout, je récupère automatiquement tout les cadavres avec mon titan des étoiles. Bon, bah ça à même pas rembourser le coup de mes appareils. Je veux même pas savoir combien de vaisseau seront nécessaire pour dégommer un point chaud et de la dépense en matières premières.

Donc voilà, je serai peut-être l'un des seuls à ne pas recommander ce jeux. Mais clairement, dans l'état actuel, c'est sympa, mais c'est une purge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030414092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1623823611}
review:
The controls are so wacked out that I can't play... mouse look is flying all over the place and controller is not much better. After trying numerous settings for both, I reckon it's unplayable for me and my bog-standard rig with wired Razer mouse.

It's almost like they knew how weird the camera is, because they have like 4 control schemes. But all of them have insane mouse acceleration. I couldn't get the camera to do what I wanted... Usually I blame my gear or myself but this is not on my end I think.

Along with that the scale is very weird in that everything looks miniature instead of, you know... big. Like in space. 

All in all I expected little, but got a little less than that. Oh well, that's the risk you take going to the bargain bin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153016062', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5651, 'last_played': 1617881959}
review:
Большой простор для исследования и полёта. Довольно простое/интуитивное управление. Сюжет радует, но не напрягает. Механика стратегии на глобальной карте сделана добротно.
Однако не стоит считать, что всё идеально. У игры есть свои слабые места - учтите это.
В целом рекомендую. Потраченного времени не жалею. Ставлю 8/10 успешных абордажей.
П.С. и 2/15 захваченных планет. Похоже, баг словил.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047517815', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1661058420}
review:
I'm sorry, but the controller support for this game is just awful, And it's advertised under the full controller support label.

Now, I really do want to love this game as much as I did playing it on XB1, but playing it on PC is a nightmare and most of what I'm fighting are the controls. Which feels janky, at best.

Sometimes I have to press up/down/etc. several times to get an input to even register ONCE (in menu UIs primarily). When moving my ship, sometimes the input will act as if I'm holding down an analog input when I'm not (like analog drift). So I'm constantly spinning until I wrestle the stick to STOP registering the motion. The game is advertised as having "Full Controller Support". I realize that it doesn't mean an ideal mapping scheme, but what that does carry the implication that it SHOULDN'T be bipolar in terms of input response. That's part of what compatibility means.

And no. It's not my controller at all. I've tested this with every other game in my library with controller support. I have tested it with different controllers. This is an issue with the game, I'm afraid. :(

I have tried looking for solutions but there is practically no technical support to be found. Tons of topics made in the forums regarding this complaint that haven't been responded to. No FAQ that identifies this problem or any solutions to it. 

Unless you don't mind playing this on mouse and keyboard, I'd stay away from this game and turn toward something else.

I would love to change my opinion on this game (regarding the Steam version), but until this issue is resolved... my thumb is pointing down on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081354312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1616614882}
review:
Ich habe jetzt 7 Stunden in 2 Tagen ernsthaft versucht mit diesem Spiel Spaß zu haben , aber es geht einfach nicht . 
Ich hatte eine Art Rebel Galaxy erwartet mit Aufbauaspekten , bekommen habe ich ein Spiel mit einer viel zu trägen Geschichte als das sie einen irgendwie mitreißen würde und einem lächerlich kleinen Anpassungmenü
für die Schiffe .
Über all das hätte ich ja noch hinweg geschaut , wenn da nicht dieses Kampfsystem wäre , das es mir unmöglich macht  für länger als 30 Sekunden zu kämpfen ohne das mir schlecht wird .
Ich habe schon eine Korvette ( das 5te Schiff das zum Kauf steht ) und es läuft immer darauf hinaus das man einem anderen Schiff hinterherdreht . Also Maus zum Bildschirmrand und drehen , drehen und drehen .

Wenn man es dann mal mit größeren unwendigen Schiffen zu tun hat , schießt man drauf , und 15 Sekunden zu warten bis die Energie wieder für die Waffen da ist und schießt wieder um zu warten ... 
Ich denke besser als RG wird es nicht .

24.03.2021 Jeder der Kommentare nicht zulässt ist ein Rückgrat loses Stück Bio Fairtrade Käse .
