author: {'steamid': '76561198016603957', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 283, 'playtime_forever': 1708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1708, 'last_played': 1591964988}
review:
First, I considering Starpoint Gemini 2 as "barely enjoyable" C-.

Warlords is *worlds* better, definite A (possibly better).  
Every aspect is a quantum leap ahead... story, storytelling, voice acting, game play, progression, non-combat activity viability... 
There's no comparison.

If you're going to get one, get warlords.  If you're going to get both, play 2 first... otherwise the quality of warlords will utterly ruin the 'fun' of 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029284455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1178, 'last_played': 1671637872}
review: Started the game, wanted to make money fast so i decided to trade, found out that you can make a ton by just trading items from space station to planet.  traded items like a mad man for 4 hours, also found out that you lvl insanely fast when trading. started the game at lvl 28 and the best ship i could buy at the time.  Had a lot of fun wrecking everything i could possibly find, but did make the whole freelancer thing kinda pointless, no point in doing missions on the mission board.  I would recommend trying it out, i had a lot of fun and still enjoying myself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995034940', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 2211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2177, 'last_played': 1642576653}
review:
It is a pretty straight forward space game. Pilot small to massive ships as you progress through the game. Customize these ships with a (limited) variety of weapons. Place system modifications on weapons, engines, shields, etc. Transfer weapons to new ships but not modifications. Capture or sabotage enemy ships via boarding party but beware of boarding team's energy and the fact that your fleet will stop shooting the ship that is boarded. Run missions that include main mission, board mission, and points of interest. Earn Perks and Skills for your character. Research various tech, build a space station, build or pirate a fleet, and take over the universe! 

I had fun with the game, even with skipping a massive amount of the side missions, I managed to clock in 36.3 hrs before I defeated the main story line. The strange part is that the main quest only had you run around a fraction of the map. The rest of the map was unused as I didn't wander around it or take over the entire universe. At the end of the game, it just left me with an "oh." feeling. I purchased this game on sale for around $15 with a couple of DLCs and it was worth every penny. 

If you are looking for a game to scratch that sci-fi spaceship battle itch, this could be the game for you! But, if you are looking for a deep sci-fi RPG experience this is not it. Although the game attempts to be an in depth with all the previously mentioned features, at the core game play it is a lot of wash rinse repeat. So although I would recommend it for those seeking a basic space battle type game, I can't recommend it past that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198813243843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3467, 'last_played': 1699228264}
review:
宇宙船でドンパチするのは面白い。
最初は大したことのない船ですが勧めていく内に強力な艦船を使い、艦隊を率いて盛大な戦争を引き起こせる。
面白い、面白いぞ、強いと思っている相手を一方的な暴力でぶちのめすのは快感でしか無い。

…最近悩まされいるバグ。
戦闘終了直後に超高速で移動し始める。
しかもタイトルに戻る以外に解決策がない。
どれくらい高速かって？
マップ中央から数秒程度でマップ外まで移動するほどだよ！
しかもワープ用のアイテムを10個近く費やすほど遠くに移動する。

author: {'steamid': '76561197978199586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1589983796}
review:
The music and visuals are competent. The control scheme is not great but forgivable when you Google guides on the game and learn that it's intended to be played as a capital ship game, not a space fighter game.

The presentation and gameplay are aggressively mediocre. It feels like it was designed by a hobbyist mod team in their free time, rather than professional game developers. The interface is passable at best and the dialogue reads like it was written by a teenager. In fact, it gives off the impression that everything was designed by teenagers. In the opening sequence, all the male character portraits are zoomed in from the shoulders up, but the ONE named female character's portrait is zoomed out to show her cleavage in a needlessly revealing outfit.

The core gameplay involves rotating your ship while it autofires on your enemies. The mission design is "autopilot to here, click a thing, autopilot back to base". Nothing is explained beyond the most basic of controls, unless you want to spend hours reading a poorly organized and poorly written "Geminipedia". Based on what I've read, I guess there's more to the game at some point but I couldn't be arsed to find out because nothing in the first 3 hours of play is even remotely interesting.

I paid $7 for this game on sale and I feel ripped off.

author: {'steamid': '76561199018610901', 'num_games_owned': 30, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1589977830}
review: 空间站进不去

author: {'steamid': '76561198015453045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1589916064}
review:
You know, i am not a dumb person, i can skip or miss some parts here and there but overall i'm not a fool. But in this game I constantly feel like a fool.

I mean i finished like 5-6 campaign and 4 freelance missions and still not sure what is happening in my campaign and what should i do in open world.

In that noob zone around your home base every single non-mission enemy has tried to wipe me out the universe. And i was unable to fight back because even my uber skill (sniper-shot-something, with an awful and out of place charing animation) just scratched them at 1-2% per shot... while i take 10-20% damage per enemy shot. Also my heavy weapon ("heavy", with 5-7% per shot) got like 5(!) charges total. I got my next ship and nothing has changed, exept now i am flying a little slower and have 3 mining(???) lasers and my old subpar "heavy" cannon with 5 charges. :)

The game has a very simple graphics and effects, the ships are somewhat good looking but the rest of the world is just went stright back from 2000s. Game controls are weird, not complicated but weird, i think you can get used to it after a while. But... why make them like this, to punish players just for lulz?

I do not play games in order to feel dumb or frustrated. So i just delete this game and gonna retrive X: Rebirth from my Steam backlog, finish it and then i will try X4: Foundations. I have tried Elite Dangerous one month ago... But, welp, it is just not for me, ED is just too comlicated (there are like 10 screens of hotkeys alone!) and slow to my tastes.

Good luck devs, i know that you love your game, so maybe your next game will be a bit better!

review:
This is by no means a "bad" game. It's just not good enough to recommend.

It's a bit like X3 Lite; a bit shallower, a bit less scope, a bit less involving.

It also has the worst control scheme I have ever seen in any game, space or otherwise. I think if the controls were any good at all I would have stuck with it and given it a lot more time and effort but in the end, here I am not recommending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023821266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1594726847}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981015842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1588885918}
review:
This was part of a software package that came bundled with my computer, and I'm glad I didn't have to pay for it.  It looked like it had so much promise but it is severely hindered by a very cumbersome control scheme and limited guidance on what to do.  Even in the tutorial, the objectives aren't clear and it seems impossible to zoom out far enough to get a good view of what's going on in a battle around you.  Basically you get to see your own ship zooming around in circles as you try to keep your primary target in view, while enemies represented only by deltas on your screen fire at you.
Sure, there's more actually going on around you, but you won't be able to see it in the "extreme close-up" mode that this game runs in.  Ships handle awfully and seriously, if it's just a "learning curve" it's too steep for something that is supposed to be FUN.  There are plenty of other space games that make it easier for you to interact with the universe around you.
I'm disappointed because I *wanted* to like this game.  
I might try it again some other time but for now I need something that will be less clunky to learn.

review:
I have no idea what the freeroam mode is like. I may still try it. Or I may not.
The campaign mode puts you in the role of an oversexed female character with annoying voice acting. Call me old-fashioned, but I'm sick to death of the SJW types cramming their fetishes into my face. This is an RPG. It's important for immersion in an RPG that the player can engage with their character.  As I am not a woman and have ZERO interest in playing one, and as there is not even an option to play the campaign with a character of your choice, I'm giving this a thumbs down.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976461869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2272, 'last_played': 1586722605}
review: Can be fun to play initially, but quickly falls apart after that. The game quickly becomes repetitive, with larger ships playing exactly the same as smaller ones but with slower acceleration. Larger ships use the EXACT same weapons as smaller ones, just more of them and with the largest ones also getting access to fighters. Fighters are one of the most poorly balanced mechanics I've ever seen in a game. Each individual fighter (not even a bomber mind you) does more damage than a Frigate (lower middle class ship) while coming in groups of 3-6, in addition to having infinite ammo and being indestructible. Smaller ships become quickly and completely obsolete because they don't have any advantages over larger ships in combat, even factoring in resource costs, and no purpose outside of combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020768434', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2564, 'last_played': 1586377202}
review:
Summary (compared to X3)
pro:
- Campaign (short)
- Fights are OK cause of abilitys and some special equipment
- controlabel Fleet 
- Different Ships
- ca. 40h fun Gameplay

contra:
- no trading
- no dplomacy
- no lategame
- to less diversity in ships (you always pick the biggest; Doom stack)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This game reminds me alot from X3. If you like to play a little around and dont mind a bit grind its a couple hours fun to play the story. unfortunately there is no lategame. its very boring repeatedly. theres no real diplomacy- or tradesystem.

 Its not a bad game, and i like a lot of the mechanics. Like the fighters for the carriers. Small ships always get shot down in bigger fleet and its a pain to manage in such games. The approach is good. But theres no point defence and the fighters are very moody to fight other fighters or bombers to defend your ship.

Like i sayd, i compare a lot to X3 and it was a lot of fun this 40 hours. But theres no more. The game has to less content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033449946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 12473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11895, 'last_played': 1586318918}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000172970', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1607831398}
review:
This game honestly felt like a fantasy RPG with a space ship skin, as your player ship has 'special abilities' with cooldowns (such as spawning a decoy ship out of thin air that does damage) and more focus is placed on running around doing errands than the 'strategy' side of the 4X which I was hoping for. I dont know, may be the game 'opens up' in around 20-30 hours. But I sure as hell am not sticking around to find out, because the initial 10 hours was boring enough already.

I've also seen some people say that this game is "Mount and Blade but in space", but this game does none of the things that make Mount and Blade fun, be it proper army(in this case fleet) management, intuitive controls, or more varieties in units, be it friend or foe (the ship design in this game are not exactly inspiring, nor do they differentiate from each other enough other than simply a different silhouette. )

If you're looking for a arcadey space game that plays like a fantasy RPG, with a very light hint of 4X strategy, this might be the game for you. If you're looking for a space game with proper fleet and empire management, as well as more nuanced spaceship control, or even "Mount and Blade but in space", then you should look elsewhere. This ain't it, chief.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007558399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1583530347}
review: Honestly I don't remember why I bought it and I wish I hadn't, or that I'd returned it before it was too late. The combat is boring and really not explained to you, except get close to a target and let the guns auto-fire. Maybe more is explained later, but I'm not into games that take over and hour to give me a reason to want to play them. Unless you really, really like space ships, don't bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988059328', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 7809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4835, 'last_played': 1584030581}
review: Short version: This game doesn't explain much and you will be hours in before you realize some really cool features of the game and/or controls that were never explained. The controls can seem awkward at first but truly are done very well once you're further into the game and have a good grasp of them. This also actually adds to the greatness of the game as it gets better and better continually all the way to the end and figuring out some feature you didn't know about just adds to that. A true gem once you get past the first couple hours and start to realize what you're getting into and not a pushover. Save often! The pirating function is addicting as hell and I wonder why it's not in more space games. Highly recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198052269077', 'num_games_owned': 620, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2404, 'last_played': 1583382621}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039997480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3304, 'last_played': 1583748091}
review: Well I've Put in about fifty hours now so obviously its a pretty good title! I do wish the maps were bigger with more content like some other 4X titles, but they aren't small, its about the size of a solar system, which seems to be the intent, they just aren't as big as i would like to create the feeling of vastness that space has in reality. I really enjoy the way they blend controlling your own personal ship and abilities along with a fleet and military industrial development of the sectors your faction controls. It had some pretty beautiful space scenery as well in which we can freely fly around and do what we want how we want to achieve our goals and the goals of the storyline, and I like how after you complete the story you can continue to play sandbox mode style, a very nice touch, its disapointing in other games when you put in all the effort to develop your empire or character only to have it all end as soon as it starts going really well, but here you dont have to worry about that, you can continue to enjoy the fruits of your effort even after completing the storyline.  if they combined this with the crafting options and nearly infinite worlds of no mans sky it would be pretty awesome xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198045497821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1698, 'last_played': 1560912449}
review:
This is by far one of my favorite space games as far as a roaming shooter RPG goes. Not to be confused with a space sim. I enjoy this game and find it fun except for some of the longer flight times to get to places early on in game. Later after you get more funds available it's good to buy speed boosts and T-drives to equip for faster travel.

The Graphics are good and the overall gameplay is fantastic. I recommend picking this up and giving it a go. Especially if you've played any of the other Starpoint Gemini games.

I've played all but the original Starpoint Gemini and I like them all so far except for the early access version of 3. I'll not get into details of Starpoint Gemini 3 here, however, early access is just that early access and not a complete game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103776534', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1571, 'last_played': 1582407139}
review:
It's an enjoyable game, even with it's predictable plot and really repetitive gameplay... 

 Seriously, the ships get more and more expensive which puts you on an endless and annoying grinding mode through side quests and freelance contracts, now, the problem is that you can only accept 1 freelance contract at the time, which means that you get the contract and you get kicked out of the base to go fulfill the contract, you go and get the job done and you need to go back to the station in order to get another contract, not to mention that it would seem to that the reward doesn't seem to scale up to the contract's difficulty.

 On another side, this game would greatly benefit from a control rework... camera it's way too sensitive...

author: {'steamid': '76561197970517334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1581393576}
review: After 4 hours of wrestling with the UI and cringe-worthy dialog, I uninstalled it. My gaming time is better spent elsewhere. Really wanted to like it too since there seems to be a significant amount of content. Will look into the modding to see if it corrects some of the issues I have, if so then I will change my review.
developer_response:
Hello Pharohe! I'm sorry you don't approve the experience from the game. Warlords is actually two different genres in one, so amount of controls is larger then average. Unlocked free camera for both movement of the view and ship alike is also something that players haven't seen too often and can cause confusion for some. However, after a while it usually sinks in and reveals all the options enabled this way.
Regarding voices...not much we can do there now. Sorry to hear you don't like them. 
I do appreciate your feedback, despite being negative at this point. You tried the game and expressed your honest opinion, and I thank you for your time. If you think I could help you out with some specific answer, please let me know and I will do my best...

author: {'steamid': '76561197991371784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 17190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2906, 'last_played': 1584908969}
review:
Great space RPG game, just get ready to waste your life grinding credits to buy the next size ship,
oh and once you have, start again to buy the next one. LOL

-Research new equipment for your ships 
-Build your own space station
-create your own fleets
-board and capture ships

The story line is ok, you can finish the campaign in a short time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052553408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6281, 'last_played': 1690481383}
review: Игра интересна своей возможностью отыграть роль "отца нации", также хочу отметить интересный микроменеджмент станции, возможность развивать свои корабли и брать в подмогу компаньонов, неплохо реализовано изучение технологий. Игра атмосферная, очень динамичная, в чём-то похожа на старую добрую freelancer а в чём-то на серию x. Надеюсь создатели игры будут развивать экономическую составляющую и делать другие глобальные квесты - они очень здорово расширяют игру и добавляют интересные приключения. Ну и как всегда - больше крутых кораблей и больше крутых стволов...)))

author: {'steamid': '76561198028238016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 3455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2317, 'last_played': 1581227789}
review:
I have enjoyed my time in this game. Taking a fleet of ships with you is fun. Building up your territory is fun. Some points seemed grindy but there are a lot of things to do for those parts. 

There isn't a lot of depth to the game but that is okay I would say it is worth 20 dollars for everything including all dlc. I still have things to do and I am still enjoying it 38 hours in. Haven't looked at mods but I hope they add some playability to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081606944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 19572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3354, 'last_played': 1699566820}
review:
Up to the Star
:P
Fajna gierka taka dla relaksu tylko że ma parę błędów a mianowicie jak lecisz w podświetlnej i z fleetem to od czasu do czasu jakiś okręt z fleeta cię uderza i spowalnia lecenie bo wybija cię z linii lotu po wielu godzinach to staje się strasznie uciążliwe, po drugie czasami okręty we fleecie jak walczą to stoją jak kamienie i nic nie robią np z taką korwetą jak walczą co np. taki Carier na hita by zniszczył ją to dopiero ty podlatujesz i ściągasz ją na hita bo twój Carier nie wiem nie widzi jej czy co bo nawet nie strzela dopiero jak podlecisz to albo zacznie strzelać albo nie, po trzecie okręty mają problem z wykrywaniem innych okrętów czy jakichś obiektów budowlanych odbijają się jak piłeczki pimpongowe, po czwarte jak masz niszczyciel planet to pod niektórymi kontami jak się patrzy w czasie bronienia go to gra potrafi strasznie lagować czyli słaba optymalizacja w niektórych terenach czy miejscach jak się patrzy pod jakimiś kontami. jeśli się przejdzie kampanie to są jeszcze conquesty czy dodatkowe scenariusze w DLC TYLKO że wszystko jest takie same (więc nie wiem czy jest sens wszystko ogrywać za jednym razem bo po 2 skończeniach kampanii to już wychodzi bokiem, więc trzeba zrobić przerwę i można wrócić za rok czy jakoś tak jeśli się nie znudzi) tylko inne nazwy frakcji (a cała oprawka to wszystko to samo) nawet niema podziału na typowe bronie dla danej nacji bo każda nacja ma takie same szkoda trochę bo mogli podzielić to na inny rodzaj uzbrojenia w każdej nacji, dobrze że jest podział na inne okręty w różnej nacji trochę urozmaicenie i jeszcze by się coś znalazło ale starczy. Ale mimo to daje plusa bo mimo wszystko to przyjemnie się gra.

Jak ktoś lubi takie gierki i dla relaksu bo gra nie jest aż taka trudna w sumie i można w nią pograć na lajcie ale jeśli szukasz czegoś rozbudowanego to lepiej Seria X jest lepsza dla ciebie a jeśli tylko polatać na lajcie to ta gra jest spoko.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027879595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1579, 'last_played': 1580505504}
review:
Loving this game, especially for the combat. To be fair, I would call this a "lite" 4-X game, with less of the micro-management that earmarks the genre. In my case, that sets it aside from other 4-X types in a positive way, and gives it an almost casual "pick up and play" kind of feel. Great investment, especially if you nab the bundle, and the above description interests you.

8 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197987782215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3031, 'last_played': 1579169805}
review: Not as in-depth as some other  games such as the X series, this stripped down space-flight sim is enjoyable nonetheless, with plenty of ships and weapons and equipment to test out and upgrade. The controls are simple, and at higher levels, it becomes very enjoyable watching as your death fleets slice through entire star systems with ease. Plus, it's always satisfying to bring a planet to heel with the Proxima (your very own junior-league Death Star). Gameplay gets fairly repetitive and stale after a while, and it lacks the replayability  of some other titles, but if you see this on sale, it's well worth it. You should probably get a good couple dozen hours enjoyment out of it if you enjoy these sorts of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009669343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2770, 'last_played': 1578865241}
review:
46h pour la campagne principale + retour des titans, en promo à 15€ ça vaut le coup.

les - :
-La gestion de la camera est assez horrible (mais pas gamebreaking)
-Le vol en flotte est aussi trés mal géré
-La géopolitique inexistante (déclarer une guerre n'a aucun impact...)
-Les effets visuels des armes un peu discrets

Les + :
+Gestion du vaisseau, des flottes et de la faction en général
+Le torrent drive pour se déplacer plus vite sur la map assez grande
+Les vaisseaux supercapitaux, parce que la taille compte
+Le système d'abordage, simple mais qui ajoute une couche de stratégie

author: {'steamid': '76561198004686603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 4144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1356, 'last_played': 1686498123}
review:
A good solid space empire sim.  It's not to complex in mechanics and doesn't require a Phd to learn either, it's quite simple and that is it's strength.  

In essence you start out with a faction and a ship and then have to build up your faction, setting up your infrastructure, managing research, building and commanding fleets and taking over territory.  A nice, compelling gameplay loop and almost every action is just a click or two away, no deep diving of menus to get anything done. 

Combat is decent, you are flying capital ships not fighters so it's slower.  You can control turrets yourself or have them auto-fire.  You select one of three classes that have 4 special abilities you can use in battle so you can focus on this while letting your turrets fire at the enemy if you so wish. 

Overall I do recommend for space fans.

review: Overall, I really enjoy this game. Good amount of things to do and has an easy playstyle. I like the combat and the way it incorporates a 'broadsides' sort of tactic. Also, there seems to be a lot to explore in the game world as well. The main story is pretty horrible, with lots of reading some really unrelatable characters/interactions, but the free play is fun. I've heard someone describe the game as 'Mount and Blade: Warband' in space and so far what i've experienced seems about correct.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014146692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1693267419}
review: The game starts quite like a standard space sim. The first few hours are basically introducing the storyline and setting your character up as the commander of a massive space station. The 4X elements don't come in until after your station has been reduced to rubble and you completely take over operations of the station and gathering resources to rebuild both station and fleet. The game shows a lot of promise and I'm excited to explore deeper into the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011835656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1578771609}
review: Pretty awesome game. The controls seem to be a little wonky at first but with practice you can start zipping around and blowing things up with ease. Seems like there is a never ending plethora of stuff to do, which is great for this style game. Story line is a little random but nothing hard to follow. I'm still trying to figure out certain aspects of the game but that makes it more interesting. If you are into 4x style space games where you are the ship actually doing most of everything, then this is right up your ally. Prepare to spend countless hours enjoying the wonders of Gemini.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977677504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1577701423}
review:
Impression at five hours, doubt I'll go for six

Initial impression of combat is dreadful, everything spins around you its like trying to hit something with a peashooter while sitting on the waltzers. I had trouble seeing something long enough to target it never mind hit it. Also unlike gemini 2 there seemed to be no indicator if your auto fire was on or off and while trying to keep a target in view / range i was constantly pressing my autofire on and off to see if it was actually working or not.

luckily I had assigned a wingman to my fleet or i'd never have hit anything, So I just spun around helplessly while my wingman or nearby ships would eventually kill off the enemy ( not fun )

I would imagine whoever programmed this wasn't using a mouse and keyboard to fly with maybe its easier with a controller or a joystick. 

Everything else seems to have been programmed to be as frustrating as possible, eg: shoot  an asteroid ...no you don't seem to get some minerals  with every hit so some you get none. Also  if its a big asteroid all the pieces fly off in different directions making hitting them slow and frustrating  to catch up with them  as the the distance to hit them is very small which now means your out of range of all the other bits which have flown off. For the paltry amount of minerals you get why oh why did they make this so frustrating. 

It also seems that every second piece of cargo you manage to acquire after combat is illegal ... you spend more time going to your cargo to destroy illegal cargo then you do picking it up. You end up just leaving cargo behind as its too annoying to either risk getting caught with it or having to destroy it. Tip if you must have loads of illegal cargo let us check a box to automatically destroy illegal cargo or not pick it up.

Pity because I like the idea of building fleets and an empire but its just no fun not being unable to hit anything in combat and everything you do no matter how simple eg: mining being designed to be deliberately difficult, awkward and low reward. Tip if you make something awkward and difficult at least make it high reward. I liked gemini 2 which had much more reasonable controls and simpler combat ... you could actually target and hit things

author: {'steamid': '76561198006908388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 10777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2593, 'last_played': 1666059459}
review:
Good game for about 30-40 hours.
The gameplay is fun, with pew-pew in space and empire management, skills and perks, and nice events (missions, bounty hunting, exploration, trade, mining...) but galaxy is small and the progression is too easy/fast: I began to grind mission, dreaming of a better ship, but I skipped most of them and went from a Firgate to a Battlecruiser to a Dreadnougth in two game sessions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050718401', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 3381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3381, 'last_played': 1576315808}
review:
Well now that I finished it an most of the DLC's.

Combat was fun enough. Im a simple woman who has simple desires: I get to fly big space ship, Im a happy girl. Once I Started annihilating with my Legion Titan, Everything was just. Perfect. (I highly recommend the mods that make titans and carriers way better and more expensive. Makes them actually worth playing. And while we are on mods, get the one that increases your income per zone collected, will sort out some of the grind that I will discuss below. 

My biggest gripe is that destroyers and below are only good at the start, and quickly fall off. Gun ships will last about 10 seconds from the start of combat. I wish that was an eggsaturation but it is not. They die REAL fast when other big ships exist. Small ships should be able to harrass and stay out of firing arcs. But they cant, So they are a waste of materials in the end.

 The story was freaking boring as hell. No words written were interesting to me (Which is scathing and Im sorry, but I just hated all of it.) I dont have anything else to say except you wont be missing out if you just skip through conversation as fast as possible.

THis game is grindy. I dont mind grind if its fun! And the game is fun, but there is a limit! And this game got real close to that.

But when you need to grind for hours to continue the story? Thats bad game design. Grind to make the campaign easier later on? Sure, but not as an actual objective. One of the last story missions took over 15 hours to do. Just that one mission, because I needed to grind out taking over as much of the map I could to get the resources to do research that was story critical. No.  Bad. Do not.

In the end, I got to have a fleet of dreadnoughts and Pilot a massive Titan. That was fun. But I cant recommend this game.

Go play Endless Sky instead. The writing is better, there's way more gameplay to be had, and the game IS FREE. Go check it out. 

This game gets a thumbs down from me unfortunately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198863307604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1587712817}
review:
总体还是可以的，但问题也不少。。。
1.剧情开头有点莫名其妙的“变更”主角（操作角色）。
2.操作感十分的别扭————然后才明白，原因有2点：
    1）炮台居然不能攻击屏幕中心，这个设定很反人类啊。。。
    2）视角镜头的跟踪，不是固定的（只有第一人称和座舱视角是固定的，另外几种都不行）。这点还不如自由枪骑兵。。。
3.采矿和自由枪骑兵是一样的，都是炮台攻击。但采矿系统的话，还说EVE做的更好。
4.开局选择技能天赋还有说明，但是更重要的第一艘船，却没有任何比较对比。。。
5.新手村的船坞里，全是不能买的船（有钱也不行）——刚才可以选择的那一堆船哪里去了？
6.如果设定了商人和赏金猎人之类的职业道路，那么要玩多久才能开始？
——————
小结：游戏是还不错，但相比于其他更好玩的游戏，明显不足（最大的问题是要命的操作感）。换句话来说，游戏的底子是好的，改动一些设定，就可以成为经典。

author: {'steamid': '76561198032678805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1426, 'last_played': 1577536075}
review:
For the most part I like this game.

Pros:
+ I like the combo of rpg and 4x.
+ The start is challenging, I like that.
+ The feel of space around you is very good. You can fly in all directions, but you wont get lost. Feels open world
+ lots of side missions
+ Lots of stuff to spend your money on

Cons:
- The music is really quickly going on my nerves. After only one session I turned it all the way off.
- After you get a good ship, nothing is hard any more. (unless you count the grind, see below)
- Late game is really really grindy. You need a shit-ton of resources to finish the main story and its SLOW!
- The story is really linear. Makes it feel less like a true open world.
- Main quest is mostly in text, I would have liked it to be at least voiced. Maybe even a movie clip here and there.
- Civilian tasks feels really grindy. Feels like something an advisor would be bored doing and made a clerk do.

Would still recommend it for space nerds like me, I have gotten lots of nice hours of it. Now I just need to work past the grindy ending and then I can try one of the other classes!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999003048', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3329, 'last_played': 1578495419}
review:
I've had a lot of fun with this game. The strategic/conquest aspect of the game, while not world-changing, kept me engaged when running around trading or doing random missions, which is where most space sims lose me. However, there are a few things you should probably know before buying:

1. Combat, even for the smallest ships, is battleship-based, with shield facing being more important than dogfighting skills. If you don't want to use Fire At Will (and have the light guns fire automatically for you) you're almost certainly going to be spending a while tweaking aiming and camera options for Turret view to get it just right for shoot for yourself while still being able to turn your ship to keep your strongest shields facing the enemy.

2. Most Freelance missions and random encounters scale to your ship and the fleet you bring. Fly around in a Dreadnought and a fleet full of Supercaptial ships and almost every random hostile encounter (especially in enemy space) will be the Battle of Endor. Fly solo in a Frigate, and expect only a handful of ships with Destroyers and the occasional Cruiser being the largest thing you run across in most cases.

3. The story is.... there. Luckily there are a lot of options for Free Flight/non-campaign starts, so you don't have to go through it again if you want to start fresh (or at all if you don't need chevos or a tutorial,) but don't expect anything compelling there to keep you playing.

4. Few pro tips: Hitting the key for a specifc camera view for the second time will toggle you out of it, so if you only use two views most of the time, you only need on key in reach. Bounties are hilariously overpowered for their ship size; you might want to bring a fleet. Capturing ships to sell is probably the best way to make money (after trading of course) and other than Warmasters and some objectives you can do it to pretty much any hostile ship as long as you have the perks to pull it off. Finally, the Interstate Faction (at least in my game) will buy your strategy resources for cold hard credits once you unlock trade deals. They also IIRC don't have a station or region of their own by default, so you don't even have to worry about going to war with them at some point either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047622599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8143, 'last_played': 1576826355}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052271794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2975, 'last_played': 1576701170}
review:
TL;DR- Buy on sale.

A fun but quirky game, with a fantastic premise and okay implementation.  Feels like it could have been one of the greats, but falls short.  Still a fun game to play through if you enjoy space combat games.

Pros-
Decent customization of your ship.  Choosing weapon loadouts and special enhancements on each gives a good feeling of uniqueness to your ship.

A good mix of 4x and Space combat elements. Good balance between prioritizing empire building and solo ventures gives two solid points of progression linked to, but distinct from eachother.

Decent campaign. Whilst not anything mindblowing, the campaign story and missions are done well enough to keep you interested.


Cons-
Ship classes literally boil down to just how good they are.  As soon as you can get the next class up, you wil never ever use a smaller class.  This is probably my biggest letdown in the game, as having distinct roles for each class would have been great, but it's more accurate to think of them all as different levels of the same class.  Each "Class" of ship is just a more armored, more shielded, more guns, and same maneuverability as the one before it.  This may be the main thing stopping it from being a great game, as having to strategize your fleet composition instead of just making only the largest available ships and feeling like you can specialize in a frigate smuggler, or cruiser captain would add immensely to gameplay and replayability.

Replayability isn't where you would think.  Due to the somewhat linear nature of progression, I found it really hard to play any of the free-form modes.

Difficulty comes in spikes and then becomes inanely easy once you get the largest class.  You'll go from well balanced battles to getting instantly killed by enemies to going AFK whilst you single handedly wipe out the map.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038121331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 2045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1575744182}
review:
Very good. You have to get a few missions in before the game actually reveals itself but once you do its a big improvement on Starpoint Gemini 2.
Has most of the same drawbacks as SG2 but there's a lot more to do than just save money for a better ship.

You can now customise your ships with much more control than before, which is great, but also a complete pain to use as the tool is like trying to paint a ship that is both offset and either too far away or right in front of your face with a paintbrush that is stuck up your nose. With a lot of patience I was able to create some pretty sweet looking ships though so bear with it.

review: I have no idea what I'm doing, but I'm having fun! The beginner tutorial mission seems to be doing a good job laying out the basics and showing me my options. It looks like there's going to be a lot of depth to this game once I finally accumulate enough rank and credits. It's much more combat-oriented than No Man's Sky. It has a lot in common with Elite Dangerous, but with a slightly gentler learning curve. I'd recommend it for at least ten hours of play; beyond this point remains to be seen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974041596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 16981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14817, 'last_played': 1676554599}
review:
I think this game is underrated and is actually quite remarkable.  I have played a lot of space games over the years and this captures some of the classic joys of fleet battles and dog fighting along the lines of Freespace 2 while adding an entirely new feeling real time space empire builders typically only seen in turn based strategy games.

Don't let the low price fool you, aside from a few bugs and some mediocre voice acting, this is a solid game easily worth $99 for the main game plus all DLC. 

One aspect I love about this game is it has an almost role-play like progression.  After the prologue, you start in a small ship and start putting together your ragtag band of misfits as your entire faction stands on the brink of total destruction. 

I think perhaps some of the people who feel it is too grindy may have stuck too closely to the main campaign story line.  There is so much more to do! I have onlly have felt that I had to grind a couple hours here and there when I "just couldn't wait" to get that next MK2 Dreadnought added to my fleet or I found a hidden weapon's dealers and just HAD to have that new beam weapon for the forward turret of the flagship under my personal command.

The other thing I did which kept me leveled up without grinding was I decided to start aggressively taking territory away from hostile factions (okay, and perhaps I may have betrayed a few neutral factions too) which greatly expanded my income base needed for research, fleet building, and ships/upgrades.  It is also gives you quite an edge in the main campaign to secure some jump gates at strategic locations.

Lastly, GET THE DLC for the first playthrough, if not all of them, then at least "deadly dozen". They make the experience even richer than it already is and give you even more to do outside the lines of the main campaign.  I remember the first time I saw a big skull icon appear on my sector map...do I go check it out? am I ready to take them on? Some of the other DLC can wait until later as you don't get access to titan type ships until after the main game campaign.

This review is already too long, but thanks for those who took the time to read it, I don't write many reviews.  I left the section open for comments.

review: I dont quite understand why people are saying "this game has a large learning curve for new players" the game has tutorial missions and little videos for pretty much all of the major mechanics. The game itself is enjoyable to say the least the fact that i can just sit back and leave my starting region and become a trader. i can also do missions for the other alliances building myself up as a mercenary, or i can build up my empire and conquer the other empires. The graphics are pretty good for this small development team, overall id rate this game an 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032566216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5050, 'last_played': 1638394433}
review:
I really enjoy the game - its a combination of flight simulator, and command and Conquer. You have to conquer new territories to gain resources, which in turn allow you to research new tech ships and weapons. You are able to command a fleet who's size is based on the size of your territory, or use the fleet as a personal escort while you go into battle. You can also capture enemy ships and steal the ship designs to make for your fleet or sell them.
it is a long game - that may be a positive or a negative depending on what your looking for. it take a very long time to gain the resources needed to progress and you can spend a long time flying through space from one place to another. 
My only real negative is that you have to read all the dialog boxes for the main story line instead of having voice actors. This is a real drag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020838155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1524540876}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993183205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1574017379}
review:
This game is terrible.

The script is boring.

the conversation options are rubbish, I mean because I didn't have the diplomacy perk, I could not make up a plausible excuse for my men wandering the enemy ship and apparently could only say "UUuuuhhhhh...." What is THAT about?

The combat is plain bad. I mean I found the only way I could actually SEE the ship I was trying to dog fight with was to shut my engines down and just pivot on the spot. There is the option to just let your turrets auto-fire, but then you are just flying around aimlessly until the enemy dissapears off your radar over and over again (booooooriiiiiing). I found I just sat around waiting for their shields to FINALLY fall to allow me to do some actual damage. It was when some random SWAM of about 6 ships decended upon me mid way through a mission and totally obliterated me in less then 20 seconds and there was NOTHING I could do about it that I finally stopped, uninstalled the game and went back to one of the many better alternatives on the market.

The camera controls a rubbish, I mean i was constantly trying to move the camera back to where it belonged when trying to pilot.

The graphics are average for it's genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020362251', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2329, 'last_played': 1573875067}
review:
This is a relatively slow paced/repetitive at times space sim about leading an armada of increasingly larger ships on missions of bounty hunting, resource gathering, or empire expansion. I once read a review that stated it was similar to Mount and Blade Warband but in space, and I have to agree to an extent. 

I wish the concept this tries to deliver gets more fleshed out in other titles, which I may not know about at the time of writing. I'm always interested in games that mix different genres in ways you don't expect, like Sanctum does by combining turret defense/fps/rpg (scifi version of orcs must die). 

I feel that with more time spent fleshing this game out to reduce the amount of time sitting around waiting for resources to come in to upgrade your buildings and tech (hours and hours of being alt-tabbed waiting, doing nothing, since tech has insanely bloated costs) would be a great upgrade. The UI also has some issues that made me wish there were more hotkeys so I could do less mouse clicking and tedious movements. Double clicking to do a civilian task would be better than moving over to click and confirm the task. It is annoying after doing it hundreds of times and made me stop caring to do civilian tasks altogether, even trades as they are done the same way in favor of just letting the resources sort themselves out over time. Another issue I encountered was some side quest you get from talking to ally/neutral ships set a marker that disappears and when you go to the location, nothing is there. 

I could say more but it's not worth it since this would be too long. I'm sure the devs know by now there are issues with this game and I hope they fix it if they do a similar game in the future. I also hope anyone looking at this game for inspiration learns from the flaws, which are often obvious from playing the game and comparing to how other games do things.

review:
I would recommend it to fans of space and action. It is another good entry in the series and much easier to get started with than some other more complex space games.

+Controls are easy to use
+Give commands to entire fleets in addition to managing your own ship
+Decent variety of options for earning income to suit your style
+Variety of skills and ships to choose from as you level

-Slow to start with few ship options and low damage battles
-Infrequent voice acting, feels disconnected
-Several skills, upgrades, or weapons feel lackluster

author: {'steamid': '76561197999247034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1669131245}
review:
Das Spiel startet wie der Vorgänger SPG2 holperig und man muss sich erst in die Mechaniken reinfuchsen. Nachdem man in den Hauptmissionen soweit voran geschritten ist, um auch die strategischen Elemente zu nutzen, kann man meines Erachtens das Spiel auf allen Ebenen genießen.
Anfangs dachte ich der Raum im All sei ziemlich Leer. Bei genauerer Betrachtung und verschiedenen Kammeramodi kann man sich eines besseren belehren lassen und viele schöne Bilder genießen. Auch wenn sich die meisten Elemente wiederholen, so schafft das spiel auch im Bezug auf die Söldnermissionen einen doch zu überraschen. 
Da ich das spiel allerdings erst 16 Stunden gespielt habe ist meine Euphorie natürlich auch noch recht hoch für das Spiel. 
Den vollen Preis hätte ich für das spiel nicht ausgegeben aber für ein sale Angebot kann man sich keinesfalls beschweren und kommt nach bisherigen beobachtungen auf seine kosten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032763579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1536451576}
review:
Mount and Blade in space, basically. But it doesn't match up to Mount and Blade, this is more cumbersome, less well designed with factions that are barely relevant, mission design sucks big time and makes almost everything boring. 

What really irked me with this game is that it has the feel of a car racing game, on earth, in gravity. There is no drift here, drop the throttle and the spacecraft slows to a halt. You know that's not how SPACE and zero-g works? The designers behind this game strike me as kindergardeners.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055510937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1242, 'last_played': 1696370093}
review:
If you came from Starpoint Gemini 2 after purchasing a discounted bundle:
-You'll get crushed alone, get a fleet or be a cheesy marauder
-You'll spend 90% of your looking at your starchart instead of looking at your game
-You'll spend the remaining 10% in some paused state selecting research and construction

This is a pseudoRTS, you are no longer a one man army(unless you're a cheesy marauder) and you'll need more than suicidal Briggs charging a dreadnought while in a half dead frigate in order to take a base.

Now here's the problem with the RTS part of the game:
-Your income is abysmal and takes forever to build up
-ore farms take about 100 ingame weeks to pay for itself, 3mins irl per ingame week, so about 5 hours irl to pay for itself
-The rest of your income comes from sending your civ fleets to do rng missions where it isn't really clear what you'll get and sometimes they'll just straight up fail.
-Making an army that can actually take a strong base took me about 10hrs from start of barebones free explore scenario
-There is no ship specialization; literally no reason to make gunships, corvettes, or destroyers because you can just make frigates, cruisers, and dreadnoughts which will survive longer and do more damage.
-Once you solve the economy problem, you'll win the game because god knows you'll just spam cruisers and dreadnoughts

The biggest problem I have with this game is that there are already established nations where some bases or armies have a dreadnought or two in their fleet. You cannot take them on until way later and they can be blocking your access to needed resources. Just check the default start map without fog. Half of the map is all blue neutral states while you are on the other half surrounded by raiders. I get that you're supposed to absorb the raiders and turn their territory into economy, but two zones have 16-20k fleet strength with at least one dreadnought in each of em and they'll keep poking at your base with a warmaster that may or may not be a dreadnought until you clear those zones. The problem is that you won't be able to take them on even with a fleet until way later because your economy makes it so discouraging to build a strong enough fleet at the beginning. By the time you finally build that economy and a proper fleet, it's strong enough to just steamroll everything besides planets.

I wish that gunships were at least cheap and easy to make without the need of a hanger bay so you aren't alone at any point of the game. Who even makes gunships for their fleet later on anyway? I'm pretty sure they're too weak to ever do anything. Also, don't make carriers; I made the mistake of making a whole fleet of them and then lost them to an army with lower fleet strength and no dreadnoughts.

In the end, I still really enjoyed this game because it's basically Mount&Blade but in space. I felt like it solved the problems I had with Starpoint Gemini 2 but just needs more tweaking. It's a shame the modding community seems small for a game like this as it seems to have so much potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006935966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 2289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1611516182}
review:
This game is great.  An addictive, well designed game that plays a bit like warband in space, with most of my complaints from Starpoint Gemini 2 being mitigated or outright fixed.  I've put 15 hours into this in 2 days and I'm planning on putting a lot more in.

It's still got a few issues.  If there's a pause button I have yet to find it and it would be nice to at least be able to slow time in combat.  I think they oversimplified your commander skills because of the real time battles and I'd prefer a bit more complexity with a pause button, because it's kind of repetitive as is and you can't give orders to other ships in the fleet.  There are also stretches of resource bottlenecks where you're kind of waiting around, you can do jobs or check out mysterious signals but tedium can be an issue.  Finally, while combining the rpg and conquest mechanics works pretty well there are some features that were shoehorned together without a ton of thought.  Having a decent fleet pretty much trivializes a lot of the freelance missions, for example, making it really hard to gauge difficulty from the hiring screen alone.

All that said, where this game works it really shines.  The ships handle well and are visually outstanding.  Customization, research, and faction management are also very nicely integrated into the RPG experience.  Most importantly it just feels satisfying to play.  

Price point is a bit high given that it's almost 3 years old, but I got it on pretty deep discount ($11 for the game, deadly dozen, and titans) and have spent more for less fun.  If you're on the fence then just go for it, worst case you can always get a refund in 2 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044276815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1096, 'last_played': 1572242099}
review:
[h1] TLDR: Worth it, especially if it's on sale [/h1]
Been eyeing this one for a while and picked it up on sale, I'm really glad that I did.
For those who have no experience with the SPG games, this is like if EVE:online was mashed with Rogue Galaxy.  It's more focused on fun, capital-ship battles, and feels better as an RPG.  I found the controls easy to get a hang of, and they're all rebindable.
This one improves a lot on the mechanics and controls of the previous SPG, and brings a ton of new features.  I felt like it was [b] MUCH [/b] less of a grind than SPG2, and the dreaded boarding mechanic has been changed for the better!
At this point in writing my review I haven't finished the main story.  It's ... okay so far.  It's getting better the further I go.  There's a fair few custom scenarios and free-roam starts to try out as well if the main story doesn't fit your fancy.  I, for one, am excited to start my space pirate empire >:)
There's modding support, but not a whole lotta mods out there.  Hopefully that changes over time, because it'd be cool to roll around in some Homeworld or Freelancer ships in this kind of game.
Hope you found this review helpful.  Thought I'd weigh in my 2 cents before the sale ends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120687901', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2969, 'last_played': 1570781400}
review: As a returning SG fan, I am happy to where the Developers have taken the series. The game feels very familiar in its visuals and combat mechanics to SG2, while providing more ships, equipment, weapons, a refined story-telling, and more. The additional ability to manufacture and control fleets, research new technologies, and enhancements, conquer other factions and fight over territory, while managing the growth of your newly acquired territory adds to an almost  real-time 4X game mixed with a space sim. The balance works well, and with mod support, such as models for new ships, new music to replace the in-game variety and other additions, SGW has shaped up to be a wonderful game with many hours worth of side activities.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978352555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1570884771}
review:
Looks way better than it is. The basic mechanics = grind, and not the fun Privateer grind, really grindy levelling up everything, only to have the game scale with you as you go to make sure you never actually feel the progress.

I just pushed on grinding trade until I saved up to get a dreadnought - so of course now all my basic missions put me up against the same (or more powerful because I haven't min-maxed everything yet).

Took me ages to be dependable with the boarding boarding mechanic as well, now I can finally pull off boarding, and I don't care.

Basically, anything you invest mentally, you don't get back.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980080457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2536, 'last_played': 1565978666}
review:
Starpoint Gemini ist ein Spiel das sich mit gemischten Gefühlen spiele.

Zum einen, ist es eine Art Wirtschaftssimulator mit Upgrades flotten Aufbau usw.

Zum anderen hat man sein Hauptschiff dass sie natürlich bedingt upgraden lässt, auch wenn es etwas mehr sein hätte können.

Es gibt halt gefühlt immer die gleiche Mission wobei die ein mehr Geld bringen für weniger Leistung. Und andere einfach nur nervtötend sind.

Das Handeln wird anfangs bescheuert, macht aber am Ende dann doch Spaß.

Auch der Aufbau des Weltalls die Diplomatie, und viele andere Dinge die in diesem Spiel sind, sind vielfältig,oft auch spaßig, aber oft auch eintönig und zäh.

Die Performance ist gut, der Sound auch, die Atmosphäre stimmt.

Man kann zu diesem Spiel nur sagen, man muss gewisse Dinge verzeihen damit man in den Genuss eines schönen Weltraumspieles gelangen kann.

Wenn man über gewisse Probleme, hinwegsehen kann macht diese Spiel definitiv Spaß.

Von mir eine Kaufempfehlung

author: {'steamid': '76561198065247541', 'num_games_owned': 1024, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 3388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3388, 'last_played': 1569760337}
review:
スターウォーズEP3冒頭の艦隊戦みたいなのが楽しめるオープンワールドSTG
ストラテジー要素もあるけどほとんどおまけ
日本語の攻略情報は少ないけどゲーム内wikiとチュートリアルが割と優秀だから
ストーリーモードで始めればわりとなんとかなる。

最初は小型艦からでちょっとつらいけど
艦隊作って数で押せるようになってきたあたりから楽しくなるはず。
苦しくなってきたらゲートを使って輸送で稼げばいい。コンコルド～イオリア間が楽でうまい。

実績コンプ直前までいったけど
マップの全エリア抑えたのにジェミニペディアが埋まらなくて断念
全エリア制圧しても見つからない派閥と艦船がいるとかどういうことなの…

review:
- Bad and confusing controls
- Many things/items in game are not explained in any way.
- I failed the initial tutorial 4 times. First thing the game has you do is target a ship and then use the radial menu to follow it. 3 times the ship failed to follow and would just fly in a straight line, fourth time it followed and over-shot the target. Each time I would fail this, instead of just restarting the mission, the game would end and make me restart from scratch.

So basically after about 10-15 min of play it was made very clear to me that this game is rubbish. (Steam says an hour of game time played, the rest of that time was me trying to figure out controls and systems.)

Refunding!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996186863', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 3947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3231, 'last_played': 1568720492}
review:
Oddly enough, all the things that I didn't like about the original Starpoint Gemini are the things that actually work in this game.  My complaint in the previous iteration was that the game used MMO logic in a single-player game; i.e. grind credits to get a bigger ship so that you can fight bigger ships to get more credits etc to infinity.  The problem with that is that there was no end game, no overall goal beyond just getting the biggest, baddest ship and murdering your way across the galaxy.

While that same pattern exists here, there is now a real purpose to it all.  Now you want that bigger, better ship with bigger, badder weapons to expand your empire.  Why?  So you can gather more resources in which to further expand your empire.  Wait, isn't this just a variation of the original trope?  Yes, but it's also the trope that every 4X strategy game was ever built on, so I'll allow it.

And that's my point: There is a strategy game layered onto the tactical ship combat, now.  It's not the deepest or most complex, but all the mechanics are there and it gives point & meaning to your personal space battles.  Yes, it's still a grind but it's the fun kind of grind where you can see the rewards, you can see an end goal, and you'll want to hit that next level rather than dreading the climb.

Oh, and they added piracy, which is a serious game changer.  Can't afford that new multi-million credit ship you want so bad?  Well... you could always just, y'know, steal one and stick your own flag on it.  Same goes for fleet building, too - why waste your own money on ships when you can just slowly turn the enemy fleet into your own?  This is a nice touch that helps break up the pace in space combat that still feels like it matters at the strategic level, too.

The game isn't perfect, of course - there's still a number on unresolved UI issues, such as like the way you can't tell what enhancements are already in a slot, the convoluted way of moving equipment from your ship to your cargo holds and the fact that working as a trade is pointless due to the trivial amount of trade goods actually present on stations and that fighter craft are nothing more than blips on your screen that apparently lack any real graphics once launched.  

However, overall the game is still good and a serious step up from the previous title, it's on sale for cheap and I look forward to seeing what the next one is like.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970980141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1567809627}
review:
Steam needs a "Meh" button between the yes/no recommend buttons.

So admittedly I bought this game at a significant discount, but even so I was somewhat disappointed.

<whinge>

That's a lie, I was extremely frustrated. The tutorial does a terrible job of explaining the game, most of the mechanics are unintuitive and the controls on the keyboard are simply badly laid out. In fact something as simple as the description of which key to press was infuriating... the "Divide" key or as it should have been called in game "Numpad Divide", "Numpad /", or even just "/" to present a clearer message to the player. The camera felt terrible too, I have no idea what they were going for there, but jesus.

</whinge>

Cons
-Steep learning curve that the game does nothing to prepare you for
-Camera (and apparently no mods over the years to fix it either)
-Controls
-Player information

Pros
-Pretty
-Lots of positive support from the player base
-Lots of people seem to love it so it clearly can't be all bad

I was honestly on the fence about this game, but frankly the amount of effort it seems you need to put into this game to "get used to it" didn't feel like it was worth my time.

review: 操作太特么的蛋疼。还各种毫无意义的对话（字幕）剧情。难得一次两船对战，只要鼠标点上，就自动开火，哪怕是一艘小船，小机枪不对战个10分钟，是打不下来。大把时间就消耗在看这小鸟枪 啾啾、啾啾。然后敌舰唯一的战术就是围绕着你上下左右乱飞，你不可能让镜头扑捉成功，一会就头晕眼花了。就看着自己的小船在 啾啾、啾啾也不知道打在哪里，反正等个10分钟或者更长时间，敌舰就被打败了，也可能是你被打败了，重新再来以后是漫长的裹脚布一样的垃圾剧情。

author: {'steamid': '76561198160132099', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1566919878}
review:
虽然第一眼被太空开放世界吸引住了，然而很遗憾，它无法达到我的预期。
短短几分钟，原本一开始热情地打算探索游戏机制，却很快就被没有碰撞伤害判断，狗斗没有任何意义，甚至只是单纯的把炮塔对着敌人剩下就是等系统办事的作战节奏给击垮了。诚然，它有很多值得游玩和探索的系统，但是这些系统如果通过战斗来反馈其存在的乐趣与意义的话，那么最终当你把希望寄托在某一场战斗中可以体现出在其他系统上的摸索使你的战斗更加富有乐趣的话。
你错了，你大错特错了，甚至当你进入战斗后看到战斗的瞬间，你就已经失去了观赏的欲望。
没有炫酷的特效演出，也没有通过操作就能改变的过程，甚至当你把一切交给船体上的武器时，你甚至会觉得它为何显得如此“贫穷”。再加上点击互动和互动菜单是需要你通过暂停其他动作而去切换菜单进行指令选择时，非常影响节奏感，好歹给个子弹时间吧？
以上观点我个人主要是对比了Space Pirates and Zombies 2这款游戏，显然这款更加注重战斗表现的太空脏比游戏比起这款单纯的体验太空跑商太空种田的节奏要好太多了。
我知道，尽管这游戏主要是让玩家体验一个太空指挥官的生活，跑商，研发，挖矿的自由自在，倒也和自由枪骑兵有类似，可是这一切乏味的刷数值，全是为了能够在战斗中体现出通过这一系列努力而组建起来的帝国舰队或者超级战舰是多么的牛掰，可惜的是。。。战斗体验是真的很微妙，狗斗救不了你武器系统导致的劣势，第三人称看不出来值得欣赏的特效，甚至连许多理所应当存在的战斗因素和判定诸如碰撞和船体冲击都不存在，连这种“真实”程度都反馈不出来的作战系统，反而让整个游戏所有存在的机制都变得鸡肋了起来。
机制内容足够丰富（不一定）但是却缺乏了一个足够爽快且直观的反馈，就如同努力学习各种知识后却不一定会得到直接的回报一般的令人乏味。

author: {'steamid': '76561198040339543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1567140835}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068576870', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1583, 'last_played': 1567822714}
review:
一部糟糕的科幻垃圾。

原谅我如此用力的形容它，但毫无疑问，你们设计了很好的一些概念，却几乎没有实现它们。

--------------------

游戏节奏：糟糕的
如果你稳固了自己的领土，接下来就只好等待资源缓慢的增长。等待资源积攒、占领新的领土、等待资源积攒……我很难形容这样匮乏的结构能被实现。

玩家舰船升级：乏味的
在漫长而枯燥的跑商后，玩家终于能换下一个级别舰船了，于是，他发现还有 5723 个“下一个级别”，缺乏其他有趣的事情来填充。

资源采集：莫名的
你可以用很长的时间，来采集一点资源，并同时派遣一个劳工队去快速拿到比这更多的资源，以此证实：你是个想要变好的采矿废物。
我实在没看懂“玩家采矿”的意义，留言开了，希望有大佬指点一下。

战斗代入感：愚蠢的
糟糕的战斗代入感是：你无法代入进去，愚蠢的战斗代入感则是：你不想代入进去。
没有狗斗，没有碰撞，更没有集群战术和掩护冲锋，你将看到一个漂亮的 Double TD Game——两群会射火花的石块在击碎对方。乏味。

毫无疑问，这款游戏激怒了我。
我很少写评测，相比逗笑大家，我更愿意在游戏中寻找快乐；我也很难想到，具备颇多的优秀概念后，这款游戏体验会这么糟糕。

author: {'steamid': '76561198035951038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 3131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3131, 'last_played': 1565046322}
review:
"Eh, it's good enough" appears to be the way the developers felt about the game when making it. It was good enough to ship, despite lacking basic and obvious features that are, at least in my opinion, pretty important. Examples? A way of telling the hp/shields of the ships in your fleet other than manually targeting them one by one, that would be nice. Maybe a way of telling them to join the fight when they're too far away, instead of just sitting there staring at enemy units near them (units too far from your player ship don't really fight, they just hang out, no shooting...the distance isn't that far, and this will regularly affect your fleet in the mid to late game and beyond). Hell, it's downright lazy sometimes, the way some enemies simply cannot be killed until they've summoned in allied ships a couple of times, or until you've destroyed all of their allies (this pretty common in freelance missions). The whole game is full of stuff like that.

But it's a fairly fun game, if you can overlook those small frustrations (and the many others) and a total lack of polish. Oh, and it's worth noting, it's beautiful. Really, it's a very pretty game. The plot is a complete wreck, and at one point it's scripted of you saying things are X, then literally a minute or two later someone else tells your character that things are Y, and you don't even bat an eye. Really, not a word, and it's a near 180 degree flip. So don't expect great writing. But it's alright. It's...good enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169055269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 5200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1695, 'last_played': 1564900440}
review:
My first step in the star point series and it is is fun, however simple.  Dog fighting is mostly me turning the ship for max broadsides, and letting the auto aim do its work, the 4x part of it is very simple.  Mostly just take over an area, build it up then move on.  Also a grind to get your first war party.  Trading is stiff as hell and simple to abuse.  DLC may make it better but I don't have that info at this time.

Is it fun, yes, however unless you like your soup thin, better go play other thicker games.  You might not get all this has in other games, but this game is just a sum of its parts.  So carefully set your toe in to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278996142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 4479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3643, 'last_played': 1564742303}
review:
制作优良，诚意满满！虽然细节稍显粗糙，但总体不错，星战爱好者推荐入手！

主线剧情模式玩的停不下来，但通关后就无聊了。因为敌人太弱，特别是在配合泰坦的情况下，简直是一边倒的屠杀，毫无悬念的那种，所以很快就觉得没意思了。

最后：说视角陀螺的人根本没有搞清楚这个游戏的玩法！由于炮塔可以360度全向旋转，并且配有自动开火模式，所以根本不用狗斗，只需要把主要火力面朝向敌方即可。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970617636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1563927800}
review:
This is an example where steams yay/nay review system really does not afford the ability to properly describe the quality of a game in adequate detail. I chose to recommend this game, with a lot of “buts”. I can only recommend this game on sale price, and not at full price.

This game is a weird mix of genres. Space adventure (Freelancer/Privateer), RPG, 4x strategy, and RTS all blended into on. It tries to be a jack of all trades and falls short of excelling on any front. It is a package worth the sale price, and you can expect to have a weekend of fun with it.

The game starts you out slow. Very slow. For the first 2-3 hours of this game, you will be flying around thinking “is this all there is?”. Eventually, if you play through the first few missions of the campaign, the “warlord” mechanics will open up, and you will get to manage fleets, construct headquarters, and take over territory. This I fun for a few hours, but it progresses slowly and starts to get boring after a while.

The campaign is written to B-movie quality. The characters are forgettable, and the lore is adequate to build a plot around, but not interesting enough to learn about. 

The game is still riddled with bugs. Some of them are annoying, and some are game breaking. The save system is still not reliable, so use multiple save slots. Sometimes ships will be invincible, and you will have to fly away and come back. Its unfortunately that the game has had so many version updates and DLC’s, and yet these core issues continue to be a problem. As long as you save regularly and in different slots, you should be able to avoid any major setbacks.

The controls are unintuitive, but you can train yourself to learn them. Once your muscle memory is conditioned, you will find things much easier.

Overall, you could spend your money on worse games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990357600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1563593005}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023594172', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1590, 'last_played': 1563788817}
review:
If you're a fan of the genre or just want to roam the cosmos during evening hours - I believe Starpoint Gemini Warlords won't leave you shorthanded. The overall atmosphere is immersing and beautifully done which can have you just explore and do random quests for hours. Around the main story there are many events, jobs, mysterious signals and random encounters that will keep you going and I was pleasantly surprised to see that no heavy grind is needed to get what you want. Somehow the devs got the prices and amount of rewards just right imo. 

Downside I would say is the combat system and movement in some sense. Somehow, after having 20+ hours in the game, almost all combat I've done was stationary. It seems it's really not necessary to move your ship at all which really feels weird + weapons don't seem to differ much, besides doing different DPS. 

Overall, I would definitely recommend this game if for nothing else - roaming the universe and causing trouble. It's an experience. 

PROS: 
- atmosphere
- background music
- immersive
- among better in it's genre
- it happens in space

CONS
- combat system & movement
- no real depth behind the mechanics

author: {'steamid': '76561197960269409', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 2935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1698, 'last_played': 1564254501}
review: Fun game.  Sort of like Mount + Blade in space; you're flying around battling while also building up an empire, constructing fleets, and then using those fleets either to assist you or fight on their own.  Lots of progression elements; you'll be leveling up and gaining combat+non-combat skills, upgrading your ship, upgrading your ship components, upgrading the -upgrades- to your ship components, build a space station, establishing mining stations for income, building out a fleet, conquering territory, defending territory.  There's a ton going on here and it manages it surprisingly well.  The campaign can drag a little due to mineral income shortages, but other than that, it was all really enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208028496', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1563078410}
review: 我是个陀螺，没得感情

author: {'steamid': '76561198244885960', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1001, 'last_played': 1563447896}
review:
首先就是游戏内无法更改分辨率和显示方式

卡窗口模式了只能退出再开

注意，以下是重点！！！

操纵手感不是一般的差

游戏内画质真的没有官方截图上的好，差距中等，画面党会有些小失望，但是游戏的可玩度绝对不低，只要你喜欢星舰，舰队，掠夺，模拟养成，打群架，完全推荐入手，而且优化还可以，配置要求较低，轻度肝，点一点就能赚钱，只要有时间

重点说一下操纵手感，它不是拿来玩小飞船秀操作的，这个操纵机制是拿来给星舰舰队使用的（带兵打仗），因为只有这么说，这个操纵机制才有了存在的意义/滑稽

中后期星舰起步，没有从敌军舰队外层所向披靡般入场，一路杀进敌军舰队内部的快感，因为我选的掠夺者职业，有隐身和单体巨额输出，中期往后了隐身只有5秒冷却，你想想你一个大星舰给他玩隐身风筝打法（虽然屡试不爽哈哈哈哈），这也太违和了8

如果能改进操纵机制如：永恒空间（魔鱼风格，GOF系列），整体体验会提升非常多
总之缺点就三点：画质，操纵机制，小BUG
优点是自由度非常高，可玩性也很高   仅此而已

8说了，这个限时运输运完了，我要回空间站开下一个了（刷钱运输）
真正意义上的点一下玩一年

author: {'steamid': '76561197977082865', 'num_games_owned': 934, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 2666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1983, 'last_played': 1564206824}
review:
As someone who gave Starpoint Gemini 2 a negative review, I like the direction they went with Warlords.

Specifically, the developers finally realized how awful they were at making a proper space combat sim with the over-reliance on turret mounts, and decided to make combat a bit more RPG-esque. This allowed them to focus the game more on management of a space empire through a first person perspective which I think is a better way of showcasing their world-building, which is definitely one of their strong suits.

Lots to nitpick at such as how blandly repetitive much of the game is, and how completely imbalanced a lot of the task rewards are with one another. But ultimately, I must concede that the game is fun enough to keep me playing, and that's a lot more than I can say of other games.

This probably isn't good enough to buy at full price, but it's not hard to find it on 70+% off sale, so just wait for it.
