author: {'steamid': '76561197993280859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1716, 'last_played': 1561828415}
review:
TL;DR: 7/10
A fun but shallow game, much simplified X series game, with arcadey space flight-sim and very light 4x element.

Pro:
- A sense of scale and power between different ships classes, where dreadnought or carrier can crush any number of small ship in no time
- Can conquer areas for your faction (i.e. 4x element)
- Can assemble fleets and fight with you; swarming enemy with dozen of cruisers and a few dreadnought is always fun to do and glorious to watch

Con:
- As superior firepower and shield usually means victory, there's no point in piloting smaller ship
- Combat is too simple, just fly in and start blasting, while spamming skills and items
- Small ship have no way to counter bigger ship other then en masse (which require tons of resources, and if you have such resources you should already build a bigger ship), in early game there are not much choice beside get a dreadnought and fight enemy fleet yourselves (where battleship or even carrier is quite common)
- Trading is very shallow, to the point of broken; price and quantity of goods is static in whole game, and everything refresh to original status when you land
- Friendly fleet always doing terrible job when player is not on site, when you send four destroyers to hunt two enemy corvettes, they may drag one or two of your destroyers with them before blow up

author: {'steamid': '76561198077762642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1561674424}
review:
I have been able to run many space games and the like at at least medium graphics settings but with this game I am not able to run it properly even at the bare minimum video settings. The highest fps I had was at 20.
Plus this is not my only reason. The ship controls are an absolute nightmare. I have played with everspace and Elite: Dangerous; both had great controls for navigation and combat. This game though has a way too sensitive ship (which cannot be modified in the settings which made me hate it from the start), weapons and sub-commands that are not easy to get to, and a pvp that reminds me of 2006 mmorpg fights.
With all of these combined I get the feeling that the game was indeed made in 2006, even though its a game made in 2017. Sure doesn't feel like a 2017 game.

Hell, I've been able to run skyrim high quality at better framerates than this

author: {'steamid': '76561198122877627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 7943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5594, 'last_played': 1593462790}
review: Great game, but not as good as X-Rebirth because its like a scaled down version of it where as in X-Rebirth you can build fleets enter bridge to order commands build station of massive scale and blow them up as well as other factions so it really makes you feel that the game is real and speaking with civilians as well to do trade and diplomacy in first person which is nice as well. and range of ships are more accurate and have longer range because we all know its space and there is no such thing as range in space which this game lacks really bad in. Ships are smaller then usual for they're class in this game so kinda makes you feel that your playing a game from the 1990's those really old game boxes you saw at every gas station lol no offence. I would recommend this game for a 6 year old or 12 year old but any higher if your looking for realism and immersion this game probably is not for you, because its lacking so many immersive features in the game and you can't build stations your self anywhere further more almost every gaming company fails at this when in space and your flying those big ships there are thousands and thousand of crew more on every tier and level of ship so as far as boarding wise goes I think they all fail to comprehend and understand that there are thousands of troops on bored each ship damage to ships would reduce that number if the ships starts taking hull damage which in turn loss of troops and manpower. I honestly feel like I'm a 40 year old telling a child that is 6 this is what will peak the interest of gamers not the slabs on the side. Also docks are very similar to EVE online game except without voices to hear the latest news or how your faction is fairing which I also know that people will love in this game but yet again this game fails again. Overall because I'm not going to go into every detail of what this game has done wrong I will give it a thumbs down for that but its good game if your just trying to pass time by. I will mention one last thing space borders? This is the first space game that I've played and saw that there are actual borders in the game unlike X-Rebirth and Eve online its like saying don't go that way child or your going to be in trouble son or daughter and I'll have to ground you for a week if you go off the edge of the map. lol anyway there is my revue but yet again I give the honest truth of what I see in games so you all know now this is 100% true what I've said about this game and no hold backs. I play games for they're immersion and realism and with 20 20 vision I see and notice these types of problems in games and will speak plain  and truthfully about what they lack and don't lack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038106181', 'num_games_owned': 1871, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2497, 'last_played': 1561300389}
review:
Was looking for good single-player novice-friendly space game, and this turns out almost exactly what i wanted.
A lot of variety, easy to learn, no need to dig in-game excel spreadsheets instead of playing, tons of things to build and upgrade, nice visuals overall. But could've been better.
Some bad things:
- too much sandbox, too little story and quests. All you got is single main campaign quest, titans dlc quest, endpoint campaign. That's it. Side quests either don't exist or too hard to find (i've only found one). I don't count boring autogenerated job-missions, you only do for quick money, as real quests.
- too hard early game with a lot of grind and waiting for resources to collect. Everything accumulates way too slow, but you need way too much to progress. While in endgame you can faceroll entire planet captures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051484615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 2416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2416, 'last_played': 1560741481}
review:
Probably one of the better of these star pilot games since Freelancer, but this genre has seen such crap the past 16 years it's not much of a bar. Overall, this game has some good ideas but really fails to execute almost every single one of those ideas. I cannot recommend playing it unless you're a glutton for mediocrity. 

Pros:
- Tactical map of the sector with fighting over control for specific zones is a fun idea
- Increasingly larger sizes of ships is a decent idea (though poorly implemented)
- More fun than Starpoint Gemini 2, but that's not really saying much.

Cons:
- Combat, what you'll be doing 99% of the time, sucks. 

  o You'll quickly find you're encouraged to actually stop your ship during combat, especially as you move to larger ship sizes. And what do your enemies do? They usually stop their ships dead in water too. So you literally have stationary ships sitting and clicking on each other. 

  o The weapons absolutely suck. There're basically 3 types of weapons which all feel identical and barely even look different. And you'll never actually see them mounted on your ship and you can barely even see the weapon effects as they're fired.

  o Total lack of any creativity in the combat. From the first battle through the last battle, you'll never get cool new weapons to use or new tools. It's always just the same thing- point at the (stationary) enemy and hold the fire button.

- Physics is absolutely awful to the point that the game practically has no physics. Ships can slow down and stop without any counter thrust. Asteroids sit motionless suspended in place. Ships crashing into each other doesn't damage or affect either ship in any way.

- Scale of the ships suck. This is a common problem in space games of the last 15 years- why do I want to play a space game where I can barely see my ship, or the enemy ship, or the weapons they're firing because they're so tiny on the screen? Maybe it'd be less realistic, but everything should be a lot larger. I want to see the details on my ships. I want to see weapon effects. I want to see details on the enemy ships and actually be able to tell them apart without having to use a tooltip. In Star Trek, when a Romulan Warbird decloaks you know exactly what it looks like and who is inside of it without someone needing to explain it to you via tooltip.

- Economy is fundamentally broken. This game feels like the developers wanted so badly to not make it "easy" to buy everything that they made all the upgrades so expensive that you'll have to grind for hours and hours to afford to upgrade your ship. In a single player game. Or you could just cheat. And don't even think about trying to become a trader; you'll make such paltry amounts of money there is absolutely no way it is a viable past time.

- Couple the above with the fact that the leveling system is totally broken. You level up automatically, you cannot control when it happens. And all the enemies and quest difficulties scale with you (and into larger ships) so you never feel like you're becoming more powerful. In fact you'll feel less and less powerful as you play the game. Why? Because the quest rewards don't scale. They're remain the same paltry amounts from the beginning of the game through the end. So this means the biggest ships and best equipment would take days of grinding to afford, all while your character is becoming increasingly underpowered because the enemies are scaling with your level. Meaning the end-game becomes a super boring, super frustrating mess.

- The aforementioned quests are all random, samey, and boring. Go play a game of Solitaire. You'll have more fun than playing the garbage this game passes off as quests.

- Ship sizes are broken. The larger ships are so massively overpowered compared to the smaller ships that there really is no "choice" about what class of ship you want to fly. As you level up, you eventually have to fly one of the two biggest classes or you'll have no chance to survive. This also means that when you're leveled up but can't afford a larger ship (as described above) the quests become even more grindy and ridiculous because you'll be firing your little pea shooter weapons at ships vastly larger and more powerful than you. And as mentioned these battles involve sitting stationary in space while you click on the enemy ship for 45 minutes until it eventually blows up.

- The "story", if you can call it that, is also your standard sci-fi trope garbage that could have been written by a child for all the suspense or complexity it has.

- For some odd reason, all the characters in the story seem to have voice actors, but the vast majority of their lines are not voiced. Only once in a blue moon you'll hear a character actually say something. You'll mostly be reading text.

- Fast travel is artificially limited using a bizarre system of "charges" for your warp drive that you have to purchase. They're not particularly expensive, but they're not cheap either and it is a weird design choice why they would make the player have to contend with this rather than just letting you go where you want to go without jumping through not-fun gameplay devices. The end result is you'll spend a lot of your time slowwwwly traveling between points on the map rather than wanting to waste some of the charges you have left.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028348706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1290, 'last_played': 1560304805}
review:
This game isn't terrible, but it leaves me with a strong sense of "meh". I feel like a lot of its parts don't "mesh" well with each other or aren't balanced relative to each other. For example, I specialized a character in doing freelance missions, and I found it easy to make millions of credits(?) in these missions. Meanwhile, other ways to make money seemed completely inferior and useless.

As another example of things not meshing well together: it is not the case that a dreadnought is a dreadnought. If you want to pilot a dreadnought, you can buy one for your own usage from your base for about 50 million credits. If you want to build one so that your subordinates can fly one, you can do so for 50 thousand credits plus other mined resources. However, there is no option to buy a dreadnought with credits in order to have your subordinates fly it. Likewise, there is no option to build a dreadnought with (mostly) mined resources and then fly it yourself. This disconnect makes absolutely no sense and is completely jarring. Instead, your dreadnoughts are completely different from those of your subordinates.

This brings me to another jarring disparity: your subordinates suck. A dreadnought piloted by you can tear apart dozens of smaller ships with barely a scratch but a dreadnought piloted by your subordinates can be killed by a small number of small enemy ships, especially if you're not there to personally observe the battle. Again, it is not the case that a dreadnought is a dreadnought.

Problems like this make the 4X element feel kinda tacked on: your subordinates live in a completely different world than you do. Also, you cannot give them commands to do a lot of the work you have to do yourself, such as linking with satellites. I could go on about the various "mesh" problems I feel this game has, but I think you get the picture. Things just don't seem to make sense in this world and I find it highly illusion-breaking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048236026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2506, 'last_played': 1655439720}
review: It's a fun game. Fleet management, base management, 1st or 3rd person space combat with multiple ships and bringing in large fleets against enemy fleets with out horribly ruining your frame rate. Make alliances or declare war, set up trade agreements. Does have a character class system but its not overly complicated. Resource collection isn't tedious since you have structures to do it and have mini missions you can assign non-combat fleets to do all the extra collecting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020051016', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 4160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2288, 'last_played': 1595195472}
review:
I never knew this game existed until the steam sale a few days ago. The third installment of the series comes out later this year and I just now found this gem. I read a previous review someone stated it's similar to EvE Online but a single player experience wrapped up into an RPG (i agree). This game also reminds me of another game I support as well called Rebel Galaxy (the original). 


Wish List for the next iteration SPG3;
Bigger and meaner and more ships to choose at every level
Field of View changer
Expanded build mechanics to allow more creativity in the users hand
Procedural generated maps for replayability
All the same stuff in SPG:Warlords
Dynamic events that trigger/change the world map as you play 
More and better mods (mod creation contests with rewards and easier interface to mod making would spark this)
Co-Op or some form of multiplayer

I honestly really enjoy what these developers put together here. Thanks to them! I'm enjoying this game a lot and looking forward to the next creation from your dev team. To my fellow gamers out there, this game is a gem, worth every penny. It's a cross between EvE and Rebel Galaxy, if you like those games than you will enjoy this one as well. 

Good luck fellow gamers in finding your next adventure, fly safe and let your imagination free.

review:
Definitely worthy of a playthrough. And yes I can see the comparison of this game with a Mount & Blade Warband in space. It's good fun.

Combat takes some getting used to, because of how the turret view is kind of required to do some good shooting. Thankfully it doesn't take long before you start to build fleets making fighting a lot more enjoyable. Has some grindy aspects to it, however that just goes with the type of game. Think X3 and how you would have to gather resources there too. And in this game it's not even that bad really.

author: {'steamid': '76561198436575473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 3577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3362, 'last_played': 1561908848}
review:
Worth a play through at the least.

This was one of the first games I purchased for PC a couple years ago when I finally bought one. I do not regret that purchase. I remember coming home and playing this game endlessly for hours. Mostly what I remember playing for was the actual game play. I really enjoyed the ship to ship combat - something a lot of games don't get right. This game makes you think about where you place your ship in relation to the enemy. The game separates forward, aft, port and starboard shields. Each ship also has unique turret placements. Positioning yourself underneath a target with one ship design could leave it open to all turrets while doing so with another could leave you blind sided. That's what I love about the game, you have to think about where you are.

Now as far as the story goes, there's a lot to be desired but at least there is one. I actually somewhat enjoyed the story and found myself somewhat carrying about the plight of the antagonist. This isn't the first installment in the game, obviously. I didn't feel that mattered. Most of the references to previous story installments were easy enough to understand without a need to play the other games. As far as the environment went, the environment was beautiful.

This is a game I will gladly play again. In fact, I'm going to. I'm actually downloading it as I type this since the DLC is on sale. I recommend you give this game a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985618796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1559160660}
review:
Like many other i think this game has a great concept, but it's poorly realized.
I loved Freelancer back in the days and still play it from time to time, just like the good old Fallout games.

However, Freelancer made everything right.
Good controls, hud, voice acting, dialogue text and esthetical design

While Starpoint comes with crapy controls that simply don't feel right and a minimalistic hud that doesn't offer a good overwiev. The voice acting sounds lazy + the dialogue text reads like a story for children. Also i agree with poeple that say the menus look more like excel with poor item symbols wich would have costed me more time to get through than the 2 hour refund limit allows.

Additionally i gotta say that you can't trust the trailers in terms of beauty, just saw a few symbols and something not as dark as the backround inside that hud marker.

After this first impression i decided to better refund the game, before regretting it...
There are better ones in this genre!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023831623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2248, 'last_played': 1558958436}
review:
En resumen: El juego está muy bien, cumple su función, que es proporcionar horas de entretenimiento y diversión, mejor que otros del mismo precio o incluso más caros. Es una mezcla de rol, simulador de naves, comercio y estrategia espacial, no sumergiéndose en profundidad en ninguno de los tres aspectos, por lo que en realidad tiene muchas posibilidades de desarrollarse a través de mods o DLCs. Quizá sea el único pero me recuerda a un X3 (o cualquier otro de la saga), con menos profundidad y menor complejidad, lo que para algunos será algo positivo, y para otros no.

Lo mejor: la historia está bien, las batallas son difíciles al principio (en muchos casos imposibles de ganar por lo que habrá que volver más tarde), hay bastante que hacer y resulta un desafío abrirse paso en esos primeros momentos. A medida que avanzamos, nuestra atención se desplaza de objetivos personales sencillos (acumular dinero, sobrevivir, etc.) a objetivos de facción, buscando en última instancia la conquista de Gemini, sin luchar contra todos al mismo tiempo porque la cosa podría ponerse fea. Esto resulta muy interesante ya que el juego cambia radicalmente de una forma bastante progresiva, y a tu ritmo, permitiendo cambiar entre etapas al gusto, con sólo cambiar de nave y de tarea.

Lo peor: Llevar una batalla en modo completamente manual es misión imposible, sobre todo al principio, ya que hay varios detalles (y algunos bugs) que complican mucho, por lo que quien esté buscando trepidantes batallas de cazas espaciales entre asteroides posiblemente deba mirar en otro lugar, ya que en este juego lo mejor es conseguir una nave lo más grande posible cuanto antes y dejar que el fuego automático haga su trabajo mientras tú te limitas a las habilidades. Otro aspecto negativo es que la dificultad cae en picado a medida que avanzamos, ya que al principio no hay manera de ganar las batallas más ridículas, y ya para el final prácticamente puede conquistarse todo el mapa con una sola nave (prácticamente, pero hay enemigos o batallas más difíciles que pondrán la cosa interesante).

author: {'steamid': '76561198077619292', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2587, 'last_played': 1642076322}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041851567', 'num_games_owned': 2102, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1654874412}
review:
For a long time wanted something like this, In this little gem, you can do a lot of things thanks to multi genre. As many have compared it with "Mount and blade" only this one is in space. You can fly your ship and explore the game universe, trade with others. Buy/sell ships. build base and expand your territory. Maintain relationships with other factions. Build your fleet with different ships. Mine and collect resources. And do different quests (both main and side quests (freelancing)). Yes there are some things i would like to see in the game - better fleet management (so i could give more commands to them, and also see their HP on the main screen). Graphics are awesome, Music could be better, sometimes it was boring, it didn't stick in my head. For example "Elite Dangerous" music for a long time couldn't get it out of my head :D
Sometimes had a feeling that i'm playing "freelancer" (game). 
one more thing that is missing, when you create ships for the fleet you can't choose those for yourself. Or put your old ships in your fleet (maybe this is in the game, but haven't found it yet).

Recommend to those who likes to explore space and enjoy the view. Collect resources, trade, build base and fleet. Fight over territory.

Pros: 
- Several things do do in the game (you can do quests; mine; fight with others; trade; build base; build fleet)
- Great graphics
- Easy to understand
- big variety of ships
- big variety of resources to trade
- Has workshop (but haven't tried anything from there yet)

Cons: 
- lack of deeper fleet managment
- can't put your old ships in your fleet and can't fly the ship that you built for the fleet
- personally i think ship designs are a bit poor, too abstract. But that doesn't influence the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962257838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 5670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2442, 'last_played': 1558460882}

author: {'steamid': '76561198278838324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 5195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4142, 'last_played': 1599570761}
review:
It's a fun game if you want to fly around space and shoot things, a real "Shoot'em up" game but it doesn't really have an exciting story line to go with it, a bit of a twist in the story but that's about it, i wouldn't recommend this to someone who's playing the game for the story as it is very short, you can become very overpowered even on the hardest difficulty and rule the universe without the need of fleets if you can get the right weapons and ship enhancements.

Great game to pass the time.

Pros:

:: Expansive armada building
:: Tactical combat
:: Fleet commanding ability
:: Research of ship commandeering
:: Free Roam
:: Multiple choices of enemies & allies
:: Capture of enemy ships
:: Recycling
:: Continues game play if you finish story line.

Cons:
:: Fleet path-finding corrupted (Your wing men and followers knock into your ship while travelling alongside you.)
:: Text storyline. (No real actual video context of gameplay)
:: Fighters get lost while travelling (The small combat fighters you deploy)
:: Choices don't matter
:: Unrealistic combat system
:: Game seems different than the Video

author: {'steamid': '76561197984812138', 'num_games_owned': 706, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2477, 'last_played': 1555985983}
review:
Jack of all Trades, Master of None

I am a fan of games like Stellaris & Wing Commander/Privateer. After reading the game description and other reviews, this game showed some potential to cover both bases. However, this game can at best generate a mixed response from me. I am only recommending it because I had fun playing it, which is the main point of a game after all.
 
The game puts you in a scenario where you start out as a captain of a single ship and eventually lets you become a leader of an empire with diplomatic ties with other factions. The progress from beginning to end is vast enough to allow the player to enjoy each stage of the game without too much of a grind. There are also plenty of scenarios to choose from in the game options aside from the main campaign storyline.

However, when one starts to dig deeper into each aspect of the game, the game starts to become very bland.
While the option is there, every factor in the game feels too simplified and basic. 

Diplomacy options with factions are very limited. You can only start/end a war or set up some basic trades like trade deals that don't last very long or purchasing a space station. Alliances feel so superficial. They'll give you resources/ships every few weeks, but that's it. It's basically a non-aggression pact with benefits. Allies won't join on your conquest campaigns. It's also too easy to get allied with anyone. You start taking over bandit territories, and somehow a faction on the other side of the galaxy loves you. In fact, in most cases, it's everyone ends up loving you. Pretty boring when that happens. 
Diplomacy level 3 is also overpowered. Wars are too easy to end with that option unlocked as it basically is a powerful "speech check" that let's you end a war without paying anything if you have no real advantage.

On a privateer scale, commodity pricing doesn't shift over time, so there's no real variety of where to go to sell your loot.

Fleet orders are very basic. Follow the player, or guard a site on the map. You can mark a target in combat, but that's very much up to the AI to really follow that order. Taking over zones is big pain because it feels like your fleet ships don't seem to move toward the space station area to take out stationary targets. They will if you separate from the fleet on the map beforehand and tell them to attack a point on their own. 

In the late game, you can conquer planets. It sounds fun on paper, but it is a horrible grind in reality. This is somewhat a spoiler, but the process is pretty silly. Destroy defense things that every faction suddenly is deploying that prevents planet conquering process from starting, plop down the planet conquering ship, defend ship from enemy ship waves, click the nuke planet button.  Another gripe I have is the means of conquering a planet. Why do I have to basically nuke a planet once and suddenly it's mine? I don't think I want a nuked planet.

After writing this review, it really does feel like I wouldn't recommend this game. However, I did enjoy my time playing this game. As long you aren't looking for much depth, this game is a satisfying time killer. It covers the basics in a fun space game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070492423', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1924, 'last_played': 1704499287}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017910443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 1466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1214, 'last_played': 1555666969}
review:
Absolutely amazing.

It's the Freelancer and X series hybrid that I have always dreamt of.

Faster paced than the X games, but with Freelancers simplicity and charm, with bigger fleet battles than both. 
The controls are wonky at first, but you get used to them. Your flying capital ships, not fighters, so don't expect to zip around like a formula 1 spacecar.

What you can expect is a huge map filled with friends, enemies, cool stuff, explosions and enormous fleet battles, loaded with sexy but simple 4x design elements and all the Space stuff we are used to - looting, exploring, lasers, biiiiiig ships, upgrading to biiiiiiiiiiiiger ships, trading, fulfilling contracts, bounty hunting, with some added boarding and a dash of destroying planets with a yuge lazer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018463849', 'num_games_owned': 743, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1556708447}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970724842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7957, 'last_played': 1555631163}
review:
Game is a mixed bag:

My initial lure was when I read other reviews saying this game was like "Mount and Blade" in space. To an extent, it is. You can participate in small random events or jobs, and/or you eventually can get involved in relatively large fleet battles between your personal fleet vs. other enemies.

Controls can be clunky. It would take a few hours just to get used to it. Even after getting familiar with controlling the movement and camera views, there are some features you'd wish were there. No real showstoppers though.

The game can also start fairly slow and grindy as you work your way up to bigger ships. However, once you figure out some good ways to make money, that growth accelerates exponentially and you'll find yourself considerably too powerful where the vast majority of battles will feel like walks in the park. At that point, the game gets stale and you find yourself rushing to complete whatever "end-game" objectives there are just so you can get it all over with.

Of the possibly 60 hours you can get from the entire set of DLCs, you'll find entertainment in about 1/3 of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079952264', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 8130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3337, 'last_played': 1682152158}
review:
по мне дк. игра отличная. можно поиграть за пиратов, враждебных пришельцев и за другие стороны в свободной игре.
 Основной сюжет коротковат, если конечно фрилансерством не заниматься и не фармить на "просперити" с полным его апгрейдом включая изучение в лабах : \.

Плюсы
1+.звуковое сопровождение(музыка)
2+. не плохая боевая система( но в дальнейшем стрелять будете меньше на больших кораблях т.к. , а будете использовать турели или автоматическую стрельбу)
3+. разнообразее квестов.
 
Минусы
1-. немного не логичных захват планет (смысле думал, что будет несколько выстрелов, а на картинке игры вообще разрушение планеты . _-_)
2-. баги ( багов было не так много, но встретилось парочку например:
    1. Не прилетали враги на обороне.
    2. Если на миссии "атака на установку" отправить десант на объект, то он станет бессмертной.
    3. Не прилетал транспортник на миссии по добыче руды. )

author: {'steamid': '76561198008335018', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2666, 'last_played': 1555289222}
review:
One of the better space games I have played recently.

Combat is decent and doesn't get too stale too fast, the missions are interesting enough to keep doing, and varied enough to prevent burnout, the story is decent if not stellar, and overall the game was pretty fun.

Some of the forced leveling/grind is a bit tedious, but nothing too obnoxious.

If you enjoy space games, fleet battles, and empire building this game is definitely worth looking into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038781038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1710784826}
review:
Самое отвратительное дерьмо в которое я когда либо играл. Starpoint Gemini Warlords это когда разрабы не могут сделать адекватное обучение в кампании даже в 3ей части. топ сюжет, на тебе никуя ресурсов, столько же кораблей, иди теперь штурмуй соседнюю станцию, которую сторожит флот в 10 раз больше твоего, добавте к этому унылый сюжет, локализацию через гугл и тормоза во всех системных меню. И слава разрабам, они уменьшили дальность всех орудий и способностей!!! алилуя! во 2ой части было можно спастись от этой сраной камеры расстреливая всех издалека а теперь неееет, давайте ебошить в упор, что бы игрок, применяя способность в бою, мог заработать морскую болезнь.
В общем я хз как в это играть: обучение всрато, бои и камера всраты, кампания тоже всрата, зависать в свободном режиме что ли? майнить астероиды и торговать? ибо это похоже единственный нормальный способ играть в это, надрочить за овер докуя часов дредноут\носитель и идти в кампанию

author: {'steamid': '76561198302591233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1623781284}
review:
I have never played a space combat game where the controls were that AWFUL.

By default, you control your ship with WASD and accelerate / break with the mousewheel. What the fuck. Have the devs never played X, Freelancer or Everspace, or you know, any other game in space? Regardless of how you set it up, it simply doesn't work as you expect it to. Either the crosshair doesn't control your ship at all or it's too tight. It feels like you're flying a stick through space.

The biggest issue: You can't strafe in ANY direction. Not sideways, not up, not down. In a somewhat fast paced space combat game. Are you fucking kidding me.

Bought the game for 18 €, started it a few weeks later for the first time, played a bit, gave up after not even an hour.

Let's hope I can still get a Steam refund. :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198380040147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 5857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1399, 'last_played': 1580296339}
review:
开始玩的玩的4～5小时，真心想删这游戏。和隔壁平面宇宙rebel galaxy一比全是缺点，没有视角锁定，飞过敌船就是看不到敌人的自动炮击，要么就停在那里搞固定炮台式打击，飞船护盾、引擎、发电也没得改，飞船又弱没得刚的可能。过了这段时间就感觉好了，2k战力的僚机，火力好的战舰，收集和建造系统。但固有缺点还在，只是没那么明显。
整体上来讲这游戏偏重运营管理，而非飞船，后期无畏舰还是很强大的。
技能系统，有些技能不知所谓，比如黑客，看上去很好，实际应用很少也就剧情和卫星之流，非敌人还不能黑，也许剧情通了以后就有用也不一定。
整体来说7分，不能多了，先期绝对劝退新人。

author: {'steamid': '76561198007042487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1197, 'last_played': 1532837199}
review: Short version: a pretty game with extremely repetitive gameplay and god-awful "voice acting," where there is any. It's lazy, but gorgeous. Fun for a time, but anyone with a life will realize how pointless everything is. It's just a loop of gameplay. Nothing that makes space interesting except your little group battles. It's meh, small and empty of life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057493661', 'num_games_owned': 3568, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 2101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2101, 'last_played': 1559787094}
review:
Strategy rts (real time strategy) in space!

Its a wargame.

You can fly many ship types and also build fleets in your starbase eventually which you can give orders to on the world map to help conquer enemy star-bases, which allow you to take control of areas of space (territory) and the resources within.

In most other space-games you just fly around and trade but never really take over or conquer, here you can and get a greater feeling of accomplishment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000903121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 3554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3554, 'last_played': 1552871757}
review:
So much in this game was done great... and so much of it fell short.
With all of the complaints I have about the game I thoroughly enjoyed it.  It sucked me in and ate my free time for weeks up to 60hours total.  The story was good, there were tons of systems to play with and learn.  The busywork did get a little grindy but I also took over the entire galaxy so that... may be my own fault.  However all that time building up removes all replay value.  Now that I'm done the main campaign and DLC I'm not even going to look at the other modes to start over.
You can build fleets of spectacular ships and send them to do things! Unfortunately those things are purely relegated to attacking things... and they aren't very good at it.  If you go with them it'll take 3 minutes and you'll have 0 lost ships.  If you don't go with them it'll take 10 minutes and you'll need to rebuild some lost ships.  Much quicker to babysit and do it all yourself.
In large battles you are involved in you can see your ships next to enemy ships 10k away but no damage will be exchanged.  You need to be in a certain range for action to occur.  While I can appreciate this helping to prevent loss of ships it does also make some battles incredibly long as you hunt down each individual enemy who fled from a station for 30k distance away.  That again... one of your fleet ships is right next to... but refuses to attack unless you're watching it...
You can send civilian fleets out to do things! By clicking on the map in various places and sending ships out... about 50x every 10 minutes... on a map that doesn't let you search it very well... with minimal rewards... Yeah this went to the wayside quite quickly for me.  Auto-assign may be a good option for this particular busy-work?
You can have a massive freighter ship for mining and gather tons of resources to sell and make tons of money and minerals to build things! But you need to mine everything manually, autofire won't target anything but enemies.  At least there is a collect all button you can hotkey.  I took 1 large mining ship out once, after that I stuck to the fun stuff.
You can acquire 4 massive Titan class ships that sit outside your main base looking dangerous and menacing, each with their own unique benefits to pilot.  However you can only pilot them yourself so you can only use 1 at a time and the rest can't be in your fleet so really once you have the Juggernaught the rest are just for show.  Maybe let the ships in your garage join your fleet? Multi-player potential?

author: {'steamid': '76561198041638845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1487, 'last_played': 1554044406}
review: This game is a brilliant blending of 4x and rpg for space ships.  The control are not all that difficult in my opinion.   I highly recommend playing through the campaign.  It give a lot of the mechanics in an upfront tutorial(plot) and is fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357595134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1552152953}
review:
The controls of this game are hard to use. Once you get it figured out the action is already over. Just getting past the basic intro took 51 minutes. Long enough to know I wasted my money. 

If you make the mistake of purchasing this game, don't forget you only have 2 weeks or under 2 hours of game play to request a refund. I went over on the 2 weeks and am now stuck with this gem. I may give it a try again later after I have won all my other games and catch up on reading several books.

The game looked good on the video, I only wished the controls made it worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987150555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1552790969}
review:
A pretty game that fits an important niche, but with major flaws. The control scheme is rubbish. Both keyboard + mouse and gamepad are counter-intuitive and difficult to operate. And the intro story is tedious and uninteresting. Characters and dialog are entirely forgettable, and the UI for interacting with NPCs is lowest-common-denominator bad.

I really wanted to like this game. On paper, it scratches an itch that few modern games bother with: 3rd-person control of a space warship. But there are just too many barriers to enjoyment. If there had been a demo, I would've been able to recognize Gemini Warlords as cosmetically pleasing trash.

I wouldn't play this game more if you paid me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198387374246', 'num_games_owned': 12, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1552192491}
review:
[quote=悄咪咪测评]
关注悄咪咪测评，每天悄咪咪的给你推荐一个好游戏<3
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34041140/] 悄咪咪点一下这里关注[/url] 
[/quote]

[h1]题外话	[/h1]

人类的历史是一部不断去挑战的历史，对于未知的好奇驱使了一代又一代的人踏入哪些未被涉及的疆土，从大航海时代开始，我们就不断的拓展着人类的生活领域，直到有一天重力井已经满足不了人类的好奇心，我们便进入到了UC纪年（误）。

[h1]游戏简评	[/h1]

作为一款较为硬核的射击类游戏，《STARPOINT GEMINI WARLORDS》在故事上具有一定的前传性质，画面精良，背景设定是在外太空，在剧情的引导下，进行着一场有一场的战斗。总体而言，战斗难度较高，且在前期操作练习上提示不足，需要一定的时间对游戏的整体操作流程进行熟悉才能够较好的上手；同时游戏节奏较快，需要具备一些此类游戏的经验才能比较好的适应。

[h1]游戏体验	[/h1]

战斗空间较大，无视角锁定，具有一定难度操作方式，对于3D眩晕的玩家而言可能游戏过程会较为难受；剧情比较线性，开放性有待进一步提升，可以考虑进一步增加游戏模式；游戏设计精良:广阔的战斗场景、极具挑战的战斗关卡、充满机械感的战舰设计。这些要素无不让人热血沸腾，对于射击游戏爱好者来说是一款不容错过的佳作。

author: {'steamid': '76561198182942983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1552121412}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024044065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3148, 'last_played': 1552260788}
review:
I've really enjoyed this game so far.  I played SG2 as well, and I have enjoyed a lot of the new editions.  I'll sum up my opinions on the game in bullet-point form (note:  I have all DLCs available so far):

The Good:
-General thrust of creating fleets and managing them, even being able to send fleets to do your bidding or join ongoing battles (offensive or defensive).
-Ship designs are cool and distinct from one another (e.g. Solari vs Protectorate vs Trinity Free States)
-Planetary Bombardment (in DLC) is really cool
-Easy to just 'pick up and play' while still having difficult battles and general tactical expectations from the player (shield facing, positioning relative to rest of fleet, etc.)
-Mix of bounties, freelance, looting, and straight-up conquering enemies
-Music 'feels right' for the setting
-Factions all feel imperfect.  No clear 'good guy' and the 'bad guy' Aliens only make limited appearances...well except that one challenge scenario...where they *really* make an appearance.

The Bad:
-Limited ability to manage your fleet locally/tactically.  I can't set formations or behavior (pursue enemies, guard this installation, etc.).  This has led to a few embarrassing situations.  I would end sublight once I am close to enemy destination, only to find that my fleet is 10 clicks behind me and the enemy is ready to go full Brazzers on me.  I *think* mark target makes your fleet focus on the target, which is nice.
-The classes are ... probably better than in SG2 (I'm a little fuzzy on how they worked in SG2) but the close-range class just seems to be the best.  Long range would be better if fleets/carriers/heavyweps were stronger and fleets were easier to adjust tactics (see above).  In the game's current form, short-range dread always seems to be the better approach.
-Assorted minor glitches and typos in objectives, dialogue, menus, etc. were enough to be noticeable and strange (Endpoint DLC only for the glitches).

Misc hopes for future releases or SG3 (neither good nor bad):
-I want to see huge ships in the style of either Iolian Pact or MultiOps.  I know outsourcing is the (crony) capitalist way, but I'd love so see some larger models.  
-Speaking of different ships, I'd like to see different PROXIMA equivalents for the different factions.  Playing as other factions, it felt weird using a bright blue-gold Solari planet killer.  Maybe change up the titan models and make them look more 'planet-killy' for the other factions?
-Mercenary mechanics/freeroam-scenario wherein you overtly work for a faction and help them conquer stuff for money but have no land of your own.  Your loyalty goes with the cash, so you move between factions...or something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198324746818', 'num_games_owned': 6580, 'num_reviews': 600, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1552174747}
review:
[quote]

[h1]前言[/h1]

《双子星座军阀（Starpoint Gemini Warlords）》是Little Green Men Games制作的一款太空题材的策略游戏，游戏包含了模拟经营，角色扮演和4X元素。在游戏中，你所扮演的是一名指挥官，你需要最大化发挥手中不多的资源，建立起属于自己的空间站，对浩瀚的宇宙进行不断的勘探，与此同时也要不断的发展自己的“太空帝国”，侵入敌人的领土，征服其他星球，书写自己的宇宙传奇。

[h1]友好的新手教程，需要您耐心对待[/h1]

　　个人感觉游戏的难度不是很大，并且该作对新人十分友好，新手教程很全面，就是有点长[spoiler]（我觉得开发商做的很全面，为玩家处处着想）[/spoiler]，个人认为玩这款游戏，不说掌握全部，掌握大部分新手教程的内容是很重要的，一部分玩家可能觉得新手教程无聊、枯燥而放弃了这款优秀的游戏，还有一部分玩家是没有理解或者重视新手教程导致后面战役模式操作不熟练而将游戏卸载。在新手教程中你可以学到自动驾驶、自动开火以及一些简单又必备的基本操作。但是到了后期操作，有些敌人AI特别灵活，可能还是需要玩家具备一些预判等常规操作才能“丝滑”的虐AI。

[h1]丰富的游戏玩法[/h1]

　　游戏的玩法十分丰富，玩家不仅可以选择做主线，推进主线的战役，还可以选择接自由职业任务，自由职业任务是一个为升级舰船挣外快的绝佳途径，除此之外，你还可以去倒卖货物等等，最终目的就是获得资金来扩展自己的“太空帝国”，让你的“太空帝国”越发繁茂。在任务中，我们需要操控自己的太空飞船与敌人进行空战，虽然可能你刚从新手教程出来之后觉得操作比较复杂繁琐，但是你慢慢的细细品味之后弄懂了玩法，你就知道这个游戏的魅力所在。

[h1]非常大的游戏地图，有利有弊[/h1]

　　地图大是非常好的事情，这意味着游戏中可探索要素、未知要素特别丰富。但是在本作中，任务1分钟、跑图15分钟基本都是常事。

[h1]其他杂项[/h1]

[b]1️⃣多样的太空船舰：[/b]
　　游戏中为你战斗的船舰就跟现实生活中的爱车一样，需要我们用心去保养，在这个游戏中也不例外，征战久了，你也会喜新厌旧，本作提供近90种不同船只可选，包括武装战舰、护卫舰到庞大的航空星舰。除此之外你还可以对船舰进行涂装，喷上你喜爱的颜色和你喜爱的图案等等。

[b]2️⃣风景值得一赞：[/b]
　　在太空中游走，怎么可能遇不到一片自己喜欢的星云，《双子星座军阀》可谓是张张截图均壁纸~

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1677687218]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1677687218[/url]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1677687045]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1677687045[/url]

[h1]总结及推荐人群[/h1]

[b]优点：[/b]

❤️ 新手教程丰富，对新人比较友好

❤️ 丰富的游戏玩法，经营、策略等等

❤️ 支持简体中文，虽然不是很完善，但是开发商至少听到了玩家的呼吁给个赞

[b]缺点：[/b]

💔 游戏飞船近距离战斗的物理判定做的不是很好

💔 游戏飞船战斗的打击感与画面真实感没有达到我的预期，可能只有前几次提的起兴趣

[b]推荐人群：[/b]

[b]《双子星座军阀（Starpoint Gemini Warlords）》一个不错的风景拍照游戏，怕操作难、怕迷路，无需担心本作支持自动开火、自动导航，所以对于喜欢太空经营战略的玩家，这是一个可以一玩的佳作。[/b]

[quote=悄咪咪测评]
关注悄咪咪测评，每天悄咪咪的给你推荐一个好游戏<3
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34041140/] 悄咪咪点一下这里关注[/url] 
[/quote]

[/quote]

This is my first example of steam needing a 'meh' button. I didn't dislike enough to not finish it, but I would not recommend it to anyone I know either.

I'm still going to play the next one though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961402524', 'num_games_owned': 975, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1551893228}
review:
Abysmal controls when using keyboard/mouse.

After the game launches, it changes your mouse sensitivity system-wide even if you dewindow the application and it loses focus—everything will have an altered mouse sensitivity until the game is closed. The sensitivity is also extremely high. I have a Logitech G502 mouse, which I keep at 8200 DPI with my Windows mouse sensitivity set to the third-slowest setting, and the game is unplayable; the mouse is far, far too sensitive: moving my mouse less than a centimetre will move the cursor over halfway across my screen. I had to drop my mouse DPI down to less than 2000 and use the game's lowest possible mouse sensitivity to make it barely even usable, after which point I closed the and game and requested a refund.

There is no excuse for how poorly designed and lazily implemented the control scheme in this game is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019227338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 2495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1551400960}
review: Another case where I would advocate for a middle option between recommend and don't. Warlords is not a bad game, it works pretty well, few bugs but nothing game breaking, it's just still pretty bare and bland. I feel combat could be improved significantly with the ability to target subsystems with weapons to disable enemy engines, weapons, etc. Right now you're just hitting the whole ship and in the case of larger ships are just slowly whittling away at health pools. The boarding system needs to be looked at again, it seems needlessly difficult to take over crippled vessels. Again could be aided with the ability to destroy subsystems with shipboard weapons. Interactions with NPC's are very limited. Voice acting is pretty bad in the few instances where it is present. Grinding is an enormous chore, again due to bland combat and difficulty capturing enemy vessels. Flying around gets old quickly. Still, you can spend a good deal of time with this game, they just won't be very engaging. Worth it on a decent sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154447689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 3147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1905, 'last_played': 1551678146}
review:
Was on the fence about buying this because of the recent reviews, but it's been on my wishlist for a very long time. I do recommend this game after 17 hours(got tons more gameplay ahead of me)

It's true, the controls are all over the place but that's because the combat is designed to be a multi-tasking effort. At first, before I had a fleet of ships, I was upset that the combat was so insultingly dull and almost refunded...but now I understand because the combat develops depth the harder the battles get. 

The main mission is always there for you to pick up at any point which is nice because I can go do side-missions and build my empire however long I wish. 

I am really enjoying just starting to expand my borders and build big ships. There's enough elements of the game that it makes it a resource management game for sure.

If you're looking for deep strategy armada vs armada this isn't it. You throw your fleet against the other and use some special tools against priority targets. There isn't even a focus ability that I found.

I do not like how my neighboring pirates have a few visible fleets patrolling with low strength...and then when I go to kill them the game generates fleet after fleet in front of me on the way to my target that are WAY stronger (proportional to my...level?) 

Edit: you can focus fleet fire by hitting middle mouse button and selecting the target option

author: {'steamid': '76561198901634317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1551240435}
review: I gave this game a try but realized quickly it couldn't tell the difference between me using a keyboard to a controller. So i eventually gave up trying to mess with the settings trying to figure out why it thought my keyboard was a controller. This game looks amazing and has a lot of cool things. But if it don't have a good interface that can tell the difference between a keyboard or controller I will rather pass on the game. This game has bad coding all over. The game isn't playable straight out of the box which is very disappointing. Even bad games that are cents have better controls over this game. They really lack in updates for bug fixes and more. The devs have no intentions as far as i know of to fix the issues the game has. Save your money and spend it elsewhere as this game isn't worth the hassle. This game is simply unplayable with keyboard and mouse. The WASD controls send the ship spiraling out of control, and the mouse directed movement (pressing space) is little better. I'm amazed that this hasn't been patched to improve the controls. From reading the forums, your only real option is some kind of controller... but frankly that should have been stated in caps in the game description before I bought the game. The game is a waste of money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197071339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1616, 'last_played': 1552834986}
review: 游戏是好游戏，既包含单打独斗，又包含集群作战，还包括建设发展（种田），最喜欢这种可以闷头发展，然后暴兵推家的骚操作。操作起来比较繁琐别扭，需要花时间才能熟悉其操作方式，最好的方式就是改按键比如切换锁定Z改成tab，加速前滚轮改成w，减速后滚轮改成s，向上看w改成前滚轮等等。。 如果不喜欢第三人称改成第一人称也可以，但是要把鼠标移速改低一些不然很容易晕。

author: {'steamid': '76561197998552615', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1551502278}
review: How does this game even exist? The controls are the worst I have ever experienced. I keep reading where the devs like to say "once you get used to it". NO! Make the game playable out of the box! This isn't some "style" of game, this is just bad coding! The ship should not swing wildly out of control every time it's nudged in one direction or another. No, I'm not turning down mouse sensitivity, that means I have to pick my mouse up twice to get from one corner of the screen to another. If you guys can't figure out what Atari coders figured out 40 years ago, try a different line of work. I hear Burger King is hiring. Now excuse me while I get my money back...

author: {'steamid': '76561198042070331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5910, 'last_played': 1551238964}
review: I played both Starpoint Gemini 2 and Starpoint Gemini Warlords. I enjoyed 2 so much that I purchased Warlords immediately upon release and I can honestly say I have not been disappointed. The story is very enjoyable and the game does not force you to go back and play previous games just so you can understand what's going on. I see a lot of hate over the controls, but I have really not had any issue with them. Bottom line is if you're looking for a beautiful, fun, and relaxing romp through space then this one is definitely worth a pickup.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088574097', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 2359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1976, 'last_played': 1581956201}
review:
Starpoint Gemini Warlords is an excellent game that doesn't deserve all the hate over flight controls.  While the game doesn't have typical first-person flight sim controls, the controls are good at simulating ship command.  I don't need to aim every single turret; [i]I tell my gunners to open fire.[/i]  I don't need to maneuver with cat like reflexes; [i]I tell my navigator where to go.[/i]

With over 80 ships to choose from and generous weapon options, roaming the galaxy is a lot of fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999032821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1551053526}
review:
Зря потраченные деньги.
Управление ужасное, хоть какая бы маневренность у вас ни была, если ты двигаешься, враг будет заходить тебе в спину с такой скоростью, что не успеваешь крутить мышью. Бесконечные кошки мышки по кругу, надоело.

Джамп драйв нужно ставить в слот для активации, занимает место, потом вынимать для нужных активных скилов в бою.

Система торговли убогая, фриланс миссии берутся только по одной, нельзя взять несколько.

Масштабы и относительные размеры кораблей так отрисованы, что противника практически не видно, пока в упор не подойдёшь, и даже тогда он будет размером с комара.

Эдаким эталоном боевой системы и управления имхо можно считать игру StarConflict. Этой же игре до неё далеко.

Эталоном в торговле и строительстве всё таки серия игр от Egosoft. Даже в 1ю часть X серии было приятнее играть.
Короче, не советую.

review:
Mount & Blade in space. Decent graphics, poor flight control. Besides the tutorial the game lacks any form of story, therefore making it a bit of a grind. What I've seen so far enemies tend to level up with you, making your progress feel inefficient.
Still a nice game to spend some time, though buy only on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991892678', 'num_games_owned': 836, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 3958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3948, 'last_played': 1553490864}
review:
[h1]Starpoint Gemini Warlords[/h1]

Curte games no espaço? Check!
Curte games rpg? Check!
Curte pilotar naves massivas, chamadas de "capital ships"? Check!
Curte explosões? Mapa aberto? Escolhas? Criar seu destino? Check! Check! Check! E muito mais?
Então este jogo é para você!

Possui um tutorial bem instrutivo, devs que ouvem a comunidade, lançam dlcs bem grandinhas mais para expansões, são ultra baratas. Os Desenvolvedores sempre conversam com os jogadores, respondem os comentários e implementam sugestões da galera no game e corrigem os bugs sempre. São devs bem dedicados!

Agora sobre o game, vc começa nas menores classes como um corvette, e vai ate as maiores, dreadnoughts, carriers ou se possui a expansão titan, pilotara um titan.

Tem varias missões na sua estação inicial, onde vc pode evoluir ela, para produzir mais recursos, criar naves melhores, mandar suas naves em missões, pesquisar novas tecnologias e criar toda uma armada para limpar o universo de xenos.. muhuahahahaha ou apenas ter uma escolta junto a vc capaz de evaporar qualquer um que entre em seu caminho.

O jogo te da varias opções de como jogar, curte combate? curte comercio? curte minerar? curte extrair? explorar? Pode fazer um, focar, ou um pouco de tudo. Você upa de level, se especializa e escolhe uma das 3 classes disponíveis no game, melhorando seus atributos e cada vez mais subindo de rank e pilotando naves maiores, não se esqueça do mapa enorme onde pode conquistar territórios, fazer alianças, trocar recursos e fazer guerras com outras facções nesse universo enorme.
O jogo tem muitas armas disponíveis, como lasers, plasma, canhões, etc. Podendo customizar sua nave do jeito que quiser, pintar, especializa-la em um tipo de arma, em velocidade etc. Durante a batalha ou exploração vc pode focar em tankar(toda energia em shields), atacar pra valer(toda energia em atk), ou escapar ou voar que nem a luz(focar em speed).

Se recomendo? Recomendadíssimo, o jogo tem workshop com vários mods para baixar, se vc ama jogos rpg e espaço, vai amar o game! Não esquece das dlc, são muito f... tem que compra-las!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003848034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1665, 'last_played': 1551057843}
review:
I like some of this game and will probably play more, though that being said it has some issues and I found myself agreeing with some of the other reviewers.

It is decently pretty, though I tried to "crank up" the graphics at one point and was sad to realize they were already maxed.
The space combat is decent if really simple even at "hard" like some people try to defend it, I like space battles so it seemed mostly fun to watch the ships battle it out but it wasn't going to win an award for my favorite or anything.
Because of the way the ships fight it has a naval feel.  In other words, having a smaller and faster fighter didn't really seem like a viable option.  Big was always better more star trek next generation and less Battlestar if you get what I mean..

My issues with this game come from the grind style game play and the lack of immersion.  If I have to grind for 2 hours to get my next cool ship and and then the enemy immediately scales to the same thing... that sucks.  The game seems to get better as you expand your empire but I just hate all the NPCs... like ALL of them.  The campaign felt more like a point and click adventure as most of it consists of click on map and then instantly teleport there to murder some bad guy and then rinse and repeat meanwhile listening to the B squad NPCs trying to win an EMO contest. 

Actually I think I can sum this game up pretty easily.  If you want to play a really simple single player EVE online this is decently fun.  They even have frieghters to do your own cargo runs if you want,  I couldn't get into it that aspect of the game as it just seemed to basic with out players trying to murder me at different jump gates in null sec.  I think there is a really good market for a single player EVE online... almost like a space Skyrim, but this isnt that game.  This would be more like the space Nazi Army Trilogy, it has some really cool elements but its not something you will spend all your time playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992810992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2996, 'last_played': 1552767251}
review:
I am surprised by the recent streak of negative reviews. Admitedly the controls are a little clunky and the game is a little on the simple side, but it's still quite fun. I played Gemini 2 and the things I kept wishing I could do were command a fleet or faction, and this gives exactly that.

The game may not be worth it at full price anymore (that's a personal judgement call I rarely buy any steam game at full price), but it definetly fills a nice niche of a simpler space strategy game that you can play both at an individual combat level and a higher strategic level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198685679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1551066501}

author: {'steamid': '76561198075452656', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1423, 'last_played': 1551059001}
review: I am amazed how many people disliked this game.  Been playing space sims for ages, everything from the x series to elite dangerous.  Yes this game is a wee bit arcadey BUT THAT IS THE POINT.  Its not meant for hardcore simulation.  The controls are really fluid and the game is INCREDIBLY easy to mod.  Enemies scale with you yes and it very easy to get in over your head if you're not paying attention.  hint hint, DONT FIGHT AN ENEMY FLEET WITHOUT A FLEET OF YOUR OWN.  and for god sakes dont engage a dreadnought or a battleship with nothing but a destroyer or a cruiser.  i cant help but wonder what people are complaining about with this.  If you dont like this game go play something else that is "mur herdker fer meh."  this is literally meant to jump in and have fun and experience a nice story, not t o beat you into the ground harder than dark souls with no armor and no sword.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149732758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1551019061}
review:
来谈一谈自己为什么退款
说实话，在我两个小时的游玩过程中，我是看得出来它有很有趣的对话和派系系统的，这大概也是游戏最大的闪光点。但是涉及到舰船方面，那就真的很折磨人了，旋转视角，自动开火，手动开火和锁定发射重武器这一大堆乱七八糟的战斗操作（哦，是的，还有技能），足以让我在迎战一群敌手的时候晕头转向。
可以说是由于这种陀螺一样的体验，我彻底放弃了继续体验的想法，就是这样。

author: {'steamid': '76561198006529799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3972, 'last_played': 1690772511}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979929149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1550897834}
review:
Wow. I wanted to like this, but they probably should have worked harder to make the actual game better rather than releasing all that DLC.

The trailer and screenshots make this look amazing. Graphics in game are just decent.
The controls are terrible (really). The controls are similar to what you might expect from a 1990's space sim.
Ship weapons have no feedback and just look like your ship is firing special effects cannons. Ships are bullet sponges.
The voiceover is mildly embarassing.
One of the first characters you're introduced to is the spitting image of chuck norris, and nobody seems to notice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302170687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1550955105}
review: It's impossible to actually play the game. You can try every fix on the web and you still won't be able to actually start a new game and play without it crashing. I'm bummed because I really like space combat game like this and had this on my wishlist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027745413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2018, 'last_played': 1576977036}
review: An alle Käufer die das Spiels Nummer Meckern ? Ihr seit wirklich Herzlos das spiel ist Super gut gemacht ich habe lange zeit nicht so ein gutes spiel gespielt wie Starpoint Gemnini Reihe . Ihr müsst das spiel eine Chance geben es zu verstehen die Steuerung und es spielt sie wie ein RPG in Weltraum mit Weltraum schiefe. Wenn ihr ein niedrigen Level seit dann fliegt das Anfang schief nicht so gut dann müsst ihr euren Skill Baum nach eure wünsche formen und natürlich upgrats kaufen. Ich habe Starpoint Gemini 1-2 gespielt und das ist ein frischer wind in der Weltraum Serie es gibt nicht nur X universum auch das spielt hat es voll drauf. Ich bin begeistert Das der Weltraum in vordere stelle steht und das schief und alle modifikazion als Statt stunden lang auf eine Basis rum zu spazieren und immer wider die selten Sprüche zu hören. Du landest kaufst was du willst und schon geht es los. Ich finde auch der schief größen unterschied klasse fliegst du eine Friegate bist du Natürlich kleiner als ein Titan und fliegst du mit ein Gigant bist du noch Größer und die alten Feinde kommen dir vor wie kleine Fliegen ich finde es einfach nur Hammer. Meine Meinung kauft euch das spiel und gibt das spiel 10-20 stunden levelt euch hoch klaut schiefe von Feinde und ihr wird sehen das macht großen Spaß wenn ihr Levelt und besser wird..

author: {'steamid': '76561198259979819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 2719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2596, 'last_played': 1551047709}
review:
Fan de la trilogie Starpoint et ayant commencer avec le deuxième ( sur lequel j'ai passer de très longue session de jeux ), j'ai beaucoup attendue du 3ème et je ne suis vraiment pas décue !

Pour les habituer de la saga, les commandes vont être très intuitive, facile a retenir et sans prise de tête ( pas besoin d'apprendre pendant 2 h comment juste faire avancer son vaisseaux par exemple ) et de base, les commande sont très simple, globalement, on doit connaître les mouvement du vaisseaux , le tire automatique, et la répartition de l'énergie dans les système.

Pour le jeux en lui même, il est vraiment très jolie, pas besoin d'avoir un pc de la nasa pour en profiter. Même si sa se déroule dans l'espace, il est très loin d'être vide, on croise souvent allié et ennemie, les déplacement ne son pas redondent ( trou de ver, portail etc.... ), les combat sont très beaux a voir même si en soit il n'y a pas grand choses a faire. Le tir manuel n'est cependant pas vraiment pratique face a plusieur adversaire, et on s'en remest vite au tir automatique.

L'histoire principal est très sympas a suivre, même si rapide a faire , d'ou l'interet des dlc. Et le fait d'avoir avec sois des '' héro '' ( comprenais des personnage type leader avec leur vaisseaux qui evolue seul ) est très sympas

Cependant, le jeux a tout de même des point négatif. Par exemple, certain pourrait être rebuter par le manque de choses a faire pendant les combat, mis a part bien se positionner, lancer les chasseur et aborder les vaisseaux, il n'y a pas grand choses a faire. 

Une fois l'histoire et les DLC completer, il n'y a plus grand choses a faire, on s'ennuie un peut.

Un autre défaut c'est les Titan, du moins leur controle. Alors certe, se sont des vaisseaux capitaux, donc assez lent, mais la ils sont beaucoup moins maniable que dans le deuxième.

Et le dernier défaut et a mon sens le plus gros, c'est l'impossibiliter de récupérer tout les territoire sans déclarer la guerre a ses alliée. Certe ceux qui ne veulent pas capturer toute la map ne sont pas trop embeter avec sa, mais si on a pour objectif de prendre toute les zone, on a pas le choix.

En bref, un exellent jeux, très agréable, facile a jouer, malgrès quelque petit défaut ici et la mais sans grande importance. Les fan de la Trilogie vont être vraiment heureux de retrouver en partie le deuxième volet dans se 3ème, malgrès pas mal de différence dans le bon sens du terme. Un jeux pour les fan de vaisseaux, de combat épique et de vrai histoire spatial.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006914300', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1544102422}
review:
A première vue, ce jeu parait génial!
Que ce soit les critiques ou les évaluations des joueurs, tout laissent à pensé que c'est un bon mélange de gestion et de STR.
Je l'ai acheté et alors là, impossible de lancé le jeu. Mais ça peut arriver donc je contacte le support via Steam et depuis le site internet.
Et c'est là que c'est inadmissible, je n'ai reçu aucune réponse à mes 3 emails!!
J'ai attendu 2 jours d'avoir une réponse pour résoudre mon soucis et rien.
Donc je ne recommande clairement pas ce jeu aux vus de leur service technique et après vente.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998802401', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2366, 'last_played': 1693193347}
review: This game is ok. The controls are pretty awful, but the gameplay isn't bad. It's fun to build up a little space empire and have your fleet join you in battle. There are a decent number of mechanics to toy around with, given that it's both a game with "dogfighting" and empire building. Both of these feel toned down so that they could both be fit into one game, but the lack of depth isn't too bad. If you're looking for an extremely in depth dogfighting game, or a highly strategic conquering game, this is not for you. But if you enjoy a bit of varied gameplay then this might be worth getting on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117688368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1550819604}
review:
Buenas.

A pesar de poder jugar al Elite: Dangerous al nivel medio, en este juego no puedo. Ni bajando todo al mínimo, no paso de 15 FPS, y eso que supero las exigencias mínimas requeridas.

Aparte, no entiendo al editor: tiene su juego traducido al francés (comprensible, hay bastantes sitios que lo hablan), al chino (hay un montón de chinos) y al alemán (no hay muchos alemanes, pero se ve que pagan), pero ni en español (el segundo idioma más hablado en el mundo), ni en portugués (también tienen un montón de personas que lo hablan). Y, por supuesto, en inglés, el idioma comercial.

No he podido darle una oportunidad, porque no puedo jugar a 15FPS con todo al mínimo. 

Por sus exigencias gráficas desmesuradas y por su desidia en la traducción me obligan a darle una reseña negativa.

Nos vemos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069809013', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2726, 'last_played': 1660447988}
review:
This game is both pretty big and has a good amount of content and features, much wanted if you played starpoint gemini 2, also keeps many weapons and upgrades with the same name, if you're a new player be prepared since you're going to find a lot of different upgrades and weapons and a lot of ships.
There is no rush in the campaign so you can enjoy freeplay in between missions, politics and tactical choices make a good part of the story so be sure you have the right skills to ease your life. and after you complete it you will have a lot of world to explore and side objectives to keep you busy, also the conquest objective if you're going for a full completion.

I played this with a video card under the recommended requirements (i have a 1GB DDR5 video card) and the game is playable, however expect low frame rates and longer battles, it is pretty annoying on stations and planets since game keeps rendering everything off the screen making menus wonky, so if you can upgrade your pc before purchasing it's going to be better for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972132272', 'num_games_owned': 941, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1549666616}
review:
I gave it a try, honestly. But being used to Evochron and the X-series, the gameplay is much to simple for my taste. Combat is rinse-repeat which gets boring fast. Management and expansion is easy and not that challenging. Controls a bit wonky, nothing feels fine or good enough. And enemies scale with your equipment and ship, and whenever you fly from A to B you see simple placement of different units which is really lazy coding because it ruins immersion instead of giving the impression you are in a living an breathing galaxy.

The only good thing are the graphics, because these are excellent.
( Also, I didn't encounter any loss of framerate!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198029314628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 8906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6807, 'last_played': 1701031693}
review:
I really liked the main story and was hyped AF when the Concord Titan showed up with its insane passive ability. 
Had plenty of fun for the ~68 hours of playing just the main story and the Titan dlc.

The salt:

The Main Story was 96% fine with translations, but the Titans DLC translation was a real downgrade to the game. I could understand like 70% of the things people said, especially the Nyx Dominion king Zaldur and his officer Laurel, the main protagonists of the story with the player himself were saying many things that dont make any sense in my language(german). I literally had to read all the words between the full stops and improvise grammar to it repeatedly in the same conversation.
But it gets worse. The Deadly Dozen DLC was so badly translated, out of all the bounties set, I could clearly see which one were from the deadly dozen by seeing the bad translations in their descriptions. If the Titans DLC translation was done by someone who was capable of 50% of the grammar the german language requires, the Deadly Dozen was clearly made by someone who doesnt even came across 10%. The words were randomly chosen, didn't add any sense to what was said right before them, and even with the improvising method I used for the Titans DLC between full stops I couldn't make any sense of the texts whatsoever. Finishing the mini story of the Deadly Dozen showed me that even worse translation can be done worse. This is the highlight. The very last conversation with the very last Deadly Dozen was so well done, that I really started to believe they just used google translate to translate the game into another language once, and then used the result of that translation to translate it into another language, just to go on like that and put german to the very end of it. 

Also the Cycles of Warfare DLC promises a challenge, in which you play the aliens who can buy alien ships and equipment on their own mothership with credits only. But the rewards for capturing Zones, Independent Stations, and Planets stayed exactly the same like in the original game. The result was that I was tortured to get just one of best laser until I captured a third of gemini with >100k credits left after buying it and over 100k of every station upgrading resource(ore, gas and materials) each, without being able to actually use any of it for building stuff or selling it for credits. Yeah relocating the starting area and start with different fleet ships is a nice idea, but obviously they didnt even finish their work on the major reason people would buy the DLC. The alien race and ships. And since I played Titans and Deadly Dozen to the end, I dont expect the other modes that come with it to be any better. 

Even if the Cycles of Warface DLC was just 5€, it still would not be worth the money. Unfinished work is never worth its full price. And they just took everything except the alien ships from the main game and changed the starting location and the faction. Wow.

I didnt play Numbia or Endpoint yet, and even if i know they're out already, I still hope deeply that they finally did something about their bad translations and actually finish their work instead of just implementing 1-2 tweeks for a full price DLC again.
