review: This is a damn fun game, no way around it. Some VERY helpful hints: After targeting a ship, press K for a padlock view of the target (only works on SHIPS not on objects). Stock up on decoys (they work like chaff or flares) and T drive charges (for getting out of trouble fast. Once you get past the very short learning curve you will love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313286756', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1549036164}
review: 这个游戏比较有空间大战的感觉，但是操作起来比较繁琐别扭，需要花时间才能熟悉其操作方式。在发行年代来说可能是一款很好的游戏，但现在看来不是一款什么值得去花很多时间的游戏。而且故事的情节不是多么引人入胜。

author: {'steamid': '76561198021621725', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 7679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4950, 'last_played': 1631427073}
review:
I have got to say, this has hit the scales as one of my favorite space games that is not a massive multiplayer scale. I had originally gotten Starpoint Gemini 2 on one of its free spells. After a fair bit of playing, I took some looking into this game and am beyond thrilled with it. The playstyle starts off slow and picks up very fast. All in all, for what this game is, it succeeds by leaps and bounds. Wish that it shared the same framerate as SPG2, but that relates to personal specs only.

All in all, I'd rate this game a solid 9.2 out of 10. Graphics are fantastic, audio is gorgeous. Story content is very enjoyable, replayability is through the roof due to how many takes you can get on the system at large. The addition of an RTS style for faction management makes this a must have for those who want an enjoyable, customizeable space experience without relying on multiplayer. The modding support is also superb, even non-modders can figure out an easy way of changing a few things to add in custom features. So this game really is what you want it to be.

Happy Warmongering.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077194982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 3026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2019, 'last_played': 1548437169}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996859673', 'num_games_owned': 2105, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 1580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1580, 'last_played': 1544305611}
review:
I gave this game a chance, sold on the idea, I watched a lot of youtube videos and decided to bite the bullet buying the Gold Pack.

I feel that I've given this game a big chance, but I also feel let down.
The devs seem to care about the game and it breaks my heart to give a thumbs down to them, but I don't feel like recommending the game and here's why.

The main gripe for me about this game is this... it paints a fine picture, it's a good combination of genres and the ambition of this game is great, thumbs up for that, but when you look closer, you start to see that everything is really mediocre.

The combat is mediocre, not a whole lot to do, you're either more powerful than your enemy or you're not, yes, you can turn around to manage your shields and power, but that's pretty much it, the boarding system is fine but nothing major, it's mostly based on luck.  So it really boils down to your gear, you either optimize it with your grind or grind more but can still pretty much asphalt anyone with enough grind (and that includes the flotilla you have with you, don't get me even started on lost ships that drain your resources very fast that requires even more grind).
The weapons feel largely similar and while I liked to try them and try different combos of them, I didn't really feel like it was making much of a difference.
Good use of abilities can turn the tide a bit and they were nice, but you only get to play with four of them and they are determined by your class, still that was cool and I approve.

The galaxy management system is mediocre, you exchange resources to get small increments in your "taxes", then you wait till you get your taxes, then you upgrade again (sorta like cookie clicker); you also send these civilian ships for tasks every once in a while to boost your resources, again, you're just clicking around and seeing numbers go up, fine that's satisfying to a point, but the amazement of numbers fade, just as any clicker does.

The story is ehh, mediocre, from the writing to the actual engagement of it... it serves its purpose but it's nothing memorable, I mostly did it when I was bored and it never engaged me... it didn't help that the dialog choices were either limited, ridiculous or both, but at least some answers were tied to your skills, I appreciated that.

The RPG part? Mediocre, while the game has a nice list of skills to choose from when you level up, some of them are redundant, some are useless, some are simple trees of upgrades of themselves. I approve of the idea and I liked to personalize my character, but more than half of the skills felt useless and were just there for the sake of it.
The exp you get was ok tho, maybe a bit on the faster side, you level quite easily and you'll probably be max level before you conquer one quarter of the map.

Now the grind for money and resources is very high and that's fine if you're into that, but it honestly felt like an mmo in singleplayer for me, which I did not like much. In a way I get it, it's a calm game, you get a contract (I like the randomized contracts), you set out, complete it, and do it again, and again, and again... or just go mine, whatever.
There's actually a lot of ways to make money, but very few that make sense and actually make you turn a profit in a decent time.

Now, by the time I grinded my way to the best ship and had a decent fleet, I started conquering the map, it was cool at first, but I quickly realized it was more of the same everytime, it lost its charm very quickly and became a tedious chore to see my income go up, then spend my resources to get better stuff, to get even more income, then conquer more stuff with battles that felt like copy-paste from one another.
It was satisfying to grow my empire, but  at 26 hours I was done, I felt like the game had nothing else for me.

On a side note, a lot of people seem to be complaining about the controls, they were fine I think.

I spent around 21 euros so one might argue that my game time is well spent (exceeding the 1h = 1€) .
I would agree if it was not for one fact... I sadly realize this cannot be described as quality time, I don't remember my time with this game fondly, but mostly as a chore I was trying to enjoy.
I can understand someone enjoying their time with this for 100 or 300 hours, but for me? Nah, I'll pass. I might be open to the idea of a sequel, and I was happy to support this labor, we don't have enough games like this, but I think it needs improvement.

EDIT after Developer Response :
Of course, as I said it breaks my heart to give you a negative review seeing as you are dedicated to this and I will gladly support your next project, cheers!
developer_response:
Hello Raiseo Hitsu,

thank You for constructive feedback, we don't get them often. Eventho is negative review, we're happy because you've invested time to tell us what's good and what's bad in our game. I can guranatee we will invest 120% of our energy, time and will to create better games in future. 

Thank you for giving us chance with SPGW and I hope you will give us chance with future projects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009173518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 2692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2274, 'last_played': 1678835574}
review:
First: The controls.

I read a lot about the poor controls in reviews but while they're certainly exotic I am not sure how else you should assign that many functions without things becoming utter chaos.
It did take some getting used to but I like the radial which allows me to do things much faster than I could do it by button mashing.

Having said that I find Starpoint Gemini Warlords an almost perfect game.

Almost.

Too many features of the game are not quite there. Little variation, too little depth etc etc. Below some exemples.

Diplomacy:
Way too little depth. Just being able to declare war/ sue for peace and doing some trading won't cut it for me. You actually get automatic alliances when you shoot enough of a factions enemies. Who says I want to be their ally?
All in all diplomacy is really a dissapointment.

Events
Often you see mysterious spot on the radar you can investigate. That is awesome in theory but if there are a grand total of five possible events or so then you stop investigating soon enough. Again, good idea but far too shallow.

Freelancer missions
These are fun. You can pick some eight or so differant missions and earn some extra credits. Too bad you can only earn credits with these though, it's a little vexing when you need ore badly and all you can earn is credits (and materials from captured ships.) Yes, you can trade but that's both very limited and not many trade ore away.

Combat
Combat can be chaotic but leading a wing of battleships in the heart of enemy territory really makes the trumphets blare in my head. CHARGE!

Story
I'd call the story decent. I enjoyed the first fifteen twenty missions or so but then I had to build something that exceeded my resources by about fifty times suddenly which meant end of story for me. Almost felt like the dev's were tired of building the storyline and glued the end on at that spot.

Visual
Very very satisfying. Space never is empty in this game.

Ships
Quite well done, you can select a chasis and then kit it out with heavy and light weapons. Takes some getting used to but it's really nice to personalise your ship and then pulverise your enemies with it. There's quite a few classes of ships as well (gunboat -> corvette -> frigate -> destroyer -> cruiser -> battleship -> dreadnought -> carrier.)

Tutorial
Normally I don't comment on tutorials but this one really got me started and didn't fell stale or like a chore clickfest. It blended smoothly with the campaign and told a little of the story and set the stage. I want more tutorials like this one!

All in all I enjoy playing the game but I cant help lamenting the missed opportunities called diplomacy and events. Had those been fleshed out a little better then SGW would have been a dream come true.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968526294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1547188045}
review: Controls ARE very cumbersome, gameplay was bland and uninspiring, and story and characters were largely forgettable. They took a page from many shoddy development companies and fully voiced the first 20 minutes of gameplay, but after that, sporadic voice acting, to the degree that when it  did happen, it was oddly jarring. Maybe this improves after a couple hours of gameplay, but even if it does, I doubt the core combat would get particularly more interesting. For that reason I returned this title and cannot recommend it to anyone, even for the sale price I paid for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041981125', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 4416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1724, 'last_played': 1563982433}
review: A great space game with lots of hours to spend trading, building, dominating. I definitely recommend buying up all the DLC if there's ever a sale. It'll increase the amount of ships, stations you can visit and missions to go on. Along with factions. Taking over enemy ships is such a huge bonus, especially once you have your own docking bays. I've heard the game called the Mount and Blade of Space, but I don't know how many in this day and age remember or have experiences Mount and Blade... either way, it's a great mix of RTS and RPG. I've really enjoyed it so far and can't wait to play more. Cheers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036096802', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 4481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3430, 'last_played': 1562394023}
review:
Someone looked at a 3x or 4x title and said "I want to do that, but make it more accessible to the average player." This is that game. Actually, this is the latest in that series of games. Starpoint Gemini Warlords is great for the average player, as it succeeds in making the whole game complete but less involved than titles like Stellaris or X4. 

This game is especially worth picking up on sale, as it regularly goes on sale for about US $9. It's also worth picking up even if you own Starpoint Gemini 2, since this game has a whole new aspect that does not exist in the older one--conquest (or at least partial acquisition via diplomacy and a LOT of money) and resource exploitation of the entire Gemini system with a fleet chosen and built by you at your side.

Also note that your power snowballs mid to late in your personal progression (which is independent of the story, even if you play in story mode). This is a bit of a con, since it's entirely possible to trivialise the entire story that way. And veteran 3x and 4x players might have trouble finding a challenge here.

Final thought: The story is kind of meh. They've improved on their voice acting since previous games, but the story writing is still iffy and a fair amount of the writing is clearly ESL, though it's improved from previous titles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032528294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 3933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3732, 'last_played': 1542466156}
review:
Take it from someone who hated Starpoint Gemini 2 - this is the title you should play.  However, while it's a vast improvement in several areas over the last title, it has many shortcomings, which I am now beginning to suspect as simple developer myopia.  It IS one of the best space sims out there, but you have to know what the game ISN'T.   

First off, if you're a flight sim nerd, you should probably be looking at Evochron Legacy.  It has Newtonian physics if you want that kind of dogfighting.  I mention this because in spite of the new and mostly vain attempt at adding strategic / empire building elements, this is still a combat game, and there are games with better controls and mechanics for that.  

If you're looking at this game in the first place, you've either played Starpoint Gemini games before, or kind of already know what you're looking at because you're into space sim/sandboxes.  To that end, I'm going to skip a bunch of the fluff and get right to the things that stand out.  

This game, while still grindy, isn't a slogfest like so many space sims - including previous SG games.  It'll take hours, not days to get enough credits for the next ship, and overall you're looking at about 40 hours for the campaign.  That's with the grinding but without too much screwing around. 

As always, the main campaign is written as a pile of mush, but this time around it had better voice acting, and the game itself did a better job than previous titles on radiant events, giving you things to do and actually making them worth your time.  The setting is a lot more developed with bits of lore, such as particular asteroid fields having more of some resources than others.  It's all still linear of course, with many types of activities forming the same illusion-of-choice bottlenecks like they always do.   

I still do not understand how you can write a background where humanity gets kicked off its home turf by hostile aliens, and yet your entire next game is about bickering between baronies in another star system.  

This time around you build a space station, and the map doubles as a command center to send civilian fleets on jobs, or military fleets around the map for defensive purposes, or just to follow you and  help you kick some *ss.  The more grids your faction has, the more resource extractors you can set up, civilian tasks you can take, and cash you get.  I particularly liked this management system during the slow times when the ship had some traveling to do and there wasn't anything pretty to look at.  

The plot has ship-gates in the sense that if you aren't in a certain ship class or higher (and thus a certain level), you have to bounce around doing whatever it is that you do for credits and exp.  Enter the first bottleneck.  Yes, there are many ways to make money, and yes, you can roleplay as much as you like.  However, taking other people's ships is still the best way of making it.  My complaint here is not that the most dangerous activity in the game gives a better reward than all other activities, it's the painful linearity the game tries to disguise as strategy. 

Your space station will be exactly the same by the end of your game every single time.  All of its upgrades are linear, and while you may research some before others depending on preference, it's still going to wind up the same in every playthrough.  You take territory through force in this game.  That's all that there is, even after the "diplomacy" update.  There are no diplomatic victories, no economic victories, not even vassals, though occasionally a friendly faction may give you ships if you get your *ss beat.  

Which is my problem.  You mine, or salvage, or trade, to get into a bigger ship, and take people's territories by force.   Or, you fight, take people's ships, and take people's territories by force FASTER.   That's all that there is.  And the DLC is exactly the same way, if you were wondering.   Oh, I suppose you can buy space stations for ludicrous amounts of credits to get things like +5% ship building speed, even if you won't own the territory afterwards, even if it's the only thing THERE.  Yay.  

If this all sounds fine to you, good.  I like blowing things up too.  But when I start another playthrough to become a trade baron, or a pirate, or a diplomat, I expect a different experience each time, and it's just not here.  The series has always merely given the appearance of supporting other playstyles, and adding strategic components to this one made it a dreadful tease.   

Still good.  One of the best, actually.  Still recommend it.  But if you want certain types of experiences, they're simply not here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003308890', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 297, 'playtime_forever': 5353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1364, 'last_played': 1706134299}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033350075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1548253341}
review:
Warlords improves upon SPG2 in a positive way. Improved mechanics, improved fleet management and Unique fleet commanders (Warmasters) who can level on their own, improve themselves and upgrade their ships as well as 4X strategy mechanics found in games like Mount & Blade. I do miss a few things, like targeting subsystems and assigning officers to your ship's systems. If the Devs could consider reimplementing those two features, I'd actually rate Warlords 10/10. As it stands, it's a 8/10. An absolutely phenomenal RPG. Freelancer would be so proud

I can't recommend the Starpoint Gemini games enough. SPG1 (A RTS take on space combat), SPG2 and Warlords are a must have for any Freelancer and X fanatic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016548618', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1545470264}
review:
The most awkward controls of any spacefighter I've ever played. By far the most difficult part of combat is simply looking at and targetting the enemy. Adjusting sensitivity doesn't help, it has this strange nonlinear response.

Story/Writing - Horribly boring copypaste space opera. Would have been better with none at all.

Customization - worst ship customizer I've seen, forces you to manually paint with bad tools instead of simply allowing you to select a palette.

The combat mechanics got repetitive and boring within the little time I played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993564239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3090, 'last_played': 1546347980}
review:
When I first heard that this was going to be Mount and Blade: Warband in Space, I was sold.  SOLD.  I've played a lot of M&B as well as Eve Online in the past.  This game feels like an offspring of the two, except offline and a bit simpler, along with the developer's own touch sprinkled in for good measure.

TL;DR: If you like what you read above, this game is worth full price, but it's even more insane if you can buy the whole bundle on sale like I did.

THE GOOD:
The visuals have really improved from the previous titles, to the point that it no longer looks Indie.  You can see a lot of inspiration taken from Eve Online here, which I do not consider as a bad thing.  Unlike Eve Online, however, one can clearly see that the developer wanted more direct control of your personal ship, and this is realized quite nicely in this game.  The tutorial campaign eases you into the game nicely, and then allows you to proceed into its freeroam and empire building.

Also, the map view deserves special mention.  More often than not, I just use the map to travel now.  This is especially useful once you turn off the "pause during map" mode so that, while in flight, I can check the other stuff going on in my empire, like sending civilian fleets to resources I want, upgrade my harvesters and outposts, and more importantly, keep an eye on rival fleet movements and make sure they don't take my outposts without a fight from me.  For a tactical view, this is well-implemented and the devs deserve a pat on the back for it.

THE BAD:
The ship controls is bad.  Sure, Eve Online gets its fair share of criticism for obtuse UI and controls, but you know what?  Once you know what to do, it's all fairly functional and effective.  Here, some of the control schemes details will plague you for the rest of the game, and there is nothing you can do about it.  For example, I tried manual firing, but after the first 30 minutes, I threw that straight out the window and used fire-at-will for the rest of the game.  You don't have time!  You have to target, switch targets, keep your skills cycling, use equipment if necessary, switch energy distribution, and most important of all, you need to stay on top of the boarding mini-game, all the while make sure you are not too far from the ship you are boarding.  Luckily, fire-at-will is very good at what it does, so I am OK with that.

Another UI sore spot is the radial menu.  That, along with skills and equipment layout, and clearly this series was designed with consoles in mind.  Is this a port?  In any case, you may want to re-assign the menu button to something more convenient than the middle mouse button, because you will be using that constantly.

Speaking of re-assigning keys, I changed my max-shields shortcut to Q and my max-weapons shortcut to E.  I have never once needed to roll my ship for any practical reason, but I sure as hell needed to constantly swap my shielding or guns depending on the situation.  But that's not really the gripe.  The gripe comes in the form of the boarding mini-game occupying the same space as the energy distribution triangle.  Therefore, when I am boarding, I can never tell if my commands for max-shields or max-weapons have ever gone through.  Does the game even function that way?  It should, but I don't know if it does, and I'll never know since all I can see is the boarding mini-game.

The last gripe I have is the four ship arcs that pop up during combat.  It's a nice visual touch, and is an important way to keep track of how much shields and energy each of your arcs have left.  The problem is when you get into bigger ships, like dreadnoughts on up, where you are no longer able to see some of these arcs, especially the one in the back.  You can try to angle the second camera view to see a top down, but you still need your mouse to fly your ship, so this isn't practical.    Yes, your small radar thingie tells your shields too, but that's it and it's not quite as useful.  Considering how important these two stats are (shields and energy), there has to be a better way to show this information to the player.

One last thing: Try not to switch back and forth between the Steam overlay.  For some reason, doing so freezes the game for a good 5 to 10 seconds.

THE UGLY:
Many are emo, but Raynor is so emo, he never takes off that emo gas mask that's how emo he is.  Also, why can't I put my companions in a different ship?

author: {'steamid': '76561198054510747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 1709608699}
review:
Game looks great...but, it's not PS4 controller style friendly...[b][i]at all!![/i][/b].


[h1][b]New Review after support from LGM!![/b][/h1] 
After a many e-mails back and forth with the devs we finally got my issue resolved.
If you use a playstation controller with the game, IT WILL WORK!!!!  In the settings you do not want to select the Playstation controller.  Only select the XBOX controller configuration.  Also, you should have a switch on your Logitech controller that says "D" and "X".  Switch it to "X" and your problems are resolved. 
I don't know why I didn't try this before...but bottom line is the devs never gave up on me and that says a lot!
I'm not able to play with no issues and look forward to getting further into the game.
I love the graphics and if I didn't want to play it, I wouldn't have spent so much time trying to get it to work.
I give the game a run now & give a more thorough review after I've played it a few hours!  Stay tuned!!


Thanks, Little Green Men!
developer_response:
Update:

We have tried to reproduce the issue here at our office. Basically, the main issue is the PlayStation layout which we currently don't support. At this time, we only support Xbox layout.

If you can, please play the game with an Xbox controller layout (turn off PlayStation configuration support, as well as Switch Pro configuration support).

-------

Hi Cowski,

We have tried to help you out on the official discussion boards, although you didn't reply to my latest message. 

You didn't clarify what exactly means a "PS4 designed" controller. Does it mean that the controller came with a PlayStation button layout? 

Does it mean that you have tried to emulate the PS4 layout? 

Have you tried playing with controller settings in Steam?

We need more details before we could help you out with the issue.

Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198340668235', 'num_games_owned': 1306, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1559060808}
review:
[quote=2P] 加入[url=http://firefly.17173.com/]2P[/url]，和我们一起用热爱点亮游戏之光[/quote]

[h1]操作：[/h1]
之所以先说这方面，是因为我实在忍不了了。
举个栗子：开头时我们要击退敌机来保护战舰。
一开始，我想自己操控机炮来射击敌机，5分钟后，我放弃了，开了自动射击。
如果你能将敌机一直留在屏幕内，那很好。
而一旦你不能将敌机留在屏幕内，那么你可能接下来30s都找不到那架敌机了。
因为游戏中的太空几乎没有任何明显的标志物，再加上太空是个立体空间，顺着敌人标志转动视角更多时候会把自己变成一个[i]大陀螺[/i]。
这里[b]WASD移动视角[/b]的操作有很大一部分功劳。我是不明白开发商为什么一定要选择WASD移动视角，不选择跟随鼠标移动视角。别跟我说按空格可以切换移动模式，鼠标移动的时候WASD移动视角同样有效！

[h1]画面：[/h1]
画面也让人不敢恭维，感觉是14、15年的画面。
不要相信商店页面的视频，[i][b]不存在的[/b][/i]。
关键是就这种画面还要求GTX470？R6S 最低配置GTX460的画面了解下？
[引用图片]//i.17173cdn.com/lkyr0a/YWxqaGBf/2p/20181215/vzsYQRbmEyoDrxp.jpg

[h1]翻译：[/h1]
创意工坊的汉化貌似失效了。
这游戏的官方中文质量也堪忧。
具体的图我没截到，但整体还是给人非常不舒服的感觉：
时而中文时而英文的NPC名称，默认主角是中文人名但是玩家自己只能输入英文······
开头教学时甚至如何操作都翻译不清。

[h1]其他：[/h1]
这游戏难道真的一无是处吗？
如其他评论说的，当然有。
太空策略模拟游戏有群星，太空roguelike游戏有永恒空间，（伪）太空MOBA有无畏战舰。
[spoiler]还有终极太空游戏[/spoiler][b][spoiler]EVE[/spoiler][/b]
它则加入了策略元素，模拟元素，角色扮演元素。
它也为玩家提供了丰富的选择。
这些都非常好，极大的拓宽了自由度。
但我还是想说，我是冲着星战来的，整那么多花里胡哨的干嘛？
我想玩策略模拟我不会去玩群星咩？
=====
[h1]6\10[/h1]

最后，还是感谢这个游戏，他成功让我想起了我多年未碰的[b][i]无人深空[/i][/b]，我要去探索18亿亿颗星球了，告辞。

更多游戏推荐请关注[url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/17173firefly]2P[/url]以及[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31716674]17173萤火虫鉴赏家[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198151853139', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 7297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1310, 'last_played': 1573265752}
review:
Just picked up SGW, and have been playing it completely in freeform mode.  It's easily the most addictive space themed game I've played in ages.  It actually plays quite a bit like a single player MMORPG.  The amount of freedom, coupled with the ease of exploring the more detailed aspects of gameplay, are unparalleled here.  

You have a customizable character, ship, base, and everything from abilities, to perks, to research and base building, along with an evolving world, and the freedom to live in it as you please.  And all of these possibilities blend together more smoothly than I think I've ever experienced.

Very slick, and easy to grasp.  My only regret is that I waited so long to pull the trigger on this one.  I can't wait to get back to it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198311426141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1544703240}
review:
[quote] 加入[url=https://www.2p.com/#Steam]2P萤火虫[/url]，和我们一起用热爱点亮游戏之光[/quote]
游戏有简体中文算是良心的但有些地方没有汉化

游戏UI比较简陋没太多的东西也没有武器损毁系统，舰船系统也是简陋本来职业就少还加上4个不能可选技能导致战斗比较无聊。

背景过于单一，场景比较黑暗。

舰船武器配置过于单调，感觉无畏舰就像是个大号炮艇，大型舰船没有主力武器，升级船只就像是大号炮舰乱斗。那群星举例子，里面的大号舰船可以使用更高级的舰炮。而且玩法和群星类似，好像是把第三人称改成第一人称，把领袖角度改成跑任务的军阀。

由于画面太过粗糙，太长时间容易头晕。

总体来说这款游戏除了背景能吸引我好像就没有别的能把我留住了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198054049793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1544691535}
review:
評価が分かれていたので買うのをためらっていたが、セールになっていたのでこの機会に商品を購入した。
そして返品予定。
とてもじゃないがやってられない。

長くなるので、簡単に理由を書くと「セーブデータ（オート、手動どちらも）をロードしてもバグが起こって進行不可能になる」という内容があるため。

長文嫌いな人はここだけ読めばおｋ。
愚痴みたいな評価を見たいって暇人は読めばおｋ。


触りだけしかやっていないが、ストーリーでのチュートリアルでの無さとか色々指摘するところはあるかもしれない。
が、宇宙艦船スキーなお方や手軽に艦隊戦を楽しみたい。って方にはいいのかもしれない。

実際、ぱっと触った感じはＥＶＥオンラインを超縮小したオフラインモードのようなものと、スマホアプリのＧＯＦ２の超拡張版のようなものを足して割ったものなんだなぁ、と思ったし個人的には面白いと思った。

所謂フリーモード的なのものでは、（陣営のようなものは固定されるが）初めから戦艦クラスを操作できたりするし、いきなり艦隊も組める（ここは事前にどういうものかをやっておかないと運営が大変だが）ので、初めから艦隊組んで提督気分も味わえる。

戦闘もせず、延々と鉱石を掘ったり貿易をしてもいい。
フリーミッションをこなしてもいい。
（ここは先に挙げたスマホアプリみたいなものだなと感じた）

実際、上記２つのゲームはドはまりしたので、このゲームもスルメのように楽しめると思っていた。

問題は１時間３０分ほどで一旦区切りでゲームをやめ、また再開しようとした時に起こった。

自分は心配性なので、いくつもセーブデータを作れる場合、いろんなタイミングでセーブをする。
ミッションを受ける前。アイテムを買う前、売る前、etc...
そして、その間にやったどのデータをロードしても、開始直後に

「ミッションエリアに戻ってください」の警告とともに２０秒のカウントダウン。
カウントが終了するとミッション頑張ろうね的な画面の後にタイトル画面へ。

まだ序盤だから最初からやればいいと言えばそうなんだろう。
しかし、またこのバグのような何かが起こるとしたら怖くてやりこむ気にもなれない。
かといってスナック菓子のように簡単に最初からやって１時間で堪能できるものかといわれたらそうでもない。
その中間の、適当にある程度やりこみ、飽きたらまた最初から。もしくはしばらく離れてまた思い出したときにやる。
このゲームはそういうものなんだと思う。
もちろんがっつりやってもいいだろう。
しかし、そのたびにこういったバグが起こるとすれば、とてもじゃないが遊ぶ期にはならないしお勧めはできない。

せっかく貯めたお金で買った船や用意した艦隊があると仮定してほしい。
一息入れるためにセーブをして休憩をしよう。
しばらくしてさあと意気込んでゲームをスタートする。

「ミッションエリアに戻ってください」

この光景が一瞬で浮かんだ。
よって最初の結論に行きつく。

ちなみにＭＯＤ等といった類は入れてないし、オートセーブでもこういった具合だ。




長くなりましたがこれ以上はただの愚痴になりますのでここまでとし、、以上の理由につきまして、個人的にはこの製品をお勧めできないという報告をさせていただきます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198201748690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1608888211}

review:

 界面，UI界面中规中矩，设置改键的时候，我重置按键会把其他的设置也重置了，这得改改，菜单中文界面翻译有待提升。
 优化，我配置是没问题的，但是有时候还是会稍微掉帧。跃迁到了目的地后黑了2秒才加载出来，吓我一跳。
 游戏性，带领舰队打架很爽啊…欺负无畏的时候很有意思，地图很大有木有？！后期暗爽中…风景还是很不错的。
不过操作确实是比较迷的，不过习惯了就好。

author: {'steamid': '76561198413266831', 'num_games_owned': 15548, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1544370066}
review:
[quote] 加入[url=https://www.2p.com/]2P萤火虫[/url]，和我们一起用热爱点亮游戏之光[/quote]

双子星座军阀，双子系列最新一作，一款可以一玩的太空战略类游戏。

在游戏中，你的身份是一名劫后余生的指挥官，利用这手中有限的资源，通过一步步的积累，逐渐建立属于自己的舰队，打造属于自己的宇宙帝国。

游戏的玩法极为丰富，在游戏中，你既要操纵飞船与敌人战斗，又要学会经营，一步步打造属于你的宇宙帝国。同时，你还可以培养你所扮演的指挥官（游戏具有加点和天赋树系统）。虽然操作起来有点复杂繁琐，但只要耐心地摸索一段时间，弄懂玩法对玩家来说是完全没问题的。游戏有着还不错的新手引导系统，最重要的是，官方简中比较完善。

游戏的操作手感不怎么好，这可能会劝退一部分玩家，但这无需太担心，游戏中有着自动导航和自动开火系统，较好的弥补了操作手感欠佳这一缺点，但是还是希望制作组能对此有所改进。

总而言之，对喜欢太空战略类游戏的玩家来说，这仍是一个可以一玩的游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198298214441', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 11207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3171, 'last_played': 1697518204}
review:
Great game, absolutely love, it,... except for the controls.  God help me, how is a game that is made this great, and has the steam controller in mind, so horrible to actually play with the controller?

I'll write a longer review about the gameplay and all later, but right now, I just needed to say this, cause for me the controls are completely and utterly broken.  Movement sticks, making me go in circles randomly, the camera is slow and clumsy, sometimes input doesn't work at all.  The camera finally started following targets which at first helped, but then I realized for the life me, I couldn't stop tracking them, and since I couldn't regain control of the camera, I couldn't interact with other ships until the tracked target was gone.

There doesn't seem to be any options to adjust controller inputs, or sensitivities, and modifying the steam controller through the overlay just breaks the controls.  Using their own controller config, the controls work, but barely, and if I change anything, like switching a trigger to the actual right or left trigger input, the game doesn't respond to it anymore.  Speaking of, the triggers only react to the full button press, no anolog.  I tried full gamepad preset, and nothing at all worked, and all this being said for a game that is supposed to have full controller support.  Really, if there's no analog control, then there's definitly not full controller input.  It's the primary advantage of using a gamepad at all, the joysticks and triggers.

It's just beyond me how a game this great, has so much to offer, but they don't give you reliable, decent controller input, and options to adjust the controls to what you're comfortable with.  I don't know how even the developers play this game, but apperantly they want you to only be able to play it how they would.

Maybe I'm missing something, hopefully I am, and someone can tell me how to fix the many issues I have with this game.  Again, great game, but having my ship stand still when I'm trying to turn, or I nudge the stick and it starts spinning, and doesn't stop, or being obssessed with another ship like nothing else matters, even when I'm getting shot or my allies are dying, or just tring to navigate the menue like I'm on skates, and half the time can't stop where I want to.......

Hours in, I love the ships, the charactors, the potential, I see myself playing this for a really long time, but it's a love/hate relationship here.  I love it, but sometimes I wish the game had a throat so I could strangle it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212755084', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1548516231}
review:
[quote] 加入[url=https://www.2p.com/]2P萤火虫[/url]，和我们一起用热爱点亮游戏之光[/quote]
双子星座军阀是一款集策略类、模拟经营和角色扮演于一身的游戏演。玩家在这个虚拟的宇宙世界中自由的探险，或者发展人类殖民地，或者建造空间站与贸易路线，打造自己的商业帝国，甚至也可以成为星际绿林或者征服者。

这款游戏感觉还是不错的，比较适合那种能够耐得住寂寞和孤独的人玩的，因为双子星座是一款慢节奏的游戏，特别是前期，两点之间经常是枯燥的跑上四五分钟，想要跑星球更是十分钟都不够。

双子星座军阀支持中文简体，它有完整的剧情和语音支持，也支持添加mod。这款游戏和以前发售的自由枪骑兵还有最近发售的X4：基石都很相像，建议在游玩之前先做个攻略，因为这类型的游戏操作很复杂。

总结：
这是一款游戏内容很丰富的游戏，也是我非常喜欢的类型，虽然游戏还有很多的bug，但是可玩性也是非常高的。
更多游戏推荐请关注[url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/17173firefly]2P萤火虫[/url]以及[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31716674]2P萤火虫鉴赏家[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198426249193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1505, 'last_played': 1608564797}
review:
汉化版会卡剧情，换英文版再回来就好了，前5级适应阶段的任务不应该卡住。
游戏元素很丰富，很好玩，一人称星际游戏是一种很特别的体验。
操控很蹩脚，鼠标有延迟，至少左键松转向停才对。鼠标操控镜头最舒服，不过下面那个快捷停泊快捷取却没有快捷键，和鼠标操控冲突...
总的来说，内容很不错，基础操作很别扭。

author: {'steamid': '76561198122721506', 'num_games_owned': 1639, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1544070169}
review:
[h1]向日葵游戏评分：8分（1-10）[/h1]

《双子星系军阀》是一款加入了4x元素的太空题材角色扮演游戏，玩家从驾驶一艘战舰的指挥官开始，一步步建立起庞大的势力。

在游戏初期，玩家的体验和大部分太空类游戏相似。玩家一方面可以选择完成主线剧情，执行任务，另一方面也能接取自由职业任务，亦或者是倒卖货物，获得资金来改装自己的战舰。但是，这款游戏里的内容并不局限于此，因为随着剧情的推进，玩家还能掌控领土、建设建筑以及还其他势力进行交涉，这也是这个游戏的4x元素所在，后期内容会更加地丰富多彩。
 
这款游戏的教程十分详细，新手能学到自动驾驶、跟随、自动开火等十分实用的功能，降低了操作的难度。但战斗过程中，敌人过于灵活，导致虽然能靠自动开火或小弟获得胜利，但体验并不是很好（比如转向一分钟才在镜头中锁定敌人）。

另外，这款游戏的开发者积极地回复和解决问题，再加上本身游戏元素众多，可玩性强，值得大家尝试。
 
[h1]欢迎大家关注我们的鉴赏家：http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28763059[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198009405286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1543961986}
review:
This mostly appears to be a travelling through the empty dead wastes of space simulator, in real time.

I was promised custom ship designs and fleet combat, what i got was an option to buy a small range of ships with no details save their weight class and a meaningless swarm of red and yellow dots passing by my rediculous chase cam view from what is supposed to be a dreadnaught or similar which flies basically like a tie fighter, but with none of the thrills.

The opening to the story was the most trite recycled off the shelf garbage possible, literally every story you ever heard a 5 year old mumbling is more engaging than this.

There might be content that is worthwhile here somewhere but i wasnt about to risk my refund window timing out to find it.

Pure garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970948137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1543068198}
review:
An easy to get into game, easily played. Loved the game atmosphere and the more arcade feel and battle system compared to titles like Elite Dangerous or the X series.

What I loved most was the seemless universe. No need for fancy jumpgates, you can just fly to everywhere. What I disliked most was the way how the player and fleet are seperate, instead of the player being able to trade themselves for metal or gas, only constructed structures or civ. fleets could gather them... then why am I trading metal and gas wares with my HQ?

Pros: 
- open and seemless universe, 
- easy trade, 
- quick ship switching and continuing, 
- easy fleet management <3, 
- good map
Cons: 
 - player and the fleets are seperate, including their resources and ships.. (except money) why?

author: {'steamid': '76561198048124522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3159, 'last_played': 1541878340}
review: Nie wiem jakim sposobem ta gra ma tyle pozytywnych recenzji. Jestem fanem wszelkich strategii i z czystym sercem moge wam wszystkim odradzic zakupu tej gry.  X3 ktora wyszla lata temu bije Starpoint Gemini Warlords pod kazdym wzgledem. Dlugo by wymieniac minusy tej gry wiec skupie sie na glownych niedociagnieciach. Produkcja malych i srednich statkow jest bezsensowna z powodu braku balansu typow broni (Ciezka bron powinna byc uzyteczna na ciezkie pancerniki ale malo uzyteczna w walce z lekkimi statkami) a w zamian jeden ciezki statek potrafi wyciac cala flote srednich i lekkich wrogow. Do tego mozna dorzucic kiepskie ustawienia kamery(zdarza sie ze latajac niektorymi jednostkami nie widac pola walki bo statek zaslania caly ekran), niejasne opisy techmologii(opcja opracowania technologii ktore nie maja opisu do czego w ogole sluza), liniowa nudna fabula (gameplay typu zrob jedna flote samych ciezkich statkow i lataj nia po calej mapie przejmujac sekror za sektorem w nudnej liniowej walce), kiepska mechanika walki (zerowa satysfakcja z walk), brak sensownej dyplomacji z innymi frakcjami(bez komentarza bo doslonie rece opadaja) i wiele innych.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031940168', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1543579562}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053278849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 5058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4919, 'last_played': 1612246592}
review:
This is a good game.  I played it in Early Access after seeing a video of it, and it looked cool.  It was kind of fun but unfinished, so I bought Starpoint Gemini 2 (the predecessor) and played that instead.  I liked that game but there was not enough to do.  (But I paid so little for it on sale, I am not complaining.)

I came back to Warlords after they finished it and was not disappointed.  The ability to take territory added a strategic element that SG2 lacked, and I enjoyed it immensely.  In truth I never finished conquering a whole map; it takes a very long time to actually conquer an enemy planet, and I had taken most of the map sectors so victory was inevitable.  But it was a long and challenging war.

In some ways this game is like a 4X game, except for you can take a ship out and be part of the action, conducting exploration, espionage, resource gathering, or leading fleets to victory.  You can capture ships to use in your fleets or scrap them for resources.  You can salvage the wrecks of battles.

Even though the mechanics were similar to the preceding games, the war and conquest element makes battles feel like they mean something, and I found it more engaging than SG2.

I got a good 80 hours out of the game, and would play it again in the future.  Well worth it.

review:
Какой то обрубок от оригинальной Starpoint Gemini......я прошел сюжет, и он короткий, скучный, способов прохождения - 1, кораблей мало, ИИ слабый, мир пустой и скучный, без всякой ненависти говорю, эта игра должна стоить в половину стоимости первой части, ровно по её возможностям...

p.s я ждал эту игру, я закоренелый пират и купил эту сюжетку в надежде на красоту как в 1 части...а что в итоге? я у разбитого корыта.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006530747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 13617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9466, 'last_played': 1586897276}
review:
My overall verdict is that this is an enjoyable game for those who wanted a simplified version of their previous iterations in the franchise. I will give it a conditional recommendation at this time: Only buy it on discount!

Here are my deciding factors. DLC comments are below and an overall conclusion.

Pro:
 - Decent graphics and sound
 - The controls have more shortcuts to the commonly used actions
 - The concept of greater control over your faction
 - Interesting ship models (visually) and faction lore (if you do not mind reading)
 - The English voice acting has improved a lot since SPG 1
 - The Warmasters actually have a bit of personality in the campaign (though I hoped for more dialogue with them)

Con:
 - The AI is absolutely terrible... For both you and the enemy.
 - The story was average and had absolutely no player choices that alter it (even Endpoint choices don't change anything)
 - Several factions were missing ship classes so they felt unbalanced in composition
 - The DLC only adds ONE campaign to the actual story, the rest are factions for the conquest mode. (No plot or missions, just conquer everyone at your leisure)
 - The ships were unbalanced toward the heavier classes making anything below Cruiser useless by midgame
 - By late game it becomes rather grind oriented and repetative gameplay

The AI and a few glitches make replayability rather unsatisfying and the DLC is mostly a waste of time. The Endpoint DLC offers a campaign and Titans DLC gives you access to the ships and a VERY short eplilogue to the first campaign. The others are basically fluff and start conditions with no plot or missions associated. A couple offer challenge scenarios.

My conclusion is that it was an enjoyable game if you are just looking to play through a campaign and maybe mess around with the Freelance missions a bit. Buy it at discount (especially if you want the DLC) but not full price and know what you are getting before you decide to buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002252866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 526, 'playtime_forever': 3146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3146, 'last_played': 1541944959}
review:
[h1] 広大なマップを亜光速飛行でじっくり流すスペースコンバットシム [/h1]

宇宙戦闘艦の艦長として、さまざまなミッションをこなしつつマップを探索するという基本は、これまでのシリーズ作品と同じ。

最初は戦闘機に毛が生えたような小舟からスタートし、お金を貯めつつコルベット、フリゲート、ドレッドノートと乗り換えていくのが楽しい。

いろんな理由でジャンプ航法が不便な世界なので、序盤は亜光速ドライブでじわじわ移動するのを、じーっと眺めるゲームだったりする。

ストーリーモードは20弱あるキャンペーンミッションの他に、破壊工作、賞金首の追跡、貿易、採掘などの自動生成ミッションがあり、バリエーションはなかなかに豊富。
ただし稼ぎの手段としては、敵艦をアボルダージュで分捕って売り払うのが最短なので、ミッションでの稼ぎは序盤に限られることだろう。

またちょっとした陣取り、マネジメント要素が追加されており、敵のステーションを攻略してリソースポイントを抑え、集めたリソースで研究開発や僚艦の生産を行うことが可能となっている。
とはいえ安価なガンシップやコルベットは、ちょっとビームを照射されただけで蒸発するので、盾代わりの主力艦を上限いっぱいまで作ればそれで良いといったところ。

いちおう外交要素もあるが、あまりシビアなアルゴリズムは組まれていないようで、たまに前線のステーションが敵の襲撃を受ける程度。
近隣勢力から、いきなり宣戦布告されるといったこともなかった。

個人的には、もう少し武装やスキルにバリエーションが欲しいし、キャンペーン後半で膨大なリソースを集めさせられるのにも閉口した。
まあ、面白いゲームであることに間違いはないので、腰を据えて遊ぶ余裕があるならばオススメ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198065472420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1133, 'last_played': 1541480886}
review:
It's really hard for me to write a review about this game because I feel like I haven't given it enough of a chance, but at the same time it really hasn't made me want to.

On the one hand, I feel bad for not giving this game more of a chance because it's soooo close to what I wanted it to be that it feel like a betrayal. What I really wanted to play was Freelancer, but that's not possible anymore, and nothing out there quite feel [i]right[/i], if that makes sense. Eve is too unforgiving and you need to devote your life to it to get good, Elite Dangerous is as wide as an ocean and as deep as a puddle, and the X games.... well... you know. But THIS game had promise, and it's predecessor was so full of potential that I thought there was no WAY they could get it wrong with the sequel. And they came so very, very close. It's beautiful, the soundtrack is passable, and they give you a whole solar system to explore, and MAN does it feel big.

But here's where it starts to fall apart for me. I looked at the classes when I was building my character and the Sharpshooter really jumped out at me, so I chose that one. I play through the tutorial and get into the real game proper, which is when I start to notice that enemies pretty much always swarm and dogpile you, and just orbit you until you're dead. Sublight turns off your guns, so constantly running to put distance between you and your target is silly, so the SS's Passive skill goes to waste, as does the primary damage dealer which also relies on you being as far from your target as possible. So I replay as the Vanguard, surely a class that gets power from being close to its enemies will dominate in this game, right? Wrong. I spent the first four hours wondering what I was doing wrong, reading what little community discussion there is that isn't over a year old and out of date. But I was watching my target's health NOT MOVE when I hit from point blank range with my Shotgun ability, it was useless. So I upgrade my weapons once I have the cash for it and, lo and behold, Shotgun damage is tied to light weapon damage. Would've been f*cking nice to know. So then I go out and that's when I notice that all the enemies arbitrarily gain tons of hitpoints every time you level up, no matter what you're flying. It's then at this point that you realize just how annoying slowly you gain Materials, on a fixed timer based on real world time, and good luck trying to help it along: what few tasks you can do to provide Materials, Gas, and Ore give such tiny piddly ammounts that they might as well have not included them at all.

More than anything, I believe that a lack of balancing is what killed this game for me, and I'm just sad that there isn't a refund based on having no fun at all over the entire time you owned the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004815337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1912, 'last_played': 1541280031}
review:
A dencent enough game if bought at a lower than full price. Clunky in many ways (controlls mostly) and at times just a glorified clicker game pretending to be a strategy. Still went through the capaing and had some fun with the story. As soon as that ended I didn't find the game-loop it self compelling enough to participate in the freeroam.
If you want a bit of space shooty gameplay with minimalist, mmo-esque mechanics and quite a bit of upgrades (which are always fun) this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171488547', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1526646957}
review:
Good game, just not an X-game. Unfortunately...
It does a lot of things right, navigation from the Star-map and ship-management through the map is brilliant. But the most important part for me, flying spaceships, does not feel as good as in X3 Albion Prelude. (with Cockpit mods)

Graphics are not that good to justify the frame-drops I experience on my GTX970 with 16gb ram.
Overall, if you got tired of X3 give Starpoint Gemini a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065269702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3882, 'last_played': 1539589407}
review:
This is a wonderful mix of RTS and space sim. The devs did an outstanding job of addressing some of the deficiencies of Starpoint Gemini II, and the galaxy feels so much more alive. The comm chatter greatly improves the experience and the NPC factions actually take over and lose different territories. It's neat to have some animations when landing on planets, and much of the game feels similar to Freelancer outside of the RTS additions. 

The game also offers:
-a fun dialogue system that is meaningfully affected by which skills you invest in on your skill tree. Your skill selections can also affect the story missions.
-more strategy in the new boarding mechanics since you can make a number of choices on what your troops do, whether it's stealing cargo, disabling ship systems, or completely capturing the ship. plus, you can now sell captured ships w/o towing back to a base
-many mission options for a fleet of civilian ships, including trading resources to NPC shipyards to help you build fleets
-discoverable heros that you can seek out and recruit to join your cause. each with interesting dialogue, backstories, and side quests. 
-an incredibly detailed way to add custom paint jobs to your ship
-good music in different regions of the galaxy that help set the mood.

minor complaints are that the mouse feedback can take some getting used to (feels less precise than the previous game, and more "floaty"). And the resource gathering can feel a bit imbalanced with ore and gas seeming alot more plentiful than 'materials', which can slow down shipbuilding. 

Overall, the game gives a great return on investment in entertainment value. I look forward to trying the expansions.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992953012', 'num_games_owned': 1486, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2898, 'last_played': 1561808520}
review:
Sci-fi "third person" space game with a bit of management:

+ quite simple space game which doesn't go deep, low learning curve
+ quite good combat
+ a bit of a RPG-system, there are 3 classes with different skills, you can lvl up and 
+ conquering stations

- 2 dimensional map, this game is 3 dimensional...but all in all the map is 2D
- not very complex game
- being trader doesn't really yield much money, being asteroid "miner" even less

8.1 out of 10 points

author: {'steamid': '76561198351625481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2429, 'last_played': 1595095089}
review:
It's an ok game, it has room for improvement, the mods available have made it worth playing for me. Unfortunatly the voice acting, story and dialougue leave a lot to be desired. The graphics need some work in certain areas, some planets look terrible and when ships get destroyed they basically just turn black and I think it looks weird, unlike some other similar games I have were the ships actually brake apart and some pieces blow up. The amount of ships you are allowed to have are to low and most ally NPC's can't defend  your territory properly, unless they destroy more than half of their fleet. The controls are also kinda complicated to get used to. That aside, I enjoyed some of the fights and the game has some cool mechanics, it's has a lot of potential. 

I haven't found any bugs so far, and the game can be entertaining, I recommend buying it at a discount.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197995716899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 4444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4444, 'last_played': 1540120666}
review:
ライトな感じで遊べるスペースシム
宇宙空間なのに前進しかできなかったり（移動中に回頭して引き撃ちとか出来ない）、
追従させてる味方艦が、サブライト移動中に進路塞ぐアクロバティックな機動で突撃してきて進路ずれたり、
部位ダメージとか無いから武器だけ破壊して安全に拿捕とか出来ないんで、下手に艦隊引き連れてる状態で敵艦拿捕しようとすると味方のコルベットやらガンシップやらがどんどん壊されたりと眉を顰めたくなる点もあるけど、
まぁクレジットはめっちゃ楽に稼げるし、一部を除いて難易度ノーマルなら単艦で行動するのが一番楽だからそもそも艦隊は基本引き連れないしでそこまで気にせずプレイできると思う

ただ一点これだけは無いわと思ったのが消失バグ
他のレビューにもあったけど、突如アイテムやガレージ内の船が消える。一切予測はできないし、アイテムの場合は全てのセーブデータに波及するから発生したら復旧もできない。
ガレージは流石に他のセーブデータは無事だったけど、それでもやはりショックではある。
自分の場合はアイテム消失が起きたのはプロキシマ建造クエ前の、船を乗り換えさせられて偵察するクエの後
ガレージ内消失が起きたのはメインクエスト封印part2の最中で、セーブデータも結構前のしかなかったから戻すのはアレだったけど、乗ってたのがプロスペリティだったおかげですぐクレジット貯めれるからそのまま進めれた
でもそうじゃなかったら多分アンインストールしてた

ちなみに他のレビューに開発からのコメントで消失はMODの影響じゃないかってあったけど、自分はバンドルで買ったからDLC全部入りで、MODは一切導入していないバニラでプレイしてる

X3が難しくて積んでた自分にはちょうどいい難易度です
自動操縦でデブリにぶつかっても死なないし（ただし惑星にぶつかり続けたら死ぬ）
戦闘は防御と火力至上主義で機動性はそれほど重要じゃない感じ
上位艦船と下位艦船でそれほどサイズは変わらないし
ガンシップやコルベットで動きまくっても戦艦に死角がなく敵の照準が正確で弾速が早すぎて絶対当たる
ただ単純に自分のゲームプレイアビリティが悪いのかもしれんが（X3積んだし）
個人技量よりも金と資源集めて戦艦やドレットノートそろえて物量でごり押しするゲームですロマンも糞もない
この辺のゲームバランスをもうちょっとどうにかなんなかったのかと（まああくまでストラテジーだし期待する方が馬鹿か）
（例えばコルベットで戦艦の砲射角が取れない所に急接近して張り付きつつ一方的に攻撃するなど）
エリートデンジャラスのような熱いスペースコンバットシムは期待しないほうがいい
それでも宇宙物として入門用に人にお勧めできます
何故ならエリートデンジャラスと違ってマニュアルもゲーム本編も完全日本語化されて遊ぶのに支障がないからです
エリートデンジャラスと違って←ここ大事

author: {'steamid': '76561198000216935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1576, 'last_played': 1564930193}
review:
TL;DR - I highly recommend this game. Fun to play! No space legs!

Starpoint Gemini Warlords is a suberb space simulation sandbox game. You can do just about anything from pirating to smuggling, trading, capturing ships, buy space stations... woot? Yeah. Buy space stations!

Invest in your character like an RPG game. Then fight with other NPC like an action game, while dominating fleets under your command conquer space. Like a strategy game! It is like a 4x with space-simulation. Terrible downside though, space legs are nowhere to be found.

The ships are fun to fly and the combat is also enticing. Got that pew pew itch? This game delivers. You can land on stations and planets, too, which is also great. You have access to choosing classes, perks and a skill system that improve the gameplay with refreshing tactical decisions.

The mission system is varied and offers just about any kind of mission you may like. The campaign is fun to play - it is like a lengthy tutorial though, but it helps you get to know the game a bit more. Plus, you get to develop a history of your own and continue as you wish.

I've picked up this game because, for a fan of the genre that I am, it is like a mix of space simulation and tactical goodness, with a fun twist!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040829517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1539718209}
review:
I currently have 191 hours in Starpoint Gemini 2, so I was really looking forward for this game. Refunded it after 50 minutes.
I tried to like it. I had all the patience in the world with the boring, late 90s style cinematics in the previous game only to find out somehow it got worse here, with the same long, cliche sci fi conversations that now require me to click on continue instead of adding a much needed skip button.
I tried to get used to the interface which now had nice keyboard shortcut for the most used commands but for some reason they don't have static positions in the option wheel and I have to look for depending on what options the game decides are available for me. 
I liked how now the star chart didn't paused the game but it also had all the useful information stripped from the previous game. 
I also liked how now it has an animation when docking to a station but why is all the beautiful art for each weapon and device gone, replaced by a generic icon and a text description?
I simply don't understand how such a good game turned into this sequel. And for some reason the graphics look worse than the previous game. 

I'm so disappointed it's not even fun to write a review to bash this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164166557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1539803550}
review: It's pretty rare for me to stumble upon a space game that I truly enjoy, and this is one of those times. SGW is a massive game, with a gigantic map, loads of ships, weapons, research trees, you name it! The graphics are excellent, the story is pretty good so far, and the voice acting isn't awful {not the best I've ever heard, but pretty decent}. One of the highlights for me is the ability to create and command fleets of ships to fight at your side, or send some civilain ships to perfoprm tasks that, if successful, will net you some nice resources. There are lots of structures in the game that you can conquer and upgrade to ensure residual currency. I haven't even gotten into most of the DLC yet and I'm already blown away by how much you can do! A small gripe I have in regards to this game are the repetitive quests in the story mode. A lot of them so far have been pretty simple: fly here, talk to somebody, blow up some ships that magically arrive, fly back to HQ. There is some variety to the quests, but you'll see this pattern emerge pretty quickly. The HUD when you're in battle first seems a bit daunting, but its easy to familiarize yourself with it pretty fast and once you do, you'll grow to love it. Overall this is becoming one of my favorite games, and I can see myself pouring hundreds of hours into it in the coming months. I HIGHLY suggest picking this up with all the DLC now while its on sale, you won't be disappointed, especially if you're a fan of space RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102656821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3990, 'last_played': 1691161698}
review:
ゲーム自体はかなりライトな宇宙RPGでストラテジー要素はおまけ程度です。
Xシリーズ等は複雑すぎて敷居が高すぎるという方にはお勧めです。


プレイヤースキルが必要とされるシミュレータ系と違い、
主人公のレベルと装備（船）が重要となってくるRPGなので、
あまり操作はうまくないけど宇宙物が好き、という方にもお勧めです。

あと、ゲームには直接関係ありませんが開発元の対応がとても良いのが印象的です。
developer_response:
LGMゲームズ開発部のジェリコ・コスです。
レビューのご投稿ありがとうございました。
プレイ中の不具合はおそらく、ご利用になっている「MOD」が原因で起きた
不具合と思われます。
残念ながら弊社開発部は、Steamワークショップに掲載されるMODに
関わることはできないのですが、
もしご希望でしたら不具合の原因を調査いたします。
お手数ですが、Logファイル（Log.txt）と、
不具合が生じたセーブファイルを
以下のメールアドレスにお送りいただけますか。（日本語可です）
mail: customersupport@starpointgemini.com

Logファイル（Log.txt）は、
ライブラリにあるStarpoint Gemini Warlordsを右クリック→
プロパティ→ローカルファイル→ローカルファイルを閲覧→
フォルダ内にLog（Log.txt）と書かれたテキストファイルがあります。

セーブファイルも同様に、プロパティ→ローカルファイル→
ローカルファイルを閲覧→「Saves」フォルダー内にあります。

どうぞよろしくお願いいたします。

review: Came back after a long abscence, last online during Early Access. The game has improved dramatically since that time, especially with the addition of the DLCs which greatly flesh out the game. Far more enjoyable than x3 or even Elite:Dangerous imo; there is never a shortage of things to do. Be aware it's not the deepest game in the simulation department; if you want realistic flight controls with complicated takeoff and landing proceedures this game will disappoint. But if you are okay with arcade-like dogfights, like to have some fleet combat or want to go nuts in a supercap, this is your game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011224256', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3016, 'last_played': 1539049457}
review:
I don't know why people call this "Mount and Blade" in  space, because those people have obviously never played Mount and Blade. Sure, you can control some space ship fleets, but you can only order them to "go here", "attack this", "use this warp gate" through the map. Yes, you have to open the map and click on the fleet to order it to do anything. Which, as you can imagine, is a pain in the ass during a battle. You can't control them any other way. They just float around you and that's it. If you leave the battle they'll follow you and that is about all of the control you get over your fleets. 

You're also really limited in the size of the fleets you can build. You make like 5 dreadnaughts and 8 cruisers and you'll max out your fleet cap. But don't worry, the enemy will NEVER declare war on you. A faction might try to retake a station that you just captured, but that is it. They won't besiege your capital planet or station. So at no point are you in any real jeopardy.

And the factions barely fight with each other. They sometimes invade pirate territories, but you won't have those epic Mount and Blade wars were roving armies battle each other across the map pillaging villages, besieging cities and castles, and even sometimes destroying an entire kingdom.

So, this is definitely NOT like Mount and Blade where you have to backstab your way up to be king and in just one battle can lose your entire kingdom, your highly trained troops, and you're back to starting from scratch. And for all of the hype about "warmasters" you only get four. Yeah, just four npcs who couldn't lead an attack even if the enemy ships were made out of paper mache. Well, maybe they could, but they end up losing so many damn ships on your side that it doesn't seem worthwhile to let them do anything on their own.

Frankly, besides the fleet battles, there isn't a lot to do. You can fly around doing one off freelancer missions, but every faction feels the same. The real focus is to build your station and fleet and just conquer the poor defenseless lemmings of the Gemini system. It's like beating up on mentally handicapped people in wheelchairs who can't defend themselves, so, yeah, it gets old pretty fast. That is, unless you enjoy beating up people who can't fight back to save themselves. If you do, then this is the game for you! Because these poor bastards are completely helpless. Evenly matched fleet battles quickly turn into lopsided massacres. Heck, even being completely outnumbered you'll still win every time. There is no challenge at all. Once again, unlike Mount and Blade where I've lost hours of work because some damn peasant hit me with a lucky arrow. Stupid peasant.

The scenery looks pretty though and the astroids are neat, but this game just lacks depth. The campaign is really lame. I still don't get what is up with the guy in the gas mask with glowing red Terminator eyes, but whatever. I'm done with this game. It just feels too bare bones.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986186549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1539097249}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027065253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2070, 'last_played': 1543341096}
review:
A modern day Freelancer, designed by the best devs in the business! It's not perfect, not quite. But it's still the best free roam space sim on the market (Ok yes there is the X series, but in my opinion, those are not as easily to pick up and play as Starpoint). Not played any of the DLC  so can't comment on that. I own both versions, this and the console version, both look incredible, and the update for the Xbox One X can't come quick enough. 

Bravo LGM!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972146100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 1846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1846, 'last_played': 1538111431}
review:
If you fancy yourself a commander of a capital ship, flying through space, exploring astroids and nebula, and engaging in trade and battles between massive fleets, then you'll probably like this. 

While it's similar to Gemini 2, there are many notable improvements, including warfleets which you can command and put against enemy fleets and starbases. There's even a neat mechanic for capturing planets. Overall, the scope of this game is much greater, and I recommend picking this one up even if you've never played the other games. There's a lot of ships to collect, a lot of resources to gather, and a lot to build, so the game can feel a little grindy at times - but no where near the intesity of the X series. Still, you feel like you're building towards something. (Also, you can use mods to give yourself credits and resources if trading and collecting is not your thing.) There's also a really great editor, so you can customize the appearance of your ship - really appreciated this addition!

I recommend picking up the Titan DLC at least. They're a great deal of fun to stomp around in, although the Titan's can make the end game a little too easy.

+Great visual
+Fun gameplay
+Okay story
+Fleet battles

-End game is a little grindy
-Some of the mechanics seem unexplained

author: {'steamid': '76561197975384601', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4792, 'last_played': 1544820382}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019578954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 7531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7359, 'last_played': 1527852608}
review:
I think SPG games are becoming more shallower with every step and Warlord is the last step for me. We are not braindead players, we can handle a bit more complex and detailed gameplay imho.

There are only few games which let us command damn capital spaceships but in Warlords, I don't feel like a captain anymore, not even a little bit. New special abilities and boadring looks awful. I wish less arcadish abilities and SPG2's boarding system again.

Well, there are much to write but I have limited time and english knowledge, but I believe you got the point. 

Devs: I don't want to see SPG games that much arcade and shallow. Please try to find sweetspot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006606710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4077, 'last_played': 1537115992}
review:
Verfasst: 13. Sep. um 17:44 Uhr

It's a good, fun game that's worth running a campaign once in a while.
What I would've loved to see is a little more depth to certain areas like faction management, research and maybe even region conquest. It's all nicely straight forward but therefore also a little unchallenging.
There's also a difficulty asymetry: depening on settings the game starts out fairly hard and tries to become harder the more you progress by making spawns bigger in number and ship size, aswell as opening up better defended targets - so far so good - but it just doesn't scale with your character's abilities, your ship's power and your faction's ressources.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032073178', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8518, 'last_played': 1536877656}
review: Very fun game to play. I'm at 133 hours played and only just now closing in on conquering the last bit of the starmap (Halberd Dreadnought is awesome!!). After that I still have the Rise of Numibia DLC to play as well as some achievements to hunt down. For me it was money well spent and I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes spacegames and is looking to expand their collection. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198038550400', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 5878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5678, 'last_played': 1543163807}
review:
Série Starpoint Gemini má mezi milovníky vesmírných „simulátorů“ své nezapomenutelné místo. Velkou zásluhu na tom mají vývojáři a to hlavně díky jejich přístupu a naslouchání komunitě.

Starpoint Gemini Warlords, je jak jsem již zmínil vesmírný „simulátor“ z pohledu třetí osoby nesoucí kouzlo starého, ale dovolím si tvrdit určitým způsobem kultovního Freelancera. 

Příběh Warlords volně navazuje na události z předešlého dílu, nicméně opravdu jen volně. Je zde zcela nový příběh, i když není zas tak originální. Vaši loď zničili a Vy jste jako jediný přeživší zachráněn půvabnou mladou kapitánkou Tarou. A zde začíná Váš příběh, respektive nejdříve si vytvoříte charakter a zvolíte základní skilly a tributy. Pak přijde na řadu Vaše základní vesmírné plavidlo a teď už Vám nic nebrání brázdit rozsáhlý systém Gemini.

Příběh tedy opravdu nezačíná nijak originálně, nicméně to se brzy změní. V Gemini je opravdová hrozba a tou je superzbraň, díky které je možné zničit celou planetu. Kdo tuto superzbraň jménem Proxima stvoří, co s ní zamýšlí a jakou úlohu v tom hrajete Vy? To záleží jenom na Vás!  Je jen na Vás zda budete nelítostný pirát, pašerák, služebník Imperia nebo diplomat, který z každého souboje (z velké části) vyjde elegantně bez boje a s hlavou hrdě vztyčenou. 

Máme zde opravdu mnoho možností jakou cestou se vydat, nicméně princip a hlavní děj budou vždy stejné a tudíž i jeden konec. Tedy můžete být pirát, ale na hlavní děj to nemá zásadní vliv, jen na okolní frakce a jejich spolupráci s Vámi. Po dokončení hlavní příběhové linie přecházíte automaticky do „freelancer modu“, ve kterém si můžete doslova dělat, co chcete (a to včetně použití Proximy).

Hratelnost, je hra velice povedená a pro milovníky žánru hravá a chytlavá. Je zde klasické ovládání myš+klávesnice. Vývojáři navíc opravdu pečlivě naslouchali komunitě a předělali některé věci z minulého dílu a to co se hráčům moc nelíbilo. Jako jednu z hlavních změn musím zmínit, že když zajmete nepřátelskou loď (systém obsazení nepřátelského plavidla prošel kompletní inovací), již ji nemusíte za sebou táhnout vlečným paprskem, ale velitel komanda se Vás po obsazení nepřátelské lodi zeptá, co s nově získanou lodí chcete udělat. Je zde možnost prodat na materiál, prodat za peníze, opravit a dát do garáže anebo rozebrat a získat možnost tuto loď později postavit ať už pro Vás anebo pro Vaší flotilu.

Zmínil jsem materiál. Ano další novinkou je, že Warlords není, až tak úplně simulátor, ale z ne malé části i strategie. Potřebujete získávat materiál, abyste mohli postavit vesmírné stanice, těžební stanice nebo i jak jsem již zmínil flotily lodí, které budou Vaše území bránit (nebo lítat po Vašem boku jako doprovod). Samozřejmostí je i možnost obsazování nepřátelských stanic a dokonce i planet. Stanice můžete postupně vylepšovat a to samozřejmě platí i pro Vaší domovskou „základnu“, která se dá opravdu parádně vylepšit. Tento systém je velice chytlavý nicméně v pozdější fázi hry, může na někoho působit spíše otravně, protože určité pasáže děje jsou přímo spojeny s výrobou a těžením materiálů, případně konstrukcí určitých zařízení (spoiler).

Ve hře nechybí ani arény, ve kterých si můžete snadno vydělat peníze, které ze začátku opravdu jen tak snadno nezískáte. Jedná se o velice milé zpestření, ale hlavně dobrý a rychlý zdroj penízků.

Jedním z hlavních prvků série Starpoint Gemini je i pestrá škála nepřátel a také lodí, které můžete ovládat. Warlords samozřejmě nejsou výjimkou a tak zde opět nalezneme bitevníky, fregaty, destroyer a po DLC si opět vychutnáme možnost mít pod naší kontrolou loď třídy TITAN. Lodě si samozřejmě můžete upravovat a vylepšovat, upravovat zbraňový arsenál, štíty, nebo třeba i Vaše stihačky v hangáru.

Vesmír je sám o sobě velice živý, a tak každou chvilku můžete narazit na záhadný signál, anomálii, prosbu o pomoc (volání S.O.S), přepadení piráty nebo nabídku na „zajímavý“ obchod.

Grafické zpracování je na povedené úrovni, ovšem optimalizace opravdu trpí. Bohužel nedokážu posoudit, zda se jedná pouze o moji starší sestavu nebo takový problém má více hráčů. Hra obsahuje bohužel i několik buggů a to zejména „neviditelných štítů“ kdy i když jste od jiného vesmírného tělesa poměrně daleko, přesto do něj narazíte. Nicméně se to dá překousnout. 

Hra obsahuje perfektní soundtrack, který doporučuji poslechnout, jako zvukovou kulisu, třeba při nějaké práci na PC nebo i jen tak. Jedná se o orchestrální hudbu, která uklidní, ale i nakopne.

Hra je poměrně dlouhá a hlavní příběh má při plynulém hraní (bez čekání na suroviny a materiál) délku krásných 8 hodin herního času. Nicméně na úplný konec respektive totální vítězství (ovládnutí systému Gemini) budete potřebovat nejméně 25 – 35 hodin herního času.

Co říci závěrem? Starpoint Gemini Warlords je povedený vesmírný strategický simulátor s krásnou grafikou, povedeným soundtrackem a mořem zábavy. Pokud patříte mezi fanoušky série anebo máte rádi povedené vesmírné simulátory, tak s touto hrou neuděláte chybu.

edit: its hard not to recommend something with a dev team that cares. Not even 6 hours later and these guys respond with a potenial resolution.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992178786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1758, 'last_played': 1604605743}
review:
Excellent Space game with beautiful graphics and it reminds me sort of like freelancer but a bigger and more open world.
I had some problems with the game stuttering but the devs were exceptional in helping me out and I cant praise them enough. You dont normally receive such support these days from game companies all they want is your money.  Fantastic.
I recommend this game to anyone who likes space exploration and combat.
developer_response:
Hello DarthJW,

I'm sorry for late reply. If you're still interested in resolving problems, please send me your log.txt right after stuttering starts to happen. When sending e-mail, please tell to forward it to me (zeko_i_mrkva) with urgency and I'm gonna take a look what's going on. Sometimes communication stucks between players and developers. In most cases we reply within 24-48 MAX. 

email::	customersupport@starpointgemini.com

author: {'steamid': '76561198052811848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 23619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22308, 'last_played': 1536005210}
review:
いろいろ縛りをかけながら、結構長く楽しく遊べました
一言でいうと、RPG体験版(宇宙風味)という感じでした。
以下、気が付いた点をいくつか。

言語:　まずは日本語化にご尽力頂いた方に感謝します。
　　　プレイ中、特段のストレス無く遊べると思います。
操作:　不慣れな方でも問題ありません。戦闘に関しては
　　　機動的なものは関係なく、艦の大きさが全てです。
　　　駆逐艦が空母に肉薄した場合、恐らく一瞬で撃沈
　　　されます。武器の特性などは特に意味は無いです。
　　　尚、乗艦の選択の幅はかなり狭く、カスタム化も
　　　さほど外観に影響はありません。
シナリオ:お使い型のもので、選択に応じて細かく分岐
　　　していく訳ではありません。
　　　特に後半は、美しい宇宙を、ぶらぶら観光するか
　　　他国を滅ぼして暇つぶしするかどちらかです。
宇宙観:本作の宇宙には、艦に危険を及ぼす自然現象や
　　　宇宙生物は特にありません。(放射能星雲除く)
　　　また、開拓的な要素もありませんが、航行して
　　　いて、とても綺麗な風景が楽しめます。
内政・経済:本作にはこれらの要素は特にありません。
　　　おこずかい制なので赤字とかにはなりません
　　　戦時だろうが平和だろうがどうでも良いです。

おすすめできるかどうかは、本作に何をどこまで求めるか
ですので、手軽に宇宙風味のRPGをやってみたいという事
であれば、良い作品かと思います。
反対に、SLGがやりたい方や、新しい文明・新しい生命が
待ち受けている事を期待して五年間の調査飛行に飛び出し
たい方には他の作品を探される事をお勧めします。

author: {'steamid': '76561197988091288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4344, 'last_played': 1524694484}
review:
J'ai bien aimé le jeu, l'histoire est intéressante mais je la trouve un peu trop courte.
Il y a plein de petites quêtes sympas à faire, mais ce sont très souvent les mêmes et ça devient rapidement répétitif.
Une fois que l'histoire est finie, on peut se mettre en quête de conquérir tout, mais là aussi c'est très répétitif.
Toutefois, c'est un très bon jeu où on commence avec rien et on s'améliore petit à petit! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198025390493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1535511262}
review: It could have been such a great game, but the controls are clumsy, story is linear, and there is this one terrible mission where the enemy battleship bombards your little corvette, and you can't even move.  No explanations or a story even as to why you can't move, so you spend first 30 seconds trying to figure out why the throttle keeps resetting to zero, and then you die.  I can only assume it's so the lazy devs don't have to come up with how to deal with your ship if you fly out of the story zone.  But come on, at least throw the players a bone with some flimsy rationale as to why ship can't move.
