author: {'steamid': '76561197976795888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 5231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2368, 'last_played': 1541227421}
review: 游戏还可以，中文化太烂了，如果是外国人做的也许可以原谅，如果是中国人做的，你拿的那份薪水，良心不痛吗？

author: {'steamid': '76561198087065195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1531, 'last_played': 1534833872}
review:
This game was incredibly entertaining for the first few hours, despite its flaws. However it suffers greatly from a slow down in gameplay and an extremely repetitive core loop.

The gameplay loop in regards to the campaign is as follows:
- Do story missions (Earn money and XP)
- Get blocked off from the next missions because you require a larger (More expensive) ship
- Grind side missions for the XP and money to buy the ship

The issue primarily with the gameplay loop is that the time step 3 takes increases exponentially every time you go around the loop. On top of that, the side missions are a small pool of repetitive missions with little challenge to start with and none by the end of your play through.

I bought this game for the advertised gameplay of building your empire (ala X3 / Eve Online [but offline]) but what I got instead was a game with clunky controls and non-responsive commands (For your turrets and fleet) where it feels like you're helping someone else expand and micromanage their empire instead of building one yourself.

Gaining resources is a waiting game lacking any ability to optimise or otherwise interact with the logistics, and it takes forever to be able to gather the resources to build any ships of actual value.
This is compounded by almost all neighbouring provinces being well defended and requiring a significant investment in fleet to capture (Like, 5 dreadnoughts and some cruisers significant).

Overall:
Pros:
- Aesthetically beautiful
- Solid release mostly lacking bugs
- Passable gameplay for a few hours
- Passable story and voice acting

Cons:
- Somewhat annoying UI
- Combat feels light and unimpactful
- RPG elements feel underwhelming (Skills seem to do basically nothing)
- Extremely grindy, especially at later levels
- Missions are repetitive and get boring very quickly
- Voice acting is inconsistent (I.E. some missions in the main story line will have a line voiced then a line of text for no apparent reason)
- Research is shallow and benefits of said research are often very boring

Starpoint Gemini Warlords is not a bad game; it's just not a good game. You might get some value our of it at a significant markdown.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085895635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 1478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1203, 'last_played': 1613928466}
review:
Fajnie się gra, głównie przez:
-nie latasz sam
-jest co rozwijać, podbijać, nawet dobry wybór zleceń
-i powód do podboju jest, przyjemna mapka, lot do celu
-nawet spoko ekonomia
-kosmos dobrze zbalansowany w porównaniu do elite dangerous, czy x3
-autotargeting - bardziej pasuje gdy masz osoby do obsługi na pokładzie czy AI, czy masz się skupić na przybocznych
-autolądowanie, przyspieszanie animacji
-rozwój postaci i bohaterów

Wady:
-pathfinding - niby kosmos i przestrzeń, a statki walą jeden o drugi chociaż prędkości nie zmieniam, nie wpominam, że czasem stacji nie wyminie statek po obraniu kursu, na szczęscie nie ma jakiegoś damage wkurzającego w tym przypadku
-bywają akcje gdzie jest atak na stację, stacja ma dużo hp, dokoła obrona, stacja nie strzela, ale moje statki tak i czasem jakiś imbecyl z drużyny zamieni się w pył, na szczęście to broń obusieczna
-GUI no kurcza jest ok momentami, ale przydałoby się przemyśleć lepiej, bo na pewno się da, sterowanie zwłaszcza. Poprzestawiałem tych klawiszy. Brakuje ikon, wyróżników.
-kamera przez pierwsze 4h bardzo wnerwia, potem też ale mniej
-brakuje dobrej prezentacji twojej załgi, kto kogo rozwalił w trakcie walki i poza nią. Na początku to bitwy mrówek, choć w tych czasach pewnie gorzej mogłoby być z zasięgiem i widocznością przeciwnika
-tworzę sobie teamy i co? Się zjoinowały się, za łatwo, w końcu latam z jednym teamem bo i tak się bardziej opłaci
-zadania powtarzalne bardzo
-po kupnie statku i przeniesieniu załogi bronie przepadają, może się sprzedają, trzeba pamiętać o rozebraniu starego statku przed przeniesieniem dowództwa.
-rozumiem i nie rozumiem pomysłu z dokupywaniem wieżyczek do broni, ale tak czy siak coś tu jest zagmatwanego 
-abordaże - trochę ciężko zrozumieć, dobre guziki, ale ciężko się zorientować jak wypada ten abordaż
-autotargeting się nieraz wyłączy sam i lecę czasem jak turysta w rój przeciwnika
-może nie wiem jeszcze, że jest, ale przydałby się autoprzydział flot cywilnych do zadań
-rozbudowę stacji można było efektowniej zrobić, nie czuję satysfakcji z rozbudowy. I klocki do składania i animacja jakoś takie sobie. Model stacji ok wygląda mimo to.
-po statku nie pochodzę jak w mass effect i brak jakoś przywiązania, emocji do tego co się robi

10 PRINT "THIS IS AWESOME!!! AND THEN SOME!"

review:
Suprisingly interesting genre mix. It's good. Balancing is off, game is too time consuming out of the box. You definitely want some modes: cheaper T-Drive prices, unlimited ammo etc.

Biggest issue with the game is in combat: your ship doesn't use all the turrest for ships in your field of view. So you need to fly in strange angles where you don't see the target to use them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220032911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2488, 'last_played': 1611906745}

author: {'steamid': '76561198095349885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 2193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1941, 'last_played': 1534507565}
review:
It feels a bit *half completed*. 

Before I get a comment about  *dev responses to blahblahblah in SPG2* (the prequel), I never played it. I'm new to the franchise. Sorry but SPGW doesn't feel like a finished game, which surprised me given how much dlc there is. 

The research and construct options aren't exactly intuitive. You have to construct upgrades to get resource missions with better rewards, but requiring more civilian fleets? Yet you have to spend personal perks on the resource gathering "skill tree" to be able to upgrade individual facilities across Gemini? How the hell does that make sense?

I've played this game for a few hours now, obtained a dreadnought ("Magistrate" I think?), stuck a bunch of Sage 3 turrets on it with some level 3 upgrade option, and now it's easy. The element of strategy has gone; I've got a fleet of batleships and dreadnoughts I've captured following me around with two of the NPC characters (one in a dreadnought and the other in a carrier, which btw is the most pointless class of ship in the game) and I can fly into the middle of any enemy fleet I come across, hit two Vanguard specials and then spend 30 seconds wiping out anything smaller than a cruiser, and then another minute or two taking out everything else. A cruiser lasts about 10 seconds with sustained fire, battleships *maybe* 20, carriers the same, and dreadnoughts about 30 seconds.

Actually thinking about it, I might still be able to get a refund...

Seriously, try X3 Albion Prelude, which is about one third the price, without a rediculous amount of attached dlc and about x10 the game, or Rebel Galaxy which I picked up for pennies in a Steam sale *and yet* is more fun, *and* prices on commodities even respond to in-game events, which they don't in this.

EDIT: Was unable to get a refund as I'd played it for longer than two hours (!); don't make the same mistake

author: {'steamid': '76561197973930313', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1534155731}
review:
next to the bad controls that can be handled are some points to make that game not good
- stupid AI, bumping into each other, flying in cluster formation etc.
- fleet AI is unable to retreat or keep distance in battles.
- fleet AI is bumping in sublight travel allways into me
- fleet AI can hold only one formation
- fleet AI just goes straight into a fight no matter how strong the enemy is..
- (the fleet AI is sh1t)
- no ram damage
- turrets are terrible, can't only activate fire at will or not. no turret placement, turrets wont split their aiming if the target is blocked by own ship f.e.
- weapon ranges are ridicoulous
- some big ships can turn like destroyers
- shield segments are 2D in 3D room
- no possiblity to adjust or customize his own fleets weaponry
- fighter squadrons are stronger than main weapons of big battleships, killing my shields faster than anything else
- own fighters are stupid af, cant order them to defend me, just attack or dock; fighters flying insane distances dont stick to the ship, keymapping for suqadrons are not working properly (multiply=start/land squadrons; it only starts them; each numpad 9 6 3 can start and land a suqadron, this isnt changeable in the controls
- average lack of commanding possibilities and organizing
- arming menu for own ship is terrible, you need to by one turret system and place it into the slot after that you can buy a number of turrets, if you wanna change your turret u dont have to by f.e. 20 new turrets just 1 and put him into the slot...
- no active defences turrets, unable attack missiles or fighters
- every turret can turn 360° in 0 sec

------ absolute gamebreaker = there is no real fleet fight. If you come to a fleet battle between 2 factions and you keep your distance to them (aprox 5k) the only dmg that is made is thru squadrons, perks, missiles. All turrets are disabled!!! The fleets only use the turrets if you come close enough in loading range to render the turrets and suddenly the fight will goes faster!!!!!!! All the other points are problematic but not so devastating like this problem!


+ fleet creating
+ conquer mode
+ average graphics

author: {'steamid': '76561198077188556', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1534177017}
review: Ich habe das Spiel zurückgegeben, weil die guten inhaltlichen und spielmechanischen Ansätze durch die doch sehr altbackenen und textlastigen Interfaces den Reiz des Spiels zunichte machen. Sehr schade, denn es gibt wirklich gut konzeptionierte Ideen. Doch ich persönlich mag es nicht mich durch unzählige Textfenster durchzuklicken, Schiffskonfigurationen im Charme einer Excel-Tabelle vorzunehmen oder mit sperrigem Umschalten zwischen freier Schiffsansicht und Cursor-Modus die kostbare Spielzeit zu verbringen. Da täuschen leider wieder einmal die gerenderten Trailer etwas vor, das es nicht gibt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995709318', 'num_games_owned': 2327, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1675253543}
review:
Лучшеб эта игра стоила в три раза дороже, но:
- с нормальным переводом
- с интуитивным интерфейсом
- и удобным управлением

Upd:

Признаюсь я хотел чтобы игра понравилась, и если с этими тремя недостатками выше, играть вполне возможно, то

С отсутствием баланса уже нельзя, если я в середине игры могу выполнить одно задание и купить топовый корабль(и это на максимальной сложности), то возникает вопрос: зачем вся торговля, Mining в игре, все те копейки что я пытался сэкономить и наскрести остальными механиками - вроде как сбор лута и долгим исследованием аномалий.

Также выяснилось, что стратегическая составляющая отсутствует, у противников нет как таковых ресурсов, флоты спавнятся после перезагрузки игры

author: {'steamid': '76561198008113002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1534321185}
review: Not a bad game but not a great one either. Camera angles are a bit wonky UI is a little bit of a mess. The asking price is waaay to high this is more like a 19.99 game if that. I got it on sale and it's a fair price on sale. In the current state I can't recommend a bit repetive and too easy once you get a established fleet. AI needs to be a bit more aggressive when attacking you and a little more strategic. They simply go in and reconquer their stuff and mostly just leave you alone. Fleet management  is a nightmare wish you could have a screen dedicated to telling how your fleet should operate , formations, etc. You have to speak individually to each ship. Combat is ok but could be a bit better I guess. Needs to have multiplayer Co-op mode to have any replayabilty honestly. Solid game but would steer clear unless on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009126398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2430, 'last_played': 1710641605}
review:
I can't figure out how to acquire gas, materials or ore.  I destroy an asteroid and must sell everything.  The space station produces nothing that I can see and I have completed several missions.  The construction menu is ghosted.  I am becoming frustrated with this game.
Some parts are fun but without the items to build ships or construct other stations it will lose its appeal soon.
I reached level 6 as told by the developer and everything works like he said.
The game is very fun to play and has many options.  I should have been more patient.
developer_response: 4X content is locked until you've reached Mission 7 of the Main Story Campaign as mission 6 stands as a tutorial on how to obtain and manage resources, develop HQ infrastructure, command battle fleets and more. If you start any other scenario other than Campaign, the content will be available from the start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025789964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1563845050}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197978584835', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 7000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3246, 'last_played': 1632084255}
review:
This mofo has unbeliavebly bitchy controls beyond the basic movement and engagement, making it very newcomer unfriendly. After +15h I'm still struggling to get a good flow of it. Should one decide to plow throught that, is when the gameplay really opens up.

But other than that I find the game Great. There's always something along the way to distract you from the main objective and the game world is vast. It's not as lively as I'd hope for though, could use more AI patrols and traders running their routes.

Sadly the I don't really feel the main story, but that might be cause I never played the previous SPGs, the open ended from the get go free modes are fokin excellent though, and seem like the only place where combat alternative progress options are viable.

And you get to purge planets Exterminatus style! Fuck yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999031456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3183, 'last_played': 1534361313}
review:
As a Starpoint Gemini 2 player, I had expectations going in to this game. In some ways I will admit it did live up to them, however a "Finished" or "Ended" product should not contain bugs that completly stop progress on the main quest line. Being rammed by your own team in flight as the formation pathing does not function. Bosses that require specialized builds (They don't explain you can change your skills out via respec either), and are hardly damaged by a full fleed of frendlies. Along with various other small bugs and oddities that do not lend to the charm. 

I will say on the plus side it still remains an enjoyable game at 75% off the base price, at full price however I would avoid it. It is a unfinished and shipped product that does not do the previous game justice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073223328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3434, 'last_played': 1535649610}
review:
这个游戏的定位恰到好处，比EVE-Online对舰船的操作更灵活，比X-Rebirth视角更宏观可以操纵很多船，比Elite Dangerous操作更简洁。跟X-3类似。所以是一款值得上手的游戏，看有很多DLC，猜测剧情应该十分饱满，而且全汉化。很多背景资料可以细细品读。
总体上说，是一款可以替代X-3的2017年新款游戏，可玩性很高，打折96全DLC收录，休息了玩一会，节奏自己控制，比在线网游便宜多了，还不肝。
画面嘛，真心觉得还是可以的，EVE-Online以及Elite Dangerous画面那么舒服，弃疗的还不是一大把，关键是玩法要有趣，别搞得跟上班科研似的那么肝（哭笑~）。

它的剧情很棒，有分支选项。剧情推进速度也较快，可以很快进入到生产模式，团战模式，所以刚开始不要太执迷于斗殴，后面有一大群小弟了，赏金任务想打谁就打谁。

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
要想有以上这些感受，首先你要搞定它的控制键。这款游戏操作风格是EVE-Online的风格，一定要看清按钮的用途，否则你会懵逼。在默认按键下，做任务常用按键如下（鼠标+键盘，安先后顺序操作）：

鼠标左键：选中空间某个物体
万能鼠标中间：类似于EVE的右键，许多操作都是从这里弹出的菜单进行操作
V：切换到航炮视角，
space：锁定鼠标视角，这样就可以观察宇宙而不翻滚了。
R：自动锁定敌人，T切换敌人（T键是我自己设置的）
K：航炮视角瞄准敌人

鼠标右键：开火
X：放导弹

A,D：旋转船身，让四个方向的护盾均摊伤害。
W,S：调整船头，让航炮不卡视角而无法射击
C：自动拾取所有物品，采矿、打捞常用

数字1，2，3，4：当你按鼠标中间时，右下角会有2组图表，左边四个是舰船技能，对应1234键释放
数字5，6，7，8：当你按鼠标中间时，右下角会有2组图表，右边四个是物品使用，打捞需要使用的纳米无人机就是其中之一

采矿：就是跑到石头跟前开枪射爆，捡物品。
捡物品：跑到跟前，直接打爆，捡物品
打捞：先左键选中，然后鼠标中键，跑到跟前，释放纳米无人机（数字键7，或者鼠标中键，看屏幕右下角点纳米无人机）
扫描：先左键选中，然后鼠标中键，跑到跟前，再鼠标中键，扫描

这些就是基本操作，配船、换装备选技能啥的，在玩的时候一会就能琢磨出来了。

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
知道了上面的操作，我建议按照EVE-Online的万能右键思路，改一下默认按键，然后把1-8技能键放到F1-F4，数字1-4，鼠标右键开火放到键盘上，玩起来就很舒服了。对了还有视角，只需要反转控制船身的方向就行。

祝你玩的开心，玩出自己的闲暇时光。

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

好了，这是第二篇。我们讲一下游戏中的一些难点。以及一些容易卡住的关卡。
（1）跳跃装备怎么配。
比如瞬间跳跃到一个较远的点，使用的是“T驱动”装备。这个装备是在空间站的“商人”——“装备”——“商人”列表中购买，然后在空间站的右边选项“舰队”——“装备”选项下，可以看到购买的装备与屏幕右下角四个技能的装配。
装配完毕后，出空间站，激活“T驱动”装备（直接按对应的数字键，或者鼠标中间后，点击右下角该装备图标），画面切入大地图，鼠标移到目的地附近，当光标为白色时即可跳跃，右键鼠标，启动“T驱动”装备。
（2）飞船武器系统如何升级
一是“干船坞”——“装船”选项下，可以购买相应的武器；
二是“干船坞”——“强化”选项下，一次点击屏幕右边装载的武器、设备，左边列表对应该武器设备的性能升级选项。


关卡介绍：
（1）双子星座军阀，任务3：
— —在干船坞：将炮塔配置到最大值
Gemini warlords, mission 3:
-At Drydock:Configure turrets to their maximum amount.
任务的要求不是买最贵的炮台，把炮台配齐。而是让每个炮台的“1/2”变成“2/2”，在“干船坞”中把点击炮台，会看到右下方有个“配置炮塔”，点进去，花钱升满即可。有人说要在英文下才能通关，专门读档调成中文、英文，都可以通关。

author: {'steamid': '76561197980653142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1534831350}
review: The Game Story-is definintely not a visual thriller. The Game itself Is X- Simplified in play style. The controls are rough as far as controllers go. I could not get roll to work on my XB-one controller. I ended up going to mouse and keyboard. The game itself makes you want to like it. It is not above $12.00 fun even for space game enthuisist. the controls and lack there of left me a little frustrated the mouse and keyboard take getting used to as the camera does not pan with the ship. Combat was annoying as your trying to fly your ship pan your mouse the enemy pounded the crap out of me in every confrontantion as I tried to keep them in sight. The controller issue has caused me to give what should be a thumbs up a thumbs down. the fire button also brings up the menu for systems so as you fire that is fricking annoying. Next time playing firing brings up a leveling menu. Try again complete mission game locks up. Only Steam game installed out of 100+ games that regularly freezes especially starting combat. Win 10 i7700k GTX 1080 32gb ram all drivers up to date.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993503468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1534150010}
review:
I refunded this.

my initial experience was:
-Looks bad, runs worse. game only vaguely resembles advertised footage.
-Weapon sounds are poor quality and repetitive. fights consist of listening to 10 ships firing the same weapon and they all just PIEW PIEW PIEW ad infinitum, had to take my headphones off during fights as the noise is shrill.
-galactic terrain appears at random out of nowhere, without warning. giant space stations or asteroid fields just pop into existence right infront of you. giving the impression you're in a goldfish bowl and theres someone just randomly dropping asteroid shaped fishfood on you.
- Missions are repetitive and simplistic. point your ship towards the big marker on your HUD, go there. click on whatever item on the context menu your mission states (board it, kill it, whatever), turn around, go home, rinse and repeat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114697044', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1533927251}
review: Одна из многочисленных космоигр. Невнятный шаблонный сюжет, копирующий множество подобных. Спорный интерфейс, например, окно корабля с его оборудованием неудобно и неинформативно. Игра натурально скучная, при неплохой картинке и приемлимом геймплее. Итог - проходной товар, есть EVE Online, Elite Dangerous, вселенная X, Star Citizen. Незачем плодить сущности.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007545076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 2735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2112, 'last_played': 1670673827}
review:
Купил игру за 150 р и с этим ценником игра достойна 
пару вечеров скоротать можно 

но ниже будет развернутая критика (ведь можно было сделать лудше)

-Перевод. о нем просто - он ужасен, это видно сразу. вместо надписи загрузить написано боезопас (LOAD же) местами пробивается английский текст и подобное (перевод ур гугл) но стоит отдать должное, могли и вовсе без него оставить.

-Модель корабля. да корабли сделаны красиво, но это кирпич 1) нет моделей повреждения  2) нет визуализации тяжёлого оружия, сняряд вылетает просто из стенки 3) нет повреждений систем по типу радара, турелей и прч 4) нет визуализации стыковки для искадрилий 5) скиллы персонажа действуют так, у вас будет гаубица и инвиз, нам пофиг на системы, оружие и возможности корабля, собственно где логика?

-Дипломатия. м она есть но её нет скажу так. да прокачка её есть, можно и мир предложить, но на этом всё, единственный способ захвата планеты взорвать её мега пушкой, я не увидел в игре возможности сделать вассала, сформировать альянс или какие либо изменения в политике соседей, они не стремятся заводить друзей или врагов они просто существуют. 

-Торговля. да есть обширный список товаров но на этом всё, действия игрока никак не влияют на рынок, нет скидок на товар, инфляции, экономических блокад, станция где дают самые высокие цены за допустим медикаменты не изменит цены своего предложения на протяжении всей игры. 

-Стратегия. это не стратегия, противник не использует экономику, ресурсы, не строит корабли, а просто спавнит флоты у себя на територии раз в 5 мин и отправляет к вам на 
ближайшую станцию если сила флота чуть больше (и собственно где тактические маневры почему всегда атака в лоб?) 

-Управление оно крайне неудобное и особенно управление мышкой, чуть дернул и твой корабль уже три сальто сделал, менюшка абордажа сделана так, что тебе надо освободить курсор от навигации + перекрывает радар,  да и почему дредноуты столь маневренные? управление на них будто с ганшипа не слезал (не ощущается мощь корабля размером с пол станции)

-Оружие. звуки стрельбы довольно однотипные, нет моделек ракет вместо них сгустки непонятно чего, балистическое оружие тоже весьма странное, стрляет зелеными-белыми сгустками и издает звуки типо пиу пиу, серьёзно? это по вашему балистика?
послушайте как танк стреляет, примерно так и должны быть сделаны балистические орудия. 

-Оптимизация. непонятно почему, но ангар на планетах дико лагает, что странно для одного коробля и менюшки, да + я уверен при такой картинке можно производительность повысить (вобщем на оптимизацию забили) 

-Баланс. корабль больше корабль лудше. стадо ганшипов не сносит одного дредноута никак (тестил 35к боевой мощи из ганшипов)

Вобщем надеюсь разарабы это увидят и возьмут на заметку при создании следующей части.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032588422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1534078199}
review:
Menschen die dieses Spiel positiv bewerten, haben womöglich nie "Freelancer" gespielt und wissen es einfach nicht besser.
Was mich hier am meisten abtörnt sind die Weltraumkämpfe - völlig unübersichtlich und hektisch. Zu 99% sieht man den Gegner gar nicht in der Hektik. Also "R" drücken für "nächstes Ziel anpeilen", Türme auf Automatikfeuer stellen und im Kreis fliegen, und Tasten für Spezialawaffen hin und wieder drücken. Ich habe ca. 4 Std. gespielt und finde es jetzt schon mega langeweilig. Es ist nicht mal die 8€ in sale wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006221778', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2161, 'last_played': 1551018248}
review: 中文名《双子座军阀》，游戏很棒（虽然画面确实有待提高...），星战RPG和策略的结合，上手也不是很难，尤其是能够手动操作舰船与敌方搏斗，这一点给开发商点赞。看很多朋友都在纠结操作的问题，其实并不复杂，默认操作模式有点奇怪，不过大家可以自己调整，我用的是“炮塔视角+航行模式”，这样在对战时舰船可以WASD手动操作，准星也可以手动对准敌人。先说这么多吧，马上要为无畏舰奋斗了！

author: {'steamid': '76561198090209580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 2627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2627, 'last_played': 1534524334}
review:
Alles in allem Durchschnitt. typisches 08/15 Weltraumspiel, die es immer mal wieder gibt. Steuerung ist ok, Grafik ist Funktional, Story eher Belanglos, dazwische Looten und Lvl um ein größeres Schiff zu Kaufen.
Hat man eben alles schon mal gesehen.
 
Leider auch hier und da auch noch ein parr kleine Bugs. (versucht mal kleine Container im Weltraum zu erwischen, das ist nen krampf oder aber Rotz dumme Ki die einem zu gerne mal mit voller wucht ins Schiff brettert.)
Und einige Grafik entscheidungen die ich nicht nachvollziehen kann, wie z.B. 
warum sieht die Basis Raumstation aus als ob sie ein 8 Jähriger aus Spaß an Papas altem Rechner gestaltet hat? Mal im ernst, Spiele Anno 2003 hatten bessere Texturen und Modelle als an manch einer Ecke hier im Spiel. 
Das ist einfach Quantiät und für 7-8€ ist das gerade noch ok, aber für über 30?
 
Dennoch, dieses Spiel kann man sich gut mal auf den alten Laptop hauen und bei langer Zug fahrt spielen, oder wenn man mal wieder zu blöde zum Laufen war und auf der Treppe stürzt eben auch um die Langeweile im Krankenhaus zu bekämpfen. 
Für nen parr Euro Ok, aber bei mehr als 10 Kröten würde ich sagen Finger von lassen. 
Wer aber mehr wert auf Qualität legt sollte sich mal Rebel Galaxy anschauen, für 20€ finde ich, wird einem dort mehr geboten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000647721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 3074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3074, 'last_played': 1530936490}
review:
Overall I really liked the game. 
I had some things that bugged me a lot though:
    1st Your fleets don't do as much as they should. Your ship seems to always be the one doing the lions share of anything.
    2nd In the end mission I had a huge fleet come in to fight with me. I don't know if it was a game bug or what but for this 
       mission they wouldn't do anything. They just floated around. That's really frustrating when you spend the whole game 
       building up an armada you're proud of. It was bad enough that it ruined the game for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003815990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3883, 'last_played': 1534578662}
review:
This is a very good game. It's a fresh take on space warfare, trying to mix elements from action and 4x. The strategic layer isn't too deep and tactical commands are barebone but still, it manages to create a mix that's more than the sum of its part. The campaign is a nice tutorial although I personally think the freeroam scenarios are the meat of the game, the story is decent enough and provides motivation behind your actions, although it's nothing mind blowing.

As a final note, disregard the number of "0,2 hours on record" reviews lamenting problems with control or lack of hand holding. Sure, the game has a very peculiar control scheme (and for the sake of God I'm unable to understand why entering turret view doesn't automatically activate mouseview, instead of having to click left mouse to rotate the camera) but it's perfectly functional and everything is explained in depth. This isn't an arcade shooter, if your brain melts thinking about having more than a "fire" and "smartbomb" button to take in consideration, please look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106037933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1631864911}
review:
这款游戏的操作和感觉像是X3+EVE的结合体，恰巧这两款游戏我都玩过上手还算是比较快。
不足的地方也有，比如键盘视角旋转、战斗视角、武器射程。
AI的飞船给我就一种感觉，硬。
这是一款2017年的太空游戏，没有内部驾驶舱视角也就算了，炮台也不能第一人称操作，不得不说这两点是一大败笔。
要是加上飞船内部构造和舰桥，再添加一些养成元素比如招募与培养船员，把鼠标中键的选项添加到有按钮并且可按的控制台上，这游戏应该会比较出彩吧。
5个小时左右的游玩，这游戏总体给我的感觉还不如当年的X3系列，暂且就这点看法。

author: {'steamid': '76561197996049384', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 1434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1434, 'last_played': 1534338825}
review:
if you like rebel galaxy you should like this...
this like every game has its own set of issues but most can easily be overlooked.

story is not as good as i would like, very little RPG...
that said there side quests, random quests, and a ton of micromanaging.

leveling and point distribution are a little weird, and minimal for an game that expands through galaxies within the universe..
you can gain some extra points but they are all but useless since they all go to one section of level upgrading...

gameplay is pretty smooth and doesnt have too many issues except shield regen rates...
hull is weak no matter the ship or upgrades, not sure if this was a screw up with programming or a massive glitch/bug...

all in all, a well built game which is a massive improvement over the alternatives offered by 99% of the game companies selling games through steam.

review: Overall this is a good game.OVERALL:Graphics good-not great,story line average at best,next time Iceberg think outside tha box. Fyi:U spent alot of time making a great universe so why make the gamer read everything?could u atleast add audio,u didn't even need actors,just decent audio i shouldn't have to read your average story&manually hit continue.as far as base building resource gathering#depth outside of killing things etc,poor at best simply blow sumthin up collect items,alil to simple for a game made in 2017.Also u claim to have full controller support that needs serious work it actually easier to enjoy this game with a mouse&keyboard. This man cum as a surprise but sum of use would prefer to play combat-shooters with a controller- i use the wireless afterglow ps3-pc controller,first didn't feel any rumble ability outta this game,& i should.another thing next time u guys make a title like this remember u can put virtually every function into a controlller for example hit buttons X&A to do a scan instead of having to use the mouse or keyboard to do that combinations of buttons do different things McFly duh,Any questions ask the makers of MK or 2k18,how they manage.  Last when u guys do a live broadcast it would help to have someone who speaks english clearly,as i said before overall good game,that needs BETTER CONTROLLER SUPPORT,&GASP CINEMATICS,YOUR GAMERS DONT WANNA READ EVERYTHING,&personally i like to read but not when im gaming. so much effort was put into this universe-ships,they look great but u fell asleep when it came time to make sum depth more effort of base building,better storyline,get really creative.I honestly look forward to the next title u put out in this field,really im gonna assume you'll get it just right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038132210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1533959556}
review:
I watched the trailers and loved the description and what the game looked like from the preview.  I boot up the game and then attempt the campaign to learn how to play.

What a joke that is.  There is no learning.  It just tells you to do stuff.  "Follow the ship."  Ok...  What buttons do I need to press to go?  A couple taps and I'm finally going after getting yelled at by the captain of the ship I'm supposed to be following.  Then it tells me to lock on and follow the ship, which takes a long time for no reason.

Once we finally get to the way point, the game stops and tells me to scan the ship.  How am I supposed to do this?  There is no help whatsoever.  One of the buttons on the bottom right?  Nope.  How about the mouse buttons?  Not that either.  How about trying A-Z on the keyboard?  Not that either.  So now I'm at a loss.  Why would you tell me to scan the ship in the TUTORIAL and not tell me how to do it?  That makes no sense.  

This isn't a one time issue.  There is a thread from 2016 with this problem.  And it still isn't fixed. 

What a waste of money.  I wish I could have played it more and enjoyed it.  But letting bugs stay for over 2 years in the tutorial shows what type of quality the rest of the game will have.
developer_response:
Hello Killashard,

I did some testing and there were no bugs in first mission you've played (prologue). Actually there is hint to use MMB (middle mouse button)  open context menu where you can easily find Scan option.


I'm sorry you didn't even bother asking on steam forum or someone else what's going on. Our forum is active from both players and developers. We do read every thread, comment, suggestions, critics, etc..

I hope you will give us second chance one day. Stay frosty :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198060703185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1533957809}
review: This game seems like it might be fun but I didn't get very far. Parts of the Steam Controller API were poorly implemented and I couldn't get the game to function with the mouse-like joystick style of input I'd like to control the camera/turret with. I prefer to use the right track-pad like a track-ball so that if I swipe quickly across the pad, the camera keeps panning as the virtual track-ball is spinning. It's disappointing. To their credit, they did [i]try[/i] to implement the controller API. Not many game developers can say that. They just didn't implement one of the options I'd like to use.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289678174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 3934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2009, 'last_played': 1599824483}
review:
宇宙モノファンの諸君、ごきげんよう！

超簡単にこのゲームの紹介をしよう。
宇宙戦艦を操り、最終的には宇宙国家を操るゲームだが

まず、このゲームは超カジュアルだ！
何と言っても船が軽い。
ゲーム内で最大の戦艦　ドレッドノートであっても、
スラスターを使わずに　わずか１０秒で１８０度の回転ができるぞ！
（スターほにゃららのような　重く高火力な船を期待する人にはお勧めしない）
ついでに言うと、超高速でステーションにぶつかっても　一切ダメージを受けない！

戦闘システムは、（敵AIは発展段階だが）一応ちゃんとできている！
主兵装の魚雷をぶっ放し副兵装のビームでチリチリ焼いていけば
敵艦はすぐに吹き飛ぶか、逃げ出すだろう！
エネルギーの配分を　スラスター/武器/シールド　に自由に設定できるため
シールドに１００％回して　メチャ硬い船にしたり
武器に回して一時的に高火力な攻撃が可能だ。
単に撃つだけではなく
・艦載機による攻撃（実用性は後述）
・マリーンによる敵艦内部での破壊工作/敵艦の拿捕
などもできるぞ！

どうだ？買いたくなってきたか？

ではここから大量の文句を言わせてもらう。

このゲームには艦隊運用という要素があるが、
建造/移動/戦闘以外に複雑なことは何一つできない。
戦闘が始まったら　撤退命令以外に出来ることはない。
最優先目標や　攻撃手段などを設定できると思っていた。
思っていたんだよ・・・

さらに艦隊を建造するためにはお金と資源が必要だが、
これらは一定時間ごとに少しもらえるシステムだ。
つまり・・・放置ゲーになるのだ・・・
主力艦を作る資源を貯めるには　だいたい３０分かかるだろう。
その間に戦闘しとけと言うことなのだろうが、
このゲームの戦闘は単調すぎて飽きる。

そして最もガッカリしたのが　空母と艦載機だ。
空母　と聞いたら大量の艦載機を運用し
敵艦を安全な位置から仕留める　と思うだろう？


このゲームの空母は爆撃機を３中隊（９機）しか運用できない。

そんなものを空母と呼べるか・・・
ちなみに１飛行中台の強さだが　ガンシップ（最弱の船）を
撃破するのに数分かかるという具合だ。

まとめよう　私はこのゲームをおすすめしない。

author: {'steamid': '76561198256319112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1533874048}
review:
very 1990's game.  lots and lots of clicking to go through each page to read segements of each characters storyline.
it starts to get very annoying after 5 minutes into the game.
The game UX and GUI very clunky also very 1990's.
Graphics needs an overhall work as it also has a very 1990's graphic design for a game that was released in 2017.
polygons on ships are old style graphics quality which makes it also harder to bare in 2018 going on 2019.
Some ships designs are cool looking but the graphics along with the polygons for them does not give them any justice at all.
I own a GTX 1080-Ti and game graphics options was on max, and game was still bad.

Also there is this constant reading each time you have to click to continue to the next characters conversation line,
Which makes is unbearable to keep playing. 
I turned my ship just a bit while flying and the game said I was out of some stupid range that it made me repeat an entire section of the story, just because I vered off course a bit.
After about an hour if forcing myself pushing through this mess, I couldnt take it anymore.  I closed the game.

This game needs an overhaul for a 2018 / 2019 feel as I do NOT feel emersed into the game at all.
I spend more time clicking so I can read each line of the chaaratcers lines while going through the story.
If I wanted to read, I would pick up a book instead of playing video games.

I was going to refund the game, but im the type of person that once I buy a game and dont like it,
I usually let it sit and hope that gaming company will fix, update and so on, otherwise it will just rot in my library.

Im a space game fanatic, but this game so far just doesnt do it for me. I purchased the full complete package game on special including all the DLCs , as it was on special on steam.
I had really high hopes for this game, So with that I will say
I do not recommend this game at this current time of August 8th 2018.

if they update the game, I will check it out again. until then back hoping and wishing for a proper space game.  :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198030336925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 4003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1797, 'last_played': 1624210097}
review:
Still very bad, when you start a new game the game world does not reset 3/4 of the time. THere for you are going up against what ever your last character was going up against in your newbie ship. 

From there the battles are stupid. your one cruiser fleet  can be taken out by one enemy newbie ship. i put 2 cruisers 2 battleships 6 frigates against 2 cruisers and 6 newbie ships. 1 cruiser returned form that battle 


This product is pretty bad, truthfully. i will still play as it is fun but it is really shitty having to restart fights to get a lagitamate outcome.

After completeing the main mission, and start the incoming king mission they strip you of your fleets, and give you crap instead shps instead then beef up the enemies to insane levels.
developer_response:
Hi Flashand,

As stated on the game's official store page, it will not work on a graphics card/chip that has less than 1280 MB of video RAM. Shared memory will not do the trick, most of the time.

Regarding controls, the game does offer a tutorial.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995659501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2400, 'last_played': 1648159518}
review:
I loved sg2  I enjoyed grabbing ships and exploring, this game has none of that.  honestly I was pretty excited for warlords. I bought it in early access and kept trying to play the game.  It just has nothing to really keep you playing.

Pros:
Game looks good, runs ok.
Sound is good, believable voices
Story was ok, ( what little part of it I saw).

That's really it for the pros:

Cons:
Boring as hell. You spend all of your time waiting for something to be built or for resources to come in.
Combat is just awful, the worst ship controls since 1999.  The computer npcs fly amazingly fast and with next to no lag or anything.  I found myself coming to a complete stop top simply target a ship
Quests are boring and repetative, it's the same crap over and over and over and the payouts suck. Makes it almost useless to grind quests
Crashes all the time and is loaded with bugs.  Last time I loaded the game, the screen was glitching randomly. It crashed 3 out of 5 attempts to load the game
No multiplayer, I know this wasn't offered when the game was developed. Come on with a game this boring and shallow. Having a friend helping with the grind would have made this fun
Nothing is explained. They show you how to land and how to buy stuff ( LOLOLOLOL).  That's it.  No explanation on invading areas around you or even how to get resources.
Limited weapons and ships.  I only found about 8 ships and about 4 weapons that were worth the money. Most of the ships are oddly shaped making them much easier for the enemy ai to hit.

I'd have to say pass on this game unless it's under 5 bucks. all these guys had to do was fix the combat and the godwaful flying mechanics and this game would have blown sg2 out of the park.  It feels inferior in almost every way to sg2. I'd get sg2 as it's just far superior in every way.  What a missed oppurtunity.

Thumbs down

author: {'steamid': '76561198007393417', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1543836369}
review:
EDIT: My official hours on this game are low, but I've been playing it offline for about 3 weeks... so probably more accurate game time is 40-50 hours).


Hmm... how should I say? It's kind of like Eve Online and Mount & Blade mated and had a space child...

Combat reminds me of Eve Online, free-roaming and missions remind me Mount & Blade (if it were in space). You can conquer planets and interact with them, but cannot land on there and walk around. AI Interactions are text-box with some voice acting.

You can conquer territory, capture enemy ships (and sell, collect or recruit them) you can build (or more like.. invest in pre-existing structures). You can command fleets and engage in massive battles. You can drive Titan-class ships or tiny gunboats. You can mine astroids, harvest gas, trade.

You can have some diplomacy with AI factions... Alliances, trade... that type of stuff. You can pirate and reave across the stars... you can attack giant ships and run away like a giggling child. You can wander the stars and look at the vastness of space.

The controls take a little getting used too but honestly... if your playing a space game not a point and click 2D RPG.

I recommend it, because I enjoyed my time here. It would have been nice if they absorbed a little more of the businessy side from X Rebirth (like building farms, factories, etc) but it's a small company and I'm glad they didn't bite off more than they can chew.... but I do hope they have more planned as DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964105298', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1533782484}
review:
Game launcher crashes 9/10 launch attempts.
Frustrating amount of grind.
Campaign is basically an extremely drawn out tutorial.
Campaign includes incredibly broken and frustrating stealth sections that will reset hours of progress.
Very weird and immersion breaking limitations like not being able to add owned ships to your fleet.
Absolutely the worst space ship controls I've ever used.

Not good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999109251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 8380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7508, 'last_played': 1534257657}
review:
I purchased Star Point Gemini Warlords around the release date and played through the storyline.  I have done another play through recently with the aim of grabbing as many achievements as I felt were in my reach.  While the base game play is enjoyable and I would recommend this game to anyone looking for something to sink in the hours, but there are definitely some quality of life shortcomings that made the end game a complete SLOG.

[h1]Aesthetics: Outstanding[/h1]
Graphics are beautiful.  The ship models, lighting, and texture work are fantastic.  It's a pretty game and I had no performance issues on my desktop with everything turned to max.  The UI is sleek and has a nice minimalist style.  The UI is however missing a lot of quality of life features that I will get to later.
[h1]Storyline: Mediocre - typical of most space games[/h1]
The storyline is poor compared to its prequel.  It's bland and has too many characters and locations that you don't care about.  It has decent voice acting and the game lets you travel to the storyline objective instantly at no cost which is a nice quality of life feature.  It is obvious that LGM were more focused on the overworld than on the game's story.

[h1]Core Gameplay: Good with caveats[/h1]
The gameplay loop is simple: you start in a station, fly off into space with a job or some personal goal, return to base, sell loot and upgrade with any profits.  So how does this loop feel?
Feels good for the most part.  Jobs are easy to come by and pay well, but you can only queue up one at a time.  This makes the route from the station to the job area and back the most common path.  And that's a terrible waste.  If you could queue multiple jobs then you might actually get to explore the space between jobs a bit.  
Combat is where the game shines with plenty of fun ships to fly and some pretty sizable fleet engagements.  The difference in size of ship classes feels incredible and is quite the spectacle when your fleet is all out brawling with an enemy.  Heavy weapons lack punch though and barely do damage even with endgame missiles.  Platforms mysteriously don't take damage if you're not 1500 range or less from them even though you have 6000 range and they're ridiculously tanky.  Platforms will murder AI ships because they don't close past that invulnerability range.  Also your AI ships will repeatedly ram into you while you're traveling on autopilot.
The upgrade system is beefy and with the best upgrades you can beat ships multiple classes above you making all the ships viable.  However, the UI does not make this easy.  There is very little explanation for certain game mechanics mentioned in the tool tips.  "This enhancement improves fighter damage by 50%."  Does that mean it only works on fighter weapons or does that 50% apply to all hangar weapon systems?  WHO KNOWS!?   "Damage amplifier increases weapon damage by 20%." Does that mean abilities like precision shot, does it include heavy weapons damage, or is this only a light weapons buff?  (It's only light weapons from what I've tested btw).  There are way too many of these ambiguous mechanics and while the UI tries to be helpful - it utterly fails.  Also there is no way to sort weapons by type or cost and that makes management of inventory or even searching for be best weapon a chore.

[h1]UI: Bad and tedious[/h1]
It's terrible when it comes to using it.  The UI does not tell you hotkeys.  Those 8 ability buttons on the bottom are begging to have their corresponding hotkeys shown.  Sure I can look up the keys in the options but they really should be accessible on hover.  The menus in the game do not respond to keyboard input at all so mouse navigation is the only option.  This wouldn't be too much of an issue, but when you have to click on an overworld map location, and then move your mouse ALLLLL the way to the bottom left to click confirm, it really becomes a drag when you have to do it to 12 civilian fleets at a time.  If you're a high level captain and decide to respec your skills, you will feel the pain of having a very un-ergonomic UI to fight against as you'll be spending 90% of your time just moving your mouse cursor to hit the out of the way "confirm" button.  

[h1]Overworld: Good with caveats[/h1]
The map is huge and gives you tons of places to go to.  Different areas have different kinds of fleet compositions and ambience.  Travel is seamless with no loading screen unless you are using a t-drive jump.  Even the asteroids have different models depending on region and some are downright beautiful.  Military fleet management is easy to handle and not headache inducing if you're not going into any of the menus for transferring ships.   I just wish the UI for handling civilian fleets more ergonomic (see complaints above) and the window for managing a fleet's composition also suffers the same QoL issues.  The AI factions are passive and will not put up a fight (diplomacy feels static) making the overworld lifeless as far as events and activity goes.  It feels like you're the only one that's alive and no one is going to fight you unless you declare war on them first.  If you want to play at your own pace, then this is fine, but it's never going to be a challenge.  I conquered the entire map and no one preemptively fought back against me.  Beating the map also rewarded me with a sudden cut scene with no sound so that feels like a bug as well.  

[h1]Encyclopedia: Bad and tedious[/h1]
Starpoint Gemini is a series with deep lore and it's a great thing to read and get to know.  It's a wonderful universe that I wish more people knew about and got into.  But the UI in the Geminipedia is once again terrible.  I wanted to collect all entries in this and read it on my own time, but the game doesn't give you any hints as to what you're missing and everything seems to be out of order.  And some sections are downright bugged, displaying obviously wrong entries.  The ship chassis section isn't showing the right lore for the ships selected, and there are what seem to be duplicate entries but are actually entries for different ships (i.e. You'll see two entries for Mogul.  They are actually for Mogul A and the other for Mogul B and you will not know which is associated with which as they're just listed as "Mogul").  I'm missing 1 ship chassis and I don't have any clue what it is because there isn't a way to sort them by name or class.  I don't even know how things get put into the Geminipedia.  Do I have to scan the thing or capture them?  I'm missing a faction entry but I conquered the entire map - where they wiped out in the overworld before I could communicate with them?  For any completionist, the Geminipedia is horrid.  It's so sad seeing this be neglected when there is so much good lore to be read.  

[h1]Conclusion: [/h1]
Starpoint Gemini Warlords is definitely a mixed bag for me.  The UI hasn't changed in the time span between my two playthroughs and it remains one of my biggest gripes about the experience.  It's an excellent game for fulfilling the casual desire to fly around in space doing small odds and ends with no goals in mind, but if you really want to get into the game and play around with the big overworld and finish the Geminipedia, the UI and the strange combat tuning will certainly get to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059075954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6527, 'last_played': 1547352227}
review:
เป็นเกมส์ อวกาศที่สนุก และมีอะไรให้ทำมากกว่าที่คิดเยอะเลย 

เอาจริงๆผมชอบตั้งแต่เราสามารถหาพักพวกที่เป็นตัวละคร warlord (อารมเหมือนแม่ทัพงะ) 
ซึ่งถ้าเราได้เขามาเราก้สามารถที่จะแยกยานบางส่วนในสังกัดเราให้ไปกับแม่ทัพและตั้งชื่อทีมได้ อารมเหมือน กองยาน 

แล้วมีหน่วยต่างๆอะไรแบบเนี่ย ถมสามารถสั่งการจัด รูปแบบการรบ ที่เหมือนจะเข้าใจยากแต่ผมว่ามันง่ายมากเลย 
และเรายังสามารถสั่งให้กองยานเราไปยึดพื้นท่ต่างโดยที่เราไม่ต้องไปเองได้อีกด้วย

อย่างระบบยึดยานศัตรู ให้มาเป็นยานใหม่ของเรา แถมเลือกได้ด้วยว่าจะแยกเป็นอะไหล่ หรือให้เป็นยานลูกน้อง

แถมระบบการยึดพื้นที่แต่ละส่วนของ จักรวาลก้เว้นช่องมาให้เข้าใจง่าย แถมถ้าเรายิ่งยึด ความสัมพันกับเจ้าของที่ก้จะตกลง แต่เราก้สามารถที่จะเจรจาให้ทางนั้นเลืกโกรธ เราได้ถ้าหากเราอัพสกิลเน้นเจรจา

หรือไม่ว่างๆก้ทำเทรดรัน รับของจากดาวนึงไปขายอีกดาว ไม่ก้นั่งหาร้านค้าลับที่จะมาเป็นสัญญานปริศนา 

บางทีก้อาจจะไปสู้ในสนามแข็ง gladiatrix area เอาเงินรางวัลก้ได้ คือมันมีไรให้เยอะมากงะ

แต่เอาจริงๆที่มผมชอบสดก้น่าจะเป็น เรื่องของการล่าค่าหัว คือแบบบอสแต่ละตัวเราดูถูกมันไม่ได้เยอะ แต่ละตัวก้อย่กันต่างที่ 
และแนะนำถ้าใครชอบที่จะล่าหัวบอส คือคุณซื้อ DLC Deadly dozen เลย เพราะมันจะมีบอสกับยานใหม่ๆโผล่มาเพียบให้คุณยิ่งไม่เบื่อเข้าไปอีก
แถมถ้าฆ่าบอสสูงสุดตาย เราก้จะได้ยานของตัวบอสมาใช้ด้วยดีสัตๆ

author: {'steamid': '76561198056783258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7884, 'last_played': 1589713382}
review:
Starpoint Gemini Warlords is a great game from Little Green Men Games. The graphics are outstanding and the performance is excellent. It includes a wide variety of ships that you can purchase and fly. Enemies abound and combat is frequent.

You can earn money in a variety of ways. Capturing ships is one of my favorites. You can also prospect, trade and send out civilian ships to perform tasks. The Job Board has numerous jobs available to earn cash.

Modding is fully supported and LGM continues to improve on this. Steam’s Workshop offers many mods to choose from or you can make your own.

The LGM dev team answers questions quickly and thoroughly. They will also use your suggestions to help make the game better.

My only complaint is the lack of joystick support. It seems strange that the game has been out for over a year without adding the ability to use joysticks. Some people can get them to work and others can’t. Controllers are a little better with some support available.

All in all, if you love space games, I would highly recommend Warlords.

review: One of the worst games I have ever played. If you looking poorly designed game play and impossible odds then this is for you. Campaign mode offers fights that are literally impossible due to the fact they send you out undermanned and under equipped. Obviously I cant fight three large class ships in a small. Not just once, but every time you'll face this rediculousness. Game isnt worty 5 dollars let alone $30. author: {'steamid': '76561198040421250', 'num_games_owned': 19550, 'num_reviews': 743, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1531554334}
review:
I was looking forward to trying this game and I wasn't disappointed.
It's a third person (spaceship third person) RPG with 4x strategy and not only are the graphics fantastic but there is so much to do. You can pilot your own ship or order your own fleet. You have a garage tab you can fill with ships to pilot. There is free roam mode where you can delve into all the features and do what you want or there is story mode which is a mixture of both and when you finish the story you continue your game in free roam mode. There are all sorts of upgrades for your ships, trading and mercenary missions, and basically everything you would want in this type of game.
Making money to start buy all the upgrades and perks was also pretty easy too, as you can see in the video, and sometimes these games can be hard to navigate and confusing but this one was quite easy to figure out so I was able to get into the gameplay quickly.
I played it for nearly three hours and it's plain to see that I have only scratched the surface of what it has to offer making the $35 price of entry really good value, it's just a shame I have to move onto other games. I think I will put this one on my "Games I'd Play" list on my curation page for a rainy day.
They have also added the Steam Workshop feature so there is a nice range of community made bonus to enjoy.
Head to the following link to view my video.....
https://youtu.be/Ltcld-M4Xc8
Thanks for watching, please like, subscribe and comment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979541245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1503, 'last_played': 1531166613}
review: It plays sort of like Mount and Blade in space, which is nice. The gameplay is a lot quicker than X3 (not to mention easier to master), but there is still quite a lot to do. Conquering the entire map is going to take you a while. The core gameplay loop is fun I'd say, except it can occasionally feel slow (especially if you haven't figured out fast ways to make money, such as capturing other ships). All in all, I'd say get it if you enjoy space combat. It does that very well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005689168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1530812777}
review:
Another title where we really need a "maybe" button.  Total playtime was around 20 hours including offline time.

I really tried to like Warlords and while I don't hate the game I don't think I can suggest it.  Overall, the game does a passable job of most things (graphics, controls, sound, story, combat, etc) but there lies the problem.  Everything just feels passable vs anything being really good.  Sure the game has RPG and 4X elements but they feel shallow IMO compared to other offerings.

The game deserves credit for blending RPG, 4X, Flight sim mechanics together but at the end of the day I felt bored since none of the individual pieces actually pulled me in.  I kept playing because I knew the game was supposed to be good rather than actually being pulled in.  Ultimately, playing made me want to go and play other games that actually shine at the individual elements (IE:  actually go play a 4X or fire up X3 again for space combat, etc).

I want to be clear, the game is NOT bad but I just cant suggest it based on my taste and the reasons I explain above.  Maybe I will revisit it in the future with mods, etc but for now I am going to need to look elsewhere to scratch that space gameplay itch.

For some people that ok with a combination of somewhat watered down gameplay aspects this may be an amazing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971562414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1302, 'last_played': 1531184119}
review:
This is a HUGE improvement over the previous title in the series.

I tried the last game in this series and I didn't like it much.  Felt too easy to spam consumables.  The environmental damage all over the place was annoying.  I also did not find the graphics to be to my taste and a big part of games like this is how bad ass your ship looks.  

All of that is dramatically improved in this game and plus you have a whole new fleet/region management system.  This is just a great game to kick back, relax, drink a beer and roam around doing whatever suits your fancy at the moment while admiring your cool looking ship.  

The only minor complaint I have is that the customization system for ships should allow you to paint the predefined color sections with a single click like a paint bucket tool.  Painting with a brush is just too time consuming.

If you measured games purely in how much entertaining playtime you can get per dollar spent, I think this game would score very highly since there are many things to do and the price is very modest especially on the sales and package deals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008475726', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2233, 'last_played': 1561105621}
review: Nie wiem czy mam wygórowane wymagania czy ta gra jest strasznie uboga tylko udając, że ma bogatą zawartość. Elementy RPG są strasznie słabe i przejaskrawione, tłumaczenie polskie ma wiele błędów. Walki bardzo szybko się nudzą. Ekonomia jest na poziomioe gier z 98 roku. Dowodzenie flotą ogranicza się do "leć tam na niedokładnej mapie świata" lub leć za mną. Nie można konfigurować floty. Słowem: jest cała masa rzeczy do bólu uproszczonych. Gra zdecydowanie nie jest dla fanów serii X. Jednak gra zadowoli tych, którzy nie lubią zbyt skomplikowanych gier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181980667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3525, 'last_played': 1531041093}
review:
Its a good game, but it does have its problems. 

Positives:
*Ships looks nice (and you have a lot of them)
*Ui to move units on map is clean enogh and easy to use
*Background is pretty nice
*Able to color your ships
*Lots of missions
*Mining is simple and easy to do (unlike other games)
*Ship can go in all directions (i hate games where you cant go up and down with spaceship)
*Landing on planets (just to sell and buy stuff) -- not many space games do that

Negatives:
*Ship combat sucks -- it took me a while to figure out usefull settings and keybind them to make combat less frustating
*Ships in combat move to fast --- like a x-3 scout fast...makes it pointless to aim
*Weapon range for the size of ships is to small (they should do it like with rebel galaxy when the range on weapons increase with the size of ship)
*I cant see my weapons fireing at all (there is also a anoying bug that disables your auto-fire)
*Shield location defense on ship is weird -- it should have shields on top and under to make sense (or they could just make it into one single shield)
*Ship upgrade ui problems --) Sometimes UI on sensors just dissapears (also its hard to see what upgrades you already have, i wish the text with upgrade would be green and not just on side icon)
*When you are buying a new ship you dont see all the stats 
*Exploration is not rewarded -- as soon as you enter a red teritory you will get instantly swarmed by enemy (i find it retarded) -- random spawn enemy is more of a hassle
*To many factions and not enogh alien races (just humans -- ugh)
*Weak story
*Resorces feel a bit unbalanced compared how a player obtains them
*Its very easy to break the game just doing weapon smuggling betwen 2 planets and it makes missions pointless
*You cant make a fleet of traders (to manualy buy and sell from a far), only a automatic resorce trades (but those dont make money)
*Diplomacy betwen 2 factions is to simple (i can ask for peace, when i never engaged that pirate faction ever)
*It takes forever to build anything and you cant expand till you get at least a destroyer as any other ship you fly will get instantly destroyed when you try to expand
*Titan ships are breaking the game engine and can cause crash (and only good for mining realy)


I recomend this game for players who are more into strategy space sims games, but i dont recomend to players who like exploration like in x games.
Personaly this game reminds me of a Rise and fall civilizations. (just expanded on 4x strategy lvl)

author: {'steamid': '76561198123267209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1609680321}
review:
普段、コントローラ主体で遊んでいる人のレビューです
フルコントローラーサポートと表記されていますが、あれはうそ
マニュアルを見れば判るんですが、一部の機能はマウスなりキーボードなりから動作しなければならず
正直言うと、部分的コントローラーが正解
動作も無理やりエミュレートさせているような印象で、お世辞にもさくさくうごくとはいえません
ならばこの際、キーボード+マウス操作に慣れてしまおうとおもったんですが
機能が豊富過ぎて、とても扱いづらい印象。
日本語訳は若干の硬さを感じるものの、誤訳もなく素晴らしいのだけれど
操作性の悪さからゲームが思い通り先に進まないのが難点
今後のバージョンアップに期待しつつ、しばらくは積みゲーになりそうです

review: 本人是群星和fracture space的玩家，这款游戏的设计完美的拥有了以上2个我很喜欢的游戏特点，但是我觉得这个游戏有个很大的缺陷导致了我退款，这个宇宙的画面太动画了一点，没有给我足够的代入感，没有·一种飞船真正在群星中穿梭的感觉，让人觉得飞船飞行的时候很无聊，有点出戏的感觉。希望制作者再接再厉，我很喜欢你们的游戏模式，可是可以把画面做的在精美一点吗？如果改进了画面的话，我相信这个游戏会非常好玩的

author: {'steamid': '76561198031234768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 12066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5660, 'last_played': 1703186056}
review:
If space strategy games are your thing, rather than space dog fights, then this is the game for you.  With a large map, and variety of ships, it's a great game.

I've put 67 hours into it so far, and still not got a complete play thru yet, though I must admit I'm doing loads of missions, trying out loads of ships, and enjoying every minute of it.

Obviously no game is all things to all people, but this one certainly gave me a good investment return on my purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993590661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 7576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7576, 'last_played': 1530105472}
review:
A pretty good mashup on the whole flying around in space/conquor the universe genres.

There's a lot to like here, with the story being servicable, if not fantastic, to the perks available to customize your character, to the fact you can ever so slowly start to take over the galaxy and rule it with an iron paw of doom! Dooooom!

The ships on offer are similar enough each tier that you can usually find a couple of styles you'll enjoy flying around in without sacrificing much (if anything )in the way of performance.  Combat is decent, this isn't Tie Fighter where having a flightstick is going to be mandatory, but being able to pew pew the pirates and other pesky people who cross your path is still fun hours into the game.  There's a number of options with the weapons as to how you want to turn your enemies into ionized gas, and the ability to research tech to improve not only your ship but your empire's capabilities is a nice touch.
The fact they allow and encourage folks to mod the game is a huge plus.

I'd really love to see this title fleshed out more in future games (Assuming there are more) as having different factions on offer, with various poliitcal aspirations and even differing perks on who you start or side with having more of an impact would be pretty cool. This is defintely a game where you can see the framework of a good building here, and hope they build bigger and better for future iterations.

There's also some stuff that really wears thin after a while.  Your followers/allies careening around like drunken pinball imitators would be my personal biggest pet peeve. You set a course, jump to crusing speed and a rogue ally comes flying off from a weird angle and decides that a ship to ship headbutt was definitely in order.  Thank the gods there's no collision damage or this'd be upgraded to a huge dealbreaker.
Level progression feels far too fast in the early stages with your character earning ranks in just a mission or two while rewards do little to help keep pace with the upgrades available.  You can now fly a larger ship class? Great, good luck having the creds to afford it.  I found myself having to skip every other ship tier just so I could afford the occasional new kit.

Overall a fair and fun title if you're into the whole trucking around in space, with some light empire management thrown in for good measure that's provided some solid entertainment and leaves me wanting much more down the line in future releases.  The fact there's modding available is also a very nice positive. Kudos!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005987662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3387, 'last_played': 1529908183}
review:
I reccommend this game but it is quite a bit different than starpoint gemini 2.

First, most of the DLC's provide alternate beginnings and not enhancements to the main campaign.  Only the deadly dozen and Titans Return add to the main story line.  I highly recommend that you go through the campaign first and then try one of these alternates.

Visually this is a beautiful game until you go to the map.  I've a bit color weak so the yellows and greens chosen are almost identical to me.  This is a problem that has been in all of their games from the first one.  If you scroll out the areas will now have the symbol of the ruling group so you can tell the difference.

You have the ability to create a fleet of ships.  You want to take them with you everywhere you go.  There is no option to hire mercs like in Starpoint Gemini 2.  Many other areas will provide you with a fleet of ships to add to your fleet for sufficient resources.  It is really easy to accidentally deselect your fleet and end up somewhere without your support.  Always save before using a warp gate and check once you arrive.

You will spend most of your time trying to maximize your resource gathering, Whether it be by upgrading providers in your area of influence (best) or by harvesting gas pockets, anomalies, asteroids, or ship remains (not as good).  This is one of the main motivations to take over an area.  There is a huge need for these resources to build fleets, build enhancements to your base space station, and to research practically everything.  But if you spend all your time in managing resources you will miss notifications of enemy fleets who try to take over your space stations or forward bases.  You can take control of an area and its resources but enemy fleets will try to get them back unless you hunt down these fleets and destroy them first.  It can be exhausting.

If all you want to do is free roam you'd be better off keeping to Starpoint Gemini 2.

You don't have to be a ruthless expansionist.  You can make peace with certain neighbors.  Not everyone is initially antagonistic to you.  I only took over areas that were hostile to me and coexisted with the rest of the map just fine.

Ships get much larger by class.  A carrier ship will dwarf a corvette.  Titans are so large that if you scroll out enough to see the ship, you won't be able to see your weapons firing.  Getting to at least a destroyer is key.  My favorite ship class was the Dreadnaught.  Titans are practically invulnerable but they steer like a cow.  Make sure you have at least 200 million in the bank before you transfer command to a titan or you will not be able to have the same load out and enhancements as before.

It took me 35 hours to get  a dreadnaught fully tricked out and complete all the research and perk loads I wanted.  I don't think it could have been done much faster.  Travel is harder because most of the Gates are inactive, but it doesn't cost anything to use the ones that are open.  Using Tdrives is very easy but expensive.  I always had better places to spend my money.

Warlords is much more stable than Gemini 2.  Still there were a handful of crashes to desktop.  Save often.  I revolve through 5 saves so I don't have to worry.

Warlords is Gemini 2 with conquest, resource management, and research.  If all that sounds great to you then you should like this game very much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198244146346', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 18253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10770, 'last_played': 1533059899}
review:
Давно искал Freelancer но с современной графикой и с не такой линейной игрой и наконец нашел.
плюсы:
- графика радует глаз, любителям поаутировать в космосе самое то
- большой выбор кораблей разных фракций и назначений
- Элементы стратегии при покорении карты
- Большой выбор побочных заданий 
- Локация огромна, до сих пор половину не осилил
- Свобода выбора чем зарабатывать бабки
- Музыка хороша, не напрягает 
минусы
- Интеллект врагов уровня овоща - хотя при такой динамике тяжелых кораблей (уровня утюга в ванной) непонятно как они должны его (интеллект) показывать
- Треков музыки маловато все таки
- Система присоединения/отсоединения кораблей от твоей армии бесит - часто отваливаются целым флотом просто потому что чекнул на карте, что там у них во флоте
- Видов основных вооружений всего 3, хотя подтипов множество (но вид у всех как у одного из 3)
- Русификация есть, но довольно топорная. 
- Слишком быстрая прокачка уровня из-за чего 3/4 кораблей даже не успеваешь потестить, и пол-игры катаешь на самом жирном, так как у него превосходство по всем параметрам кроме подвижности.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984943731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1477, 'last_played': 1538866042}
review:
My personal EVE Offline.

This is one of my favorite games. A successor to one of my other favorite games, Starpoint Gemini 2, this game improves in a lot of ways. The UI is more clean and intuitive, the freelance missions are worthwhile, getting around is easier, and the empire management is relatively simple but fun.

I love spaceship games, but I struggle to find ones where you control capital ships with an exterior camera. Most spaceship games are like flying jets in a cockpit, and that's just not my cup of tea. While this game does still have a couple things that irk me, by and large, it's a great spaceship sim that one can sink many hours into.

Highly recommended!

review:
Control is a bit different but much more simple than games like X4 or ED.

Pros:Tons of well designed ships in different styles are always the best part of SPG series.Also they provided a deep background story and many interesting factions.
Cons:They didn't COMBINE the advantages above well.Simply it's a spaceship stimulater + space txt adventure game.
The main story is mehh. Only 8 character and 4 factions are involved throughout the story.Other factions differ only in icons and they do nothing but wait for your conquer. So lame.

Edit:They should release this game as a SPG3 instead of the 'SPG gunship' now...

author: {'steamid': '76561198080977663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2926, 'last_played': 1529157009}
review:
Un jeu qui aurait pu être énorme mais qui manque d'ambition. C'est juste un "bon" jeu de space opéra 4X.

Graphisme : 3,5/5. Pas exceptionnel mais le job est fait.

Son : 3,5/5. Comme les graphismes.

Gameplay : 3/5. Aurait pu être exceptionnel mais finalement on reste sur sa faim, dommage. Finalement il n'y a pas tant de choses à faire que ça et c'est assez répétitif. La dimension tactique est assez limitée, en cause une IA des années 90.... La stratégie est elle aussi assez limitée. L'exploration peut-être poussée mais il n'y a rien de grandiose à découvrir, toujours les mêmes choses.

Rejouabilité : 1/5. Quand on l'a fini, on ne veut plus y rejouer.

Immersion : 2,5/5. Assez bonne au départ mais elle se dissipe assez rapidement dû à des longueurs dans le jeu et à cause de l'aspect répétitif.

Difficulté : 3/5. J'ai joué dans le mode par défaut et je n'ai eu aucune difficulté à avancer. Un brin trop facile. Dans le pire des cas si vous êtes bloqués, un peu de farm et le tour est joué.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060656659', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1606290601}
review:
I like this game, it has nice visuals and such, but I recently tried to reinstall it on my (Relatively) new laptop and it crashed in the character creation screen, I relaunched it then it promply crashed my laptop as a whole and I believe it's damaged my Hard Drive.

For those curious, Win10 64bit, GTX 1050, 16GB RAM, latest Nvidia Drivers with latest Windows Update (14/06/2018), laptop has been virus free and relatively clean, and I excercise extreme caution when browsing ever since I got it 6 months ago, so I know it's not a virus problem.

So with that said, I personally can't recomend it, but as a whole, it's a pretty ok game, sadly I never got the chance to fully experience it, first time I played it I only played it for 3 hours moved on and my Desktop promptly kicked the bucket for unknown reasons, and second time? well, it crashed my laptop.
developer_response:
Hello Kor'thara,

I'm sorry you had this issues you've described. Not sure how that happened, you're the first person who's hard drive crashed because of this game. 

Feel free to contact us on e-mail: 	customersupport@starpointgemini.com so we can take a look what's goin' on with crashes. 

Best regards

author: {'steamid': '76561198006220306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1836, 'last_played': 1528949467}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970908064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5213, 'last_played': 1527468181}
review:
After almost 90 hours of play I thought its time to review.

The game is a good 'filler' game, one to play when your bored stiff of everything else in your library.  It will draw you in for a few days then let you go again as it can get a bit repetative and make you want to play something else for a while.   Its very easy to drop in and out of,  and you dont  have to spend ages trying to figure out what you were doing last time you played, which I like.

Is it worth almost £30 quid?  I have to say yes, as Ive already spent close to 90 hours playing and will probably spend 30-40 hours more with it before it goes to the library graveyard of titles I dont play anymore, but Id have to say its only just worth the price.  If you can get it on sale, snap it up.
