author: {'steamid': '76561198000177587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2122, 'last_played': 1520974773}
review:
This game was fun for the first 5 hours into it, but then it got insanely repetitive and awkward. Also, it felt more like an arcade game, where if I was being attacked, for some reason, there was a timer... this is a problem which i'll list going forward with this review.

1. Missions - (ARCADE STYLE) at first, it's fun to tackle new problems and trying to solve them. But the problem continued to be the same, no variations of these tasks at all. I don't really find a problem with this, because it would be a difficult thing to make a game to have missions that becomes completely unique to the player's experience. So the repetitive of this nature, I can forgive, but these elements made it feel more like an arcade game, rather than a warlord making rational and reasonable decisions to conquer a galaxy. Also, the missions themselves do nothing to push forward the games progress. Why did I hunt these pirates, only to see when i return to HQ, it's under attack? what's more unbelievable is that I'll enter the HQ with enemies surrounding it, and when I leave, their gone... No continuity, which made me suspect this game was designed to be an arcade game.

2. Resources and upgrades -(Too pitiful for words)  In order to conquer, you need resources to build a fleet and upgrade to a better ship. In order to obtain more resources you either have to farm them, or upgrade infrastructure to output more resources. I have no problem with this concept, however it's the rate of which it can reasonably be done is ludicrous. The hours I spent just farming resources just to upgrade, only to realize the NEXT upgrade was going to take 4x the amount literally started putting me off. I also conquered a good amount of territory, but the amount of resources that each area gives is just too pitiful for words. All that effort to build a fleet, and the sacrifice they made... to get 100 more per week of a much needed and desparate resource? ARE YOU FU*KING KIDDING ME?? So I thought, ok... maybe i need more territories, maybe THAT will fix my income, maybe i'm just complaining about nothing, I upgraded the infrastructures as well and conquered more territory. The amount of resources gained is still paltry and meager to the cost needed to conquer it. #notworth, #regert. I can't upgrade my gathering power without the research, I can't research without resources. I can't upgrade resource gathering, without upgrading infrastructure. I can't upgrade infrastructures without research. I can't gain the upgraded research without resources... Do you see my point??

3. Dialog - (This was torture) People interact, talk to each other, and have fun and sometimes you just want to kill each other. However, whenever doing a mission or docking into a station, it's the same damn dialog. And what's worse, it's really awkward. "Hope your battles are short, and your stay on Concordia long"... Seriously!? No one on the development team thought this wasn't awkward?? WHO in HELL would phrase it like this?? Did a middle schooler write your scripts for you guys? And this is only one example of bad dialog throughout the game. "God Speed Captain" would've been slightly better. But to be fair, I didn't play this game for the dialog, it's just something i had to mention because it was literal torture to hear it. I almost opted to just staying in space forever without docking... rearm? repair? awkward dialog? nah, i'm good. thanks bro!

4. Ships/weapons - (Money problems) One of the best way to increase your firepower, is to upgrade your ships, better weapons, and apply enhancements. But WHY is my level outpacing my ability to upgrade my ships?? Also, WHY is there such a HUGE CAP(money) in order to do so? So, without complaining I decided to solve this problem and farm ships, missions, and once I got a freighter, off world trading(this is also another problem which I will discuss) Saved enough resources for a warp gate near HQ, and starting selling fertilizer to Thauria. Did it enough times, to save up to a titan. Which increased my ability to make EVEN MORE money... it's just too bad that at that point... I was already fully upgraded as possible so any more money earned would be pointless only enough to buy ships, upgrades and items. No victory in such accomplishments... Was fun though to watch those puny little ships trying to destroy mine, their kinda my heroes for not running away.

5. Economy and Trading - (Static economy) Ok so this is the problem. I needed money, And so I dealt with it the way i knew how in 4x games; trading, and conquering. The game simply has no concept of supply and demand. Example - Concordia sells fertilizers, but they only carry about 380~ for about 4.5k each. I bought 4,500 just by redocking...(where the hell were they hiding their supply?) AND THEN, I sold it to Thauria for about 9.3k each. Price did not drop or rise, did not fluctuate, NOTHING. The economy is literally dead in the game. No point in worrying about how much your buying, which at first i did worry thinking it would add much needed substance to the game. Nope, denied.

6. Not casual friendly. well technically, every problem i listed would actually make this game EXTREMELY unfit for casual players. good luck making money >.> Your only chance is to trick unsuspecting players (like myself) to buy this game, thinking it would be hours upon hours of fun. Felt more like a chore... I HATE CHORES!

7. Mount and blade reference - no... just no... it is NOT like mount and blade... but in space. Stop making that comparison.. At least the 'search and destroy' mission in that game is because of REAL consequences/actions of the bandits that were already ON THE MAP attacking caravans and/or peasants. Even if you can't see them in the fog of war, it's still there... doing their thing, attacking caravans and stuff.

Anyway, the game feels arcade-like, no economy, too much grind, not enough reward, and even then, victories feel hollow. For the problems listed above made me think this was not a 4x game, let alone a strategy game. It's undeserving of that title, AND they should take it off their description because I felt insulted after investing 30 hours into the game.
Anyway, entry into the game, it was fun to play at first, but the longer you play, you start to realize the fundamental issue with this game being called 4x/strategy. RPG? maybe... Overall? less then 'meh'.

Long Story short, would not recommend to any players looking to play this for the 4x/strategy aspect of the game. looking for a fun space arcade game better than space invaders? yep this is pretty decent at that.

Edit - I forgot to add the timer thing... why is there a timer for fleet battles? especially when I hover it, it says only 1 corvette against my 8 battleships........................................................................ Yep, i mean, it only takes me 10secs to destroy a corvette, but I guess I see your point of 8 battleships having a hard time defeating 1 corvette in a reasonable amount of time... make sense game. good logic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048370087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1571764130}
review:
ich find das spiel toll zur abwechslung weil man es einfach mit dem gamepad zocken kann. leider verliert es storytechnisch etwas an fahrt wenn man mal die ersten grundsätze verstanden hat und man bekommt ziemlich viel zu tun was taktisches vorgehen aus der herscher perspektive notwendig macht. grafisch dürfte man leider etwas mer erwarten und man komuniziert per comik bilder also keine bewegten charakter was eigentlich nicht weiter schlimm ist aber mit der herrscherperspektive etwas lasch daher kommt und die grafik macht das dan so schnell nicht wieder weg. 

aber im grossen und ganzen kann man es super zocken es ist einfach nicht das spiel wo man 700 stunden top unterhaltung hat sondern einfach zufrieden wieder mal rangeht und für eine zeit abschalten kann.

ok - so einfach lässt sich dieses spiel mit dem gamepad nicht spielen. habe so 3 wochen pausiert und echt schwierigkeiten wieder in die steuerung rein zu finden.

ok - mir fehlt halt in spacesimulationen meistens die kockpitaussicht, und bei mir bugt die turret ansicht. auf so einer brücke zu stehen wäre schon toll.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005607237', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 3014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2294, 'last_played': 1522454054}
review:
J'aime bien ce Starpoint,
Il est peut-être un peu en dessous du 2, mais globalement c'est un bon jeu.
Histoire sympa, les côté explo, trade, combat etc.. sont toujours plaisants, même il y a un côté répétitif dans les moments ou il faut faire de l'argent.
Mais comme il y a plusieurs manière d'en faire, on peut ne pas s'ennuyer (Gladiatrix, Trade, missions et biesur abordage)
Le côté Stratégie est sympa aussi, même en mode story on peut faire un peu ce qu'on veut, il faut juste attendre que l'histoire avance pour que les options soit débloquées au fur et à mesure.

Un bon jeu pour ceux qui ont aimé les SPG.
Pour le nouveaux, vous pouvez commencer par le 2. 
Sur celui-ci, il n'y a que 2 DLC qui s'activent en mode story, pas besoin de tous les acheter.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967685401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1665423836}
review:
This is an odd one. Think Mount and Blade mixed with Star Trek - Online/Rebel Galaxy.

So you start off in a small ship and can trade, fight or think your way to fame and fortune. Except it doesn't end there. Unlike most space games, this title adds a bit of empire management. So the grind pays off with a sort of 4x light where you can lead your fleet around blowing stuff up. Like Mount and Blade, the actual strategic portion of the game is fairly light. However, this is a clear case of the whole sum of parts being far better than they have any right to be.

In this super niche of niche genre's, you have exactly two titles the X series,( I reccomend X3:TC or X2.) and this. Both games are part of a long running series, and it really shows in the lore, setting, and overall feel. One thing alot of people don't really understand about the space sim genre... its it's very, VERY grindy. That's the point. Even Elite Dangerous and EVE are mind-numbingly grindy. Blowing up spaceships can get tedious. Then again, the payoff is a huge ship, or in this case a huge ship and an empire.

Starpoint Gemini Warlords has combat that was more exciting in Rebel Galaxy, a light 4x element that was done better in Master of Orion 2, and a grind and story that was done better in Freelancer. So what exactly does it offer? All those things in one. I'm already horribly addicted, I can't wait to get my first Battleship, or take my next sector. I can't wait to hunt bounties, and get in some rediculously large firefights. There is ALWAYS something to do, and even if you've done it a thousand times before, its pushing you towards your own goals. Its a fantastic sandbox game with a rediculous amount of content, some awesome themed DLC's, a beareable story, and some amazing developers.

Those Developers? They started out with a typical Freelancer clone, and based on player feedback created a whole new game with an empire to manage on top of said Freelancer clone. These guys are amazing. Patches are coming down the pipe, and content keeps getting added. If nothing else support some excellent game developers. I cannot recommend this game enough. This game is truly a work of passion, and if you are a fan of the X series, but want something far more arcadey and a bit lighter for after work.. well you won't go wrong here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019939545', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2908, 'last_played': 1635184545}
review: 10/10 very fun game that brings the nostalgia of other similar titles of the past. Rather than being blatant copying though, it truly adds its own to the genre, visually appealing, fun game play, and the pro's of building your own empire the previous titles didn't have. I even bought the console version as soon as I saw it, and expecting a poor port and wonky controls, it was just as much fun to play on xbox one as it is on pc.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972187762', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1520882524}
review:
Kurz und knapp, top Spiel!

meine Meinung zu einigen Reviews hier:

- das Spiel verdient mehr positive Bewertungen
- und einen höheren score als 73 (83 oder mehr)
- wer die Steuerung nicht schnallt hat sich damit nicht beschäftigt, dies ist 3D Spacegame/Shooter und nicht Moorhuhn
- man hat die Wahl diverser Kamera und Steuerungsmodi, außerdem kann man die Türme eigenständig feuern lassen
- Tastenzuweisung anschauen hilft

pros:
- machbare Steuerung mit vielen Modi
- Fülle an Schiffen und Waffen (DLCs noch mehr)
- sehr coole Designs
- sinnvolle und gute DLCs (Seltenheit heut zu Tage)
- stimmiges Gameplay
- der Mix aus Steuerung der eigenen Flotten/anderer Flotten über die Karte und fliegen im Schiff ist gut gelungen

Kritik:
- die Story ist keine Story, sondern ein langes Tutorial
- die deutsche Übersetzung richtig machen oder bleiben lassen
- lange nicht alle Tasten im Tutorial vorgestellt
- Handel hat etwas zu wenig Substanz

author: {'steamid': '76561198007312110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2806, 'last_played': 1522520206}
review:
Love the Game and the developer.  I basically can sum up this game by stating it is what a Star Trek game should be.  You have a capital ship which you navigate and a fleet which you can command.  You can go solo or have an all out battle.

The conquest part of the game is something that has been missing in a lot of games now days.

I really enjoy it and you can tell the developers care; which makes the glitches (not many I've encountered) sort of ok because they're actually doing something about it.  Very big plus.

Pick up SPGII too if you like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018371850', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1520202213}
review:
I know I havnt played much but Im just struggling to get over how dated it all feels and looks.

The graphics appear to be a decade old, the UI looks like something out of a PC gamer demo disc from 2006, the controls are clunky and often unresponsive and the voices are wooden.

The idea is great, open rpg like space world, so I will push through and see if theres anything here. The obvious comparison is freelancer (Which has aged better than this 'new'game) but I cant see it yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052715527', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1520308139}
review:
Generally, I play a game for a couple of hours and then come back to it the next day or even a couple of days later.
IMO, Starpoint Gemini is not a game that can be played in that manner.
The controls are to difficult to use and remember if you do not spend a lot of time playing.
Even though I bought this game on sale, I doubt I will continue to try and play due to the above.
If you have lots of time to spend playing, this probably is a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993406475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4347, 'last_played': 1700548261}

author: {'steamid': '76561198215461792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 257, 'playtime_forever': 5992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5992, 'last_played': 1520523715}
review:
I have had a few technical issues with this game and that has to an extent clouded my enjoyment. Firstly the games control system is appauling so get ready for a long boring key rebinding session even then your ship will fly badly until you get to grips with the less is more way you need to fly in this game it takes a while.Another thing i didnt like was the in game music easily dealt with of course but annoying none the less next time guys try finding a decent composer please.
Now on to the game itself theres a ton of fun here the main story characters look so ridiculous thouigh i was laughing all through the supposedly serious story for god sakes guys does everyone have to be so ugly and wear red plastic 1980s jump suits lmao.ok ok enough complaining nearly....... theres one issue ther best ships can cost 150 million credits few missions pay more than half a million do you see where this is going......someone please make a stupidly rich parents mod please.
 The base building empire management part of the game is great i love it but again i wish you could chose how your base looked im not a huge fan of star bases that look like a motorway petrol station ...just saying.
Space itself looks good but not awesome in this game but you do get emmersed.
I would recomend buying this game only if you played the first game and loved it you definately dont want to buy this game as an entry into the series.
The developers are fantastic people warm friendly and super helpful and theres tons of bang for your buckin this one big thumbs up inspite of my moaning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003764717', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 2806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2784, 'last_played': 1520115418}
review:
bought this because many people said it was like Mount & Blade: warband in space...and is sorta.

yes you build an army and take territory but depending on how strong each member of the army is, makes the size of the group smaller. you can have dozens of gunships but only around 15ish cruisers (compairing to have 300+ top teir soldiers in M&B) after you max out concordia fleet size but before you start taking terriroty to increase it further. 

the battles are fun but it's less fulfilling than winning in M&B. here you fire lasers or torpedos til the enemy ship is blows up, and it's really just that over and over again. the large fleet battles are very cool. i only wish there was some notification when one of your ships are destoryed.

over all i liked it. can't say i'll take the time to take over the rest of the map but i did enjoy the story.

developer_response: 你好MirrorMasker，感谢评论！我们意识到了之前的汉化版本有严重的问题，去年拿到汉化文本时我们还没有能力对其进行校对，因此对玩家造巨大困扰，我们深表歉意。一个月前我们开始了一些优化升级的工作，包括修复了征战模式（剧情和教程）下的大部分汉化问题，并且重新翻译了最新的DLC：努米比亚之崛起并对游戏世界观做了新的的补充说明，以及新加了不少操作提示等等。这些优化和修复会随着本周的一次更新一同到来，我们会继续优化并且更加重视中文游戏的体验，希望您能继续支持我们并向我们提供反馈。谢谢！

author: {'steamid': '76561198013328690', 'num_games_owned': 683, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 6838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2686, 'last_played': 1613263582}
review:
Sadly i missed when the game left early access despite quite liking both Starpoing Gemini 1 and 2.
Nevertheless i got hooked quite fast again and bought the core game aswell as all the available dlcs.
In most regards SGWarlords is overall a fast improvement over SG2, the story is more focused, grafics are more beautifull
and there are a many more improvements all over the place.

But where the game realy outclasses similiar games is the strategy component that has been added ontop of the already pretty good space sim. Think Mount and Blade Warband in space and you get a pretty good picture. 

Just like in SG1 and 2 you fly always bigger ships, from Gunships over Corvetts till you hit Dreadnoughts and Carriers (or Titans), but the brilliance in Warlords comes from your ability to command whole fleets, craft, upgrade, research and even engange some small-scale diplomacy...all in a completly open map.

You build up your empire, expand your fleets, command civilian fleets (which sort of act like your normal strategy game workers) all on a 2D representation of the game-world all while still having all (more) the game play SG2 already offered.
You still level your captain up through a fast perk- and skill-system and take on an expanded roster of freelance missions or engange in the slighty better story.
The story, while still not winning any prizes in my book, is quite better than in SG1 and 2. It's more focused (if that makes any sense) and you get tons of lore everywhere on the side. 

Some old features (which have already been expanded) work billiantly with the new strategy- and empirebuilding-
component:

boarding of hostile ships for example. Now you don't just have the choice between selling said ships or taking for your own captain, but you can also integrate them into your fleet or put them in a research pool which will enable their building via your space-station or salvage them to get one of the rarer ressources. 
And this is just one example how well the gameplay from SG2 blends with this strategy game ontop.

The map is filled little sideactivities and events collectable and selleable stuff..the list goes on and on.
Than there's so many options, so many ships, weapon-systems, equipment (like stationary platforms or homing mines, etc.), upgrade-enhancments, fighter, interceptor and bomberwings -> the list is nearly endless.

Also just like before you get one of the most engaged devs i've ever seen, chances are always pretty high atleast one of em is in the forums. Problems or comments get a dev-reply more frequently and faster than i've ever seen with any other dev. This goes a long way and you realy get the impression they care about their series and are not just here for the cash.

On a side-note, neither the UI nor controls are bad (like some reviews here suggest). 
Do they take some getting used to for new players? surely 
Is everything perfect? ofcourse not
But when my stupid brain can handle the UI and controls ever since SG1 than anyone should be able to manage.

Especialy in combat everything works from the base UI: deploying fighter-wings, grappling a hostile via beam, focus-firing, automated light-weapon-fire, using one of your 4 class-skills, using the incredible large arry of equipment, balancing your energy between weapons, shields and engines...or sending your troops to board a vessel or station.   
You got different view-modes, even a target-follwoing mode for the camera, different zoom-levels and and and.

All in all i cannot praise this dev and the series enough. If you got the slightest incling for space-combat and sci-fi, space-ships or (now) large fleet battles this is pretty much a must have. By now there's more content in the game and dlcs available to get you busy for months. 
This is truly Mount and Blade Warband in space, just better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048228509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3905, 'last_played': 1520203970}
review:
Confesso que comprei o jogo com um certo receio por causa das análises, porém o game excedeu e muito minhas expectativas. Nunca tinha jogado nenhum dos games da franquia mas este estava em promoção então resolvi dar uma chance, logo de inicio os controles são um pouco complexos e domina-los levou certo tempo, porém é só uma questão de costume mesmo. 

   O game coloca você como o comandante de uma nave ligado a uma certa facção no sistema solar. Você então começa com uma nave pequena servindo a essa facção e deve cumprir missões para avançar na história do jogo, podendo dominar setores do sistema aumentando o poder de sua facção. O mapa estelar é divido por setores controlados por diversas facções, das quais algumas são aliadas e outras não. Cada setor tem recursos que podem ser extraídos com estruturas (estações de mineração, coletores de gás, recicladores de sucata...) e tais recursos podem ser usados para expandir seu poder e construir mais naves que podem ser incorporadas a sua frota. É possível ter mais de uma frota no jogo, sendo que você pode pilotar sua nave acompanhado de diversas naves ou pode colocar algum dos seus comandantes para liderar frotas paralelas e então envia-las para o combate. As diversidade de naves é muito grande, desde as pequenas até as grandes cargueiras que podem levar naves menores (carriers) porém há um limite nessas naves  pois são muito poderosas.
   
   O jogo é uma perfeita mistura de estratégia em tempo real com simulação de naves estelares, pretendo jogar os outros jogos da franquia mas esse ainda vai me divertir por muito tempo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198081229103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5553, 'last_played': 1520801039}
review:
To keep this review as short as possible, if you're like me and you play games like EU4, Crusader Kings 2, and Stellaris then based solely on the "strategy" portions of this game you will be very disheartened by the missed opportunity. This game is to Stellaris what Medieval Total War is to CK2 ~ addictive as hell but very very shallow in terms of strategy ~ basically there is none. There is no diplomacy to speak of aside from a seemingly unecessary faction status element. In short, you don't buy this game for its strategy elements! Additionally, there is very little replayability value when compared to most strategy games... to be fair, the devs are very engaged with their community and I remember playing SPG 2 ~ which had no 4X elements to speak of at all! In fact, almost all of the differences between SPG2 & Warlords including the 4X elements are there because of player feedback!

With all that said, I love this game! Why? Because it's an absolutely amazing Space RPG! Take away the 4X elements from the game and it's still great ~ add them in however and its even better! Basically, the 4X elements are the icing on the cake but I wish wish wish that they were so much more. I can only salavate at the thought of playing this game meshed together with a Paradox game level of depth... wow! 

In short, This is a space RPG game and probably the best one on the market. It lets you conquer territories, build ships and fleets, spec your own ship, upgrade to better ships, upgrade space stations, and more! It even has a moding community ~ albeit a small one. I love the Star Trek mods!

The story is ok, but the lore is engaging ~ that said, it's pretty short (the lore is extensive though)

Replayability is an issue (when compared to typical strategy games) but that hasn't stopped me from getting 50 hours into this game ~ you get your money's worth! It's basically about as replayable as Mass Effect is.

Gameplay is amazing even if it does take some time to get used to the controls ~ the "K" key is your friend and so is the "V" key and the target next enemy key!

The RPG elements are top notch ~ this is where the game becomes so addictive. So many ships, classes, weapons and upgrades. That said, there are only 3 classes and about 15 or so abilities that are fully customizable (they can be mixed together and replaced at anytime) ~ keep in mind that this game can be grindy. 

Lastly, dont forget to mod the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014059061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 3906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2184, 'last_played': 1682727551}
review:
This game is the great space fighter simulator with added fleet and empire managent. I've been eager to try this since Gemini 2 as my first try on Gemini universe. It's great experience in any virtue of 4x space simulators. I can see though all negatives and not polished parts - like funny bouncing with your own ships when flying in fleet mode (let your ships follow), kind of flat campaign with no suprising twist at the end or really grindy aspects of the game.

++ Power management of your ship. Full power to the shields, mister Scotty!
+ Big universe to explore and conquer
+ Many ships and progress of you and your fleet
+ Graphic and some nice ship designs
+ Nice flashy space battles
+ Many side misions, space events, freelancer missions 
+- Price. Overally the content is solid and plentyfull but still makes you think twice of buying if you are not familiar with the previous titles
- Side misions, space events, freelancer missions will get old really soon and feel repetetive. More types would be welcomed.
- Campaign story feels flat and it's artificially prolonged by resource gathering. Story telling could also be more movie-like instead of texting with pictures.
-- Grind parts of the game. Great demand of resources that takes shitload long to gather or wait for structures to gather. Also it require you to really start attacking surrounding regions.
- Even though you can T-drive instantly almost anywhere on the map, you will spent a long time "on the road". Map is big/or you are slow. I can't tell .
- Sometimes things get chaotic and crazy battle camera doesn't really help.

7/10 "At the end, I can recommend this game with happy neglection of some major flaws. I know it's wierd but I had a great time playing it and if you are into Gemini universum, you will like it too. For the rest of you, I suggest you to at least give it a try :)"

author: {'steamid': '76561197991413819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 3654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2286, 'last_played': 1519705500}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057324902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1626104363}
review:
SGW manages to remain interestingly deep and satisfying despite some aspects being streamlined from previous releases, the graphical overhaul transforms the galaxy from snoozefest to eye-candy, the ships are still tiny as hell but nevermind that, robust empire building mechanics make the game feel fullfiling on long-term. 
I didn't like that this time some numbers and stats are hidden and the UI lacks some information that I considered critical in SG2, still a pretty cool game.

developer_response:
Hello ThiCC Thighs Save Lives,

I'm sorry you feel that way about our game. We did anounce major content update soon (one of those content updates will touch diplomacy options). Did you try to solve some faction quests to get more resources? Conquer planets, raid structures? You can even do some trade tasks with other friendly/neutral stations or send your fleet civilian task to get some of resources. Enviromental encounters gives you high possibility to find some derelicts, anomalies, etc.. to get nice amount of credits or resources.


I hope you will give us second chance one day. Every feedback we get is appreciated alot because it gives us chance to make this game better than it's now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970914713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1005, 'last_played': 1519630550}
review:
Wow this game has so much depth. It truly makes you feel like a star captain in charge of the fleet. Not only do you get to fly your own ship with fully manual controls (and you can automate a bunch of it if you want to), but you can build fleets and order them around as well. Maintain and grow your empire while still taking on missions privateer style. It's confusing as hell at first because there's so much to do, but within a few hours, you'll figure it out. The campaign helps a lot, and there are a bunch of game modes that let you jump in however you like once you figure it out.

On top of that, the steam workshop lets you add in Star Wars, Star Trek, and various other ships thanks to the wonderful modders out there! Fly the Enterprise, make a fleet of Millenium Falcons, or conquer the galaxy as a Borg Cube!

This game is what I wish Civilization had become. Full perspective from commanding the troops in the field all the way up to resource management and empire building!

author: {'steamid': '76561198160783080', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1519451890}
review:
游戏做的远不像宣传视频那么好，画面很卡通，细节也很差，最明显的就是太空的背景，密密麻麻的点就当做星星，问题是这些点也太大了，还满屏幕都是，密集恐惧症都要犯了。游戏也很多借用X3系列的，操作是最明显的，但是操作还奇差，比X3都不如。
系统相当简单，跟欲火银河系差不多，总之如果你是X3的粉丝，别买，如果你是找个太空探索背景的空战小游戏，可以玩晕你。
developer_response:
Hello Polar_Tiger,

did you try to play with options menu? There you can change start size, density, details, etc..

author: {'steamid': '76561197972446888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1519448200}
review: Decent with minor customization to your ship/fleet. Once you understand the controls the game gets exponentially easier. Controls and gameplay certainly lean towards optimizing your ship for balanced, fairly stationary capital ship autofire combat. Dogfighting is sparse and unrewarding. Still fun. I would recommend not autopiloting between locations and doing a little collecting, combat, exploring, etc... before docking at your next major destination.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181885030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1519437209}

author: {'steamid': '76561198130238664', 'num_games_owned': 2440, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1519462607}
review:
Wow, this game is something amazing. Now, as you can see from my games list, I don't play a lot of games. I've always wanted to play a space type game, but they're all so confusing to a guy like me that's not very good at these space sim types of games. 

This game really hit the target when it came to helping a new person like me learn how to play a space sim. The tutorials are very easy for me to understand. The graphics are very well put together, they look amazing! The sound is excellent. Lastly, the game runs super smooth on my system with every option maxed out!

I've only spent about an hour on the game, but I'm looking forward to spending more time playing this game.

I highly recommend this game! Buy this game and support these developers, they are very talented! I haven't played SPG2 much at all, but I purchased that to support this talented crew and I'm glad I did because now we have this game!

Thank you developers for making such a great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039411490', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2268, 'last_played': 1520331255}
review:
pretty cool game for freelancer or space sim fans.
The game is extremely addicting and does take a lot of time
Just like what others mentioned, it's a cross betwwen bannerlords and freelancer

My only complaint is the control is a bit tricky with mouse and keyboard, so I recommend using a controller like the PS4 one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983289662', 'num_games_owned': 949, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1519431254}
review:
Open map. Right click destination. Wait 5 minutes, Arrive at destination. Middle mouse click to perform required action. Wait. Press F to initiate combat. Wait for enemies to die. Finish task. Open map. Right click destination. Wait 5 minutes. Arrive at destination.

Waiting: The Game.
developer_response:
Hello Protocol7,

did you try to use TDrive, wormholes/T-Gates to fast travel? You get from one place to another in matter of seconds.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973718331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1059, 'last_played': 1666838677}
review:
really awesome game:

pro's:

1: you can create your own fleet and conquer space. Besides that you can,upgrade and arrange your space ports & facillity's ( Something you dont see a lot in games i wish there where more games like this ). This makes the game very addicting. 

2: the space battles are chaotic, cool and feel rewarding when you see your space vessels engage the enemy for you.

3: combined genres work here, i wish there where more games like this.

cons:

1: i wish there where more games like this but with better graphics. 
2: the game starts slow there is a lot of grinding.
3: No zoom function to see your ship up close, i hope the developers do something about this in the future.
4: more spectaculair explosions and graphics and this game would get a golden reward.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019735937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1519487070}
review:
I’m having a lot of fun with the game itself - it’s a strong sequel to the original. If you liked SPG2 you’ll like this. Do your research on the DLCs - the two “expansion” DLCs sound like they’re integrated into the main game, but they have their own scenarios.

You’ll see a couple of responses to my original review from the Dev, below - as always, they are super responsive and have a great community team. Considering how rare that is nowadays, I thought it was worth mentioning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056859458', 'num_games_owned': 841, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 23954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9777, 'last_played': 1610559140}
review:
Starpoint Gemini Warlords is a fine title indeed. Solid gameplay, smooth controls, great graphics, and all with an interesting mix of single-ship combat and 4X civilization management. It feels like a grind at first and it's a bit choppy, but the long-term gameplay is very fun and it captures you with important decision-making and freeform exploration.

If you love space simulator games, this is one to try out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067923711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1519697279}
review:
上世纪的画面，下个世纪的硬件需求（优化差），不如手游
任务，战斗，贸易，建设。该有的貌似都有，但都很鸡肋。不如手游
舰船种类还算多，但是细节太少，就只有轻重武器，推进，护盾等几个固定的组件。属性也只有几个参数，完全没啥特色。跟手游差不多
操作及其别扭。反正打起来基本是看不见敌人，只看见自己在翻转。推进感0，打击感0，操作感0，只有瞎几把转圈的眩晕感MAX。手控射击？不存在的！视角少而差，既不能像射击游戏那样畅快，又不能像策略游戏那样运筹。不如手游
系统简单，这点比X系列或者EVE亲民一些。说白了，还是个手游级别。
总之一句话，这游戏就是烂大街的太空4X游戏，还是平均水准以下。不值这个价。想玩建议5折以下入
developer_response:
Hello eszvgy,


you can change camera options so you can follow your targets more closely. Also, there is option where you can lock your camera onto enemy so he will never run out of your sight.

review: 操作对新手极不友好，但很值得一玩。对这个操作我只能给个好评。中国红色代表喜庆，福字倒着贴代表福到。所以我点这个红色的代表喜庆到。

author: {'steamid': '76561198036172119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1554612129}
review:
Great Game. 

Pros: Very expansive ship building and RPG system. Also has a very good 4x expansioni system that's fairly well developed with a large amount of territory to reclaim. I like how much there is to do in this game and you'll never be bored with the missions which are fairly dynamic and different. 

Cons: Very reminiscent of a single player version of EVE online. Some gameplay elements seem like a carbon copy of that game which isn't necessarily a bad thing. It can also take a while to get around the map which makes for a lot of dead time. 

I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who likes ship building games. Lots of fun to be had here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040014730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1519841941}
review: This game is a great idea conceptually, and the general approach in its concept is somewhat endearing and likeable, but the controls for this game, especially in combat, are highly difficult, especially so for a new player. After messing with the sensitivities and looking at all of the keybindings for ship-related controls, it is still highly difficult to functionally fight more than one enemy craft at a time. While there are default keybindings (R) to switch to the nearest enemy, your ship is entirely dependent on your movement commands, as well as commands for hard-targeting (Direct targeting of a specific craft) and engagement of said target. This game needs a rework of its ship controls to be effective as a whole in general, and as a point to make players likely to enjoy the game. There is no presence of "autonomy" short of flying your craft to waypoints or major hubs, such as planets or space stations. As it is now, the current appeal of the mid-late game aspects is completely bogged down by the control mechanisms. It is not very fun at all to be unable to even follow an enemy craft or keep it in your sights, instead having your guns able to track targets on auto-fire if you are successful enough to mark your target. By then, however, you are likely going to have already been overwhelmed by the enemy ships present that are actively engaging you at the same time. This game's concept is promising, but as it is now it is not a game I could recommend in good conscience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198301922928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1519309822}
review: 这汉化的什么玩意儿，看的云里雾里的，机器翻译也太敷衍了，很后悔买
developer_response: 您好，感谢您的评论。我们注意到了汉化版有严重的问题，我们在之前得到汉化翻译文本时还没有能力对中文进行校对，对您造成了困扰，为此向您道歉。一个月前我们开始了对汉化的优化工作，目前已经修复了征战模式（剧情和教程）下的大部分汉化问题，并且重新翻译了最新的DLC：努米比亚之崛起同时优化了中文的商店页面。这些优化和修复会随着下周的一次更新一同到来，我们会继续优化并且更加重视中文游戏的体验，希望您能继续支持我们并向我们提供反馈。

author: {'steamid': '76561197988721412', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1519292981}
review: Awesome concept and very promising gameplay mechanics but controls feel much like the game doesn't know if it wants to be a dogfighter or a battleship-sim and ships generally have this unrealistic toylike touch especially noticeable during combat.
developer_response:
Hello Rufour,


did you try to fly bigger class ships? They're alot slower and their maneuverability is low, firepower and shields stronger. If you want something big and slow, we have Titan ship class (there is one you get for free in vanilla if you don't have Titans DLC).

I'm sorry you're dissapointed in our game. I hope you will give us second chance one day once we push more updates, tweaks and fixes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977744657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 6096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1430, 'last_played': 1609787034}
review:
Had an issue previously -- 

Each time I close the game out, it will not re-launch. I validated the game files in Steam and it said that I had 2 files that failed to validate. The game then proceeds to re-download the 2 files. After that, I can re-launch the game, but I have to go into the settings and completely re-configure the customer controls/settings that I had set up prior.

Reading up on it online, someone claimed to have fixed the issue by shutting down Steam and restarting it. I rebooted my computer and the game started up just fine.

Also, I want to add that I've been enjoying the game very much when it was running properly. :)
developer_response:
Hello MagicSquid,


I'm sorry you have that problem. Is there possibility we get your log.txt everytime your game crashes on closing? Pretty sure we can help you with that problem, if you let us. 

Don't hesitate to contact us on our Customer Support at customersupport[at]starpointgemini[dot]com

author: {'steamid': '76561198304504085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 1156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1153, 'last_played': 1520012253}
review:
我终于通关了。
我终于熬到头了。

部分时间离线玩的，实际游戏时间40+小时

通关感想：
	这个游戏的各个方面简直就是反例中的典型。
	它的很多方面、很多想法都很好，可惜被糟糕的游戏体验给毁了。
	致命性缺点太多，让我在爱恨交加中给了它差评。
	同时我很庆幸当初没有一起购买这款游戏的DLC，这意味着我可以少受一点折磨。

优点：
	类似骑砍的战斗。骑砍是个好游戏。
	优秀的飞船和空间站模型设计。

致命缺点：
	一、机翻汉化。
	二、极不直观的UI设计和任务指示。
	三、极不合理的任务难度。80W的任务能遇到脆皮战斗机，30W的任务却能遇到主力舰，同样是400w的赏金有37级被打爆的也有46级能平推的。
	四、蠢到让我难以忍受的AI。连开炮都不懂怎么开，还只会站撸。一打起架来队友全在围观，只会放重武器，仿佛船上没轻武器一样，输出基本全靠玩家，我要你们无畏舰有何用！？都是啦啦队毕业的舰长！？
	五、破烂的存档机制。读档后当前正在执行的自由任务会消失。
	六、没法AA。再重复一遍，没法AA。

非致命缺点：
	一、蛋疼的操作方式。
	二、战斗时基本上看不见敌人的飞船。（在不停走位的情况下。按K也是如此，自己的船会挡住被锁定的目标）
	三、必须要重启游戏才能让部分设置生效，然而重启游戏需要很久，调整合适的显示设置很困难。
	四、地雷打不爆的。
	五、非主力舰船只简直就是高价炮灰。主线最后一个任务我带满了无畏舰和巡洋舰过去，最后只剩无畏舰回来了，而且无畏舰一个没少。巡洋舰那一共25000的指挥点数简直就是给人看的。
	六、有时候游戏的BGM和音效会突然消失。
	七、敌人一边喊着"No more! Please no more!"一边继续向我们开炮。
	八、把空间站打残了，跳出去了，马上又跳回来了，空间站又满血复活了。我觉得这个跳跃应该是某种时空跳跃，可上一次战斗留下的残骸还漂浮在那个空间站附近。
	九、游戏里有一种不停重复的、关不掉的背景音效。既不是背景音乐，也不是游戏音效，也不是用户界面的声音，只能从系统里把这个游戏的声音给关掉了，才能让那个声音消失。

其他缺点：
	一、这个游戏的策划应该没有考虑到游戏体验这种东西。
	二、一个为主线任务特制的，深藏于雷区中的工厂。

中立：
	一、没碰撞伤害。
	二、让人无感的配乐。
	三、高级任务里的炮台比航母都硬。
	四、这个游戏有点四不像。

其他：
	一、敌方无畏舰正在狂殴我方指挥官，我方无畏舰却在和一个炮台打得有来有回。

author: {'steamid': '76561197962079393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 2353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2353, 'last_played': 1519691716}
review:
The game in a nutshell can be summed up to a single word: "Meh"

Judging by the screenshots and videos, you'd think it was an explosive capital ship simulator with gorgeous battles and gripping action, but the truth is the ships feel rather small, like you're playing with little models ships, the sense of massive scale is simply not there. The story is weak, the voice acting is awkwardly subpar, the ship design is uninteresting, you can customize their paint jobs but there's a bug where those customizations aren't saved. You can download new models from the workshop, but that doesn't really affect the underlying flaws of the game.

The Universe itself seems very small, sure it can take a long time to go from point A to point B, but the sense of awe and wonder of exploring space simply isn't there either. In spite of the number of random events and missions to undertake, you never really get a sense that you're doing something new, all of the quests and bounties are standard fare, run of the mill, and highly repetitive. The mini-missions and side quests you get are often more tedious work than they are rewarding, but if you want to upgrade your ship to the next tier you'll have to do a lot of them, and of course upgrading your ship is completely arbitrary to the game.

From a gameplay standpoint, I didn't really like the controls either, seems like you're always fighting the camera more than fighting the enemies, regardless combat becomes a dull affair where you massively outclass anything the AI sends at you, your companion ships do all the killing for you, and things like boarding enemy ships are oversimplified extraneous details that rarely succeed before your enemies are obliterated. As a Fleet Commander you'll send your civillian fleets off on little errands which they complete autonomously while your main fleet escorts you around, I guess you can send your military fleet off to assault enemy targets, but honestly it's all just clicking around on a map, this aspect of the game could be any other browser based app you play on your phone.

This game is very much like Freelancer in the sense that it ended up being a pale shadow of what we thought it was going to be by the time was released. This game was released last year, but I'd put its technology level somewhere around 2008-2010, would have looked great back then but by today's standards it seems lackluster and uninspired. If you liked Freelancer and want more Freelancer gameplay go ahead and purchase it, but personally I don't recommend this game because your money could be spent better elsewhere on deeper space games with a better design.

==========*Addendum to original review*============

I meant to point out that this game kind of bills itself as a 4x Strategy Game with RPG Elements and some people have labelled it the "Mount & Blade of Space games." Neither of these statements are particularly true. You can have a fleet of ships following you around, sure, and there's a few Warlords who join your fleet with access to higher tier ships, but there isn't any sort of 'Commanding' involved. You basically just fly near an enemy and your guns and your fleet's guns will fire at random enemies until the battle is over. There are no formations, no special tactics, no order's pause, no skill synergies no combined arms. There aren't any science ships that support tank ships while DPS ships flank and do damage. You can fly around the map taking territory after territory from enemy factions for hours without feeling like you've accomplished anything at all, most of the enemy ships are weak tier 1s with a few cruisers in the mix and the occasional solo Battleship or above. If you don't make the same composition mistake in your fleets and just fly around with Cruisers and above you'll scarcely ever lose a ship, however if you want to waste the resources it takes you forever to grind then by all means bring a few gunships along to get blown up in the first few seconds of battle. Instead of going for some kind of "every ship has an use" design scenario they opted instead for "bigger/costlier is always better in every way" and that's unfortunate given what might have been possible if they chose to be a little more creative instead of rushing this title to release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021397137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2328, 'last_played': 1499170751}
review:
+ Sandbox space heaven - Follow the story or do your own thing OR do the story THEN do your thing.
+ Dozens of ships to fly, buy, steal and modify
+ Light empire building, heavy in cockpit dogfighting and rpg
+ Diverse beautiful galaxies, heaps of enemies

- Campaign threw you around allot, needed better structure
- Although plenty of modding options, more could have been implemented to make every ship your own.

Fantastic game for people who enjoy space sim with some conquering and 4x elements

author: {'steamid': '76561197992535537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 5524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4954, 'last_played': 1524523984}
review:
While the weapons in this game gave been made MUCH shorter range, the majority of the game is the same as it was in Starpoint Gemini 2.
So if you liked that game, you'll enjoy this.

Warlords also has empire management, resource collection and a storyline that revolves around said empire.
There'll be some surprises along the way as this story unfold and this time if you really don't like a faction, you can just get your fleet together and go conquer them!

No more putting up with crazy admirals! :-D

author: {'steamid': '76561198022739844', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1544, 'last_played': 1566351309}
review: Great singleplayer experience in space , love the detail they  have put through ships planets and stars nebula's combat etc. Most part just like Gemini 2 except now have abiltiy to build up your own fleets and take on the other factions in the game . Can build mining outpost , junk reclaimer to help gather credits and materails to build up your empire. Also tons of ships for you to collect/find to your play style & now have more types of heavy weapons choose from like missles torps etc. besides story missions can also play random missions form your outpost's to do something differant and also help with getting credits. They also have differant free roam scenarios that have random starting ships and credits witch is nice when wanna do something else besides the story mode. To me I feel this game is a major overhaul to Gemini 2 with more on differant skills to help you in game as well as combat and have 4 differant classes to choose from with there own set skills and so many differant ships.  Been useing my xbox controler with this game and at times can be confuseing with odd controls but for most part I have been able to make it work.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969650165', 'num_games_owned': 923, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2546, 'last_played': 1519563527}
review: This game is a absolute joy to play. Having played a fair amount of SPG:2 This is a very worthy sucessor. Flying and combat are on this side of Arcadey, but for me that is perfect. The new faction tile civilization style conquest system is fantastic. Managing civilian and war fleets is easy and a fun. Overall a really great game, my only gripe is the ship customization features. You can only really place decals on your ship. I would love to see something as simple as "Choose primary and secondary colors" to change the overall color of the ship.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970413381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2296, 'last_played': 1612809866}
review:
If you like space sims that don't require you to have lightning fast twitch reflexes and give you a sense of being in overall command of a ship as opposed to sitting in the cockpit this is the game for you. Do not expect a dog-fight simulator. Also do not expect in depth trading mechanics, while they exist, it is not the focus of the game.

This game shines when you spend your time Empire building, from your humble origins you will quickly amass mighty ships and powerful fleets that you can have as a personal escort or split off from your direct command and have them attack/defend territory on their own. Soon your Empire will be mighty as you see enemy fleets driven before you and hear the lamentations of their women (or be a complete pansy and make friends with everyone, its up to you)

Its an indy title from a small studio, with an active and friendly dev team. Don't expect the world but do expect to be suprised at this addictive and fun little gem.

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997210585', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 6680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5909, 'last_played': 1643833046}
review:
Nun nach knapp 100 Stunden Spielzeit muss ich sagen das dieses Spiel einfach der Hammer ist.

Es macht spass zu minern, vor allem mit einigen Mods. Ebenso ist die Mechanik der System- und Planetenübernahme einfach super.

Die Skyboxes sind einfach klasse und die Atmosphäre kommt klasse rüber.

Ich nutze eine Razer Chroma Tastatur und die spielereien und das leuchtn der Tastatur spiegelt auch klasse die Atmosphäre wieder.

LGM hat hier mal wieder super Arbeit geleistet.

Ich kann es jedem der auf Raumschiffkämpfe steht empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198371922522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1163, 'last_played': 1532503573}
review:
这款游戏集合了很多星战类游戏的特征，但都多少做了一些简化，总体而言游戏的乐趣来源点很多，虽然都不够深入，但好在其内容足够丰富，以支撑起了游戏体验。

有一艘可供玩家自己操控的战舰，是我觉得这款游戏最大的亮点，其战舰的制作模式相比于X3和EVE系列，简单了很多，只要满足了资源和等级条件，就可以立刻拥有一艘自己的舰船，对于非硬核向的玩家来说更有亲和力一些，但在经过一段时间游戏的过后，玩家可能会对这种轻松的模式感到枯燥，因为游戏提供的舰船改造部分实在是太过于简单，仅仅只是简单的武器改装，和一些被动技能加强。如果下一部作品能够向《坦克世界》系列学习，增加一些简单的部件改装，对玩家的游戏体验和时间可能会有不小的提升。

游戏具有一定程度上的即时战略内容，但也仅仅只是一定程度上的，和其他势力的外交停留于最基础的宣停战、买资源（仅能从其他势力买资源，卖是不指望了），虽然可以组建一支玩家自有的舰队，但并没有丰富的指挥系统来进行支撑，以至于游戏中的战斗成了最简单的战斗力比拼，哪边舰队大船多、数量多哪边就能够取胜，这种情况也导致了游戏中虽然设置了数量丰富、类型各异的舰船，但到了游戏后期，舰队的组成会变得异常单一，而战略部分的简化，也导致了玩家获得成就感的唯一途径不断重复进行纯粹依靠战力比拼的战斗。

以上提到的听起来这并不是一款好游戏，但这并非是一款硬核向的游戏，所以我还是想说这是我在过去两年时间里玩儿到的最好的星战类游戏之一，虽然游戏简化的部分令人有一些不满意，但是作为一款只有14Gb容量的游戏，它已经集合了大部分玩家对于星战类游戏的期待，操控一艘属于玩家自己的战舰，带领着一支舰队去征服宇宙，这就是很多玩家对于星战的最纯粹愿望，也是一个轻量化的星战游戏应该带给玩家的最基础体验，很显然这款游戏把这一点做的很出色，同时还给了玩家一些基础之外的游戏内容。

author: {'steamid': '76561198019123713', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1290, 'last_played': 1517938718}
review:
Стоп! Стоп! Стоп! Не надо требовать от игры того, на что она не рассчитана! Если нужен космосимулятор, то Elit Dangerous Ваш вариант. Там мануалка на 150 станиц А4 и управление как на рояле)). Если все же Вы стратег, то обратите внимание на Endles Space - пошаговая, экономики до чертиков, дипломатия, влияние и куча прочей менеджментской хрени!)) 
НО! Эта игра, Starpoint Gemini Warlords, идеально включила в себя элемент космо-RPG и стратегии. Grind-а в полной мере достаточно, разнообразие типов миссий тоже. Нет такого ощущения потерянности, при входе в игру типо, а что тут нужно делать, как например в Evochron Mercenary. Перелеты тут не особо долгие, я видел и более унылые! Тут на ранних стадиях еще дают возможность построить T-врата для быстрого перемещения по галактике. Стратегическая составляющая тоже сведена к оптимальному набору. Региональная борьба через захват опорных пунктов. Собираешь ресурсы, изучаешь Исследования, улучшаешь инфраструктуру, копишь бабки на топовый транспорт. Не забывайте, что большой корабль не значит, что он в одиночку может все! Корабли поддержки оказывают тоже не малую помощь в битвах. В общем Лайк! Полетели дальше!

author: {'steamid': '76561198166524674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 11316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6712, 'last_played': 1702883996}
review: 游戏不错，就是看不懂翻译，游戏冷门到连攻略都没有，挺无语。STEAM有完全翻译功能就美了，那样我就能去论坛找攻略。
developer_response: 您好，感谢您的评论。我们注意到了汉化版有严重的问题，我们在之前得到汉化翻译文本时还没有能力对中文进行校对，对您造成了困扰，为此向您道歉。一个月前我们开始了对汉化的优化工作，目前已经修复了征战模式（剧情和教程）下的大部分汉化问题，并且重新翻译了最新的DLC：努米比亚之崛起同时优化了中文的商店页面。这些优化和修复会随着下周的一次更新一同到来，我们会继续优化并且更加重视中文游戏的体验，希望您能继续支持我们并向我们提供反馈。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970552377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 2794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2794, 'last_played': 1514132683}
review: The game seems like there's a good concept there but it just falls short with content and confusing controls.  There's a lot of long grinds with no story, repetitious missions and combat.  I gave it a good go but it's just not that fun it needs a lot more story and content before I will give this one another look.  Also the tutorial is non-existent and considering the developers choice of weird controls it's all the more necessary.  Please consider at minimum adding in a decent tutorial.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008752253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1517595880}
review:
Nothing but a grind. Basically Freelancer, but somehow even more repetitive. All you do is dock at a station, take a bounty, go afk and make some lunch while you're autopiloting to the location, kill the target, autopilot back, and then repeat. Forever. Of course you've got people who will say "Oh but you can mine and salvage" but it's just the same shit reskinned. Even the campaign missions are basically the same thing, just with some added (low quality) flavor text sprinkled on top.

The control scheme is also one of the worst I have ever experienced. It's like the game can't decide if it wants to be an action game or a strategy game. So for the controls, you get this disgusting cross between something like EVE and something like Rebel Galaxy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039972644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1148, 'last_played': 1638643922}
review:
je pense qu'il s'agit à l'heure actuelle du jeu le plus proche de ce que fut Freelancer

freelancer proposait de faire du freelance (combat, commerce, piratage, etc)
-> gemini warlords le permet egalement
freelancer permettait de gerer sa reputation aupres de factions bien distinctes
-> gemini le permet egalement en ajoutant plus d'interets à celles ci
freelancer proposait de piloter de nombreux vaisseaux tres varies
-> gemini le permet aussi avec en plus des vaisseaux capitaux et une gestion de flottes
-> (apres le design peche un peu pour moi au niveau de pas mal de vaisseaux mais je fais avec, gouts et couleurs etc)

bref vous l'aurez compris je cherchais un jeu pour me faire revivre une experience proche de celle de Freelancer qui reste pour moi le meilleur jeu de space opera jamais crée et ce jeu me satisfait grandement avec en plus des options supplementaires

je recommande ;P

attention j'en suis a a peine qques heures de jeu donc faut voir si le jeu cache des defauts je ne les ai pas encore reperes

author: {'steamid': '76561198057334156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1532, 'last_played': 1517415986}
review:
I have two reviews now: 
3 hours gameplay 25 hours gameplay

3hrs:
Although the game has a lot of potential it isn't fun playing. The controls make you feel like every ship is a toy car. There is no weight behind the controls and none of the weapons give you "hell yeah" feeling. In my humble opinion Rebel Galaxy offers much more feeling whenever you pilot your ship. Also I found the world to be too dark, this is a game, space should be beautiful.

As disappointing as Starpoint Gemini 2.

Pros: at least I didn't pay the full price.

25hrs:
Basically, it wasn't worth it. 
The campaign is bugged. Googling it, I found there is an issue that randomly crops up and hasn't been fixed in months, therefore you might be the lucky one, or not. Ignoring the problem, I decided to give it a go in the free mode, tempted to get control of the big boys... unfortunately it was barely fun. I hack through it to get the better weapons and ships but all of them were “meh”. Then finally I got the “titan”, and this one really annoyed me. From the beginning there was a problem with the camera that was stuck literally behind the ship and when I purchased this ‘titan’, the ship covered half on my freaking screen! Yes, there are 4 modes of camera, but the navigation and fight got so awkward that I sold it and jump back into my dreadnought which seems better than carrier despite the price tag.
In essence the game is awkward. From many many points lets describe just two:
Ship comparison. When buying ships, you won’t be able to easily check and compare the shield stats, which are missing from the main purchase screen. Silly but annoying. When you capture enemy ship you also won’t be able to easily check the stats, there are non-existent, unless you send it to your garage, and then check the stats… but then again you won’t be able to add it to your fleet.
Purchasing weapons is also awkward. Very little description in-game as to what weapon does what (damage to shield vs hull).

Definitely google will be your best friend when it comes to playing this game which only shows it’s not intuitive at all. I might have a different experience if I have managed to complete the campaign but…
Still would not recommend to anyone for the full price. It’s a shame as the potential is huge, just few more tweaks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065188257', 'num_games_owned': 829, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1515118271}
review: Really bland. Travel takes forever and combat is uninspiring after a few hours.
developer_response:
Hi Dragmire,

You can use T-Drive and T-Gate to travel instantly.

Regarding combat, you could try out different classes and skills. The gladiatrix lets you respec so you can combine skills from different classes and achieve new combos. You can also use fleets and fighters to generate big station battles which aren't just mindless shooting.

Hope this helps better your game experience. If you need more advice feel free to ask.

Best regards

author: {'steamid': '76561198132325572', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1658, 'last_played': 1556930011}
review:
Fantastic game so far with plenty to keep you busy it's got some great visuals and well in my first few house I was flying around with 5 ships I built following me and getting into combat to protect me the fleets from what I can see can be over the top big which leads to some massive combat you can basically fly an army into a zone your at war with and proceed to destroy everything I will give you some good and bad points but even after reading them honestly it's worth every penny 

Good 
.simple system very descriptive and easy to learn
.devs active on forum and help out if you get confused has a great community 
.fleets make you actually fell like your the commander not just some generic guy
.campaign is very nice with multiple choices and perks to alter the outcome 
.be what you want pirate , freelancer, military , literally most things covered 
.ships when you upgraded you feel like you've upgraded the ships visually bigger and stronger 
.ships the designs look great I'd say there is something for every taste if you travel 
.factions and reputation all that destroying can have a impact on how people see you 

The bad

.customisation seems to be restricted to adding stickers unless I'm doing it wrong I would call that store page note worthy I was expecting to atleast to be able to paint my ships minimum 
.trading doesn't feel like it's something you can do to make an empire there is no way of checking what station uses as resources and trading on a whole is just bland you can do it but you can tell however you play your eventually going to be combat based.
.fleets pretty much do all your back work civilian fleets they mine collect gasses and all that stuff you can do it yourself but doing it feels like your not meant to there just so more effective if the trade system and mining system was overhauled to manufacturing and and resource trading worked like in x3 I would have multiple vessels to mine ,salvage and collect gasses however I don't need to the game basically says go fight something I'll handle this your no trader... 

Even after bad point honestly I'd still give this a 9/10 and would be solid 11/10 with a proper trade system that worked as ATM I see no reason to own a freight liner at all. I would defiantly recommend a purchase if your into space genre games like eve and x3 with mechanics of civilisation it's a brilliant game with a few feature it would be a number 1 title in genre being below big games like eve and x3 on a few points in my book is still a massive achievement

author: {'steamid': '76561198008495142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3417, 'last_played': 1543699822}
review:
Having played Star Point Gemini 2 for more hours than I can count, I REALLY looked forward to trying this one.  I now have almost 60 hours playing conquest mode.  Yes, the game is addictive.  Unfortunately, it's addictive like scratching poison ivy - the gameplay is very irritating but you think if you keep scratching it will get better.  It doesn't.  This is not to say it's a totally bad game.  It's It just that there's nothing better out there in this genre IMHO.  

So, here's what I like:
  - the graphics are better than SPG2
  - there are minor elements of NPC interaction in that you can have bits of dialog with other ship captains
  - you get to build fleets to take on the baddies

And what I don't like:
  - overall, the game is a slow grind of producing resources and earning money so you can make or buy stuff
  - while you can build better ships for your fleets, you can't fly one until you can afford to buy it for your garage
  - missions via jobs or pop-up battles or "mysterious signals" are initially interesting but become repetitive and boring
  - unless I'm missing something, the ship customizer only lets you play with decals and not the whole ship like SPG2

author: {'steamid': '76561198100388140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 845, 'playtime_forever': 1358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1358, 'last_played': 1516518478}
review:
Хотелось бы порекомендовать эту игру, но слишком уж много неприятных мелочей (на мой вкус), которые делают игру скучной.
Мёртвый космос. Много разных фракций, но все они безликие. Если бы убрали все фракции, кроме одной, то ничего бы и не изменилось. 
Проблема долгих путешествий из первой части игры так и не решена. Появились порталы и прыжковые двигатели, но всё это стоит конских денег. Корабли остались "кирпичами", т.е. вы не можете отстрелить вражескому судну турели или двигатели, только полностью уничтожить. Очень странно видеть крейсер противника, в которого всадил два десятка ракет, а на нём ни царапины. Даже самые топовые пушки наносят мало урона и годы разве что для быстрого отстрела мелких кораблей, а вот если вступить в бой с крейсерами или дредноутами, то ковырять их надо долго.
Кампания короткая и замедляет вас заданиями в стиле "Чтобы продолжить сюжет, купите вон тот дорогой корабль".
Графон в игре совсем не впечатляет, и некоторые игры семилетней давности могут дать картинку космоса лучше.
Критических багов в игре нет, но неудобное управление мышью и отвратительная русская локализация - последние гвозди в крышку гроба.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103435598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 3051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2591, 'last_played': 1516682441}
review:
The game is actually pretty fun to play but gets old pretty faast, but the loads of DLCs is a negative for me. Any game that keeps thowing out DLCs to increase revenue with thing that should have been in the game from the start is a poor business practice I will not encourage.

I also reserve the right to have misgivings about this companys intentions with this game since it showed EA purchasers such as myself such disregard with the start of the every couple of month dlc. By relesing the game then 1 month later the first dlc pops up would have been nice to your EA supporters to throw that in not trying to be petty, but I am sure when the game was release the content was being worked on or at the very least planned and scheduled. Shows where the companies motivations are.
developer_response:
Hello TomSanford,


every DLC we did was post release community wish based on their suggestions. We will release major content update on vanilla game soon. I hope you will give us second chance one day :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197994810685', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3056, 'last_played': 1694892710}
review:
Definately one of the best 4X games I've played in a long, long time.

Pros-
Warship foucused: gunboats, frigates, battleships
Strategic map: Nice design, simplistic but easy to use
Fleet management:  Easy, simple, straight to the point
Battles: Most firing is done automatically, still have control of the big guns


Cons-
Trading: Seems to be none dynamic, I can deliver 1 billion protein bars to a station and price remain more or less the same. No automatic trading system like X3.
Production: There seems to be no stations attached to production of consumer goods, or at least don't know how to do that yet
Economy/transport:  The system seems kind of dead.  Very few ships transporting goods around.
Battles: Wish there was a "fighter/bomber" mode to engage in dogfights or strikes at capital ships

If you are a fan of Mount and Blade, X3, Freelancer, etc., stop reading this and go buy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004522464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2806, 'last_played': 1589412346}
review:
Alors, pour cet opus. Il est plutot sympa dans son ensemble, pas de gros gros changement comparé au 2 exceptés certains points, je m'explique :

Le gameplay en situation de vol/combat est identique, vos armes en tir auto ou a vous de tirer pour les armes légères (canons/Plasma/laser), les lourdes activable selon votre cible, tout cela fonctionne trés bien. MAIS, à mon sens le gros gros défaut qui m'a gonflé ++ dès le début, c'est l'angle de la caméra en 3eme personne, il est hyper mal axé, se centre beaucoup trop sur le vaisseau ce qui réduit grandement la visibilité de ce qui vous entoure, en gros on passe les 3/4 du temps a tourner autour d'un ennemi sans le voir réellement (excepté pour les croiseurs/cargo et + qui sont imposants). Donc on ne vois presque jamais vraiment nos cible, heureusement que les curseur de l'interface sont là...

Le réel changement entre gemini 2 et celui ci, c'est l'aspet stratégie qui prend vraiment beaucoup de place, en somme assez basique, des missions diverses et régulière a faire faire par vottre flotte civile (de l'ordre de 4-5min maxi) afin de recupèrer des ressoures (gaz-materiaux-mineraux je crois), l'upgrad de votre QG, de vos installation (mines, collecteurd e gaz etc..), de vos défenses car vous en aurez besoin pour maintenir votre emprise sur la galaxie ^^. La diplomatie quand à elle n'est pas vraiment convaincante, des choix assez limités, des accords commerciaux pas folichons mais qui peuvent depanner, car vos ressources sont indispensable pour avance convenablement dans cet opus. C'est d'ailleur pour cela qu'il à un temps de jeu quasi illimité, il y a tellement à faire avec que vous aurez besoin de nombreuses heures ! entre la recherche scientifique, vos upgrade en tt genre (et ils sont nombreux) votre vaisseau et son équipement, tout ça va couter trés cher ! Un conseil, l'arene gladiatrix est un trés trés bon moyen de vous faire de l'argent rapidement en début de game. 

Le scénario, bon bha c'est assez classique, il est correctement ficellé bien qu'un peu fou parfois, ça tiens mais ne vous attendez pas à être surpris. Il vous fait parfois traverser le système entier pour trouver un pekno et repartir (heureusement on à les sauts hyperespace). L'intéret n'est pas là evidement mais ça occupe pendantque vos civils recupèrent des ressources. 

Pour le graphisme, bhein c'est beau, mais parfois un peu monotone, évidement l'espace bhein c'est grand, vous trouverez nombres de champs d'asteroides, de zone d'anomalies et quelques nébuleuses, mais il arrive parfois de faire des trajets dans le noir complet, ce qui est un peu tristounet. Pour eviter ça, les sauts hyper espace sont vos amis (mais coutent un bras). 

Je conseil donc si vous avez aimer gemini 2 car le concept est le meme mais avec cette donnée Stratégie qui est intéressante et qui assure un temps de jeu clairement gigantesque. On peut cependant trouver un peu de longueur ou de répétitivité au bout d'un moment m'est d'avis.
