author: {'steamid': '76561198057780737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 5311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5089, 'last_played': 1539446546}
review:
This is my first space game in this style, though I did try Elite which I didn't like at all.. SPGW however is amazing! the campaign was captivating and took me a good 50 hours because I took the time to explore, trade, hunt bounties, and get the best ship possible. After that I got the Titan DLC for even bigger ships, and Deadly dozen for the extra bounty fun. I ended up conquering the full map at around 80 hours. This was just the campaign. I haven't tried the other modes such as conquest or challenges yet.

There are a few bugs here and there which can be frustrating at times, but overall it's a very interesting and fun, sometimes challenging, but mostly casual game where you fly around and blow stuff up.

Oh.. and it's beautiful. Check out all the community screenshots.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1248321170

author: {'steamid': '76561198056102078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 8927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2444, 'last_played': 1650307096}
review:
I picked up Starpoint Gemini Warlords on a whim. I'd been craving something to the tune of Freelancer or Privateer, and I'd already ripped through the campaign of Rebel Galaxy and found the repetitive bits of the endgame. So I grabbed Warlords as a likely candidate to scratch my space itch for a while. It doesn't handle as well as Freelancer did. It's a little kludgy with a lot of moving pieces that you've got to remember. And it's got a strange RTS/Civ builder bolted on top like an egregious carbon-fiber spoiler on a 1994 Toyota Celica. Like, I get the how. I understand that it's more depth and control and faction-building and compelling stories that emerge organically. I don't necessarily get the why. I was hoping for a decent space-dogfighter with some trade and a compelling story. 

Instead, it's generally long stretches of looking out the window while the huge number between me and my destination gets slowly smaller. This gives plenty of time to micromanage my slowly expanding kingdom of people that are incapable of doing anything on their own.

But I picked it up for a song, and the strange cool-down driven space combat quieted my Freelance shakes for a while. Boarding actions are rather a fun idea, but not exactly exciting in this push-a-button and hope capacity. But lightning raids into contested territory with my custom fleet of mooks is pretty fun. 

Until they all explode and I have to wait the requisite twenty hours to rebuild my mighty armada...

author: {'steamid': '76561197997463923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3446, 'last_played': 1551085663}
review:
Играбельно, ничего более. 
     Это почти копия предыдущей части, единственное что добавили, возможность строить флот, плюс, интерфейс стал хуже как по мне. 
    Флотом, не интересно управлять вообще, да и "управлять" это я приукрасил. Он просто летит куда послали, сражается автобоем. Либо плетётся следом, периодически врезаясь в ваш корабль и, не редко, мешая автопилоту лететь к намеченной цели. Разные корабли во флоте содержать нет смысла, так как нет никакого менеджмента в создании кораблей, ну или хотя-бы возможности выбора из пары-тройки шаблонов. К примеру, поскольку самому выбрать доступные звенья истребителей в свои авианосцы нет возможности, то автоматически выходит что дредноуты ваш выбор, ну как по мне. Так же, нельзя указать ни тактику боя своему флоту, (вроде того чтобы сначала бить по крупным кораблям или наоборот по мелким) ни скажем, приказ отступить если силы не равны, ну или патрулировать определённые сектора.
     Если хочешь быстро заработать, то каждая битва не обходится без абордажа, который хоть и надоедает очень быстро, но является самым прибыльным бизнесом в игре. Раньше у разных кораблей было разное количество десанта, у тебя больше солдат чем у врага, автобой - корабль твой, лети, продавай трофей. Теперь, идиотская мини игра, с одной кнопкой выполняющей функцию "далее". По сути время много на неё уходит, а смысла в ней ни на грош.
     Карта маловата, хоть во 2ю часть играл давно, но, кажется каждый гекс на ней был сам по себе, а теперь их объединили, по 2-4 гекса, с 1 станцией, реже двумя, не знаю уж, но стало заметно теснее. Титан - имба, но уныл, на авианосце мне в разы больше понравилось играть. Да и в прошлой части они тоже были.
     Короче, как ДЛЦ бы зашла, но как отдельная игра она не очень. Да и кампания неинтересная на мой взгляд. 4 из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960431308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1213, 'last_played': 1680648270}
review:
If you want to play with a controller, give this game a pass.  It is lying about full controller support.  The ability to lock onto targets, that is present in the keyboard controls, is missing from the controller.

This makes it impossible to target a specific ship with any of your abilities, or even keep track of their shields.  As any time another ship or object travels in front of your crosshair your target will switch to them instead.  And forget about trying to fight within an asteroid field, as it will keep trying to target rocks instead of the enemies shooting at you.

This issue was reported 8 months ago, and frequently over the interm by multiple people with no action on their part to fix it.  

But hey, they spent the time to introduce Chroma Link support, so your keyboard can flash at you instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030630304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4223, 'last_played': 1529946417}
review:
Hi guys,
This review may mostly find interest with people who played Starpoint Gemini 2, since i spent hundread of hours on it. So, let's do some comparisons :
- The main thing is : you have to build your own ship armada and conquert the galaxy ! Even planets ! :)
- But don't worry, the gameplay is not so different. Dogfights are the same, moving between zones, commerce, quests are the same.
- Speaking about moving, there is no rift anymore. You know, the green tunnels we could use to quickly go from one point to another. Just wormholes and TGates now.
- The boarding system is much more funny ! Also, no need to waste time to tow a captured ship to the nearest station. When you capture a ship, some of your own will come and tow it to your base for you !
- One thing which disappointed me a little is the number of ships. There are less than in SG2. The design is also a bit different, but it's OK.
- The scale between ships is much appropriate. You really feel the difference between a very little Gunship and a huge Dreadnought. Cool ! Speaking of this, the Titan are as big of a whole station, but you can still dock "inside" it. Weird  ;)
- The icons of the weapon/equipement is not as good as in SG2. Personnal point of view... The new icons are all the same and not as pretty as the old ones.
- With the last DLC, you can restart the game a choose a different starting point, even a different gameplay. That's nice :)
- The Nemesis (Wasmaster to find and kill for money) are still here, but it looks like they don't move anymore. I need to confirm this. Looks like when you are near them, you fight one of their fleet, and when you destroy it, you get the position of the Nemesis on your map, and it don't move anymore ! Never, ever ! I liked they old system, you had to hunt them, chase them on the map. Finding them was a victory, killing them was a performance ! It's not as funny now.
- The research system is also something new. Search for new module for your base, new ship design for your fleet, new weapons for your ship, using the ressources you collect from the zones you conquered. Nice.
- And yes, you just have to use the research menu to learn new weapon system. No need to hunt and destroy big ships to collect weapon/system parts anymore.
- Don't worry about "forbidden items" in your cargo. Looks like the security of Gemini don't care anymore if you bring prohibited stuffs in their station. Maybe this will be corrected in a next patch.
- You can't purchase special contracts with faction anymore. Like "will grant you money each week", or "use TGate free", or "will give you 10k for each ship from faction XXX you destroy". Now, if your reputation is good enough with a faction, you can ask them if their is anything you can do for them, and they will give you a quest. That's nice ;)
- You can't recruit people to boost your ship power anymore. You are on your own my friend ! But you can get "friends" who will join your fleet if you free/find them. Kind of "heros" which will stay with you, even if their ship get destroyed.

See you later, space Cowboys ! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032532912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2879, 'last_played': 1680650851}
review:
I enjoyed the time I spent playing this game.  The graphics were good and it was a freelancer sim I had been looking for at the time.  Starting out as a scout sized ship and ending with a Titan/Carrier style ship that can destroy 90% of what the game throws at it.  The other 10% will still go down, but without the right setup...you should have ran from the fight.

The developers are active and will assist you if there is a problem.  Major plus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025393227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1500, 'last_played': 1515509864}
review:
先講個人給的分數，總分10分的話我給這款遊戲5分。
這款遊戲的內容跟Starpoint Gemini 2非常相似，差異在於二代玩家代表的是一個獨立的團體，然後在Gemini這個銀河系冒險，而Starpoint Gemini Warlord這款遊戲中玩家則是扮演某個勢力，可以在真正意義上去攻略其他勢力並稱霸Gemini。
優點的話包括有：漂亮的宇宙、立體的宇宙戰、豐富的船艦系列與武器類別、還算不錯的勢力分佈(遊戲中有數十個不同的勢力，彼此各自結盟並敵對)。
缺點的話包括有：
1.船艦等級差距所導致的戰力差過大，遊戲中總共有11個不同等級的船艦，從最小型的砲艇到巨無霸的無畏艦都有，而這些船艦每一階級的戰力差距過大，導致玩家幾乎都只會追求最高等級的泰坦級，其他類型的船艦真的就只是過過場而已。
2.遊戲的錢與資源獲得速度不夠快，遊戲中玩家大概得花上約20~30小時左右的時間去農錢，因為買高等級的船艦所需要的錢非常誇張的高(億起跳)，解一場難易適中的任務大概可以賺1~2百萬，花費大概15~20分鐘，於是就會導致玩家在整個遊戲中就是不斷重複的解小任務渡過，而遊戲本身的劇情模式後半段會需要建造超級武器，而這個超級武器所需要的資源誇張的多，甚至會讓人想乾脆就把遊戲開著放置play好來累積資源。因此這一點非常嚴重的破壞玩家體驗。
3.傭兵任務(非主線)難易度差距過大，遊戲中的傭兵任務難度是看玩家等級來安排的，但如同前面提到的錢難賺的問題，導致玩家一定會出現等級已經到了但卻沒錢買船的狀況，但偏偏傭兵任務的難度還是照樣提升上去，於是就會直接造成某些任務根本解不了。
4.如同虛設的物流系統，遊戲中所有可以停靠的行星或太空站幾乎都有販售商品，而這些商品在不同區域會有不同價格，理論上來說玩家應該可以靠買低賣高來賺錢，但由於這套商品系統的利潤實在是低到可憐的境界，花幾乎相同的時間，去跑一場傭兵任務賺的很可能是貿易的3~4倍，因此直接讓這套系統變得很雞肋。另外遊戲中還有小行星帶、宇宙垃圾區等區域的存在，玩家可以開採成商品來賣，而這點在Starpoint Gemini 2賺起錢來還不算太糟，但來到Warlord後就一樣變得很雞肋了。
5.惱人的平民船團系統，遊戲中玩家麾下會有一定數量的平民商船，而地圖上會隨機出現「可採集」點，玩家必須手動一一點選這些可採集點然後派平民船團去收集資源或資訊，而這個系統非常的煩人，因為每幾分鐘就得重新指派新的任務，整個作業感非常非常重。
6.過於簡陋的戰略系統，老實說Warlord的戰略成分真的不佳，遊戲中的宇宙戰如果玩家沒親自開船艦去參與，就會變成單純的比戰力數字，玩家能插手的只剩下點撤退而已，沒有陣型、沒有優先集火之類的東西。

總體而言，作為Starpoint Gemini 2的續作，我個人認為它表現的反而更糟糕，因此不推薦這款。

author: {'steamid': '76561198006951604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2582, 'last_played': 1518690796}
review: По бабкам не кусается. Стимовская версия идет в 2 раза плавнее существующей пиратки. Локализация жесть конечно, но общий смысл понятен, надеюсь допилят со временем, а то очень режет глаз. Есть чем заняться, разнообразные но не оригинальные побочки. Гринда может чуть больше чем надо. Управление необычное, но если привыкнуть очень даже удобное, спасает ситуацию автоогонь+обзор с турелей. В целом положительные впечателения. Хорошая игра за свои деньги.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970469107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1582054862}
review:
Lots of fun. I have played a whole bunch of space games as it is probably my favorite genre. The camera control was a little wonky, I had to turn the sensitivity all the way down and it still moves very quickly. The resource/fleet management was a fun break from blowing everything up. It would have nice to be able to lock the camera onto your marked target so it would remain centered in view as opposed to having to spin the camera wildly around to locate what you want to shoot at. Especially since your turrets won't fire if the target is not withing their arc; there are no indicators to inform you of this arc.

Combat is fast paced and satisfying although the weapons don't feel like they have much weigh to them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210180168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1115, 'last_played': 1652284346}
review:
Bon jeu de gestion-stratégie (prise en compte de l'économie, besoin d'effectuer des recherche, gestion des constructions/ressources). Prise en main un peu difficile pour les phases de combat au début, mais une fois assimilée cela ne gène plus.
Un Eve Online like mais en solo.
Quelques points à améliorer pour la gestion (pas de changement de vaisseaux pour les seigneurs de guerre sous vos ordres, interface utilisateur peu ergonomique pour les phases de combat...) mais reste agréable à jouer.

Jeu chronophage, comme tout jeu de gestion qui se respecte, je ne recommande pas ce jeu aux personnes qui veulent juste du piou piou, car trop de paramètre à prendre en compte dans la gestion qui augmente l'expérience dans le dogfight.
Ne convient pas aux joueurs qui ne veulent pas se creuser la tête pour comprendre un minimum (abandon à peine 10min de jeu car ne comprennent pas le gameplay).
Côté graphique, bah cela reste agréable, sans pour autant vous péter la rétine (dans le bon sens ou mauvais), mais bon dans un jeu de gestion/stratégie c'est secondaire, vu que l'on peut passer son temps sur la carte du jeu pour tout y gérer.

Donc pour apprécier ce jeu, faut brancher ses 2-3 neuronnes et profiter de l'expérience.

Petite mise en garde si vous n'êtes pas trop fufute pour les options: il y a un launcher, beaucoup de celles-ci se paramètrent via celui-ci (langue, activation mod...), donc faîtes un tour si vous trouvez pas IG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165551957', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1737, 'last_played': 1676069558}
review:
Excelent game, and it could be said that this is Mount & Blade in space if you, like me, Have played and/or liked it. Many have said that this game tries to be too many things at once and fails at beign "amazing" at any of them, It may even be true, however, this game is one of the few that manage to almost seamlessly include so many diferent ways to played, you can be a trader, a pirate amongst other things. I most certainly recommend this game. 



9/10.

review:
I went into this not really knowing what to expect, being new to the gemini series, however I can say with certainty that it is without a doubt one of my favorite games. the amount of stuff to do is seemingly endless and my first playthrough of the campaign scenario left not a lot to be desired aside from some minor technical aspects.

the only thing that I can think of off hand that I would like to see is a way to conquer a planet/territory through diplomacy rather than blowing it to hell with a space laser.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035330949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 5445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1415, 'last_played': 1607825958}
review:
If you liked SG2 then you'll probably like SGW, it adds a couple of not so complicated mechanics like having your own HQ and trading/diplomacy with other groups and guilds. 
Farming it is still as fun as it is necesary, there's a job board now instead of the random map missions, and ships are customizabled pretty much as in SG2, althought there are way more perk points earned this time around.
Boarding ships is improved too as well as having a fllet and a ship building menu. Overall a pretty fun game. 
The MOD community is very alive and creating great content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005967789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1514805726}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031577859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5846, 'last_played': 1539697430}
review:
Finally a game that reminds me of Eve Online, just offline 😝. If you don’t like grinding to feel a sense of accomplishment, then don’t bother getting this game. Since I enjoy hardcore MMOs this is truly a walk in the park, just allow some time to familiarize yourself with controls and concept. Within 15 hours you will have a fleet establish, running your civilian task like clockwork. Also the fact that this game is always self-generating combat and action in the background always leaves that feeling of threat that one of your systems are being captured. Yes, the game has some corks to iron out and much to add, but if LGM keeps it up they can truly turn this into one of the hottest mesh-up of genres I ever seen. Again the play style takes a bit from Stellaris, Eve online, Everspace and Endless Space 2 all at once.

Please note: check out the Mods for this game it also adds to the fun, such as the Ship Mods. Nothing like a good old Star Destroyer or Star Trek ship in the station for sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100985772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1516028929}
review: 不错   ，就是渣翻译有点让人头疼
developer_response: 你好放逐之翼，感谢评论！我们意识到了之前的汉化版本有严重的问题，去年拿到汉化文本时我们还没有能力对其进行校对，因此对玩家造巨大困扰，我们深表歉意。一个月前我们开始了一些优化升级的工作，包括修复了征战模式（剧情和教程）下的大部分汉化问题，并且重新翻译了最新的DLC：努米比亚之崛起并对游戏世界观做了新的的补充说明，以及新加了不少操作提示等等。这些优化和修复会随着本周的一次更新一同到来，我们会继续优化并且更加重视中文游戏的体验，希望你能继续支持我们并向我们提供反馈。谢谢！

author: {'steamid': '76561197970780175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1550, 'last_played': 1664646462}
review:
Got this game since a few days and i wasn't planning to write a review yet, but seeing the "mixed" rating, makes me want to. I will write a more thorough review later on, but right now i just really want to give this a thumbs up.

A few of the negative reviews are right on some points, but overall this is a really good game. I had it on my wishlist for a long time and bought it now because of sales. And i regret it, cause i should have bought it on launch :) This game got me hooked like no other game has in recent times. Haven't been this excited about this kind of game since i played Freelancer way back. Yes, it is a little rough around the edges. Story, voice acting, some sounds effects, etc... make it obvious it's an indie title. But otherwise this is much better than i expected and i just scratched the surface.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087598427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1514393798}
review:
Good concept but poorly executed. 
Game lacks polish and that finishing touch in every aspect.
Awkward controls that make basic game mechanics (navigation, movement, combat) tedious and unpleasant.
UI that is not really helping you to orient in 3D space.
Voice acting and soundtrack in on average level but acceptable for a game with low budget.
Most of the time, they use dialogues anyway. 
So in story missions instead having a nice cut-scene where you exit a T-drive (warp) with some nice camera focus on a ship wreckage (or whatever the mission is),
the window will popup with dialogues for you to read and make some nonsense dialogue choices that do not affect gameplay in anyway.

Graphics looks like in 2007 and not in 2017. Very basic lighting, shadows, low quality explosions, textures and laser weapon effects.
While flying into asteroid field individual asteroid pops in. Poor optimization, I had noticeable stuttering when additional resources where loaded.   

Combat, due to awkward controls is unsatisfying. Before you will get a change to lock on target and actually fallow it, your allies will finish the job for you.

This game could be epic, like better than Freelancer or Freespace 2, but it falls short instead. 
I hope the next iteration of Starpoint Gemini will improve in those areas.
LGM sudio has great IP but their need to step up their game to be successful.

At this point I can't recommend this game. I'm going to refund this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046414246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1514273995}
review:
Looks cool but it is not a serious space sim.
On the good side there is a variety of ships, gear, trading and missions you can do. 
Unfortunately I coudn't take the time to try mining, station building or fleet management before refunding.
Besides graphically is not demanding, it runs smoothly at 2k and 4k resolutions.

It's a game for consoles therefore flying controlls are very basic and it does not support Hotas controllers at all. Flying and combat controls feel unpleasant.

There is no station walking or planet landing or 3D galaxy map. AI could be better,
NPC's are just portraits, somehow the game feels empty and lifeless.

The game is ok for the price, considering it is an indie developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042766148', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 9243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7022, 'last_played': 1618933049}
review:
Update:

Mein größter Kritikpunkt (sehr schlechte Übersetzung) wurde mittlerweile dankensweise behoben.

Das Gameplay erinnert ein wenig an Freelancer, nur das man statt Jäger nun ab Korvetten und Schlachtschiffe bis hin zu gewaltigen Titanen steuert.
Leider unterscheiden sich die Kämpfe zwischen den verschidenen Schiffsklassen kaum, was mir auf Dauer etwas zu eintönig wurde.

Dank einigen wirklich guten Schiffs Mods (Star Wars & Star Trek), ist es durchaus unterhaltsam.


**********************************************************************
**********  Verbesserungsvorschäge an die Entwickler  **********
**********************************************************************

- Sorgt für mehr Diversität für alle Schiffsklassen, 
-- z.B. Fregatten mit Jägerabwehr kapazität
-- Suport schiffe die eure Flotte reparieren/Schilde aufladen oder eine große Schildblase erzeugen und euren Schiffen Deckung geben.
-- Getarnte Zerstörer die aus dem Hinterhalt angreifen
-- Schiffe die feindliche Sensoren stören/feindlich störaktionen verhindern, oder getarnte Schiffe aufspüren
-- Schiffe mit fixen und großen Langstreckenwaffen
-- Interdictor ähnliche Schiffe, die verhindern das feindlich Schiffe fliehen können
-- Kaperschiffe usw. wenn man nur will kann man so viel machen.

- Mehr Variationen für Waffen, anstatt großen Schiffen einfach mit mehr Türmen austattten, wie wäre es wenn die stattdessen eigens große Wummen bekommen, die gut gegen andere Dickschiffe sind, aber schlecht gegen kleinere Schiffe etc.

- Mehr und bessere Kontrolle über die eigen Flotte, anstatt nur gehe dahin bzw. folge mir
-- z.B. eine strategische Ansicht die man wie die Map einblenden und den eigenen Schiffen RTS ähnlich direkt anweisungen geben kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995538748', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1514228210}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024150829', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4954, 'last_played': 1514040498}
review:
My negative review rests on conquest mode wich I played mostly:
You start with your territory (you can decide how much is large and which ship to play). 
My big disappoint is AI doesn't have a proper economy. When you win a battle and destroy enemy fleet, AI will get it back after some time (depending on conquest difficulty).
Diplomacy is horrible, because you are the only one who can make alliance or declare war. Other factions will play as usual and patrol their territory until you don't declare war and be adjacent to them to be attacked. 
The universe seems like dead.
Other activies besides fleet war are boring and not worth the time you spend on such as mining/collecting gas or materials. (except you buy prosperity titan). 
If you buy titan dlc and get one in game, you literally have done the game, because AI will never be up to it.
Combat is fine, but i excepted a deeper system.
Trade system is okay, even though it's simple. 

I enjoyed the first hours in the game, but it gets easily boring given that it lacks many important aspects and fall short of expectations.
Some people used to call this game "mount and blade in space", but it lacks an aspect that made mount and blade a great game: an interactive system. 
That's not what I expected from a game who promises to have a conquest mode, it's too much simple.

The content of the game is not worth the full price.

I hope in the future I can edit this review in positive, since devs are very nice.
Sorry for my English.

review: 挺好玩，虽然没有X系列那么细致，但是比起X.R也算是满足了开大船的欲望。但是说真的这个汉化实在很粗糙，感觉完全没做过校对之类的，举例：Outsland出现了两种翻译：“奥特斯兰”和“外域”。。。这种一会音译一会意译的情况很多，很糟心。有点英语底子的话还是干脆玩英文好了。。。
developer_response: 您好TCT，感谢您的评论。我们注意到了汉化版有严重的问题，我们在之前得到汉化翻译文本时还没有能力对中文进行校对，对您造成了困扰，为此向您道歉。一个月前我们开始了对汉化的优化工作，目前已经修复了征战模式（剧情和教程）下的大部分汉化问题，并且重新翻译了最新的DLC：努米比亚之崛起同时优化了中文的商店页面。这些优化和修复会随着下周的一次更新一同到来，我们会继续优化并且更加重视中文游戏的体验，希望您能继续支持我们并向我们提供反馈。

author: {'steamid': '76561198033600090', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2961, 'last_played': 1540359622}
review:
Another hit by LGM! Warlords is sleek, friendly, and down right fun. The game allows players to manage an small faction and turn it into an empire. Add and upgrade additions to your HQ, set up infrastructure, and build huge fleets to conquer and defend territory!

The game blends the adventure that the Starpoint Gemini games already do so well, with the tactical thoughfulness of a 4x, and does so without becoming daunting and tedious. The two genre's elements play very well together, and really do feel seamless. Managing your empire is very easy and intuitive. There are various upgrades to your HQ itself, your infrastructure (mining facilities, guardposts, etc), as well as to your civilian ships and of course, to your military ships. Building military fleets is easy and fun, and you have complete control over both your civilian and military fleets. Civilian fleets can be assigned to gather resources, and military fleets can be told to move anywhere you want, to merge with other friendly fleets, or to follow the player, all in real time. 

What fleets do is all totally visible, allowing you to assist any fleets that are in combat and lemme just say, taking the helm and charging into combat surrounded by a fleet of ships, is maybe one of the most satisfying feelings I've ever had in gaming. It looks stunning, and nothing makes me quite as giddy as when as barrage just erupts from around me into the enemy fleet. There are also heroes you can recruit, that sort of "lead" your fleets in a way. They have skills like the player does, and their ships upgrade over time, also like the player. Heroes have no control over the fleet itself, but they do provide the "face" of the fleet, and tend to lead the charge alongside the player.

There's also a light diplomacy system, where you can negotiate peace, go to war, or otherwise aid other factions. It isn't too fleshed out compared to the other mechanics, but it's still impactful, and feels like a good step up from the reputation system of the last game, and definitely fits the bill of this game better. Being peaceful is totally an option though. And with that, so is trading! Trading is arguably a little more dangerous in this game compared to SPG2, but with the ability to assign your fleets to follow you, you can travel with some guards.

As for the adventure aspect: you start in a small gunship, but can work your way up to some towering monsters. Coupled with that, your character can gain experiend and level up, allowing you to take skills, which are the abilities you activate, and perks, which are your passive buffs. Gaining both experience and money can come from engaging in combat and selling the spoils, or taking missions from job boards on planets and stations. Progression feels solid, and at no point have I felt like I was falling behind or my gain was decreasing, as the game's general difficulty scales with the player's level. Lastly there's exploring, which is a blast in and of itself because the game is truly just gorgeous (there's a pinned screenshots thread if you wanna see for yourself). The map is plenty large too, even if it may not look it at first sight, so there's plenty to see!

All around it's a wonderful game and LGM really outdid themselves this time. Even if you've never played a Starpoint Gemini game, this is worth a gander for sure. Anyone who has played an SPG game will find themselves perfectly at home in Warlords though!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971682199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3572, 'last_played': 1539731626}
review:
TL;DR: Absolutely loved this game.
As another reviewer stated - this is kinda-sorta Mount and Blade in space. If you're like me, I absolutely loved M&B. I also loved the Homeworld series, which SGW also very much reminds me of.

Don't mind reviewers who only played the game for 5 minutes then wrote a negative review - the game opens up after about 30 minutes to an hour. You go from a "contained tutorial" where the game teaches you the basics while giving you missions. It isn't until after a significant event the game really unleashes what's available to you. Believe me when I say the game really unleashes on you - it's almost a whole new game. Without spoiling anything, you go from getting assistance from allied ships in the tutorial part of the game, to commanding those allied ships (that you've specifically built and assigned to fleets) to either carry out your orders and/or follow you across the space plane. 

I'm not big on the Pros/Cons type listing, but I'll spout some stuff off: the controls in the beginning can be really annoying, especially if you've played other M+KB vessel games like War Thunder, but you'll either get used to it or be smart and change the controls yourself. The atmospheric graphics are incredible and immersive, but the craft themselves can be a little lacking. The GUI and some other aspects scream "Indie," but you know what? Those have been my favorite games. 

It's OK that this game doesn't have AAA aspects, because 1) it isn't priced at AAA prices, 2) Indie games have their own charm (this gem is full of it), and 3) Dev support - just take a look on the steam forums for this game and you'll see the Devs responding and contributing to tons of converstations. That's a fantastic aspect! 

I absolutely love this game and I just started playing. I love this game so much, that out of hundreds of games in my steam profile - this is the first I felt obligated to review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330001892', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2457, 'last_played': 1580404427}
review:
Alright, what to say about SPG Warlords. i decided to take the plunge and buy an actual space game (not elite dangerous).

Starpoint Gemini Warlords was the first game in the SPG series ive ever played, I've never even heard of this series or the developer, LGM. As for the game, I'm LOVING it! the visuals are great, the atmosphere and general feeling of the game is capturing. It almost makes you want to be able to live that kind of life..

You start off from what i believe is the ending of sorts from the last game, and what an amazing way of starting the game I must add. There are plenty of ships to choose from all the way up to giant capital ships, many many missions and places to visit. There is a 4x style map where you can send civilian fleets to gather resources or tech, and in this map you can communicate with other planet ambassadors and wage war or make peace. 

The developers for this game are on point! if I had a problem they would try to help me not 5 minutes after making a steam discussion on it. 

Pros
-massive fleets of easily 40+ ships
-HUGE map
-Very easy learning curve

Cons
-Ships in said fleet WILL constantly run into your ship (no damage taken)
-a little bit grindy

author: {'steamid': '76561198020359369', 'num_games_owned': 1842, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3052, 'last_played': 1511115794}
review:
(Note : I only played the vanilla game, not sure if the DLC fix or add stuff that would make me change my mind.)

TL;DR : The game is a nice improvement on its predecessor and is not "bad", but it promises a lot and fails to deliver.


The game is quite enjoyable at first, but it also has a number of flaws that made me stop playing past the main campaign (which can be seen as an oversized tutorial for the sandbox part of the game).

The first 10 hours are great - controls are unusual (but that wasn't an issue for me), the campaign is rather well written, lots of things to do, a huge map to explore. The game looks really promising at this point, offering various aspects such as diplomacy, trade, conquest...but most of them unfortunately fall short of expectations.

Faction relations basically evolve based on the number of [insert enemy name here] destroyed, trading is not dynamic and boring (while they are oddly large numbers of different goods available), asteroid mining/salvaging is time-consuming and yields really little, player progression and conquest are quite grindy...
Space combat is also quite disappointing (although visually satisfaying), all ships are behaving more or less the same and there is no real sense of perspective (even big ships feel kinda small, which is sad).

I liked the game up to a certain point, but in the end, it just lacks depth and I lost interest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052756686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1513466372}
review: Zuerst einmal: Die deutsche Lokalisation ist nach wie vor ein Witz. Wer nicht auf Englisch spielen kann oder möchte, sollte weitersuchen; Starpoint Gemini Warlords ist dann definitiv keine Option. Weiter: Habe das Spiel relativ kurz angetestet, ja. Aber was schon da klar wurde, ist das das Spiel insgesamt merkwürdig "unfertig" wirkt. Unituitive Steuerung, komisch wirkende Grafik... alles wirkt wie ein Low Budget Produkt von einem zwei Mann Team mit wenig Erfahrung. Stimmung kommt da keine auf. Als Sale kann man es mal ausprobieren (wie ich gottseidank auch), aber man sollte wirklich nichts erwarten.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986021687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1125, 'last_played': 1513444935}
review:
Игра определенно интересная. Смесь космического РПГ и стратегии.

Из плюсов:
- довольно интересная боевая система
- в отличии от предыдущих частей серии более-менее внятная сюжетная кампания
- русский перевод

Из минусов:
- управление камерой все такое-же убогое
- русский перевод

Русский перевод это просто алмаз! Он заставляет хлестать себя по лицу фейспалмами от ОРФОГРАФИЧЕСКИХ ошибок (например "КАЛИЧЕСТВО КОРАБЛЕЙ"), но с другой стороны смысл передает, а ошибки порой доставляют позитивные эмоции.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007622141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 4988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4988, 'last_played': 1512958596}
review:
TLDR: Mount and Blade IN SPACE!!! Fly around in a big space sandbox in your own spaceship and blow up (or steal) other people's ships. Level up your character, buy bigger and better ships and weapons, build bigger and better fleets, research, mine and build to expand your empire. 

This game is a great improvement on the previous entry (Starpoint Gemini 2). The biggest and most obvious improvement is the addition of 4X elements, where you now have a base that you can build up and use to build ships to protect and expand your little space empire. You collect resources from fixed mining operations that add resources to your stockpile at fixed intervals. You can also upgrade your base to give you access to new abilities (like building bigger ship classes or making mining operations more efficient). It all works well, even if it sometimes feels a bit grindy, espescially as you get higher up in the research tree (did I mention there's a small research tree?) and the resource requirements get really high.

Fortunately for the grindiness, the space combat is still pretty good. 3 types of light weapons (lasers, railguns and plasma) with different properties. And unlike the previous game, there's some reason to use the non-railgun weapons now! The class/skill system give pretty substantial bonuses and abilities to fighting up close which gives lasers and plasma a fighting chance against railgun weapons. Railguns are still the 'easier' weapon though, in that staying at long range requires less risk to use railguns in the most efficient manner, but at least you can use the other weapon types and not be at a big disadvantage.

The sandbox world is still really good. It randomly generates encounters as you travel through space so you're never bored, and this time encounters are not purely combat. There are some anomaly scanning / cargo container encounters that can lead to some interesting rewards. While not overly interesting on their own, they do add enough variety to moving around and makes the world feel bigger than just a random combat encounter generator would.

The campaign is OK, there's enough variety in the missions and the story and characters are compelling enough to get you through to the end. The one little twist at the end I really didn't expect and kept me interested to finish the game. Not quite sure the tone of the story sets up the postgame properly though (when you use the thing to blow up things and act like the evil empire the story tells you you are not). The voice acting is STILL pretty bad though, but whatever, it adds to the B-movie space charm of the entire thing.

On the bad side, the UI and the camera can be confusing at times. The camera in particular can be really confusing in your early fights, where ships move really fast and you can barely keep up as the enemy passes behind to shoot you. Fortunately there's a 'chase cam' mode which locks the camera to your current target so you can focus on steering and shooting. Unfortunately there's no tutorial on how to use this mode at all, so you'd have to figure it out yourself. There are also some little UI quirks than can be quite irritating (like the TGate menu always going to the Kokyra Gate WHEN I NEVER WANT TO GO THERE!). The game can also run sluggishly on older systems unless you turn down everything.

In all, great space sandbox game. A bit unpolished in terms of voice acting and performance, but the fights and the progression will keep you playing for hours on hours. Buy it. Play it. Don't forget to eat and shower.

review: I am enjoying this, i have dabbled in the previous installment but this one caters to my needs. Less micro management in comparison to alot of space sandbox games but you can still expand throughout a sandboxy universe while improving your own ships weapons, engines, shields, class.. its exactly what i want. Fly around building up your space empire but still enjoy kicking behinds and just fling a few orders around. Easy learning curve and solid universe to explore, a great game to switch to if you need a break from the heavier space stuff !

author: {'steamid': '76561198032585253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1661184539}
review: it would be good if jobs weren't so hard. You level too fast and the bad guys get better ships than you real quick and it makes it a CHORE to try and beat the jobs even on easy mode. I loved the other starpoint gemini games but, until they fix this the game isn't worth the money. Just get the second game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036648577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2053, 'last_played': 1512754736}
review: Great game that features all the qualities of the previous Starpoint Gemini two while expanding from a free roaming space sim into a light strategy game in which you build fleets, attack enemy bases and expand your control over the system. People have compared it to mount and blade in space and those comparisons are fair, the only issue I've taken is that the main campaign is a bit lacking and ended quite abruptly, but the meat of the game is outside of the campaign anyway so it's not the end of the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019969017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2799, 'last_played': 1618845696}
review:
This is a game that really blurs the line on genres. It's first and foremost a 3 axis of freedom space fighter, but it also has trade, diplomacy, base building, and one hell of a massive and dynamic map.

Admittedly, for each thing this game does I've seen one or two titles that do that same thing better, but this is the only game I've seen that brings them all together under one roof, and it does so wonderfully.

Resource gathering is a bit of a grind, but you'll be finding randomly spawned things along the way so there's always a new stone to look under and with the right equipment on your ship you can take an active part in resource collection and radically shorten the time it takes to save up for that new station upgrade or shiny battleship.

This is a game that's been carefully balanced so that it's equally as fun, challenging, and rewarding for multiple playstyles. The list below is NOT of the classes you can choose, of which there are several, each with their own unique skills and abilities; It's of the playstyles the player may adopt on their quest for stellar domination.

[h1]Traders[/h1]
Will find themselves sniffing out trade routes that yield massive profit margins (one in particular I found yields just over 1 million credits per loop with a freightliner, though you'll need some serious investment first.) and level themselves up the capitalist way, shoving raw money at their experience bar.

[h1]Brawlers[/h1]
Will find the arena equal parts challenging and rewarding, betting credits on winner-take-all gladiator battles which may even [spoiler]catch the eye of old, retired warlords who're bored and looking for something to shoot.[/spoiler] And when the arena no longer sates your lust, you can take to the frontier and show enemy nations what you've learned.

[h1]Pirates[/h1]
Will find themselves engaging in real-time boarding actions amidst the bullets, missles, and lasers, plundering cargoholds, crippling ship systems to bring down powerful bosses, or just storming the bridge to take what's theirs and make it yours, adding the fallen to your fleet or just selling the bullet-riddled husks for cold hard cash.

[h1]Explorers[/h1]
Will always be finding new curiosities full of loot, whether they be the drifting derelicts of destroyed titans, abandoned shipping containers from a past age of prosperity, [spoiler]alien artifacts with mysterious powers and hidden guardians[/spoiler], or even powerful wanted pirates and their unsuspecting lackeys, not knowing what ill wind is about to befall them.

[h1]Admirals[/h1]
Will be able to step out of the captain's chair and play the grand game of nations, engaging in diplomacy and backstabbing, ordering trade missions and dispatching fleets to fight wars, comissioning the construction of stations and outposts, and twisting the map to match your vision.


In the end, you and your warlords will end up taking part in all those roles to some degree and eventually all in creation will bow to your will.

But you'll have to earn that godhood first.

[h1]==============================[/h1]

Graphics: 8.5/10
Gameplay: 10/10
Immersion: 9/10
Playtime: 8/10
Replayability: 7/10

Overall conclusion: Definitely worth the price and a good addition to any space lover's library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012414543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1595, 'last_played': 1512735801}
review:
Do you want to spend hours waiting around in order to get enough resources in order to do 1/8th of the next quest, not to mention hours getting money in order to get a better ship? Then boy howdy is this game for you! 

To be fair, the combat is fun in the beginning because it's a little dog fight-y and the quests were fun but just like a cell phone game you hit a wall where it would take HOURS to do anything and the best ships are so big that combat is literally parking it in one spot and letting the autmated turrets do the rest of the work. 

I would not recommend you get this unless it's 80% off or so on a sale and you modify your save file to skip the hours and hours of farming you'd need to do in order to buy stuff in game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972120528', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1512517633}
review: Picked this one up on sale and ultimately returned it, because the ship combat really left me disappointed; I found that that fights could easily be won by parking my ship and just enabling auto-fire, on top of that piloting the ship just didn't feel satisfying, and  the whole experience just left me wanting to play X3.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986380177', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1481, 'last_played': 1521343734}
review: I bought this game as a 'look and see'. I had low expectations going into it and I found a real sleeper hit. The gameplay is more straight forward than larger scale 4x games but the additional options of playing your own ship in the fleet make up for that and provide a fun game. I've had a surprising amount of fun with this game which I'll continue to play and definitely looking to get the DLCs soon and any future game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137759046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3338, 'last_played': 1693794916}
review:
Decent title.

Certainly reminds me of Battlestar Galactica Online with the asteroid mining & 3rd person piloting. What the game might need more is UI controls. The rest are okay but controls require certain time to get use to it as there is no hand holding from the game on how to manipulate your camera.

1. Civilain Trades
As the game go later, civilain tasks for trades are just time consuming to find the right trade (Ore to Gas or Gas to Material & vice versa among the three resources). 

2. Foreign Ship Research
You can only keep track of what you have captured and sent to research when you capture them, have not found any place that you can actually see.

3. MK1's
By then building a ship is looking for something in the list of MK1 and MK2. Could be better if the list is filterable.

Take a grain of salt, I'm only in the campaign mission 7/8/9/10 trying to figure out how to get 70M credits so I can buy a Dreadnought.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008355995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 3752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3689, 'last_played': 1512413931}
review:
Its good game early on later on your notice its flaws what is somewhat replayablity destroying. But lets add shortly as possible. I dont say anything good as this is typical space game made for simples players in game genre. You have your decent grindfeast for better ships and boading. But all of these aint anything super great. Personally biggest things what i can say about this game is it has small rpg elements what really dosent expand games replayablity. So dont get hopes up making gunner ship expert as level and perks dont allow you support this gameplay style. Also empire stuff is really really simple nothing to boast about.

Lets start shaming this game now.

- Fleet managment is awful and ships are worst. I dont know what was in your mind when you make multible ships and major space battles and you handpain up ship roles and all manners of formations. More presice there is no formations when combat start smallest ships rush to meatgrinder because they dont know anything better and dies in 1 second. Yes smallest ships are useless later on and when you making fleets make biggest battleships possible. Dont waste resourses and money to gunships and destroyers. They are waste of space. Before you say why dont you order you larget ships take lead. Sadly that is not possible expect you making multible fleets where you hope to send juggernaut one first then come later on with smaller one and even then its not worth the time.

- Like previously said ships roles are awful thats because game lacks anytype of scaling. When you get levels this makes your enemys more bullet spunges like meme about skyrim where undead doing gym training when you grind on alchemy. Here you do anything you get level and punishing you playing your ideal ship type. While there are perks for early on ships but those aint saving you from meargrinders of battleships, juggernauts, and other handpain. These ships are really durable and takes long time if your not similiar class ship or be way better armed.

- UI and your vision is awful, Yea early on smaller ships i had some what sight of enemy but later on your ships are huge and you dont see handpain. So most of times i have auto shoot on and and click abilitys to kill smaller ships. Like marksman tree has bounsing shot what kills instantly 5 ships. goodbye gunnerships. You took awful job to join to. While dont do boarding action before taking look at your power supply thing. as you cannot change power supply middle of boarding action.

- game has great lack of giving intel for players about stuff in this game. There are lasers and railguns but not smaller info what is differnece between these two than range of fire and dps? I still dont know handpain about games stats but i spammed railguns and plasma because i noticed perks adding on them crits and less energy drain. While laser says somethin about shields but im dummy and i did not have time to look into game files for stats of these weapons.

- In this game light guns are you main weapon and heavy weapons are waste of money. Entire time i played this game i took so called fusion torps because of dmg. But yea these things aint so great when light guns have free ammo and special way to weak, Like one major issue in this that you coud have made heavy ammo somewhat killing shot for shieldless ships or something like that. So smaller ships like gunnerships and destroyers could be like underdogs of game. But no smaller ships has always everything worse and all up gunning you do for smaller ships are waste of space because in this game its impossible to miss your shots in auto shoots. Small ships dont have handpain anything to do later on. I would been really clever if you could honestly make sneaky marauder who uses stealth and heavy ammo to deal bigger ships. Like early on i really hoped to do so. Took fusion torps and used stealth field to shoot them to enemy ship as suprise. To notice you need about 100 nukes to kill that handpain. When light weapons kills faster than dedicated heavy weapons? Okay where is dev who made these weapon desings?

So these probles are for my option biggest issues in this game reason i cannot recommed this game. Its like devs just made game around boring all killing juggernaut and then forgot all about later ship roles. While automatic systems do your job in killing you simple add energy to your needs and controll ships movement.

Also there is lot of bugs. Just now i went new game and my gunner ship smalllest one had ramming ability of titan ship so when i fly to close to enemy impact happend like ftying with bigger one and having invisible falls around me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006758332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1511883244}
review:
Nice, relaxing and huuuuge timesink.

The game is very niche, and fails to do a lot of cool stuff that it claims to do. "Equip a ship with a variety of weapons to suit your personal combat style" really means: "There's laser 1, 2 and 3, and youre going to GRIND LIKE HELL for each of those levels that all do the same exact thing with the same exact visuals."
"Exiting and tactical fleet combat" translates into "build a fuzzball of crap and fly it at other fuzzballs! With luck you'll even manage to direct your camera at your target every now and then!"

All-in-all, combat in this game is pretty boring altogether, if you want to fly mega-fleets or cool spaceships that you have to manage, there are better games out there.

If you like the idea of captaining a vessel and taking on a space opera then this is your game. It's just not for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128903899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1656171044}
review:
I bought this game on sale on a whim. It's the same day, and I have 7 hours in... and the surface isn't even scratched yet!

The campaign does a good job of not giving you too much all at once, though veteran SPG 1/2 captains would be right at home if it did. First it has you learn your own ship, and slowly builds it up from there. Before you know it, you're managing resources and expanding your territory.

If you've played the first two games, you'll like this one. If you're new to the series, it does really well easing you into it.

review: Surprisingly entertaining it is, even for space strategy veterans like me, who have seen it all since day 1.  The spaceship control reminds me a little bit of Rebel Galaxy, the battles are great fun, not to hasty; it feels a bit like being on the bridge of the Enterprise and actually having time to give commands. Conquering territory, researching new technology and building up your Empire and Spacefleet is pretty rewarding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021136705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1513698514}
review: This game has taken me back a fair few years. All the way back in fact to Freelancer. It's a solid game with good graphics and reasonably easy to grasps controls. Similar games in this genre such as the X3 games I have not found as interesting for varying different reasons but this one really struck me. The only disappointing thing for me so far is the lack of CO-OP. This was something I was really looking for. With that said, there are valid reasons for it not being in the game and the developers have said that they would like to add it in a sequel game so hopefully in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996205554', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1117, 'last_played': 1512096265}
review:
Excellent.  4.5/5

Think Freelancer + Space 4X (ES2/Stellaris, etc.)

Essentially, you are an admiral of a flagship running your own space empire.

Single player--pretty sure there's no multiplayer option?

+: 
Engaging, constantly changing open world--lots of fun.
Great progression of ships, classes, and empire-building.
Lots to do (trade, freelance missions, random encounters).
Storyline is fun so far (I'm not nearly through with it though).
Beautiful UI.
Great graphics.

-:
Ship combat takes some getting used to--it's complex, and there are several options for piloting (mouse, keyboard) and camera (chase cam, turret cam, etc.).  

Ship automation exists and works well, but it's limited in some respects.  The ship navigation is a bit like that of Star Trek Online, but with a fire-at-will option--and you can fly in all 3 dimensions (which makes things a bit confusing sometimes).  

There's no "orbit" button, like Eve has (at least that I can find).  I would have preferred this option.

There's no target list in the UI (at least that I can find).  They should add one.

Tiny bit of a steep learning curve.  Not terrible though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069520434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1643645527}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995057880', 'num_games_owned': 732, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1078, 'last_played': 1524521926}
review:
This game is truly a breath of fresh air. A large upgrade from the already great Starpoint Gemini 2. The developers have really outdone themselves. 

Do you like Mount & Blade? Do you like epic large scale capital ship tier combat? Well this is the game for you. It borrows very much from the former medieval game, taking the attitude; 'if aint broke dont fix it'. This is a brilliant open ended, space strategy game, where you start from humble beginings and build an empire. Advance outward while buidling your own fleet. Upgrade your character and your ship along the way. Theres a severe lack of 'large scale, captial ship on capital ship' type games and this perfectly fills that niche. Imagine Sins of a Solar Empire, except you're taking direct control of one of the ships in the thick of the combat.

It has a strong RPG system, with perks and skills that will enhace your gameplay. The graphics, while nothing ground breaking are certainly well done. The ship designs are interesting and the weapons good fun to use. Positioning in combat is important, and a well rounded fleet will help you succeed. 

There are a few issues; namely the general controls (in particular the camera). However, its nothing major or game breaking after you get used to it (i'd recommend re-binding the target follow camera to something easily accesible). The AI can also be a bit dodgy, but they get the job done 9 times out of 10. 

If you're looking for that bridge commander type experience, this is the game for you. Theres nothing better that warping in to assault an enemy fleet, laser cannons blazing like some sort of macabre space disco. 

Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999689434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1510945654}
review:
Мне, как большому любителю подобных игр, SPGW вполне понравился. Однако я прекрасно понимаю немалое количество проблем, которые он имеет (и которые в свою очередь имеют нас, ага).

[b]Плюсы:[/b]
■ Возможность создавать флот и брать с собой на задания.
■ Кастомизация корабля. Достаточно косолапая и аляповатая, но приятная.
■ Немаленькая карта.
■ Достаточно симпатичная графика.
■ Интересная система развития персонажа.
■ Захват территорий и баз, исследование новых технологий, торговля с другими фракциями.
■ Поддержка модов и воркшопа в частности, достаточно простой процесс их создания и внедрения.

[b]Минусы:[/b]
■ АИ врагов и соратников не выдерживает никакой критики, поэтому групповые бои превращаются либо в банальное подавление числом, либо в выпиливание вражин в одно лицо потому как союзники слились ещё на подступах. Неумение врагов преследовать игрока тоже не помогает.
■ Откровенно аркадная боёвка. Тут вам не иксы и не элита, пиу-пиу протекает практически нос к носу с врагом. Про ловкие манёвры и уклонение можете тоже забыть, корабли двигаются немногим элегантнее утюгов в киселе.
■ В интерфейс разработчики так и не научились даже на третьей части игры, он по прежнему никакущий. Особенно раздражает интерфейсный круг вокруг корабля, который в бою и не разглядишь толком. Нет бы сделать классические плашки со статусами щитов, корпуса и энергии в углу/внизу экрана - так нет, хотим быть впереди планеты всей и внедрять бесполезные инновации. Тьфу. Горячие клавиши всего на четыре предмета. А предметов этих десятка два. Готовьтесь регулярно заходить в меню корабля и менять рой жуков и газосборщик на т-двигатель и астероидный бур, ну и тому подобное. Это не было бы такой большой проблемой если бы можно было назначить произвольные клавиши на использование этих предметов прямо из инвентаря - но нет, такой радости тоже не завезли.
■ Микроменеджмент, тонны его. Гражданские флоты не могут сами искать цели для добычи ресурсов, построенным кораблям нельзя назначить самостоятельно просоединяться к флотам/игроку. Даже производство кораблей нельзя поставить на непрерывный поток - только очередь, и очередь эту нельзя сделать больше чем количество, на которое хватает ресурсов.
■ Искусственное ограничение скорости развития игрока через привязку доступных типов кораблей к уровню. Что в приснопамятном "Freelancer" это раздражало, что здесь. А почему это сделано становится понятно если этот ограничитель убрать модом: деньги тут не являются большой проблемой, если не заниматься отыгрышем - нагрести на титан и пойти нагибать вражеские армады можно за несколько часов усиленного гринда. То есть вместо разработки баланса "маленькие зелёные люди" решили просто использовать старый добрый левел-лок аки в какой-нибудь РПГ, "этот меч требует 20 уровень героя, лососните тунца".
■ Довольно бедноватый список типов оружия. Нет торпед, нет блокираторов двигателей, непонятно зачем введённое разделение на лёгкое и тяжелое оружие (при том что в ванили тяжёлое оружие своего названия не оправдывает совсем). Неинтуитивная и не наглядная система его установки ситуацию тоже не спасает. Какие-то циферки у слотов вроде 1/6 (шесть пушек в одну ячейку, ага), вот это вот всё. Что мешало просто сделать свободные слоты под каждое орудие списком, без этих хипстерских рисуночков? Иконки у оружия кстати отвратные, но их можно поменять модом или вообще руками на что угодно за пять минут.
■ То, что ты командир станции, никого не волнует. Нельзя, встретив какое-нибудь патрульное звено кораблей, приказать ему присоединиться к тебе на задании. Что говорите? Планету бомбят? А наша хата с краю, мы тут только патрулируем. Строй корабли сам, и только сам.

[b]Итог:[/b]
Несмотря на немалое число спорных и откровенно неудачных геймплейных решений, игра достаточно хороша и может доставить удовольствие любителям космосимов. Если вы один из них - берите со всеми дополнениями. Но по скидке, до полной цены её выхлоп не дотягивает. Остальным брать исключительно ради большого желания приобщиться к космосимам, для новичка игры серии Starpoint Gemini будут как раз.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200377238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4215, 'last_played': 1552526933}
review:
Quick overview:

Rating: 6.5/10
Pros:
*Great fun to play
*Mashup of many different game types
*3D open world
*Excellent variety of ships
*Interesting combat
Cons:
*Very buggy
*Lacks sufficient mission diversity
*Flawed functionality of certain game features
*Poorly executed in game info displays
*Weapon/ship stats not available easily or without looking through the game files.


More detailed overview:

Overall the general feel and type of game that Starpoint Gemini Warlords 'aspires' to be is what makes it a game which I keep coming back to play. It’s definitely worth getting if you KNOW you enjoy these types of games. However, it feels as though it's half cooked. It has bugs coming out of its ears and the developers clearly lack a project implementation review board because they haven't addressed basic issues. I'll not start on the various elements of the game that I could criticise because you'll be reading for hours but despite that, it’s still very enjoyable to play. The mashup of RPG elements like class skills and perks with fleet management from strategy games means there will be something that suits everyone. You also aren't limited to one style of play either. You can be an economic miner or an aggressive pirate swashbuckling marauder. 
Another positive note is that it appears the developers are still making lots of changes rapidly to address the inadequacies of the game. With time most bugs at least will be systematically removed. Game GUI both in the menu and in game might take longer (if at all) for them to fix.
With substantial bug fixes combined with a complete overhaul of the information display system for EACH aspect of the game so people don't have to look into game files or forums for basic game mechanic info, this game would be amazing. Through in some more content and diversity as well then this game would be a solid nine out of ten. However it isn't. Currently it’s about a 6.5/10 if ten is perfection and everyone loves the game and one is just pure excrement.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991688642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1511644978}
review:
Holy ship I love this game.

Open world space game, very few restrictions on anything, where it's just you, (and later on your fleet) to conquer space. Do quests, board and steal ships, find space treasure, help damsels in disress, fight pirates and make alliances. Or not. 

Take stations, ship factories, resource productions, territory, build fleets, upgrade your own ship, like, endlessly. Paint it pink and call it "HMS Hello Kitty McDEATH" before you ram it into some unsuspecting pirate and board him. (You can actually do that..) 

It's like the open space sim world you wish you could live in. And now you kinda can. If you ever watched Serenity and wished there was a game like that, well, burrah, here it is. 

Haters hate, because its hard, its a grind and its a long way to the top. But man, when your Dreadnough Halberd is crusing thowards that pant-shitting planet, accomponied by a fleet of carriers, cruisers and a bloody planet cracker..You will know you did the right thing. 

The grapichs are so stunning, I never got bored. And for some reason even my retarded laptop can run it at full specs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981447036', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1975, 'last_played': 1586879810}
review:
So ich glaub dann schreib ich auch mal was zu dem Spiel.

Da ich eine sehr sehr lange Zeit Freelancer gespielt habe und so lange nach einem spiel gesucht habe was dieses Feeling wiederbringt, bin ich auf Starpoint gestoßen. 

Vom Spielerischem her muss ich sagen bin ich schon begeistert.

Handeln , Diplomatie, Mining  oder doch lieber alles Zerstören und einnehmen.

Das Handelssystem muss ich sagen ist fast so wie bei freelancer genau so wie mining und das Dropfarmen mit Traktorstrahl.
Das Diplomatiesystem ist jetzt nicht total kompliziert (und ich bin garkein Strategiespieler) macht aber trotzdem spass.

Die Grafik ist für mich als freelancer spieler bombig, und für das spiel richtig passend.
Genau so wie das Handling der Schiffe und die Gefechte .

Alles in Alllem ein Super spiel was sau viel spass macht.
Von mir eine Klare emphelung!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038012134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2443, 'last_played': 1511624584}
review:
One of the most complete SPG game, i played a lot of Starpoint Gemini 2 but never trough they would accomplish so much with the third game of the series, there is still some work to be done. Like adding a real free roam experience and not another  concord start

The 2nd lacked the ability to build your own space empire, in this one it's (almost) done, we will regret the lack of a true 4X army with a dozens of ships that roam the system and conquer it for you while you do your things but it's still possible to just send your only fleet to conquer place while you do what you want, but that not as fun especialy since the planet conquest require you to be there anyway.

Overall a great Starpoint Gemini, true to the series, driving campaign, good learning curve for those who never played the 2nd or the first, and this one dosn't spoil you the two first game (unless you do Titan return dlc but the spoilers are minimum, wich is great for those who want to do the olds games).

For me the best space game since the X series, it dont get as close as complete as the X's but it's still great and like i said, the story campaign is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012539171', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4671, 'last_played': 1519525596}
review:
So I am guilty here of playing the game pretty early on in beta, I then did not put much effort into the game at release. I have to say im glad I have picked it back up again the last couple of weeks because once you give a good chance you will get sucked in like I did. 

Controls will take some getting used to but and done well enough once you get used to them. Also have different camera styles for all player types. 

Combat is fun if not alittle annoying with enemies not moving a great deal so you tend to just fly around in a circle or pretty much just stop, makes large battles feel cramped.  I also felt like there could have been little more to ship boarding not sure what but just somthing more. 

This has pretty much every I want in a space scifi game. Multiple ship types, good ship combat, fleets, trading, bounty hunting, OK campaign (if not overly in depth) and the ability to upgrade your space station, plus much more. Add steam wrok shop and regular DLC this game will keep you going for good amount of time.

review: 这游戏操作确实很不习惯 如果你坚持下来玩几个小时，熟悉了操作以后会发现你打开了新世界的大门。游戏的玩法可玩性很高跟着剧情走就基本学会了操作与经营。看着自己带着舰队杀的不亦乐乎

author: {'steamid': '76561198051452646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10929, 'last_played': 1510587882}
review:
Question: Does the idea of piloting your own ship around a HUGE galaxy making money from tasks like bounty hunting, convoy raiding, mining etc. sound like fun? 

Second Question: Does the idea of building a galactic empire through the build up of a huge fleet to conquer space stations and eventually planets appeal to you?

If the answer to both questions is yes, then go ahead and buy this game.

What I like:

- Freedom to explore the Gemini galaxy at my own pace. Outside of the campaign there is no artificial time limit to finish a scenario so I can mine, scavenge, look for bounties etc. as and when I feel like it.
- Dynamic spaceship combat. Whether I'm alone or in command of a fleet, there's no such thing as simply sitting back and letting the game play itself out. 
- The visuals are an improvement over the previous game in the franchise.
- The developers are active on the game forums and try to help players with technical or gameplay problems.

What I don't like:

- This is a game heavily dependent on scripts and the game has grown to the point where it's acquired a mind of its own. The developers seem to be one or two steps behind when it comes to keeping the game free of bugs, crashes and glitches.
- Some features from Starpoint Gemini 2 didn't make it into this game (dynamic trading system, faction side-quests with unique storylines)
- The game needs a game cache verification or 2-3 minutes to run and load up the first time I play it after switching on my PC. The former means having to reset my settings each and every time while the latter risks the game crashing halfway through the process. Once this "teething" problem on my PC is done, the game loads and runs very smoothly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135247084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1510532886}
review: Starpoint Gemini Warlords é um jogo interessante, com um gráfico e ambiente de exploração incríveis, que basicamente são as unicas coisas que vão de fato impressionar nele, muitos fazem propaganda dele como um "Mount & Blade de naves espaciais", se você comprar esse jogo esperando por isso, sinto muito mas você vai se decepcionar bagarai, por mais que os desenvolvedores queiram vender ele como sendo um fodendo sandbox, daqueles que arrancam horas e horas dos fãs do gênero, não chega nem perto disso, o jogo tem um modo de progressão pré-definido sim, mas é extremamente implícito. As quests formam uma historinha interessante, mas diferente dos sandbox comuns, você não vai conseguir progredir direito se não fizer elas (Ou seja, sandbox é o cacete).

author: {'steamid': '76561198280751923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2150, 'last_played': 1517741014}
review:
首先，要说的是这游戏的操作的确就像很多玩家包括媒体说的困难。但要我细说的话应该是接触的时候异常困难,熟悉后就会觉得一场战斗后很累，真的很累。不过战斗带入感很强，而且爽快我觉得很不错，敌人也不是傻子。
玩法和职业多样化是我很喜欢的，你可以当一个战士，也可以做一个外交强者，或者商人，当然干架还是免不了的。不过我还是觉得这游戏的商人玩法有些问题。可能是我才开始玩了一个晚上的原因吧。
最后说说画面吧。说实在的，画面是真的烂，这个没的说就算我是连马赛克都能接受的玩家。
总的来说，这游戏就像我当初看国外媒体说的瑕不掩瑜你只要坚持玩下去，你就会明白我的意思。
友情提示：晕3D的玩家请瑾慎考虑购买，就像前面一个给差评的玩家说的那样，真的会吐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198023785036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 460, 'playtime_forever': 3481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2567, 'last_played': 1538981972}
review:
良いところ
・前作で散々不満を言われた結果か経験値もお金もサクサク溜まる
・戦闘は個人レベルではただの殴り合いだが、自分の艦隊を連れていけるのでAIがワイワイやってるのを見るのが好きならかなり良い

微妙なところ
・自分の艦隊を持てるまでが面倒
・移動が面倒くさい（ワークショップの公式チートを入れれば改善される）
・自分自身のexp効率などは改善されたが、こんどは自分の領土用の資源がしょっぱい

不満もあるが艦隊を作ってワイワイできるのはやはり楽しい。

author: {'steamid': '76561197983594317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2422, 'last_played': 1521406814}
review:
Добрый день всем. Купил игру вчера, а сегодня запустил первый раз. Пишу этот отзыв только потому, что локализация - ОТСТОЙ! Даже в смысл пролога и начала первых миссий сложно въехать, т.к. перевод просто ужасный!!!. Либо вы использовали ИИ переводчик, который естевственно переводит НИКАК + грамматические ошибки везде, либо вы наняли дебила, который так вот и перевёл!!! Смысл реально теряется в игре! Хоть сами запустите разок - посмотрите! А то выкладываете на полку для покупки, а продукт не качественный!!! Как убрать локализацию? Я лучше в оригинальную поиграл бы!!! Да и однозначно могу перевести оригинал правильно и точно, а не то, что это!
Только из-за локализации не рекомендую - на столько она плоха!!!

review: Great game for the price. Reminded me of a space-trading game that I used to play back in early 2000s which is similar to this. Eventhough,control is a bit rusty and early game explanation is barely there, but info videos are provided for just that,so kinda need to look at those to learn how to play the game. Once you're ready to go, it's time to rule em all!

author: {'steamid': '76561198101517889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 1269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1215, 'last_played': 1564748857}
review:
Titans: A great addition, although not enough titans ingame yet. So far I found 4 titans and they have terrible collision registration, IE; Parts of the ship clipping inside objects. C'mon guys... dont charge for a dlc that still has issues like this. 

Sound glitches (My biggest complaint, its really bad at times)

Annoying UI thats more akin to console

Terrible voice acting (I dont mind though)
 
Imbalanced 4x elements (Example: 30,000 power fleet fought a 5000 power fleet, 30,000 power fleet lost 15,000 fleet power AKA, 2 Carriers and 4 Cruisers. How does this make sense? They shouldve crushed with minimal losses) 

Research tab barely describes what youre researching (all it does is give you some flavored text with a little sass sprinkled on. Dont get me wrong, I like the sass, but could you at least tell me the stats of the weapons im researching?)

Expensive Necessary Equipment (I dont understand how to make a good economy in a game, but items such as T-Drives, which you will but a shit ton of, are very expensive)

Models dont scale well with in the hangers of stations. (Carriers are supposed to be very large, but when compared to the architecture inside the stations, they look rather small)

Landing pads on planets look terrible, Starpoint Gemini 2 had such a beautifully simplistic way to handle landing by giving you a wonderful and jawdroping piece of concept art that really spoke to the aptmosphere of the planet
In this game they give you a blurry and glitchy blackdrop. 
Compare Warlord's Bealador to Gemini 2's Bealador and just try to tell me Warlords looks better. 


Verdict:
Ive mostly nit-picked here, and Id like to point out that ive nit-picked cause I love this game to death. 12 of my hours in this game were spent on the first day of purchase, I genuinly love this game. 
But there are so many tiny things that hold it back, little fixes that can be made.
I trully hope a devolpers sees what im seeing, cause these fixes would make the game perfect imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017321454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2164, 'last_played': 1510383478}
review:
save feature is broken.
Cannot Load Games if you did save something.

very broken.

kinda fun gameplay though.

Campaign is garbage. Especially if save is broken, You die and start over from ground 0. 
This game could have been better thought out, when it comes to "functionality".

After reinstalling it once to see if it fixxed bugs. no fix.
developer_response:
Hi Flufynoogins,

I'm sorry you've experienced such horrible gameplay with no saves or loads - that bug was apparently caused by Steam and we couldn't do anything to fix it. :(
People got around it by manually creating "Saves" folder inside game folder.

Do you have any more problems?
You can always contact us by sending email on customersupport@starpointgemini.com - or you can find us on forums, we are pretty active.
