author: {'steamid': '76561198007254028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1507454272}
review: xbox control is not very good i tried the game it was too hard tutorial is bad wont be playing this again. got it cheap though
developer_response:
I'm sorry you had problems with the game. What problems did you had with controllers? We have many people that play with controllers, and don't have any problems with it. Maybe something else was causing issues, Steam often doesn't download all the files properly. 

As for tutorial, we have in-game tutorial as you play, but we also have complete video tutorials in Geminipedia so I have to say that tutorial in this game is far from bad. It's extensive, it's hand in hand in the beginning and nobody had problems with them. Can you please explain what do you mean by bad? 

The game has several difficulty settings ranging from Easy which is a casual mode where the game could probably play itself to Extreme mode which is very challenging. Which mode did you find too hard? 

Since you are past refund time, we would at least like to help you and hopefully get you back in the game so you can get your money's worth. Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005851839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1507451008}
review: the xbox controller controls don't work properly in this game,  i immediately got a refund.  The game is very very unpolished.  Highly toxic, tiny fanboy community.  Too many issues in the first half hour of playing.
developer_response:
I'm sorry you think the controller is not working, because it is working without any problems. We tested many controllers in the office and there are thousands of people that play with controllers currently (Steam controller, Xbox 360, Xbox One...)

I'm not saying that you didn't have any issues, I'm just saying we might have helped and that controllers works in this game. It doesn't matter to you since you already refunded the game, but it will at least give correct information for potential new players who read this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972715167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1495941706}
review: I enjoyed this game, but troop boarding really killed it for me. It's a cool concept, but grappling another ship while you basically afk in a circle while you troops capture it just isn't fun at all, and that's the best way to get new ships or credits. If troop boarding happened passively or could only occur to a disabled ship the game would be significantly more fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978408150', 'num_games_owned': 907, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1098, 'last_played': 1519221948}
review:
je vien a peine de commencer le jeu et je l'aime deja, imaginer une fusion a la dbz de monsieurs freelancer, et mount and blade, et voila le perso ultra cheate de la mort qui tue : Starpoint Gemini Warlord.

je vien a peine de passer le cap de la corvette (la premiere classe superieur de vaisseau) et j'attend avec impatience mes prochaine mission pour tester la resistance de la peinture.

AH et aussi le jeu vien d'etre traduit entierement en francais, et je n'est remarque qu'une seule petite faute j'usque la.

A vos vaisseaux capitaines !

author: {'steamid': '76561198055628469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1507406656}
review: So heres the deal, the game is fun.  Mind you im playing without the DLC but as the game stands its fun for...id say around 4-5 hours. After that its just a grind.  The game is stationed like this: Do 5 missions to aquire a few million credits and 1 level or two.  Then your tasked with obtaining the next level of ship which is usually 4 or 5 levels ahead of you and 5x the credits youll likely have.  The problem inlies in what your cabable of doing and grind.  You have to grind the money, but more importnatly the levels in order to progress the main story line.  To me the quests are fun and enganging but the grind just ruins the story.  If your interested in the 4x grand stragety, its pretty bland in all honesty.  Its as simple as: Expand-Wait-Expand...etc...  Overall I give the game 5/10 if full price and 6.5/10 if on sale like it currently is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107344491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1507410866}
review:
Absolutely. I've seen it at my friend's house and loved it, but now I finally have a chance to play it at home. The game is huge and it gives you a freedom to do what you want. Not often I've seen so many options, so many paths to take in-game. It's RPG, 4X, strategy, and medical therapy if you just want to roam the universe and relax. I don't even think I will be fighting that much, I think I will tak it slow, explore, admire the galaxy and go sightseeing. 

Thumbs up! And big recommendation!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978019071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2709, 'last_played': 1507397092}
review:
An excellent space game where Freelancer meets Mount & Blade!

Imagine flying around and doing space battles, just with the added strategy aspect option of working for a faction, governing your own space sector as a system-lord or ignore all that and become a cutthroat mercenary!

Some positives & negatives:

+ The game doesn't force you to play in a certain way, there are many optional paths you can take and it adds to the replayability (mulitple gamemodes like campaign-mode or "sandbox"). Recommend playing the campaign first as it gives quite a lot of insight into the lore!

+ Speaking of lore, I lost myself dwelved deep into reading all the faction backgrounds and other tidbits found across the galaxy. The campaign mode does a decent job describing some of the story background from previous games in the series.

+ Good looking graphics and beautiful skyboxes

+ Quite an amount of different ships and missions available.

+ Beautiful music that gives space the right atmosphere!

+ Being able to change difficulty mid-game (I felt the game was a bit too easy on normal after a few hours in, but quite a challenge on hard now).

+ Modding and workshop is available which lets you tailor your experience!

+ The developers seem to actually listening to their community, unlike many others who totally ignore the players.

- I wish there was some more variation to chatter, I think I've heard "Ma? Pa? Is that you, Fluffy?" (or whatever they say) like a hundred times by now :-D

- Would be nice if it would be easier to see who is who on the starchart. Sometimes when several factions have the same colour due to being allied, neutral or enemies - it can often be hard to notice who owns what region.

- Some stuff that works great early on (like civilian fleet tasks for resources) become a bit obsolete mid/late-game (unless you trade with other factions).

- No coop or multiplayer :-( (but the game is still lots of fun!)



So.. What are you waiting for? Go get the game! It's currently on sale as well! And you always have a refund if you don't like it for some reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983797726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3182, 'last_played': 1603550302}
review:
Después de dedicarle unas decenas de horas (y las que me quedan por delante seguro) puedo afirmar con total seguridad que es un juego increible y muy divertido.
He jugado a otros muchos juegos de similar corte y/o género espacial desde hace muchos años (Starmade, ED, Eve Online, X, Freelancer) y hacía tiempo que no disfrutaba así con un juego ni me llenaba tanto.

Pro's
- Combates espaciales trepidantes y divertidos
- Adictivo, desafiante (que tengas una nave gigante y saltes a la batalla a cuchillo puede acarrear una explosión-cura de humildad XD).
- Tenes múltiples naves, equipo y tareas diferentes por hacer
- Gran soporte de la comunidad y los desarrolladores
- Precio ajustado. Merece cada € invertido
- Mapa gigantesco con eventos aleatorios
- Poder comandar flotas y crear batallas multitudinarias.

Contras
- No disponer de más tiempo para jugarlo XD

Si te sientes identificad@ con los puntos anteriores no lo pienses más y cómpralo, no te arrepentirás.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980288106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1525068362}
review:
I dont write many reviews....
But thought I'd just jump in on this one.
Warlords is FUN!  Very captivating.  I own SPG2 and played it for a bit.  Enjoyed it for the most part.
I've had Warlords on my wishlist for a while, and since I dont have much time, have watched it go by
in past sales.  I got it on this latest sale, and it pretty much sucked  me in.  Decent story, excellent tutorial,
and...fun!
Enjoying the game immensly.  Well worth the price, and glad I made the purchase.
(I've likely spent more time reading the forums, and dev notes, than I have playing....should have taken the
jump earlier and spent my time more wisely :-)  ).
Makes me want to read the community guides to help get better faster.

TLDR:
Great game.
Gread devs.
Fun game.
On sale?  Buy it, it's well worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054893159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6830, 'last_played': 1612247701}
review:
游戏有严重的bug，全屏无法进入游戏，然后游戏根本无法存档，简直是糟糕。

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

这两个游戏游戏公司帮忙解决了。

1.窗口模式进游戏然后进入游戏有按AIT+回车切换全屏模式。

2.steam云端吞了saves文件夹，在Steam\steamapps\common\Starpoint Gemini Warlords\下新建一个Saves文件夹能解决无法存档问题。

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1.41游戏有bug游戏存档不定时会被清空原因不明

author: {'steamid': '76561198207028351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1507415310}
review: Да игра хорошая, да это далеко не stellaris( по степени проработки) . В неё можно залипнуть не плохо, но..... Оочень своеобразное управление, но пожалуй к нему можно привыкнуть и  оно интересное  по своему .Товарищи разработчики пожалуйста заплатитье денег нормальным ребятам, которые адекватно переведут текста, но ведь абсолютно дерьмово всё сделано в плане перевода, вместо того что-бы проникнуться атмосферой игры - ты спотыкаешь о нелепый перевод и это напрочь портит от неё впечатление, хотя проект реально интересный, буд-то весь текст перевёл GOOGLE. На данный момент не рекомендую людям которые не очень сильны в английском языке, например таким как я. Вот вся локализация сделана примерно так как я её  понимаю без этого перевода, всё топорно короче, это очень сильно мешает атмосфере . Интерфейс тоже оооочень такой себе, +  долбанный перевод увеличивает порог входа в игру  и мешает обычному обывателю. Допилите игрушку пожалуйста, всё вроде хорошо в ней, есть надежы на классный проджект. Думаю если разработчики проявят уважение к людям воде меня , которые отдали денег за всю хурму и страдают из-за локализации, то отзывы  на РОССИЙСКОМ рынке тотально изменяться

author: {'steamid': '76561198047007967', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1507532982}
review:
Game is very RPGish in a bad way.  If you are level 1 you fight level 1 ships then you level up and then suddenly you'll fight level 2 ships (even if you still using peice of garbage level one ship). 

The game feels really empty. There isn't really an economy and fleet battles are just death balls attacking each other. 

The game should just do away with level locking contend and gate them by upgrades to your bases and by cost instead. 

The graphics are pretty though, but that doesn't make up for its tedious gameplay. 

Simply put. The game isn't fun.

Edit:Thing is I am kind of spoiled from playing X3 Litecube mod so all other single player space games will be compared to it. This game does not surpass X3 even unmodded for me other than its graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192838677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5502, 'last_played': 1600033713}
review:
Been a fan of space battles, empire expansion, and 4x strategy games for a while so I peed myself a little when I found this game. I wish English had devised a word that could describe my level of enthusiasm for the game but it hasn't so I'll coin flebith as the deep desire to see everyone enjoy a game and through this enjoyment bring peace to the world since everyone has gotten their rocks off dominating people in space. This game gives me great flebith.

I've had a few issues with the launcher for the game, but the community is pretty active with bug solving (the very few I've seen/heard of) and when Joe Steam-user couldn't help me with a small problem, the devs responded within 12 hours to both my email and the thread I posted on Steam. Outstanding service.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990994295', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 10646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3340, 'last_played': 1687035979}
review:
Fly your ship, take up missions, follow the plot - or don't - many new starts have been added, conquer sectors, produce resources to buy a fleet, go on missions to earn your next level ship, land on landscaped planets, enter ore producing plants, trade through wormholes, use your jump engine, make deals with other factions, attack fleets more powerful than yours, fly everywhere, get attacked by enemy patrols, battle against stations, earn experience and increase your stats, capture ships and become rich, mine asteroids, recycle junk, sell everything, try different weapon combination, build a titan, conquer the whole galaxy.

[h1]This is an excellent good game.[/h1]

I sincerely hope these developers will continue developing space games, we are talking about Egosoft dedication here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037792644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1542397639}
review:
Alright, finally

Now before we begin you might ask why would i write a review with less than an hour played.2 reasons. I had bought the last game and did not like it as you might read it from my last review. 2. I pirated it and finished the campaign. I got about 80 hours and i am gonna play it over again with new dlcs and updates. 

So with that out of the way. I will try to keep this one brief. THIS IS WHAT THE PREVIOUS GAME SHOULD HAVE BEEN. This is excellent. It fixes all of the old problems. Creating your own character. Check. Better ship selection check. Places and stations with more personality check. ACTUAL CHARACTERS check. Hell after i finish a session i would think all the warmasters go to a bar and just talk shit behind commanders back and how he is bloodthirsty maniac who is addicted to conquering more space in the middle of nowhere just coz he could. 

The game has been simplified a bit which i liked. Missions are more diverse. Abilities are interesting and you can mix and match them after certain point. This game is good simply because it is polished. THIS IS MOUNT AND BLADE IN SPACE. It takes the best part of it and just puts them in space and adds some spice on it. Sure there are no rival lords and stuff but there are MUCH more interesting characters. More diverse combat and minus the dating side activity which i think could be included but it would be hard to get it right without having it feeling like a checkbox really so i will let it pass but there is a degree of satisfaction from going from getting "Who are you?" to "Please bang my sister" so something in that regard could help.

The game has its flaws of course: When i played version 1.3 the titans missions did no make sense because we were getting ambusshed by carriers constantly and all i could think " Someone who can afford all these carriers should be able to afford a tactician who doesnt send their ships 1 by 1 or in the waves of 2. Those stuff did not make much sense. The news section can be utilized better. Reading them were fun but more variety reactions and maybe factions reacting to your genocidal conquests. Would be nice i just think the universe can be more fleshed out like we are told there is a political war going on with all sides making their propaganda but ihas no in game effect i think we should be able to give a statement which could affect the status of our alliances things like that. 

Strategy section can be improved with those elements. More stellaris less rail shooting imo. RPG section is wonderful, resource gathering while travelling is great. I would also suggest adding more distinct sound tracks to planets and stations. I will refer to Rebel galaxy again even though this game is now my favorite space sim. If we could see at least in the background where we are like in trader or bar w/e, it could add more to the world building. Even after all those years i remember rebel galaxy cantinas. ESPECIALLY STAR WARS CANTINAS. Market places etc. All you would need is maybe background changes with 1st person view of that background to feel like we are that commander. Regardless. There are a few points to work on but in general this is a HUGE improvement over the last one a solid 9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197972229972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 317, 'playtime_forever': 1626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1513284384}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005927988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2275, 'last_played': 1541476237}
review:
It's decent enough but it has 1 fatal flaw. As you level up, the space encounters level up with you. 

Here's why that is a bad thing. You gain access to new ships by level lock. When you hit a given level, suddenly all the encounters are now sporting the next tier of ship so you are somewhat forced into the next tier of ship as well, if you can afford it. Then there is the grind to actually arm it with decent equipment. Likely, before you can even finish that grind, you've leveled up and been pushed to the next level yet again. This repeats until eventually you hit the top of the tech level where it finally stops. This  makes the game feel like a mad dash to level grind rather than enjoying the trip along the way. There is no real sense of progress made until the very end. 

Equally important, this breaks immersion quite a bit as well since supposedly the large ships like Battleships, Dreadnoughts and Carriers are a rare thing. However, the game simply spawns them left and right once you get to a certain level. This would be forgiveable, except it happens so early in the game that it's a bit of a joke. For me, it happened that I was still in a Frigate by the time it was spawning Battleships on me. I was in  I really wanted to like this game, but every time I try to go back to it I just sigh and think of what it could have been.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045739617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 6311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3759, 'last_played': 1672464336}
review: A fanastic game overall. With space combat taking a center role, there's plenty else to do. Trading, developing armadas, taking territory and making friends or allies. The base building and territory management is deep but entirely possible to ignore outside of story mode. All of it feels tight and keeps pulling me back in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151480593', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1676128044}
review:
个人没有玩多久。游戏架构不错，自由度高，当时玩自由枪骑兵时，就一直希望能遇见这样一个游戏。（虽然后来转战X3）
其实还是想反映一下细节方面的问题，主要就是指UI和镜头了。某种方面会给人一种生硬的感觉。

⭐舰船一直是固定在屏幕中央，加速的时候，不像自由枪骑兵一样能有一个向前的位移，造成“推背感”的错觉。
⭐交互界面的按键和切换有种原始感。整个游戏在同类游戏里偏卡通化。
⭐Warp的时候直接进入跃迁画面，也是让人有些不知所措。舰船开始加速的过程，跃迁通道的开启，并伴随着镜头轻微的晃动，外部的噪音，这是我比较希望看到的。（可能是因为玩过了精英危险）

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2017/10/4

后来更改了一下键位，把滚轮改成镜头缩放，再把加减速分配到键盘上，这样感觉舒服多了。

中文翻译质量有待提升，目前自己已经切换回英文版。第一次进入游戏的时候，选项框上面那个大大的“播放” (PLAY) 吸引了我。这确定不是在让我玩DVD？后面的剧情对话也看的我云里雾里的，容易引起误会。

author: {'steamid': '76561198052596929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4322, 'last_played': 1602702943}
review:
Da ich Starpoint Gemini 2 regelrecht gefressen habe, hab ich natürlich auch Warlords gespielt. Habe die Hauptstory durch, bin Level 46 und habe eine Flotte die sich sehen lassen kann.  Prinzipiell war es ganz ok und der Drang nach einem bessern Schiff, besserer Ausrüstug usw. hat sich schnell breit gemacht.  Was mir allerdings überhaupt nicht gefallen hat (und genau das bewegt mich zur ersten Bewertung hier bei Steam überhaupt) ist die Qualität der deutschen Übersetzung. Diese ist teilweise so schlecht, dass man Mühe hat zu verstehen was einem überhaupt mitgeteilt werden soll bzw. der Story vernünftig zu folgen. Ich habe  mir das Spiel bewußt erst zugelegt (da ich des englischen nicht sonderlich mächtig bin) als eine deutsche Übersetzung verfügbar war. Die Qualität der Übersetzung erinnert stark an die Verwendung eines einfachen Onlineübersetzers. Dann hätte man es ehrlich gesagt auch ganz lassen können. 
Schade um ein eigentlich gutes und fesselndes Spiel. 

Zusatz: Hätte es außer "Ja" und "Nein" noch eine Zwischenstufe wie "bedingt empfehlendswert" gegeben hätte ich diese gewählt. 

Edit: Aufgrund der schnellen Reaktion der Entwickler und der mehr als glaubhaften Aussage die schlechte deutsche Übersetzung verbessern zu wollen ändere ich meine Wertung auf "Empfehlendswert".

author: {'steamid': '76561198007392741', 'num_games_owned': 691, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 3995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3995, 'last_played': 1506454045}
review:
Le doy voto positivo por los pelos, ya que flaquea en varios aspectos.

Positivo:
- Sistema de combate al estilo Starpoint Gemini 2.
- Aspecto estratégico: Construir naves, tomar sectores, construir edificios, investigar...
- La historia no está mal.

Negativo:
 - El principio del juego es pobre, ya que empezamos en un pequeño sector rodeados de enemigos y no podemos hacer casi nada con nuestra nave más que resolver misiones de la única estación que podemos visitar.
 - El final del juego tampoco funciona. Tengo la flota casi todo lo grande que puede ser, la nave que yo piloto está con todo al máximo, me sobran los recursos y he investigado todo lo que me es útil. No obstante, no puedo acabar la partida de una forma rápida o minimamente automatizada, y tengo por delante un montón de misiones de conquista sin ninguna dificultad ni interés pero que debo hacer si quiero "terminar" el juego.
- Bugs como que la nave empieza a ir hacia abajo en mitad de una batalla o naves a las que no se puede disparar durante un rato sin ninguna explicación.
- El manejo de las flotas civiles acaba siendo muy pesado y repetitivo. 
- Solo tres habilidades  a las que asignar perks y un sistema de skills con poca gracia (según tu estilo de juego la mitad no sirven para nada).

review: This game ended up better then i expected, Fist off, Make sure to verifi the game before playing, steam seams to be corupting the download. It very easy to cheat with a simple edit of a save file, note unlocking the best ship just means they will attack with theres. so its kinda pointless to cheat, its way better just to play as is. Its a long strat game with some RPG to it but thats realy half the fun. Took a bit to get used to controlls, but makes a good space shooter game with some deth, The only problem i have is the jobs get repetitive, but some new one seam to open the more you do them. the random events make up for this, you can come across anything on the way to your mission. author: {'steamid': '76561198052646816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1890, 'last_played': 1671792208}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198000655137', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2051, 'last_played': 1576862056}
review:
Brilliant game although I had my misgivings at first.  The progression is slow but not so slow that it feels like a grind, the missions add a lot of variability to the game in both Freeroam and Campaign modes.  I'd recommend the 'improved civilian fleets' mod from the workshop which makes the civilian fleet missions less frequent but more worthwhile instead of being a clickfest on the starmap and retains the game balance.

Pros:
Great tactical/strategic mix of gameplay.
Replayability.
Actions have consequences.
Research (although limited) adds a cool depth.

Cons:
Price:  £30 more than I'd be happy with for a game like this but it came highly recommended so I took a gamble.
Carriers don't really feel like carriers, more like escort carriers :(
Not able to select a particular starting faction in freeroam.
Not enough 'tiers' of ships:  Would have been better with more tiers to smooth progression.
Small selection of weapon types and little to seperate them.

All in all a great game and I've not run into a single bug/crash yet (tempting fate there haha) and I'm looking forward to DLCs that add more to this title in time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239662570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 5768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 986, 'last_played': 1695465137}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010838026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2579, 'last_played': 1657073189}
review:
I definitely recommend this game, but there is a catch that must be mentioned upfront: the game is listed as having full controller support, but it does not. It has ok support for standard Xbox controllers, however it does not support flight sticks. There is also no in-game tool to remap controller buttons, and their default layout is a bit awkward. I'm also finding that the controller can't be used to get some info--for example, if you place an enhancement on any of your weapons, you can only see which one you used by using the mouse. Controller support is definitely partial, not full.

Aside from that, I'm loving this game! The comment I keep seeing in reviews that convinced me to buy this game was, "It's not as good as X3." I'm happy to say: yes, thankfully, this game is NOT like X3. It's actually playable; it's accessible. I love that it manages to combine space simulator with RPG and economic management in a very smooth way, without a ridiculous learning curve. 

There's a fun balance between combat, trade, and tactical management. You can build fleets and have them defend your forward posts. Or you can join the fight yourself. You can assign other ships to your own fleet for some backup in a fight. You can play the main missions, go looking for your own fights, or take "freelance" quests. You can declare war on your neighbors, or send trade fleets. 

The game looks and sounds good--and if you have a decent subwoofer, the rumble of ship movement is incredible! And I love that the main missions give you a speed booster to get to the play area faster. I definitely recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074316564', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1487, 'last_played': 1505341913}
review:
Just a short review, in short, this game is great, it takes everything that was good about starpoint gemini 2, and removes/fixes a LOT of the drawbacks. Combat is fun, ships look and feel great, there is a ton more to do than in previous games, and the strategy element is in depth enough to be fun, but simple enough to not be daunting (*cough X3 cough*)

If you have a space sim fix, but don't want the massive learning curve of the more complex games, or the insane grind of something like elite, then definitely  pick this up. It's amazing.

Also, the devs are VERY active in forums (even on older unsupported games) and are extremely passionate and dedicated, something wonderful to see in this day of anti consumer game dev teams.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011127442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1483256383}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022179176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3469, 'last_played': 1505583819}
review:
Удовлетворительно. Абсолютно все на удовлетворительно, то есть на троечку и не больше. Не пойму, откуда столько положительных отзывов? Аля школота что ли.

В центре сообщества появилась русская локализация. Привет гугл транслейт да еще и с ошибками в словах.

Сюжетка вроде как и есть, но оформлена она ... опять таки, на удовлетворительно.
Графика, с одной стороный есть, а с другой как бы её нет.
Управление так же как и в предыдущих Gemini ужас, но привыкнуть можно, вопрос только зачем привыкать к плохому?

По сути 3 раз клепается одна и таже игра под разным сосусом с разными приправами. И если предыдущие были - "вроде ниче, нравиться" вот так и это - вроде ниче, только пожалуй уже хватит.

review: Out of all my games, this one keeps me returning to it. It has that certain charm, feel, atmosphere, if you want, that just keeps me wanting more. It's relaxing, music is brilliant, graphics are beautiful and you can either explore the Gemini and chill or you can get all busy with conquering the galaxy. Starpoint Gemini 2 was a pleasant surprise and this is just building on its foundations. Highly recommended game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014146141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 387, 'playtime_forever': 8089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7843, 'last_played': 1602013886}
review:
Recommend this game on sale for 10 dollars or lower for complete edition

+Better voice acting
+Ship designs
+Graphics are pretty
+Building ships and station addons
+Huge battles and conquering the universe
+Tractorbeam 
+Mod support
+HUD
+Loading pictures
-Godlike bounties
-Story (one of the worst) Gemini 2 story was better
-Rinse and repeat gameplay
-Alpha/Beta was rushed (More updates after game is gold than before)
-Patches rushed to get DLC out (this really annoyed me)
-DLC not that great
-Ship mangement (still a bit hard to figure out easily)
-Boarding (Should be 1 click/automated so you can keep an eye on battle so you don't die)
-/+Huge amount of resources to complete things
-Arena is weak and lame (only certain ship class to fight) Enemies are easy
-New sectors and fleets cause loading delay
-Having to scan ships of the same design over and over
-Music was lacking
-Space should be twice the size it is now

author: {'steamid': '76561198007046490', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2527, 'last_played': 1516034147}
review:
1、汉化质量极其糟糕，这样的汉化根本无法正常的进行游戏
2、游戏还存在大量恶性BUG，最致命的就是自动存档BUG，某些时刻重新读档时，你会丢失机库、仓库里面的全部装备，主线任务进度也会出现BUG，无法继续推进剧情
3、人物命名系统存在BUG，无法正常的为游戏人物取名
4、游戏内容大而空，中后期很无聊
5、重要的事情再说一遍！汉化质量真的很垃圾，严重影响游戏体验！！
比较典型的汉化问题：
1、地点、势力名字翻译混乱，同一个地点在“任务介绍”、“百科”、“地图”中却完全不一样，让人十分困扰
2、任务和剧情介绍翻译质量低下，导致任务无法正确进行
3、很多名词翻译的十分可笑，“航母”被翻译成了“运输舰”，你是在开玩笑么？
developer_response: 您好，感谢您的评论。我们注意到了汉化版有严重的问题，我们在之前得到汉化翻译文本时还没有能力对中文进行校对，对您造成了困扰，为此向您道歉。一个月前我们开始了对汉化的优化工作，目前已经修复了征战模式（剧情和教程）下的大部分汉化问题，并且重新翻译了最新的DLC：努米比亚之崛起同时优化了中文的商店页面。这些优化和修复会随着下周的一次更新一同到来，我们会继续优化并且更加重视中文游戏的体验，希望您能继续支持我们并向我们提供反馈。

author: {'steamid': '76561197985556440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1663, 'last_played': 1504473283}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960550140', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 3237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3026, 'last_played': 1606278787}
review:
So I just beat this game, and can say without a doubt it filled the void in my life for the last 50 hours. I am not finished yet either, as I have the DLC to do still as well as conquering the rest of the system(I own about half). I learned about this game from the Starpoint Gemini 2 forums, which was my first game made by Little Green Men. I liked it as well, but this game expands on that one and is much funner and thus I am getting way more hours of play out of this one. Warlords is a sandbox game with a campaign to play through in the sandbox. You can just play with the sandbox as well and disable the campaign when starting a new game. I guess I will just go over the main categories most reviews do briefly.

The graphics are good, but not the best either. Most other newer space games like Elite Dangerous do beat it down a bit. But they do a fantastic job with the art direction and nebulas here. There is not much more to write about here as you can view screenshots. Audio is pretty good as well, but again not state of the art or anything. Some of the campaign is voiced as well(but not a lot of it unfortunately).

The gameplay is fantastic, and where this game shines. It has a tactical based combat system. You try to manage your ships shields as you aim your turrets at the opposing ships. You can manually aim, but you will mostly just use the "fire at will" command for the AI to do it, as you need to focus on rotating your ship and using skills. The main complaint I have against this system would be the lack of balance for missiles. I found my self ignoring missiles(the heavy weapons of the game), as they barely do anymore damage than your main guns and have limited ammo. The boarding is done well, and I am not sure that I would want much changed about it. Your marines have to progress from room to room after you grapple a ship and send in your boarding party. Once the ship is yours(which you can increase your chances with perks and research) you may then choose to either sell it, keep it, or send it towards research if you don't have access to that ship yet. Besides the campaign you have mining, side missions, salvaging, bounty hunting, trading(which I almost didn't mention the economy is static) and conquering the map. You may build a fleet of ships that you can have follow you, or you can have them help defend some outpost. I mostly only saw the need to have them follow me though, and just get a death fleet to go around and conquer. This leads me to another complaint about the late game. While you are conquering and doing missions you have to micro-manage the crap out of your civilian fleet. This consists of every few minutes having to open up your map, and scroll around looking for stuff for your civilian fleet to do(this is seperate from the combat fleet that follows you). It is very annoying having to click on each allied station to see what they are trading. It would be nice if there was a window of some sort that popped up and showed you all of this information and you could choose to send your fleet from that screen instead. Or even allowing wasd movement on the map would help alot. 

The story of the campaign is alright, but nothing to write home about. It is pretty well done, but there is way to many fetch type quests IMHO. It could as well use more cinematics to tie everything together and have fully voiced dialogue throughout it. This would make it much more immersive and interesting. I sort of lost interest halfway through for a while and just ran from point a to b without reading the story. However towards the end it gets much more interesting as you start working on the end game. 

Overall this game was a lot of fun, and well worth the money I spent on it. I can safely recommend this game to anyone interested in sci-fi, space, RPG, empire building, or tactical combat as it has all of these elements going for it. I can see myself playing this quite a bit longer with the dlc(titans!), and trying to conquer the rest of my map. If they add other playable factions then it will add tremendous replayability to the game as well(hint hint!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198042790351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2983, 'last_played': 1599924002}
review:
Great game for everyone, who loves space fight almost without deep strategical choices.
Do a campain or kill / ally everyone - it's up to you. The only real help from support fleet is to take some fire while you're completing main mission, but it's not bad, it makes you feel valuable :)
Simple controls and auto change of default camera mode depending on your current shit type. I wish it was just remember-the-last system, but whatever.
DO NOT expect this game to be a strategy, read genre! It's nice action RPG with some strategy elements in favour of huge fleet battles (the only reason why your fleets exists I suppose).
Definitely recommend!
Now with titans!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197987824308', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1496207166}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035900780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1212, 'last_played': 1507425907}
review:
Old: Buggy, crashes often. Unplayable for more than an hour. (Resolved: Missing Files from Steam Install)

Updated Testing 9/7-9/9/17: I decided to give this game another chance and reinstalled and did verify files check on Steam, there were multiple missing files from the install. After running the check several times to make sure no more files were missing I ran the game again and played around on max settings. No more crashes or issues on screen.

Specs: AMD FX 8230 Eight-Core CPU 3.5ghz, 8gb Ram, SS Hard Drive, Geforce GTX 1050 TI so hardware requirements should be more than ok to run this game.

Conclusion from testing: The instability and crashes were likely due to missing files from the Steam Install, running Verify File checks to make sure every file was installed properly resolved my problem. This was unfortunate because I never had to do this previously with other games so it wasn't something that seemed necessary but I will run these file checks for every new game purchased from now on. It was tricky to figure out the problem because the game would run ok for minutes to almost an hour at a time then crash. 

Review: This game is pretty fun, you get to captain a starship, pretend to be a merchant/freelancer/warlord and live out your fantasies in digital space. The combat camera is a little annoying but zooming out helps keep track of where targets are, controls take some time to get use to but once you give it a chance it's enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995827407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 2995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2955, 'last_played': 1521712951}
review:
TaH pagh taHbe'...

With these words of klingon Shakespeare I try to describe my feelings about this game right now...

Positive or negative review...

I did decide to call it positive. First time I played it, I was unable to enjoy, because my PC was too weak for it. Now I have a new one, and must say, the graphics are really nice and it is fun to fly in space and enjoy simply the scenery.
The game began positive. I enjoyed the story and it kept me playing more and more. Soon I expanded my territory and still all was fun.
But now I simply keep it running in background to get more resources... 
I reached a point of non interesting grinding. Missions are simply the same. Nothing new to discover at the moment. Honestly... It is boring now... But I want see what ship I get for finishing the titan story. Can I crush the galaxy then? Or is it just another big ship?

I think the X-games (not rebirth) are the better games if you want real space sim. More ships, better economy, just not as good graphic as this game.

Starpoint Gemini Warlords made me wait for X4 now!

The more I write the less I know if I really say "buy it"... But I keep with my "buy it", because I spent many hours enjoing it, and hope I get again such moment...

author: {'steamid': '76561197971248771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1298, 'last_played': 1503025852}
review:
At core, this is a game about upgrading your ship, exploring a huge galaxy, trading, and blowing things up. If that's enough for you, you'll have a good time with SPGW. It looks good, the ships are cool, and the mechanics are solid, if on the repetitive side.

There's some problems though. The campaign is pretty poorly done. The much-vaunted RTS element is... meh. You can create these huge fleets and send them into battle, but your AI ships die frustratingly easily, so it's never as satisfying or efficient as just doing the thing yourself. You can take over vast swaths of the galaxy over many hours to get resources, but one lucky boarding run on a carrier in a random mission will get you FAR more. I felt like these aspects were bolted on and dispensable.

The difficulty curve is also a bit silly. Low-yield random missions and encounters will kill you with alarming regularity, up to the point where you have a Dreadnought and top-tier enhancements -- at which point you can solo a friggin planet with minimal issues. It tends to be frustrating until it's boring, with a preciously slim window in between the two.

But again, that core gameplay is there, and it's pretty choice. So overall it has to be a thumbs up.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198042394642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2052, 'last_played': 1556316983}
review:
In my opinion one of the best space games in the last few years.

Control ships from the size of a small and nimble fighter to a huge slow an powerful titan...

Do quests and missions to earn money...

I tried mining and resource gathering, trading, and fighting and capturing ships a lot and think they are all viable and lots of fun.

A bit into the game you can start your own empire, build upgrade your stations, control fleets, gather resources, building more and more fleets and conquer the galaxy by yourself, with your AI controlled ships or maybee even join your own fleets into combat with your huge battleships....

Another really great thing about this game are the developers... Look into the Comunity Hub .... They are replying to almost every problem... really great

author: {'steamid': '76561198010661237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1170, 'last_played': 1556620267}
review:
Excellent jeux de vaisseau ou l'ont peut gérer son empire ou juste si on le souhaite se balader avec son vaisseau exploré et faire du commerce , devenir chasseur de prime ou pirate ^^
C'est un jeux bac a sable mème si il possède une campagne je n'y ai pas joué et m'hasarderai pas a la juger.
Il est dans la digne veine du Starpoint Gemini 2 et il est a mes yeux légerement plus facile sur certains point qui sont bienvenue (Abordage beaucoup plus simple!! et plus facilement d'argent grace a notre empire et les vol de vaisseau au adversaire qui peuvent rapporter 3 millions voir plus ) .
C'est un jeux ou on reviendra souvent afin de s'amuser avec notre flotte ( a oui ont peux aussi avoir des flottes gigagntesque) et il vous tiendra en haleine sur le long terme .
Sans compter le Workshop alors la c'est la fin pour les fan de vaisseaux...
Des Dlc sont dispo mais ce sont plus des extension comme autrefois ou il y a du contenu
Bref adieu temps libre

author: {'steamid': '76561198109910668', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1503751382}
review:
奇怪的地图，“作弊”的远景物体大小，别扭的操作，还不能改手柄键位，我忍了
从教程开始就有bug，剧情模式一路大小bug不断，也忍了
那能够让机翻找回自信，3DM充满优越感，对着选项看半小时没明白什么意思的“官方中文”，我还是忍了

玩了6个小时剧情走了不少，主线期间随便接了个任务，半路因为受不了智障一般的翻译改回英语重启了一下，然后再进游戏，首位主线任务就变成了Test main quest，任务简介是Test，然后要求15秒内赶到400k单位距离外的“任务区域”，否则游戏结束
然后这个档就废了，除非我选择抛弃已经废掉的自动存档/快速存档和第一个手动存档，放弃3个小时的游戏时间，从3个小时前的第二个备份存档开始玩
这尼玛能忍？

我明白这并不是3A游戏，然而你这三位数的价位明显是奔着2A游戏去的呗？这体验为啥还不如某些EA阶段的独立游戏？比方说太空工程师我整天崩成狗，却从来不用担心存档损坏的问题

既然已经6h，退不了款了，只能送个差评以表诚意

author: {'steamid': '76561198087772844', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1503738893}
review: This game isn't something I expected.  It's a normal space ship shooter where you spin your ship around so you can shoot other ships / stations.  Graphics are pretty amazing.  Some of the mechanics for building the station, and doing the economy is well thought out.  Not as in depth as I would say Stellaris, but got some good quality in there.  I really feel like the space combat needs a lot of touching up on.  I've played a good chunk of space games. The F2P game Dreadnought has a much better combat system than this game. I was hoping a system like that was being implemented. True I didn't play too long, but I'm one of those where if games don't click with me for the first few hours then it will never click.  The "Campaign" seems a little boring like there isn't much except just clicking through and shooting random targets.  I actually forgot what I was doing for a bit lol.  The Sci-Fi aspect with the graphics drew me in, but the gameplay pushed me out.  Great potential, I just feel they could have done better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015612093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1395, 'last_played': 1686674332}
review: 很不错的一款太空类游戏，头一次对steam上的游戏写评测。之前玩过X系列还有欲火，到勇闯银河系，甚至是网络游戏eve。对于一款太空战斗类游戏来说很不错了。画面效果，还有游戏机制，有人说这个游戏就是刷，我个人认为这类的差不多都是这样吧，一直不停的去刷支线任务，为了就是一艘更大一些的船！游戏中的翻译错误挺多的，角色语音方面也略显冷清~配合着不是太适合氛围的背景音乐，总觉得少点什么~总之是一款不错的游戏，希望以后能在补丁上做些改进！

author: {'steamid': '76561198325670243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 12552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5875, 'last_played': 1547565791}
review: 玩了接近90个小时才想起来没发个评论是不该，所以所以今天补上，说实在的我是太空类游戏的死粉，几乎平台上太空游戏有我都玩过,说实在的就喜欢浴火和本作。一开始刚入手时因为不习惯操作方式，差点退款。不过当熟悉了以后，这种操作习惯真是很棒，看着自己的舰队越来越强大，那种感觉真的不错，画面很美（吐槽一下，当你带领太多小弟的时候，D旅行时会发现fps只有1了，直接无响应，建议修复一下，主线任务有的时候没有提示了，建议多做些说明会更好一些）这个游戏我一直在关注，因为刚出的时候没有汉化，所以我就没入，知道汉化来了，立刻入手，总体好评，虽然汉化有些地方实在是不妥，但是制作小组很尽心，希望越来越好。五星推荐，有喜欢的这类游戏的玩家试一试。

review:
SPG Warlords ist für mich EVE Offline light + Freelancer  mit Elementen eines Strategiespieles
Um Missverständnisse zu vermeiden->Es ist kein reines Strategiespiel(nur Karten + Menüs) und hat auch keine Cockpitperspektive(beides stört mich nicht-im Gegenteil).
Es gibt so einiges was mir an dem Spiel nicht gefällt-ist halt keine Maßanfertigung- aber
hier kommt eine entscheidene Stärke des Spiels zum Tragen:Modding ist wirklich kinderleicht,
lauter Textdateien und das ganze Spiel lässt sich nur mit einem Notepad-Editor auch ohne 
Programmierkenntnisse einfach und umfassend verändern.
Ich hoffe LGM entwickelt das Produkt weiter !

author: {'steamid': '76561198022921731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 3937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3725, 'last_played': 1503193261}
review:
Despite a few rocky points, Starpoint Gemini Warlords is absolutely worth picking up.

I played Eve Online for many years, and there is a familiar feeling if it's more Eve "Offline", and in a good way for the most part. It can definitely feel empty without other people to chat with, but there's NPCs roaming around, various factions squabbling over turf, and you're free to make friends and enemies as you see fit.

I started with the Campaign, and while the story is pretty mild with plot twists, it was not the worst story. Most of it felt like a dragged out tutorial, and some of it even your character seemed to make some snarky remarks that mirrored my own thoughts. It did set the tone for the game, and there were some dialogue options if you had the right perks, which made some parts easier to complete.

Most of your time will be spent actually roaming about, where there is a fair amount of things to do. From boarding ships, to just mining, you can do just about whatever you choose to do. Most of it can get repetitive, so having a lot to do at least keeps it refreshing for awhile.

There's a decent variety of ships in the game, as different areas have offered different ships for sale, and some that can only be acquired from boarding actions. Ships range from small Gunships to a massive Titan (Note, there is only one Titan without the DLC). Different factions have different aesthetics, as well as different stats. I personally flew the ships that I liked over the "best" stat ships, and never felt it hindered my gameplay. Getting the larger ships can feel a little grindy, while some of the ships you can only capture put you at the mercy of RNG, even with really good stats/perks.

The map feels pretty large, and it takes some time to get around without the use of T-Gates. At first, the map did not look all that large fully zoomed out, until I started panning around. Once I only used my sublight drive to go from one corner to the other, and it took me a fair amount of time ignoring everything along the way.

Combat takes a little getting used to, and after a while it gets fairly repetitive, especially once you have the larger ships where it's more of a slugging match, rather than a dogfighting spiral (though the larger ships is similar, but slower). You can also go into a "turret mode" to keep your guns trained on an enemy ship, or have your ship "fire at will". While you might have some turrets blocked depending on ship design, you might also be able to deliver a nasty broadside!

The boarding mechanic is more or less spending points to move from room to room, and spending points to pillage/capture. Larger ships are far harder to capture, so don't expect to successfully board a battleship early on, and even with a fully kitted out capital, boarding a ship to capture isn't a guarantee. You can choose to keep these ships, sell them, research them (so your HQ can build them for your warfleet), or scrap them for materials.

This brings me to the strategy portion, which for some will seem overly simplistic, and for others a chore. Obviously, to build a warfleet capable of taking over the map (or to get through the campaign), you'll have to build mining stations for ore, gas collectors for gas, junk collectors for "materials", and of course credits. These 4 resources are needed to buy/build ships, build/upgrade structures, and perform research. You will also get access to "civilian fleets" which can be assigned to projects on the map as you see fit. Every "week" you will get resources, and the more territory you own, the more you get.

Taking over territories will require you to battle stations/outposts to gain control. The other factions will have fleets they have patrolling to help defend their own turf, as well as to attack rivals. Destroying these fleets, capturing the stations and outposts will queue a battle, with a meter to see if you're winning/losing. If you leave the fleets to NPCs to fight it out, they'll have a timer until the battle is "won", but if you as a player intervene the timer goes away. To win these fights, you basically have to destroy all the marked targets, but the player can tip the balance in lopsided fights, and early on this is more important. By the "end" I was just letting my fleets attack on their own, while I attacked something else.

Overall, I am really happy to have picked this up, and it scratches that itch of flying around in space blowing stuff up, or just trading between stations to afford the really big ships. I haven't picked up the DLC yet, but still have about 1/2 the map left to conquer, so definitely got my money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052570992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1253, 'last_played': 1503237337}
review:
4X, Stratégie, Gestion, voici les éléments principaux de ce jeu qui mêle à la fois combat spatial, gestion d'empire et maîtrise de flottes. 

J'ai un apriori très positif sur les jeux de la série Starpoint Gemini, et celui-ci ne fait pas exception. Je crois que cette série, c'est un peu le petit frère de Star Wolves ! Et bien entendu, il ne m'a pas du tout déçu. La prise en main était un peu difficile, mais une fois les contrôles réarrangés, on rentre dans l'aventure avec grand plaisir, en découvrant une fois de plus le système Gemini et ses innombrables factions qui sont "pas en guerre du moins pas officiellement...". 

Comme toujours l'environnement et les graphismes sont à la fois simples et superbes, la musique idéale, et les combats nerveux et prenants. Le seul point noir à mon avis, c'est le saut en besoin de ressources entre le Tier 2 et le Tier 3 des bâtiments et de la recherche, qui obligent à une phase de farming assez longue.

Enfin, pour les amateurs de modding, le jeu est très facile à prendre en main pour modification, une autre de ses forces. 

Détail cependant, le jeu est anglophone, mais il existe un mod pour le passer en français.

Bref, un bon 16/20, je recommande avec plaisir !

review: Okay First off, this game is fantastic.  As you level up, the difficulty of the game scales up and the devs here listened to everyone's input on what they wanted in a game.  This is a great space sandbox type game with large fleets, massive explosions, you can capture enemy ships even and add them to your fleet, sell them, or strip em for materials.  anger people, and they will invade your space and blow up your shit!  Difficulty has been scaled down since I last played it making it much easier, but I was also fighting battleships in a frigate Because I didn't know they sold destroyers on phaneros only but they changed that so you can get it at your main base which also has many upgrades.  The Devs on this game deserve a lot because it's really fun and has an interesting storyline.  I think in future there could be more missions and events and such, and I'm looking forward to getting the dlc.  Great game 10/10.  Just as good as freelancer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988682984', 'num_games_owned': 1208, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1303, 'last_played': 1503245889}
review:
Many hours later and I'm having more fun than I did when I started. That's a good start and a nice change. Normally games are great at the start and then get worse/boring very quickly. 

There are elements of this game that I'm not a fan of. The camera and controls are quite odd and take getting used to. If you're struggling, keep plugging away, you'll get better. 

I am impressed with the scale of the game. It is multiple genres in one game. This is both great and bad. Everything seems like it needs 'fleshing out'. It's still good though.

Overall I'm playing this game quite happily, which makes a change because I really struggle to play games these days. I get so 'meh' after only 10-20 mins. Startpoint Gemini Warlords has kept my interest and has made me late for work for couple of times this week. It's nice to get a decent gaming session in again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006198755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 5854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3124, 'last_played': 1519762969}
review:
I recommend this only if you do not require realism on a large scale or extreme customization. 
Think of it as a Space Sim Lite, or Space Risk.

As per the banners below:

Fight.
Fill your capital ship capacity to max, add the remainder with little ships and enagage in a space disco, bashing and mashing your keyboard til it threatens to break. 
Wait a while (sometimes a long while), refil your fleet and repeat. 

Lead.
Click Follow Fleet, Fly around space while your fleet rams you like annoying space puppies, luckily doing no damage.
There's a disappointing lack of tactics. Would have liked to be able to get my carriers to hang back with the dreadnoughts on point, but ho hum.

Build.
Click 'Build'.

Conquer.
Do all of the above, a lot. Basically if it was football, score more goals than your opponent.

Customize.
Three types of light weapons (pew pew), three types of heavy weapons. Each hardpoint can have a mod fitted to increase an aspect of the weapon. And it is a great moment when you salvage that killer beam weapon from something you previously turned into a floating graveyard. But don't expect anything like EVE's complexity in ships or loadouts. Not even on a par with Masters of Orion I.

Overall it will keep you amused if you do not have a ton of time to spend choosing the type of washers you will fit to your run-arounds rear port auxiliary modulizer.
50 hours is plenty of time to complete the main plotline. Then you can start again from one of the pre-fabbed starting scenarios instead of having a nascent empire at your beck and call.
But it doesn't seem worth it tbh.....

author: {'steamid': '76561198041583954', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1152, 'last_played': 1526227821}
review:
Quel avis donner a ce jeu? 
J'arrive a la vingtaines d'heur eet je pense avoir vue que 30% du jeu, donc je vais donné mon avis sur ce que je vois et pas sur mes attente ^^

Bon le Mod French est arriver et franchement meme si il reste du taf, ce qui est deja fait est un super boulot chapeux!
Pour l'immersion le faire dans ça langue a plus e poid surtout que l'histoire de la campagne me semble tenir la route.

Le jeu est beau il a garder les mecanisme des anciens donc ont est pas perdu en sens la volonté de perduré dans ce qui a fait le charme du jeu, pas de beuge pour ma par, quelque ralentisement sur de grosse bataille mais je pense que ça viens plutot de moi et pas de  l'opti du jeu, les musiques, sons tout est bien fait!

Les moins c'est pour ma par un problème, un jeu bac a sable mais ont peux pas vraiment demander d'alliance ou aide ect ou alors j'ai pas trouver! ont verra dans les prochaine MaJ!

Pour finir ce qui ont aimer les anciens, les X3 aussi vont ce regaler pour l'heure il a tout pour plaire manque des choses encore mais a mon gout pour d'autres peux etre qui est complet, un peux chère aujourd'hui mais il faut c'est sous je trouve bon jeu ....

author: {'steamid': '76561198024352041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2724, 'last_played': 1507389629}
review: In so many ways the game that I always wanted an X game to be, and Rebirth let me down. Yes in some ways ship classes are a little too simplified, cannot auto transfer to any ship, but to me the space sim combined with 4X play is really great. The constant sending out of civilian fleets and their management can be a little tedios but...comon if you played X3 nothing can be as tedios as those menus. Comparitively the menus on Warlords are clean, crisp, and easy to navigage. I enjoy the built in expansion and capture element of play and the ability to manage an empire as it were. I do wish there were more options in how to expand the empire, different types of stations to custom build, etc. However I feel Warlords is a great step in the right direction filling in the hold in my heart left by XRebirth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004628852', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1676913457}
review:
Starpoint Gemini: Warlords is a lot of fun to play especially when in free roam mode.  If you like RPG elements with your space strategy games while tracking the exploits of your own personal character this is the game for you.  Many have compared this game to Mount and Blade and those people are not wrong.  

Starpoint Gemini: Warlords is definitely addicting.  Yes there are some tasks you have to perform in the beginning stages that get quite repetitive and boring but that's par for the course with these type games.  Once you have built yourself up and gotten a good income the universe opens up many new dimensions for you to explore.  Command fleets and conquer territory.  Build up a tradeship armada and ply the market for profit.  There are many paths to take.

The only downside with this game I've come across so far is a tiny bit of lag when exiting sublight just before getting into battle.  Once the transisition is complete however the game runs silky smooth again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056738560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 3838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3092, 'last_played': 1600449831}
review:
The good:
A lot of fun to be had with this game. This is the best space game I played in a very very long time. Quite a few spacecrafts to choose from, a relatively extensive (yet a bit too simple) research system and also a couple of different playstyles (and I don't mean the three 'classes', but more like strategies) to choose from. But one thing tops them all: everywhere I look on the fora on here on Steam the developers are really committed to the community and take suggestions very serious (and implement them in the game!). I really like that about this game and I think other developers should take note because this is how I would like to see all games being developed :-). This for me really is an example for how it should be done!

The bad:
The optimalization is quite bad. So bad that I am unable to get normal frame rates even though I have a really fast quad core with either a AMD R9 390 or Nvidia GTX 1070 (I use both in different PC's), SSD and 16/32GB of RAM. I tried every suggestion in practically every post or issue I could find about performance issues, but none work. Now I play the game with every setting on the lowest/least demanding setting and I get between 20-30 FPS (even less at large battles), which is really terrible. The worst part is that the CPU and GPU are not doing that much (quite the opposit)when the game is running. I don't get it and would really love a fix so I can play the game normally.

Other bad stuff: I think the minigame with the civilian fleets is rubbish. It's a stupid mechanism that isn't that rewarding to begin with and only seems to exist to extend the game time or something. In its current state, it should be automated (maybe after research?) or be thrown out of the game asap :-). Your mate back on the station is running most of everything anyway, why can't he sent a couple of civilian fleets to pick up some materials every now and then? Of course it would be cooler/better to extend the system and make it more useful and fun than just automate it (and effectively making it a persistent increase in the amount of resources you receive, but then a bit more random than with the buildings you can upgrade).

Another thing I don't like is that your warlords run in to battle ahead of all the other ships, and just get killed almost instantly. I rebuild their ships about 20 times now, and I am sick of it. No one would jump in to a highly fortified space station with one ship, just to kill themselves... It just doesn't make any sense. They are just programmed to be suicidle :/. The last thing I don't like is the lack of customization when you have finished to campaign and want to start a free roam experience. I read in a FAQ somewhere that you should be able to customize it more (colour, faction name, traits, backstory and stuff) but this isn't possible unfortunately. You have to play with the boring yellow Concordia.

Normally I don't ever play games that don't run well on modern hardware, but I make an exception for Starpoint Gemini Warlord, which by itself proofs that I like the game a lot!

5.存在感薄弱的主线剧情。我都快带领小弟统治整个星域了，但是主线剧情只做了一点    -1
6.希望教程能完善点。                                                                   +-
7.大船与小船的区别就是多几个炮塔，多几个小飞机，多点血，没有无畏舰、航母、泰坦专用武器。泰坦就多几个光环，无专用武器体现不出太大价值，而且没有史诗感。最重要的是大型舰船战列、无畏、泰坦可以装很多炮塔，武装飞机，驱逐等小船的高回避完全没用，来了就是秒，感觉大船就是披了个皮的大型武装飞机，俗称套娃,有点无趣  !!                                                   
                                                                                                        -10
有泰坦和那个奸星舰之后，后期有点无聊，创意工坊有个有39+39+20小炮塔的大船，比泰坦猛多了.希望能加强后续任务和加强泰坦专用武器！

总体来说混时间还是不错的！不过我没有重开游戏的欲望，就这样了！                                          

评分  7/10

review: 玩了兩天最大的問題是飛船操控方面，無法自由旋轉鏡頭。時常找不到敵人在什麼方向，近乎盲打一樣。敵人的飛彈射程遠得可怕，己方的短的可憐。採集資源方面不能自己定制在哪裡造工廠讓耐玩度大幅降低，hq不能個性化太死板。好的方面就畫質很美，可以有自己的艦隊很好玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198160035837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1534167112}
review:
不推荐该游戏.
第一，是操作很诡异，当年玩X3都没感觉有这么奇葩的操作，视角操作繁复不说，而且三种视角的灵敏成度都非常高，导致你必须调到很低才能控制平稳。其次飞行操作虽然类似X3的空格切换飞行和选择模式，但是一样存在烦人的指向问题，不论是鼠标还是手柄都是,移动和指向稍大就会机头乱晃。至于手柄，我测试两个手柄，PS手柄的射击和加减速和XBO的手柄射击和加减速是反的，反的。。。。。。
第二，画面党估计接受不了这10年前的建模水平，说实话，X3的建模都比这个精细。
第三，最重要的问题之一,win10正版，点击敌人闪退！保存游戏时偶尔会闪退。

Starpoint Gemini Warlords - Debug File

Error!! LoadTexture textureResource <saves\autosave.bmp> 1 Error <0x0>

翻评论看到开发者给其它人的评论回复，看了下出日志，应该是两个问题，第一个是未能找到MODLIST这个文件，第二是个自动保存里，生成的图形文件不知什么原因是一个空文件，自己解决的办法，工坊随便下个mod,然后进save目录把出错的autosave存档删除，测试了两个小任务没出跳出

author: {'steamid': '76561198016852864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1502735927}
review:
Сделайте русскую локализацию!!! (для комментаторов по типу тех, что ниже смотрите срок "создания" локализации, особенно учитывайте, что в прошлых играх серии она была)

Что насчет самой игры:
1. Игра скучная, поиграв 2 часа кроме тупого гринда квестов дляь фарма на новый кораблик более ничем не занимался.
2. Сюжет унылый, конечно зависит от того, с чем сравнить, но здесь все же банальные задания, с диалогами на уровне "Космических рейнджеров". И это в 2017 году.
3. Графика? Тут врядли о ней слышали, качество текстур обычное, обьекты обычные, сглаживание и прорисовка убогие, космом вообще отдельный разговор(какие-то низкокачественноые размытые звездочки ковром за гранью видимости, даже без динамики).
4. Контент? За 2 часа много не заметил, но оно и логично, однако сомнений насчет его обьемов по мере прохождения-масса.
5. Интерфейс? Это вообще *издец. Уровень игр 2010 года, опять же в 2017.
6. Управление тоже стоит отдельно упомянуть. Курсовые стреляют автоматически, главный калибр и еще что-то там только по нажатию, в то время как руки в этот момент пытаются худо бедно управлять корыблем, который одновременно управляется и мышкой и кнопкаи wasd.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089986274', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1503130596}
review:
官中的推出是很大的惊喜，态度值得肯定，当然有少许地方的翻译还有遗漏，不过可以修补完善。
个人认为玩这款游戏前2小时很重要，没错就是决定退款与否的2小时体验时间，一部分玩家因为不习惯操作方式而放弃了这款优秀作品，但是只要你耐心完成教程，能够熟练的切换模式，你会爱上这款游戏。因为其中包含了太多的丰富元素，既可以走私发家，也可以拦路劫财；既能当一匹独狼，一头扎到敌人堆里作死，享受激光和磁轨炮的洗礼。也能统帅自己的舰队，看着友军和敌人厮杀自己时不时补上几炮抢人头耍威风。虽然后期难免进入刷刷刷时间，但总体来说游戏诚意满满，乐趣十足。
另一方面，此游戏的优化还有待提高。如果你的电脑配置一般，最好升级硬件或者调低效果。当然全新型号高端配置的话就当我没说，你需要做的只是停止看评论，下载游戏尽情享受

author: {'steamid': '76561198006790355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1502564341}
review:
U SG2 jsem strávil téměř 50 hodin a dobře se bavil. Od SG3 jsem čekal SG2 rozšířenou o nápady, které se nestihly implementovat během early accesu dvojky (jak řekli sami vývojáři). Takže se těším na dobývání sektorů a návrat do známé galaxie. S novým DLC a sympatickou slevou nebylo nad čím dumat. Byl jsem ale nemile překvapen.

TL:DR:

Alespoň na začátku kampaně vypadá hra graficky mnohem hůř než dvojka (možná že později se to zlepší). Vše v okolí lodě je TITĚRNÉ. A díky nepochopitelně zvolenému nevýraznému jednobarevnému rozhraní je ovládání nepřehledné. Ačkoliv dvojka mě bavila a SG3 by měla být prakticky totožná hra, necelá první hodina hraní mě naprosto odradila od dalšího prozkoumávání. 

A teď delší povídání (obsahuje malinký spoiler v podobě co po vás kampaň ze začátku chce). 

První spuštění... Palec nahoru, že oproti předchozímu dílu je jasně řečeno, co je kampaň a co free roam. Volím kampaň. Divné intro (žádné není, jen se z 20 úhlů podívám a jednu stanici). Dumám, co přesně vedlo vývojáře k volbě rozhraní (zřejmě asi win10 a materiel design androidu - jednobarevné, monotóní a lehce zapomenutelné). Ještě štěstí, že si pamatuju ovládání z minula. 

Takže začínáme: klasická eskorta, follow me, bránění lodi, vrácení se na základu, skok zpátky. Klikni támhle, zmáčni tohle. Bítva vymalována A já přemýšlím, kdy mě hra má začít bavit.

Co se odehrává na obrazovně je titěrné, že se pořádně nedají věci rozlišit. Graficky hra vypadá přinejlepším chudě, možná je to jen tenhle kousek sektoru (pro jistotu kontroluji nastavení videa a vše je naškálované na maximum) a hlavně se vše děje relativně bez mého přičinění (poslušně zadávám free fire a než otočím lodí, ten červený shluk pixelů je pryč). 

Příběh se posunuje, následuje volba postavy - už jsem si říkal, jestli na to vývojáři zapomněli. Vyberu nejhezčí obrázek avatara, skilly a perky volím podle zkušeností z minulé hry a podle toho, co se může hodit. Perky se volí nahrazováním databáze ve stylu Mass effectu - podle mě zbytečných pár odstavců textu, ale pro nedočkavce je sumarizace vyplývajících perků na konci.

Jsem zpátky na základně. Hurá. Šéf mi říká, ať se za ním zaletím podívat. Ok, mám konečně možnost se podívat kolem. Na stanici klikám, kam mě hra pustí. Až budu na levelu XY vím, kam budu umisťovat bodíky. Do identicky vypadajících bleděmodrých tabulek ve stejně vypadajících záložkách. Volba zbraní to samé v bledě zeleném či červeném, doslova. Paráda. S láskou vzpomínám na SG2. Než postoupím v příběhu, vezmu první úkol bokem. Klasické doleť tam, znič, co tam najdeš. Než se vyřítím maximálním warpem, chvilku luštím jednobarevné symboly. Cestou míjím několik červených, žlutých a bílých malých čtverečků. To budou asi nějaké lodě, možná i stanice či anomálie. Naprosto nerozlišitelné. A to jsem prolétl těsně kolem nich. Pomalu mi začíná docházet, že takhle takhle hra opravdu vypadá. Doletím na místo. Loď vidím jen díky červenému orámování, tak je titěrná. Lítáme kolem sebe, pak rezignovaně přepínám na autofire a za 0.07s ji proměním na expanzivní plyny. Už chápu některé negativní recenze. Trosky sice oskenuji - asi (cosi červeného bliká před lodí), ale jinak se nic neděje. Hm, tak jo. Děkuji, to mi stačí.

Jasně, je to můj subjektivní dojem. Možná je to jen chybně zvoleným místem začátku kampaně - nejsou to žádné grafické orgie a podle obrázů tahle hra MÁ vypadat lépe, ale nevypadá. Hra je na tom vizuálně mnohem hůře než dvojka, vše v okolí lodě je menší a nepřehlednější a dojem naprosto zabíjí odporně jednobarevné rozhraní. Nemám prostě chuť a motivaci hrát dál a zjišťovat, jestli se něco možná zlepší. Dávám odinstalovat a žádám o refund. Tohle krátké demo mi stačilo a nepřesvědčilo mě.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029558448', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 14126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5240, 'last_played': 1560083611}
review:
Потрясающая игра! Жду Русский язык. Отношение разработчиков к комьюнити тоже очень порадовало. В игре же конечно есть минусы, но они с лихвой перекрываются плюсами. Ввиду редкости самого жанра я бы поставил по десятибальной не твердую 9ку. Не понимаю людей которые прям хотят от подобных игр какого то мега менеджемента и глобальной экономики, идите в ЕВУ играйте! Тут же ты играешь в свое удовольствие, бороздишь космос, прокачиваешься, зарабатываешь деньги на более крутой кораблик, выполняешь примитивные миссии. В общем я доволен покупкой на все 100%
Быстрее бы на Русский перевели.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027137228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 15728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10615, 'last_played': 1588466692}
review:
I normally do not review games, but here goes.
SPOILER ALERT! 

On the plus side, boarding ships and nuking planets are probably my favourite parts of the game. So either as a freelance captain or a pirate, you can have some real fun.

On the down side, the mining and trading careers are still kinda weak. (I think you should have to fight off more pirates or have pay off local strong-arms for protection "insurance".)

Overall, I would say this is one the better 4X games recently released.  I do recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098567761', 'num_games_owned': 3347, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1602888630}
review:
15 oct 2017---------------------------------------------------
Перевод на русский появился, но нормальным я его назвать не могу. Не знаю под каким наркотиком его писали, но аффторов штырило по высшему разряду (если вкратце, то переводчики на русский банально не знают русский).
Тем не менее, если решите "охладить траханье" в этой игре, то общую суть можно понять без проблем, хоть и с постоянными фейспалмами.
Если не касаться темы перевода, то на первый парах от игры так и веет филансером, и это плюс. Управление меня не раздражает (первый раз во всей трилогии) да и интерфейс довольно эргономичен. 

12 sep 2017--------------------------------------------------
А нормального перевода всё нет и нет =(

11 ago 2017--------------------------------------------------

*Ожидаем обещанной русской локализации.

*[u]Waiting for a promised russian localization[/u].

author: {'steamid': '76561198289277107', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1522370049}
review:
In 2013 I wrote a series of forum posts on the SPG2 forums detailing exactly what I wanted to see in a single player space RPG/sim game. The result of this development team's incredible attentiveness to the community and years of development is SPG Warlords, and I feel that this game is such a winner because of how closely they have matched their community's expectations.

I can't thank LGM enough for going the extra mile to satisfy so many community requests and make this such a fun, diverse and interesting game -- they even continue to exceed my expectations with more interesting content in the DLCs that I wasn't expecting to see. 

This is an extremely talented developer releasing a great game with complex, stable and balanced gameplay systems. This is literally what the open source VegaStrike community had envisioned for years, but it seems LGM threw this together in a couple of years of focused development -- the results are beautiful, awe-inspiring, and addictive.
