author: {'steamid': '76561198050453066', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 13857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9419, 'last_played': 1496903536}
review:
The Command Point Cap is hard to handle. How am i supposed to rule the Galaxy with this?

Why is there a long Loading screen for entering my station? (GTX1080+i76800k should handle data)

Anomaly grow more and more in some places if i ignore them. 11 once. What will happen if i ignore them forever?

Am I missing the option to command my fleet in battle?

Never flight in sight range of an minefield! The Fleet will stop in it and oh uh.

Fighting a 16k Station with my 32k Fleet and all i got was an T-Shirt.

Replacing an 32k Fleet is... oh look i could just sort out my DVD Collection.

This game can be more, i see it...
developer_response:
Hi and thank you for posting the review.

We realize the game has issues and we're doing our best to [i]iron them out[/i] as soon as possible. Two updates were already released and we're working on the next one which is planned for the end of the week.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165605842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3129, 'last_played': 1498251104}
review:
Great game!

Its an RPG, RTS and action game in one.

At first i wasn't sure about this game, until i got to build and manage my own fleets and territory, really enjoying this.
developer_response:
Great to hear!

Indeed, the game does have a slow start, but we didn't want to drown the players with everything right from the very beginning. Though, that doesn't mean we don't have more things to tweak in early game.

Thank you for reviewing!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965401732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1393, 'last_played': 1496180591}
review:
It's "ok" I guess. It's certainly not Freelancer as some have stated. Freelancer had easy and intuitive ship controls, this does not, Freelancer had unique major and minor factions that I actively wanted to learn about and join/fight against, this does not, Freelancer had a superbly voice acted and awesome main plot, this does not.

What it does have is the ability to pilot capital ships, build a mega fleet and obliterate other mega fleets to take over territory. Unfortunately to buld said mega fleet requires you partake in a mega grind for resources. Personally I find the game quite addictive but I think people who aren't massively interested in the space thing might get bored quickly. 

The game feels like a blend of Freelancer with the arcade controls and graphical style but with elements of X3 with its fleet and station management. Unlike X3 however it has a user interface that doesn't defy logic nor make you want to hang yourself - suffice to say it's actually functional.

Graphical style is definitely similar to Freelancer with the scaled down planets and ships, which I find disapointing compared to the X3 games, where planets could be incredibly large making you feel very small, which was awesome. 

Travelling the galaxy can either be done using "sub-light" engines (3x faster than usual I think), jump gates or warp drives; the latter two allowing instantaneous travel. In the early game there were times where I could be spending upwards of 5 minutes travelling around but now I have decent credit flow I can just spam warp drives after coming out a jump gate.

I don't really feel the desire to expore in this game unlike both Freelancer or X3. In Freelancer the game world had the illusion of feeling alive with all the chatter between NPCs while this game world kinda feels dead. Sure there's NPCs flying around but they're all military and they don't say anything. Also Freelancer had the 4 major factions (Americans, Brits, Germans and Japanese) that all had their own unique cultures, corporations and criminal factions. Each planet you landed on felt like it belonged to that faction and I wanted to find out everything about them. This game just doesn't grab me, sure some of the places you visit look kinda cool but it's not the same.

So yeah, it's an OK game if you like the genre but nothing ground breaking. Nothing is really exeptional about it which is probably its biggest detriment.
developer_response: Thank you very much for taking the time to post your review. We appreciate every one. It helps us determine and decide what needs the most work down the line.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039501242', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2681, 'last_played': 1528068433}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985436394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 11751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9278, 'last_played': 1582391384}
review:
I don't write reviews very often. When I do it is either because the game blew my mind and was amazing or because I regret every penny I spent on it. Thankfully this game is the former. 

Pros:
I bought into this game in Early Access, which is always terrifying with the track record of some of the "Could have been a great game..." cases that happen on Steam, but this game has been great all the way through it's release. The developers are very good about interacting with the community and really pay attention to player feedback. It is by far one of the most polished releases I have played in a long time (I personally have not had one bug or crash), even in early access bugs were few and far between. Gameplay is similar to previous games from the franchise but many new features have been added. In my opinion, this game gets as close to perfection as it can get. 

Cons? What cons? 

Ok on a serious note: The campaign can feel a little bit grindy at times when trying to push towards the next ship tier but that is the nature of any game that sets high goals for you, and each tier really is a big improvement. That being said, there could be a little bit of balancing with the freelance mission pay perhaps. Right now for example there are some missions that pay around 1m-2m credits that I completely smash, then there's a couple that pay 1.5m-3m that squash me and my entire fleet like a bug (we're talking fleet wiped out in less than 30 seconds). For the pay difference it seems a little imbalanced, especially when I can take the lower paying jobs and, with a little bit of luck, capture the enemy ship and make the same if not more than the higher paying job. 

All being said though, with that being my only gripe I would definitely give the game a solid 9.5/10, and with the way the developers have been so far I am sure that by the time they start working on the next game in the franchise (please give us another one!) this will be a solid 10/10 in my book. 

Thank you guys for delivering another outstanding addition to the franchise!!
developer_response:
Thank you for taking the time to write the review, both the pros and the cons. It gives us a good idea on the parts of the game that work and those that, well... don't :D.

We appreciate the review... and the 100+ hours you put into the game :).

author: {'steamid': '76561198154080100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1496079288}
review: The hype in the comments are overrated.  I usually rely on the reviews to help me decide if I should buy a game or not, this time around I feel cheated by the reviews. Controls are terrible. Physics non existant, colliding with an object just causes your ship to bounce like a brick hitting a wall. Gameplay is repetitive. Combat is pretty much automated. The entire game can be played via the universe map. I've played this game for 12 hours and I was already bored 6 hours in. I never write reviews, but the quality and playability vs the price I paid has forced me to write this review
developer_response:
Hi and thank you for posting your review.

I'm sorry the game disappointed you. Of course we hoped to achieve something better. What I'd like to ask you is, have you reached the 4X(ish) elements or did you lose interest before that? I don't want to harass you or anything. I'm honestly interested. Every review is an opportunity for us to learn and see how to improve the game, what areas are lacking and so on.

So, once again, thank you for reviewing. We appreciate it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027074501', 'num_games_owned': 741, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4226, 'last_played': 1575390281}
review:
Really enjoy the freedom of exploration, fleet building, and general combat. Very unforgiving game, even on normal, but it just makes it all the sweeter when you finally nab a high-end ship, or conquer a territory that has been giving you trouble.

Plenty of ship designs the further you get into the game as well. There is even several 'arena' areas with fun rules around them. So much to do.

Your character grows, as does your empires research. Plenty of options to choose from for growth. 

Devs have been very responsive as well, and have patched a few times already during the first week of launch. I've run into no major bugs either, so that is a plus.

Game is a great bargain at its current price. So much variety of content, and it is all of good quality. Very happy with my purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025841181', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1897, 'last_played': 1497199247}
review:
It's a great game, personally it reminds me of bit of Mount&Blade Warband, the sandbox is fun. Though i would have liked to be able to create more fleets (you can create many, just not very strong ones). The fleet strength cap is a bit of a bummer, would have like to have a weekly paid system instead, so the amount of ships isn't down to what upgrades i have, but if i can actually handle the amount of ships i build.

Overall great game, i highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010458551', 'num_games_owned': 824, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3419, 'last_played': 1525044379}
review:
fun, challenging, strategic layer and personal fused amazingly well. No crashes.  Only detraction is that i havent yet figured out a satisfying method of moving camera for turret view that isnt clunky. In that same vein turrets on many hulls are only on the top so dog fights involve a lot of revolving and rotating to keep them in sights. and developers for some strange reason thought with all our guns on the top of the ship, we should have a default (and most) view that focuses on aiming wahts below the ship.

The one thing i would change would be a mirror default view under the ship so that you have a greater angle of attack and can actually shoot manaully AND fly at the same time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040439031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1539, 'last_played': 1495989594}
review:
The game has potential, to be sure, but there's nowhere near enough content and variety to ensure that the repetition doesn't devolve into tedium. Give this a half a year or two for content updates and tweaking before buying.

The game that comes to mind when looking for a comparison is the classic Freelancer, just remove the transport lanes and borders between systems. Freelancer was a wonderful game because its was a focused 4x (ish) experience. Systems weren't too big (realistic space scaling would be horrible to play as a video game unless you have time-skipping ala X3:albion prelude and the X franchise in general). 

Starpoint Gemini Warlords in comparison is much much larger, and not to its benefit. A significant portion of the players time will be spent going to your destination, during which there is little to nothing for the player to do but to watch the skyboxes and space dust zoom by. LOD distance is disgustingly small, and pop ins are practically as bad as early-release No Man's Sky. Space is EMPTY, maybe this is for realism but for the purposes of a game it just means that the environment is entirely devoid of anything interesting to look at. For a game based on sci-fi and space this is a horrible thing, there's absolutely no magic with exploration. 

There is a quick-warp option but it requires giving up one of the limited (4) slots for other items, somewhat expensive, and the item system in general is cumbersome. A number of items are avaiable for the player that give temporary or situational bonuses: quick shield regen, hull repair, or high drops from specific resources, amongst others. You have to pause your gameplay just to switch out your item loadout, and if you care about optimal results from your endevours you'll need to do this alot - there is no option for loadout sets or to seamlessly switch them without having to pause the game and go through several menus and clicks.

Story mode is bare-bonesy. Just a bunch of dialogue to justify having the player go on the rails around a predetermined universe. The game comes on its own much better in the other free modes where the universe actually evolves  without your input - a key factor for anything to feel alive.

Graphics are nothing to write home about. You will be seeing just the universe skybox and your ship(or ships) zooming through it. LOD is so bad that honestly the game is worse if played in 4K. Massive structures and objects will appear out of nowhere as you get closer, apparently your ship suffers from near-sightedness.

Ship-to-ship combat is nearly automated. Fighting manually is not recommended unless you are flying the lightest ship class. Your ships have firing angles due to static turrets placed around your ship depending on what model it is. Some ships have the turrets on the front limitng them to firing only forward. Others like Freighters or carriers would have them concentrated on the sides, giving them tremendous power when their targets are on their flanks but lighter, more maneuverable ships may be able to keep themselves on the blind spots which introduces a degree of tactics to the game. This completely falls apart during large-scale battles due to multiple overlapping ship's firing lines. There is no strategic or tactical command allowing for formations for the AI, so it devolves really to who has more numerous or powerful ships. Its epic the first few times but tiresome later.

Non-combat you have mining, gas extraction, or trading to do. This really only entails buying something somewhere, shooting down asteroids somewhere, gathering gas somewhere, and selling all that somewhere else. You can find where certain items are sold for what value - its nowhere as complex as the X series. Its not to its benefit as well here either, this means the player really will just mostly going to places to sell things and thats really it. 

This isn't X but doesn't do anything to makethat a good thing. its simpler but it just ends up being tedious and lacking in variety. Give this a few months for the devs to make quality of life improvements and some badly needed graphical updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007394188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3643, 'last_played': 1628557268}

author: {'steamid': '76561198144583894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 8665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1694741597}
review: I have played the game for two days and have seen some problems that need to be corrected the first and biggest one is that when I return to Concordia at the end of the mission 'Theif in the night' it brings up a load screen that is frozen. second is that the tactical overlay pops up randomly even if you try to turn it off. My final suggestion is that both the video graphics  and controls need to be ironed out a bit more. the video of the first enemys to fight showed the ships moving forward and backward frequently and many of the controls are confusing compared to Starpoint Gemini 2. If these things can be corrected then I would be happy to fully recomend this game.
developer_response:
Hi Casey,

Problems duly noted. I'll forward them to the guys.

I do have a question though, if you don't mind: When you say the controls are more confusing than in Starpoint Gemini 2, what do you have in mind specifically? I'm really wondering, because I can't remember that we actually removed anything :S. We did do additions and changes, but all [i]legacy[/i] controls should still be accessible and usable.

Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198070695461', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2944, 'last_played': 1524629091}
review:
[h1]OVERALL: 9.2/10[/h1]
About 8.7 scored from the averages of my review, but I want to give the game a 0.3 bonus for the amazing dev group. They are active and genuinely care about their community. I can't think of any other game that cares about us the way these people do. Honestly, it feels shallow to even try and quantify it in terms of score, but I'm doing it because the dev community was what sold me on getting the game (but the game is what keeps me coming back). And it really does make it so much better! Oh, and another 0.2 for workshop!

[i][b]A note to the Developers if any of you read this:[/b] Thank you so much for your hard work in not only making this amazing game, but also the hard work you all do in interacting with the community![/i]


[h1]Graphics: 7.5/10[/h1]
[b]
+Nebulae
+Suns/lighting
+Clusters of junk/asteroids
+Ships and particles
- flat skysphere
-Planet textures
[/b]

 When you get close to a planet, it has very low resolution and overall just looks odd up close with some choppy tiling texture seams. Likewise, textures in docks seem kind of bland. The stars in the sky (not the two in the galaxy, but the ones in the background) feel very flat, too. It feels very much like a star textured sky sphere surrounding the player, which is only an issue in areas that have few other things to look at, so your attention is really drawn to it more. All that being said, the nebulae are gorgeous and make up so amazingly for it.

[h1]Sound: 9.5/10[/h1]
[b]
+Music
+Sound Effects
+VA quality
- A liiiittttle bit more VA
[/b]

Not much more that needs to be said about this. I constantly felt the music was done well. Also, with a little tweaking, you can effectively add any music you want. There's some tutorials on this and mods that [i]replace[/i] music, but none so far that I've seen add music. Very likely because you have to alter some core files of the game, so any updates would likely overwrite it. Still, if you just keep a copy of the modded file, it'd probably be pretty easy to just put it back in. And the limited amounts of voice acting are actually really nice breaks with good quality as well. A little on the sparse side in terms of frequency, though. Not saying I want an extensive amount of VA, but a little more would be nice.

[h1]Gameplay: 9.5/10[/h1]
[b]
+Unique RTS/Action 
+Great balance of play and growth
+Transition into RTS is wonderful
+NPC/Enemy AI makes the game feel alive
- A bit of sensless grind in the beginning 
[/b]

Early on in the campaign, I felt like I was just kind of left to my own devices on getting to the next tier of ship. Which is fine, but this made the gameplay a Job Board grindfest for a couple hours. I feel if I did this part again, I may be able to find more stuff to do, but in the end on my first playthrough, there were about 3 hours in the game where I was just trying to get money with no other objective. And the job board is just mindless fetch quests essentially.  That being said, after the game gets going, it [i]reeaaally[/i] gets going. It is one of the most addicting concepts I've ever played in a single player game. Honestly, this part wouldn't be nearly as good if it wasn't for the beginning area to give the rest of the game perspective. As your [strike]Empire[/strike]... I mean [i]Concord[/i]... grows in power, you will expand and the game play shifts beautifully into an RTS combination that the player character feels useful, but not overpowered as a ship among a fleet. This stage of the game is when it really hits your blood stream and hooks you in. The constant ebb and flow of defending, growing, gathering, and moving is perfect. Enemies and NPC's both attempt expansion and it really makes a single player game feel alive with all the moving parts.

[h1]Story and Setting: 8.0/10[/h1]
[b]
+Timeline
+Setting gives context to the universe
= Decent story
- Story takes a backseat to gameplay
[/b]

The story is pretty decent so far ( as I haven't finished it yet). The main problem is that between certain quests, the player has to upgrade his ship to the next tier. This really breaks the continuity and makes the story feel more sporadic, as it keeps taking a back seat to the gameplay. The setting is great, though. There is a pretty detailed timeline in the game to give context as to what's happening. Honestly, this gives so much to world in terms of interactions and even some of the insults, as well as the different structures and probably most importantly, the placement of each nation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198241515448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 2018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1547768408}
review:
That's a nice one.
More of the same Starpoint Gemini experience but with tons more content, things to do, better sound , graphics.

The conquest is a very nice feature, and i can't wait to explore the game more, and i know i will dig into it, and its freelancing universe.
Of course mods will be appreciated from talented modders.

Be informed:
When i launched the game , the fps were VERY bad, like a slideshow.
I was ready for a refund......

But, i settled down, i pick up my thoughts, downloaded the latest graphics drivers (GeForce 860M on laptop),
toned down the graphics options (someday i will try to raise them to see their breaking point), and now the game runs smoothly with great visuals even on low.

Bugs will propably pop up from time to time, but i hope the developing team will keep their promise to deliver us again and again a freelancing space game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003312996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1564719521}
review: At its core, it seems to be a solid space sim... but the controls are ridiculous.  Enemies are bouncing around like crazy while you're trying to juggle horrible keyboard and mouse controls with your camera flying around.  I tried adjusting the controls, slowing down the mouse, changing key binds... and I managed to make it almost playable.  The devs should have slowed down the action and adopted more tactical Eve-like controls, or kept it at its current speed and just scrapped the current system for something less clunky.  As it is, I'm pretty much done.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984236774', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 7125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4934, 'last_played': 1534115439}
review:
Right well I'm going to recommend it, it's a good game, the devs deserve the support considering how active they are. How open they are to admiting mistakes and accepting great ideas and their effort to fix and make the game great as it should be.

The fleet system though is it's biggest flaw and weakness. And hopefully they will bring it to a level that will make it enjoyable.

For now I found ways to avoid having your fleet go "SQUIRREL!!" on the way to attacking and capturing bases, using T-Drives to jump straight at the base, though spawns can still occure during fights, makes it more baerable for now. 

The X4 aspect is slow, and expanding too fast will bite you in the ass something fierce.

It has it's flaws, but not being a AAA huge, dev company is what makes this better than most games, as they actually care about their game, and actually want to make it successful and enjoyable. 

Anyways, for now unfortunately alot of anoying bugs and oversights that are being worked on. And knowingly will be improved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063128870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 5657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2801, 'last_played': 1637383157}
review:
It's a great game.

Pros:
.Graphics: It looks really good. (they could improve rendering distance though)
.Gameplay: The system is solid and entertaining.
.Sound: Good music and effects.
.Size: You have a ton of things to do if you want to conquer the sector.
Cons:
.UI: Confusing UI for someone new to the game. It needs more detailed explanations for items and how to assign and improve each ship system.
.Menus: Inability to use the keyboard to navigate the menus...really? 

All in all is a good game that can be improved in some aspects
developer_response: Thank you for writing the review! We browse the reviews section every day to see what the most crucial issues are, what player like and dislike and clear reviews like this really help. Thanks again!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970334417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1495926992}

developer_response:
Hi,

There is definitely controller support. A number of gamepads work without a problem. But, I don't know what controller (manufacturer) you have specifically. If you can, please run the game, and then send us the log.txt (installation folder). The log will hold all the info we need to make sure the game recognizes [i]your specific[/i] controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030508656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3639, 'last_played': 1502530868}
review:
Пожалуй будет мой первый обзор за все время, но этот проект того стоит.

Наконец после раннего доступа игра вышла в релиз, и несмотря на некоторые недоработки (которые моментально исправляются) игра получилась не просто хорошей, а ОТЛИЧНОЙ. На фоне повальных провалов других проектов раннего доступа, этот проект не просто удовлетворил ожидания игроков, но он даже превзошёл их. Разработчики очень хорошо реагировали на отзывы коммьюнити и моментально исправляли все недоработки и производили улучшения, так что на выходе получилась действительно интресная игра на космическую тему, в которой хорошо практически все, кроме разве что отсутствия русского языка, но, надеюсь, что в будущем это поправят.

Итак плюсы:
+ Отличная игра на космическую тематику
+ Отличный гибрид космосима и стратегии
+ Красивый космос и хорошая музыка, что создает атмосферу
+ Удобное управление
+ Возможность сколотить свою космическую империю!
+ Очень отзывчивые разработчики
+ Широкие возможности моддинга

Минусов не много но все же:
- Попадаются баги, но над ними очень быстро работают
- Кампания коротковата
- Выносливость солдатни в абордаже

По поводу кампании хочется сказать, что она неплоха, но коротковата, да и сюжет не шибко закручен, и не очень привязан к захвату территорий и вообще чего либо, хоть это и является основной фишкой игры. При этом, сюжет охватывает только треть всей игровой вселенной (в 2/3 вы даже не побываете за время сюжетных заданий, если идти только по ним). Но, несмотря на этот недостаток, она получилась достаточно интересной. Я надеюсь, что этот недостаток исправят в будущих обновлениях и ДЛС, которые у этих ребят выходят действительно хорошими. 
Также хотелось бы добавить про систему абордажа в игре, она реализована интересно, но очень напрягает в конце игры, потому что невозможно увеличить выносливость абордажников выше определенного уровня. К тому моменту, когда ты исследовал все технологии и взял все перки, а у тебя всего 87 единиц выносливости на самом толстом корабле, то захват любого дредноута или авианосца превращается в рулетку с шансами 40 на 60, что не особо радует. 
Но, несмотря на эти недостатки, пока это лучший пример, как НАДО мешать космосим со стратегией и лучшй проект раннего доступа, который когда либо был в стиме.

10 неудачных абордажей из 10.

Если вы фанат хороших игр на космическую тематику, то берите не раздумывая (но опять же повторюсь, что русский язык пока не завезли).

author: {'steamid': '76561198032396835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 6276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3477, 'last_played': 1699633772}
review:
This, is precisely what I've been waiting on in this series. It's different from the first couple games as you're not a single ship roaming the vast cosmos... but a fledgling faction liberating (or let's face it, pirating) your way across beautifully developed skyscapes. If there were any changes I would look for, they would be minor, like the inability to choose to take one of your garage ships and reutilize it as either parts for building or conscript in your Navy.

The story is great, controls not overly difficult and keeps you borderline frustrated/excited between "should I Expand, Research, or sit back and build my fleet?"

I highly recommend the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076826717', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1501, 'last_played': 1534181265}
review:
tl;dr - if you liked the previous installments of the series - you'll love Warlords since every single aspect of the game has been improved. If you never tried SPG - this is the one to get. It's a nice blend of X, EVE and Stellaris on a simplified scale.

FULL REVIEW can be found [url=http://www.alpha-orbital.com/news/starpoint-gemini-warlords-review]here[/url]

Graphics-wise, the game looks great. It runs smooth as butter with no hickups or framedrops. You play in a huge open universe without loading screens between zones (some occur while jumping to far-away zones or landing on planets, but those usually take a second), and you're pretty much free to do whatever you want. Trade and sign peaceful contracts, run missions to help the local factions or pirate ships, board others and take what is not yours...

Everything is done in realtime, and the option NOT to pause the game while flying/opening the circular menu is a welcomed change compared to the previous game. To make it even sweeter, you can build your own HQ, upgrade it and start piling up a massive fleet of your own to conquer other systems and planets. It's a mix of X games, Eve and Stellaris - but on a much simpler scale.

There are tons of different mechanics, but all of them are simplified. Some might not like it, but I'd rather do stuff from the get-go than have 40h of gametime grinding credits so I can start doing something meeningful. If you're expecting a deep economy with full fleet micromanagement - you're not getting it. Stick to X series. Fortunately, I know tons of people who like space sims but are put off by the shere complexity of some 4X/spacesim games. Warlords make it easy and accessible.

The controls are much better than SPG2, but sometimes still feel clunky. The new "Turret camera" helps a lot, but it would be even better if the camera wasn't fixed to your ship when moving. This way, you constanly have to re-adjust the view while moving the ship which makes some of the fight difficult since you'll spend most of the time trying to find your target.

There are also tons of various ships ingame you can buy, outfit and fly. 80ish of them spaning various classes from small ships to massive fleet capitals.

So, If you're looking for a realtime space game where you fly around pewpewing stuff that doesn't require you to go all spreadsheet on it - SPG: Warlords is a really good game to get!

Also, knowing how awesome and dedicated the devs are - you can expect any of the bugs you might run into squashed in record time with more features coming on a regular basis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049956318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1680059224}
review:
UPDATE: They fixed it! With that speedy bug fix and friendly Dev response I recommend this game fully. I'll leave the old review up so people can see why I made the update.

This game is plain and simple a solid, engaging and brilliantly well-done space sim. If you enjoy the genre or want a good one to start with, this game is the game for you. Even when you don't know what you're doing, you're doing something, and you're having fun.

The game world is beautiful, with complex and creative ship models; flashy, interesting space battles, with shots and missiles flying around; and an overall great design. 

THE OLD:
This game is spectacular. It looks great and gets good frames; the gameplay is engaging and fun. However, it's super unstable. It crashes every 30min to 1hr for me. I'll continue to play the game but I can't recommend it until the constant crashing is solved.
developer_response: We are terribly sorry you're experiencing this. Truly, seeing a player that feels game is spectacular, is experiencing such problems... very very sorry. If possible, can you please provide us your log.txt file ? If you send it to customersupport@starpointgemini.com and mention in your mail that it is you, we'd really like to dig deeper and see what is happening. One update will go live soon, but we'd like to check this issue of yours, and make sure it is already included in patch, or will be in the next one. Again, apologies for your bad experience, but we'll do everything possible to make sure you get the chance to experience entire game without such problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036463102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2626, 'last_played': 1535114384}
review:
Ich bin von dem Game echt positiv überrascht :-) Super Grafik, Atmosphäre und Interface. Ein Haufen Möglichkeiten hat man als Weltraumcaptain! Wunderbar :-) Ob man einfach nur Zeug transportieren oder kämpfen will, Stroy folgen oder Flotte aufbauen und und und - Alles einem selber überlassen. Perfekt. Habe schon lange auf ein 4X Game gewartet, was auch Grafik, Freiheit und Atmosphäre mitbringt :-) Einfach Abends mal nur bissel im Space rumflitzen und sein Schiff upgraden, seine Flotte ausbauen oder Schiffe kapern. Cool ! Das Kampfsystem macht echt Spaß und die Navigation auf der Sternenkarte total super. Wie gesagt Interface ist echt Top! 

Wer gerne Space Games spielt und nicht die ganze Zeit hektisch am Joystick hängen möchte ist hiermit sehr gut beraten.

Mir hat es gefallen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961104215', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2557, 'last_played': 1495594787}
review:
I played this game in Beta for a decent number of hours and then revisted it once the final release came out. I cannot recommend it.

The graphics are not impressive by any means. I'd rather a good game than good graphics; but Warlords doesn't even scratch the visuals in X3 and that was years ago.

The gameplay is very thin in many places. It truly is just a grind.

Trading is a joke; not even the most minor of dynamic systems like the prices for a resource going down as you flood a station with goods; instead you can find a fixed route and do nothing but that repeatedly.

Piloting is also very weak. The idea of the different classes is based on range; but there is no reasonable way to maintain a proper range from the enemy to say use Vanguard (if that's the "sniper" class, I can't remember them the names are terrible) and also keep the guns actually trained on the enemy. There is no way to reasonably control your fleet either. 

The point of the review was that the game doesn't go all in on being a first-person ship controlling game, nor does it go all in on being a strategic game. It's a mishmash of the two and does neither well.

The review was a bit over the top about calling things offensive; the game is certainly in a finished state and reasonable care went into building it. It's not one of those ripoffs you find on steam by any means. 

It's simply a boring game.
developer_response:
Hi,

I'm sorry you didn't find anything of interest or worth in the game. We were aiming for a [i]wider[/i] game gameplay-wise when compared to Starpoint Gemini 2. In any case, thank you for posting your review :).

author: {'steamid': '76561197977235219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 6554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1577, 'last_played': 1533481082}
review: This is a very good mix of tense dog fights, chilled exploration, levling your character and upgrading your ship. Balancing feels very fair (at least on normal difficulty). Side missions are a bit grindy but not too bad because they seldom last longer than a few minutes and they give good money so you can upgrade to a higher ship class after a fairly short time. The space, ships and stations are beautifully designed and the soundtrack nicely supports your travels through space.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010820818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2698, 'last_played': 1495906553}
review:
It's a good game in many aspects, but needs a bit of tweaking yet (v.1.1). You can easily throw dozens of hours in it. It's been compared many times with X3, however, thou it shares some similities, X3 is a lot more complex and has a harder learning curve.

7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995294232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1551209376}
review: Instantly hooked, I've played a lot of games like this. The UI feels really clunky compaired to other games and I'm not a fan of the camera system in this game. I'd prefer something more akin to EVE online's controls at this point with how combat in this can get a little overwhelming when there are a lot of fast moving targets, what I have seen is most people just use fire at will and focus more on flying the ship (it's what I do, and it works better than trying to dogfight in a frigate...) Overall though I enjoy the game and hopefully they will continue to make some tweaks to the controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961354351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1702, 'last_played': 1496666387}
review:
Have you ever asked yourself, "What if the X series, Rebel Galaxy and SPAZ got together for a wild, drunken night of debauchery?"

Well, nine months later, Starpoint Gemini Warlords was born.

[h1]The Good[/h1]

It's a Space-RPG-sandbox-Action-4x-RTS. Building up your little empire and sending (or leading) your fleets to [strike]annex[/strike] [i]liberate[/i] your neighbors is fun and pretty addictive.

The graphics are fairly good, with interesting ship designs. Fleets can be pretty large and ordering them around on the real-time strategy map is easy and intuitive (if a little simplistic).

[h1]The Bad[/h1]

Still somewhat buggy. Music and/or audio seemingly cut out at times, making some large battles go oddly quiet. Some ship equipment not adjusting stats in the way its description says it does, etc. One instance of not being able to save because the game thought I was still in combat. It [i]was[/i] able to autosave on docking though, so no progress was lost and the bug was gone on loading the save.

Performance may be something to be wary of. I have a pretty powerful desktop, and while the game is playable, I've definitely seen some hefty frame drops, especially when fast travelling.

I'm not sure I'd call them clunky, but the camera controls are [i]odd[/i] and definitely take some getting used to.

[h1]The Wishlist[/h1]

Certain aspects of the game's mechanics seem obtuse or hidden from the player. For example, what are the (dis)advantages of the three main light weapon types? There's an in-game encyclopedia, but even so it's never made clear. So far as I can tell, the only way to know how a specific weapon performs vs shields or armor is to go to the wiki and look at (probably outdated) damage tables.

Adding more tactical options to the battles wouldn't go amiss either. The AI ships always charge directly at the other fleet and end up in a messy furball. If they could find a way to add things like formation and engagement distance options, focusing on targets, etc. to battles (without it being a clunky control nightmare) that would be perfect.

[h1]Overall[/h1]

I've had Warlords since the start of the Early Access launch. It was an ugly mess then.

While the game still isn't perfect, it's come a very, very long way and is a lot of fun now. I'm hopeful that most of the bugs can be patched and perhaps a few more features added now that we've reached full release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127598593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1575985635}

author: {'steamid': '76561198051454676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 11689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5580, 'last_played': 1566107994}
review:
If you like Starpoint Gemini concept you will definitely enjoy Warlords. There are space sims that you play and forget and than there is this. Many ships, solid story and chance to conquer the universe in a great conquest mode. This game is easily 8/10 material right now and will be even better after DLCs and mods kick in. Yes, SPG games are one of the few where you are really looking forward to DLC releases! 

Also the community is great, including the devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053542348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1590314240}
review:
Damn, this game is amazing. Totally exceeded my expectations.

Pros:
+ much better than Starpoint Gemini 2
+ much better than Freelancer
+ pretty much the best space combat sim 4x hybrid ever
+ good Star Trek Captain Kirk simulator
+ good modding potential
+ greater than sum of its parts

Cons:
- could use more polish and bugs ironed out
- way too addictive, makes me lose sleep
- can't concentrate at work because I keep thinking of my in-game empire
- still need a Star Wars total overhaul mod

Some short detailed review: In the campaign you start with a gunship and work your way upwards into becoming a conqueror who conquer the whole galaxy. You build allied fleets to help you do so. So you have the standard 4x fare like building constructions, resource gathering, research, etc. Simple enough, but fun.

Then comes combat. Imagine Mount and Blade. You are on top of a horse, huge battlefield, and you order your men to charge the enemy formation. You see your men are slaughtering the enemy in front of you. You lower your lance and charge at someone and kill them instantly. You draw your bow and shoot arrows at someone. In this game you are like an admiral in your capital ship, and you see your fleet slaughtering the opposing fleet in front of you. You increase your speed, and ram your ship into one of the opposing ship and watch it explode. You lock into a ship and shoot torpedoes. So yes, it feels like Mount and Blade in space.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064838002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 2217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1562, 'last_played': 1547300602}
review:
Don't look for a detailed review on this game, you will find no one this week - because everybody who is into this game, currently playing))This game is great space sim, makes Elite:Dangerous look like empty s h i t. Gemini:Warlords is like singleplayer EVE. 

Should you get this game? Definitely, if you are into space simulators and also don't mind a bit of strategy and empire building. 

The only downside so far - many bugs and unpolished/unreleased features,including several gamebreaking ones, but i hope devs will fix all in next few weeks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007884321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 21939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15252, 'last_played': 1582461825}
review:
Wer die vorgänger gemocht hat und generell auf X4-Spiele steht wird sich hier wie zuhause fühlen, der Weltraum ist Riesig und die Explosionen sind es auch ... Erz sammeln macht hier regelrecht spaß!

Steuerung ist sehr intuitiv und das gameplay insgesamt sehr stimmig.

Spiele seit der e-a und bin mit der entwicklung des spiels und der schnellen und kompetenten reaktion der devs mehr als zufrieden, sowas wünscht man sich bei allen großen Titeln, leider oft vergebens.

review:
It is a great game, beautiefully made and (in comparison to X3 or EVE) easier to learn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099479587', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 5796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5758, 'last_played': 1497325470}
review:
一旦开始上手 这就是一款令人沉迷的游戏了
不知道有没有同时玩过EVE和本作的小伙伴来说一下这游戏的优缺点
在我看来 
巨舰大炮才是男人的浪漫！[spoiler]虽然一开始你只是一艘小炮艇[/spoiler]
全炮开火！[spoiler]还是交给AI吧 极限距离它比你打得准[/spoiler]
能买更强更大的船去刚更多更狠的敌人！[spoiler]到后期就是带着舰队围殴敌人[/spoiler]
这个就足够了

以下是接触5小时左右的心得
切记第一点要加外交 任何RPG里嘴炮都是主角最强技能
开战后要在左下角把能量分配从引擎划到护盾和弹药 不然会被电脑按在地上揍
不要心疼钱 多买护盾包 维修包和诱饵 这些是战时必备消耗品
最后 束能武器强无敌

80小时全星图占领 以下心得
如果想正常体验游戏请不要安装创意工坊的OPstuff MOD  研究出的磁轨炮三级太强影响游戏性
辐射伤害可以用消耗品抵消 也可以用护盾上的辐射抗性增强部件抵消
开战前一定要主动释放舰载机
舰队的AI很低 如果没有2倍以上的兵力值还是不要派去占点
抢来的船数值不如自己造的MKⅡ 当然前期可以抢着卖钱
中后期被对面航母秒可以考虑见到他放出舰载机就使用Atlas系统(大范围脉冲 秒飞弹和舰载机)
你自己的随从被打爆后可以重建的 所以不要心疼 让她上 打爆了算我的
被动尽早点出领地税收(后期一半星图到手 每一跳就是几百万 还打什么自由枪骑兵任务)
航母炮少舰载机多 无畏舰炮多舰载机少 除了航母硬一点 包大一点其实别的差不多
其它势力的船想要在自己家建造 MK1要抢2艘送去研究 MK2要再抢5艘送去研究
[spoiler]Borealis翻译过来有北方的意思 你懂我说什么[/spoiler]
这是一款跨界的上好杰作
满足了我对太空类RPG的大部分需求[spoiler]可惜战舰和无畏舰没有真正意义上的主炮 航母的舰载机也比较少[/spoiler]
我推荐这款游戏
我很享受它

[spoiler]等手痒了有空回来再换个职业重开星图[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198007587697', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1525077024}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028078053', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1533615475}
review: This game has a lot of interesting concepts, but it lacks good implementation. Every system feels clunky and unintuitive. The combat tends to center around "let your ship's turrets do all the work and spam consumables", and feels tedious. Ship controls are awkward, and half the time I feel like I'm fighting my own ship more than the enemy ships. The base management is okay at best, and boring at worst. The story isn't anything special, and has no real sense of urgency. It struggles to keep the player's attention and give them any reason for caring about what's going on. Honestly, if you want a space sim with NPC management, just go with one of the X3 games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035655467', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 3555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1635358929}
review:
This is not a simulator, this is a semi-casual space conquest , this does not mean the game cannot be challenging, you will run into fleets and ships you won't manage to defeat on your first try. 

GOOD
-More features than Starpoint Gemini 2 
-Better scale on ships 
-Nice design tool to customise the appearance of your ship 
-Better effects overall , higher quality than its predecessor (not that SG2 was bad)
-You play how you want to, want to avoid the main grind? want to get straight into Big wars with other factions, then you can, with multiple starting options, start off with nothing or ... not nothing, its up to you. 

Worth mentioning
-Good progression, although the lower tier ships will lose relevance in your fleet pretty quick. 

Im really enjoying the game, saving up resources to upgrade my homebase and do research so I can build a better fleet and kill my pesky neighbours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033603190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1502430327}
review:
I bought this game yesterday and ohh boy what a mistake that was, installed it around noon and the gf comes home around 7pm and says hey babe i make some kind of grunting noise to acknowledge her presence as I was in the grind from level 8-15 to get that destroyer you are in for all of 1 level as level 18 comes really quick then you do cruiser stuff. More on that latter, anyways the gf comes and says shes going to bed and i think i asked her what time it was she said midnight I just made more noises as my cruiser was taking a beeting. next thing I know im cruising the galaxy in my new battleship wondering where my fleet went. When all of a sudden i feel this warmpth on my face. A warmpth i have not felt in a long time, it was the sunlight starting to shine through the window. This is the first game in a long time that has somehow made me forget to eat and sleep. Just one more in game week babe i need this new ship for my fleet.

8/10 would lose sleep again

author: {'steamid': '76561198007635749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1615586476}
review:
Update nach 7,5 Std. und einem wichtigen ersten Patch:

Die von mir benannten Fehler wurden sofort behoben. Die Hauptmission lässt sich weiterspielen. Zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt kann ich das Spiel erstmal guten Gewissens empfehlen. Eine detailiertere Beschreibung/Review folgt dann deutlich später. (Außer den Bugs kenn ich ja nur das Startgebiet...)


---

Kurzreview nach 5 Stunden Spielzeit:

Das Kernspiel macht einen guten Eindruck, die Elemente greifen in einander und es macht Spass...

Zumindest bis ein Bug einen mal wieder dazu zwingt Stunden zurück zu springen und von vorne anzufangen. Wenn man innerhalb von Missionen speichert und später dort wieder einsteigen will laufen die Scribtevents (gescripteten Events) nicht weiter. Dies ist mir bislang an zwei nostalgischen (neuralgischen) Punkten passiert (Kurz nach dem Prolog und bei der Scarlet Mission im Schrottfeld). (Ich war) Insgesamt 2 der 5 Stunden damit beschäftig Zeit wieder aufzuholen oder nach dem Fehler zu suchen.

Positiv war jedoch die Forumbeteiligung der Entwickler. Diese boten immer sehr schnell Ihre Hilfe an und wollten zu dem Bug auch bestimte LOGs haben.

Ich für meinen Teil werde das Spiel erstmal auf Eis legen bis die Entwicklung und Fehlerbehebung abgeschlossen wurde. Sehr sehr schade. Ich hoffe und vertraue darauf, dass die Entwickler gas geben und ich nicht umsonst an dem Titel festhalte. Bis dahin erstmal eine negative Bewertung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196999725', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 9973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6504, 'last_played': 1620991309}
review:
于是更换了新的电脑后，我终于可以玩上这个封存许久的游戏了，由于我已经为2代写过很长的评测了，这作战争领主几乎完全继承了原有设定，就不再多做介绍，直接对比上一作进行评价。
优点：
    改善了太空中过暗的问题，宇宙的背景更绚丽多样了，星球登陆后有了3D的场景（尽管你并不能在这里行动），大部分的内容例如贴图、建模、世界设定都比之前精细的多。

    有了主线剧情，交易系统也变的不那么废柴了[spoiler]（尽管我倒卖一波高科技材料近一倍利润能拿30万，可还是抵不上抢一艘船然后卖出450万）[/spoiler]有了自己的派系势力，而且可以建造多种由AI控制的飞船来帮助自己作战，当然，指挥权是归玩家的。

    现在可以吞并势力而不只是友好相处，你大可组建一支无畏舰战队，然后碾压星球以外的一切控制点[spoiler]（你好啊我亲爱的朋友，你今天早上...吔shi了吗！我要跟你决裂！宣战！死吧虫子！！！哈哈哈哈哈！！！！！）[/spoiler]

    技能系统不再是 [b]充能一小时 使用一分钟 收益约为零[/b] 了，去掉了能耗设定，改成了技能CD，然而似乎是一不小心改的太强了，升满级后的技能让我甚至不需要使用任何武器，只管按1，然后敌人就在惨叫与爆炸中升天了，当然，只有咸鱼才会如此轻易的变成爆炸艺术，超大型船只一次只能造成3%左右的损伤，不过一个几秒CD的多目标技能有这如此高的伤害，似乎有些不合适。

    登船系统被重置了，现在可以进行多次登船，只需要等待约一分钟的使用间隔，就可以再次出动。陆战队员在登船中会消耗体能，体能会在空闲时随着时间回复，它与登船时的初始值相等，敌人的飞船被分为5个固定排序的房间和一个除了首位两端随机位置的医疗舱，每个房间消耗的值依次递增1，人数不低于进入下一个房间的要求就可以成功进入，成功突破全部房间后按剩余人数计算占领舰船的成功率。被占领的舰船既可以花费材料直接拖送至主基地投入使用（会有NPC用T驱动跳跃过来带走，不再需要非常麻烦的拖着跑几十万米，尤其是不用担心被友军饿虎扑食给炸掉了） 也可以付钱放入自己的船库或者直接出售，拓展了舰船研究模块后可以拿去增加研究点数以建造这种船。

暂时优点就想起这些，然后是缺点：
    武器系统还是老样子，只有轨道炮（机枪）、激光、等离子炮，大部分导弹CD似乎是变短了，但与武器的伤害比起来这次反而显得不是很强了（可能是因为武器的伤害在技能面前已经黯然失色了，不过也不排除是我没有使用最大伤害达到了999的等离子炮吧）

    玩家在技能加持下，可以4000+舰队威力独自单挑17000+的军备站，嗯，没错，是单挑，因为玩家自己的船威力评估就是4000+，外观甲壳虫一样的无畏舰舰护盾极厚，加上3级护盾强化研究，直接十三万盾左右，67%武器能源 33%护盾能源，打开自由开火，站在原地不动，剩下的就是选择目标放技能，然后就等待收割结束了，而其他舰船在交战中也存在类似的问题，护盾值过高，小船打不动你，护盾一直是100%，大船几秒就拿走了你10%，甚至直接一发EMP道具糊脸，然后你就发现盾红了，船在掉血，你只能狼狈的跑开，这时候护盾的回复速率问题就显现出来了，不能谨慎的打持久战，只能一来一回打消耗战，否则你完全没有资本与其战斗。

    关于舰队系统，嗯......做的还不错，然而......玩家在做主线的时候如果距离过远，可以直接免费传送到附近，可是玩家的舰队却不能，然后你就只能慢慢等待，或者就直接单干，我选择了后者。主线不能跟着玩家走，这也许不算大问题，但是，这些舰船完全没有其他移动方式，如果我想去攻打某个地点，我可以选择使用道具T驱动直接跳跃，但他们不能，我也不能给他们使用。最绝的是，明明游戏设计了虫洞传送门，我可以用它在任意传送门之间跳跃，而玩家舰船也还是不能......

    星球的贴图未见进步，反而清晰度和细节都变少了，尤其是那个双子星，2代中远远可以看见动态的星球表面，玩家飞船接近后还会有像金属加热一样的红色光泽，这一代我都撞上去了还没看见什么漂亮的动态细节，并且玩家飞船...变成了光......一开始还能看出是反光，随着距离减少亮度会逐渐增加，最后淹没飞船的轮廓，变成一个小太阳，在此期间会缓慢扣血，直到你离得够近，然后在爆炸声中Game Over读档继续

暂时缺点也就想起这些，也许以后会有补充吧，毕竟我还有俩DLC没玩，虽然我估计不会有太大差别就是了。



[h1]评测更新：由于2.0更新，并且之前的DLC还没玩，最近又回来接着打，刚完成了全地图占领，纠正一些问题并且补充一下一些目前影响个人游戏体验的问题。[/h1]

    玩家舰队可以使用急流门进行移动，但必须使用shift键选中目的地急流门加入行动队列，不能像玩家那样停靠在门附近然后直接选择目的地进行移动。并且就目前来看，玩家舰队也可以在跟随玩家的状态下，与玩家一起跃迁到主线任务附近，不确定是我疏忽了还是2.0的更新改动，因为我记得当时只有我自己到达了任务点。

    泰坦DLC中的泰斗系列船——剑圣，使得我之前提过的玩家过强更进一步，我甚至不需要给护盾分配能源，100%武器输出，就连攻占星球也只需要使用Q和E两个键就能轻松完成，进入攻击范围的主力舰以下级别活不过几秒，主力舰以上才会花点时间，大多数也就是送资源，而且无论哪个级别都拿玩家舰船没办法，现在大船几十秒可能都拿不走你10%，何况它们也活不到那么久。当然，由于剑圣的炮塔分布集中而且数量极多，相较于那艘甲壳虫，现在技能的伤害看起来不那么过分了，因为敌人都被你秒了

    各大势力贸易协议价格过高，极其不实用，如此高价钱获取到的资源量，却只是几个采集站的效果，部分交易甚至达到了千万级，购置舰船或是强化部件都比这点收益管用。

    DLC或是2.0更新后，各种资源的图标发生了变化，但在不同的地方却显示为不同的图标，比如交易站的资源和地图界面顶部的资源描述是不同的，平民任务也是一样，建议统一一下。

    玩家以急流门为行动目标使用shift键时，跃迁结束后的行动队列会被清空，而自动驾驶状态仍然保留。最近在急流门附近使用shift加入行动队列时发生了一次行动无效的情况，船就停在原地，而行动路线还在，手动选择急流门跃迁后行动队列未消失，跃迁后开始执行行动队列往我一开始选择的急流门起点出发。

    在2.0更新或是我启用了DLC后，舰队战的玩家方点数有时会显示错误，而且不会低于五万，对于我七万左右的舰队来说，这个值会变成十二万，但它不会影响战斗结果，船只损耗完后，据点仍然会被占领。

    游玩一段时间后，经常会出现部分音效消失的情况，似乎都是固定几种，比如战斗音乐失踪、武器射击音效失踪、技能音效失踪、选中音效部分失踪等等，重开游戏就会恢复，更改游戏音量设置不起作用，而且好像每次都是较长时间的游玩后才会发生。

    在刚写这个评测的时候我忘了提，星球/星站在登陆后游戏会在数十秒后逐渐变卡，离开也不会立即恢复，只能ESC暂停，然后等待片刻就会恢复，但离开后重新登陆，等待几秒再离开有可能会立即恢复。这个问题在2.0更新或是我启用了DLC后开始变本加厉，由于是同时进行的，所以无法判断是哪一个，在平时的游戏中有低概率在我攻击星站时发生，而几乎必然在[b]康科迪亚星站[/b]附近发生，短暂逗留都会开始严重卡顿，登陆星球/星站时，卡顿会来的更快，并且需要更长时间来恢复，调整画质也没有改善这个问题。个人判断卡顿是由于过度占用CPU导致的，我丢失的不是部分画面帧，而是游戏的运行开始卡顿，一旦开始登陆星球/星站，风扇会从几乎听不见噪音的低速状态逐渐变成明显的高速旋转，当然，这时候肯定要先看是不是硬件性能不达标了，I5-7300HQ+1050TI+8GR4+西数黑盘，我觉得问题显然不在我这里，在不发生卡顿的情况下我可以全高60帧。

    关于NVIDIA PhysX，这个游戏显示是它支持这个技术的，但奇怪的是无论我怎么设置，它都默认使用CPU，除非PhysX视觉指示器显示的状态是错误的，否则我不能理解它为什么不能使用GPU。

author: {'steamid': '76561198010909133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1495708538}
review:
This game has a lot of potential, but as far as I can see, it still didn't do away with the clunky ship controls, and the relatively unreadable fights.

I also found from my limited experience that the graphisms were not as pretty as those advertised in the screenshots visible on the store page.

Not saying that nobody should buy this game of course, but I couldn't recommend it to a friend.
developer_response:
I'm sorry that you feel that way, but it is certainly understandable. If you don't like it, why should you recommend to others...

We continue to work on the game and I hope that in time you'll give the game another shot. And please do post your thoughts on the various aspects of the game, as detailed as you see fit, on the forum. We're read through everything and look into what we can do.

Thanks again for posting!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010258913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 7114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4064, 'last_played': 1574589939}
review: I've been playing this game since early access. It is awesome. Build fleets, combat enemies that scale with you but also are more difficult dependant on the map. The enemy aggressively attack the space you take. The campaign story is interesting although I haven't completed it yet. The only annyoing thing is the lack of ability to zoom out to RTS levels but that is a minor point. This game is money well spent. The bugs are being ironed out actively.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982686528', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 4307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3798, 'last_played': 1510718945}
review:
A model game and team of developers, integrity and quality. 
[Update]
Gameplay is great, combat is centered around management with the ability to use auto-fire for your weapons, this leaves manuevering your ship into the best positions for skills, energy and shield management up to you. 
The missions consist of attack and defend objectives as well as some delivery and get to point A-B objectives. They have a little bit of variety within this, but can generally be simplified to those types of repeatable missions. 
You are in control of a faction so the game includes some light empire building elements, with a factions relations mechanic and some diplomacy options, 3 resources to gather and mine through buildings and direct player actions which are spent on researchable technologies and building ships for the players Fleets which he can manage and and command in real time on the map. You can attack and take over territory growing your faction.

The main story is ok, im guilty of not having cared for the story line the entire Starpoint series so I cant really comment to much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070166699', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1386, 'last_played': 1662360882}
review:
Had a little trouble with the launch build, but the devs are amazing, responsive, and really care about their work. 

Overall, as a game, it's what you'd expect, but with a little more. I'm enjoying my marauder build so far... stealthing up to the bounty target, boarding them, and running off with a prize. It provides a lot of cash and materials for growing the station and building up a fleet early on. Generally 2 to 3x the reward of the mission in many cases.

If you like space trading, bounty hunting, and ship grinding, you'll enjoy this.

Suggestions for devs :

The merger of genres work really well for about 80% of it, but has some growing pains on where the adventure and 4x elements converge. The main detracting issue is the logic used in the direction of the UI design. The way certain actions are nested can be confusing which makes the 4x elements a bit cumbersome. 

The other main issue is the camera and ship movement. The perspective of the follow camera is too steep and disorienting. While the POV camera really should be a view from the bridge. 

Planet landing pads and station interiors could use a texture rework and relight. Something isn't working or hooked up properly there.
developer_response:
Hello Wyyrd,


I'm sorry you're having this issues with game. We're working on fixing every issue players experienced in campaign story mode. Can you please send us log.txt with your save game file on this e-mail? Please take note log.txt deletes every time you relaunch game. If CTD happens again, send log.txt right away. 

customersupport@starpointgemini.com

author: {'steamid': '76561197967388234', 'num_games_owned': 642, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3630, 'last_played': 1530082025}
review:
If you have played Starpoint Gemini 2, this game will feel familiar.  If not, then I suppose I'd have to say it's like a mix between Freelancer and an X game.

You control one ship.  You can do this from a first- or third-person perspective.  It has RPG elements in that you level up and apply skill/perk points.  It has strategic elements in that you conquer and control territory, collect resources, build forces, etc.  The majority of the gameplay, though, is action-oriented, in that you control a single ship while flying through space, doing various things like fighting enemy ships, scanning anomolies, mining gas clouds, etc.

You control territory.  You control fleets.  There's a campaign.  There's freeroam.  There's the main quest, as well as side missions and random encounters.

The most important thing:  in my opinion, it's a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001643177', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1498842059}
review: Also das Spiel macht einfach kein Spaß.Es kommt einen vor als wenn man ein 15 Jahre altes mittelmäßiges Spiel spielt. Habe es daher nach 30min zurückgegeben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102082518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 12900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2393, 'playtime_at_review': 6776, 'last_played': 1712429979}
review:
Наконец многие дождались того момента, когда игра прекратит пребывать в состоянии раннего доступа и станет полноценным проектом.
Почитал многие отзывы насчет экономики, стратегии рпг, поэтому повторяться не буду. Скажу так, согласен процентов на 80 :)
Сравнивая с ранним доступом, игра, на самом деле, удалась очень даже.
1. Оптимизация. Помимо того, что люди пишут про поддержу двух GPU, от себя добавлю - оптимизация действительно на высоте и не нужен супер-пупер-гипер комп, чтобы играть на самых максимальных настройках графики (i7 3770, 8 Gb RAM, GeForce GTX770 это позволяют. иногда поддтормаживает, но очень редко и при прорисовке большого количества объектов).
2. Озвучка и саундтрек. Выше всяких похвал. Изменили немного голоса персонажей и бортового компьютера. Теперь все соответствует их внешности. Приятно:) Ненавязчивое и качественное музыкально сопровождение расслабляет.
3. Сюжет. По сюжетной линии судить не буду, далеко не ушел по ней. Но, в принципе, не ожидаю каких-то интрижек и неожиданных развязок (все равно в сюжетной части Freelancer никогда не переплюнут, не в обиду разработчиков).
Верю в то, что игра еще приобритет кое-какие элементы (все же нет предела совершенству) и привлечет к себе больше игроков. 
Ну и многие ждут руссификацию) Не вижу в отсутствии русской локализации ничего плохого, но, поскольку не все владеют английским языком, пожалуй, поддержу их мнение, что это минус игры (на данный момент). Ну а для других есть повод подтянуть и освежить свои знания английского.
Резюме. Любителям полетать, повоевать, позахватывать территории, громить кучу врагов и атаковать планеты без всяких замудреных функций, игра придется по душе.
P.S. Главное, чтобы при локализации сохранили английскую озвучку (практика показывает, что она всегда приятнее для ушей). Совет начинающим: выбирайте класс "мародер", и у вас сразу будет возможность маскировки корабля (если кто не в курсе, то теперь маскировка не дополнительный модуль на корабле, а непосредственно навык Вашего персонажа). Можно драпать в трудной ситуации. Всем удачных боев и приятного полета!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992263941', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1495641271}
review: Short playtime I know, but the camera is really awkward to deal with, in the regular mode the angle is off so the crosshair you see doesn't point towards the ship's heading, turret view while having a better view, is ruined by having it follow the ship's rotation and what not, so if you want to keep something centered, you have to keep adjusting the camera and in a game like this, I don't even remotely like that, I was hoping the camera would control like Freelancer or games like it.
developer_response:
Hi,

I'm very sorry you feel this way, we did the best we could to implement more camera modes to make it easier for players.

Have you tried playing the game in "Steering mode", default for turning it off/on is the Spacebar.

If you ever do need anything, you can always contact us at customersupport@starpointgemini.com.

Best regards

author: {'steamid': '76561197963020061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 3337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1338, 'last_played': 1691207283}
review:
This is certainly one of my favorite games on my steam list. I bought this after playing through SPG 1 and 2 so I knew what I'd be getting going in during the beta. Its been a long ride but the game has always been very playable in early stages. The developers are a great example of how alll companies should operate. Constant communication to their customers and patch updates. Questions to the dev team are always answered and they maintain presence in the forums.

The game is all I wanted it to be that others are not. A space RPG with some RTS elements and direct control of your starship. There is a campaign, scenarios, and free roam options. A large galaxy to explore and side missions. The game is mod friendly and has a workshop full. Being a Trekkie, this game reminds me a lot of the StarFleet Command series of games and if you wish, star trek ships, portraits, and music is already available in mods. There is also base and planet capture. The ability to board and capture ships with marines. There is mining and other facilities to build on stations. You can build fleets. The game is gender friendly so women out there are not stuck playing a male. 

 I will continue to follow this company for sequels. A huge thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005475526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1364, 'last_played': 1498489888}
review:
Will provide a full extensive review later, but I have been keeping an eye on this game for the past year and the final release build presents as an excellent product.  

I am enjoying the great balance of ship control, combat, RPG, and empire building elements that this game offers.  

For those who are looking for a fun and well built space sim universe, I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968768348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2411, 'last_played': 1496080840}
review:
Plenty of games out there in the Sci-fi realm today.

You've got your Homeworld 2 Remastered and Sins of a Solar Empire - recently updated (for the RTS Scifi)

You've got your Stellaris type 4x games, of which there are so many I can't even name.

Then you've got your rare (these days) fighter simulators.

Lastly, but not least, you've got your sim-oriented 4x style games along the lines of the X series. This is essentially the X series except it's not as hardcore (which in my opinion is a good thing) with much better management of your empire (those X games were for me, simply too many menus - though I understand the appeal). 

This is inbetween the sim-style campaign games (like Freespace) and the X series.

(I've yet to get into the big fights, so will comment on those at a future point)

author: {'steamid': '76561198018966098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1495622531}
review:
The camera controls are abysmal.

The camera is too close and trying to keep track of an enemy is next to impossible.

This basic thing makes the game frustrating to play as the rest of the game is quite fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060374012', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 8304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6641, 'last_played': 1645122856}
review: Plays very similar to the previous game but has many improvements and added features.  It's interesting to explore the world and lore the devs have created.  The devs are active on the forums and listen to their fans, they're quick to help or fix bugs when they're found, take feedback on improvements/additions, and seem to really care about creating a game that isn't just good looking but also fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048129526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1562365181}
review:
Great idea for a game, not well trhought out. The beginning tutorial is slow, repetative and boring. The camera and ship controls feel klunky and counter intuitive, as it seems half of the fights are you fighting more against your ship than actual AI. Voice acting is meh, along with the choices of dialog you have. 

   Overall: A half baked idea that sounds great, but isnt something i would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018843029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1495610497}
review:
Personally this gets a thumb down because it was not what I wanted to buy or play, however this thumbs down is highly subjective. It has many good points like decent RPG elements, pretty good space fighter simulator and I am sure if you play longer than me the space empire management elements will get larger and larger, but from what i understood was that it was a 4x space empire game where you could if you wanted to take over a single ship, however it is more along the line of controlling a single ship and sometimes have to do space empire management.

When I bought it i hoped for more of Stardrive, Master of Orion or heck even Stellaris.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032123859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4145, 'last_played': 1531816549}
review:
I really can't reccommend this to anyone
....unless they want a beautiful, immersive game with an amazingly responsive dev team behind it.  I loved SPG II so I bought into SPG Warlords in beta.  I made a comment on a thread once during development that one of my save games was glitched and they took the time to respond and had me send the files in.  It's one small example, but that's how this team is.  They stand behind what the produce.  I'll continue to play what they produce.  Very pleased.

I would like to see the game a little more "fleshed out".  The campaign feels a little stale and bland. 
 With no cut scenes it feels like there really is next to no character development.  To be fair though, I feel like the price point reflects that this not a $59 AAA title and it's really just a personal wish list for my preference.  I have bought all of the DLC so far and  I would still recommend this to anyone despite my personal "wish list".  I'll continue to put hours into the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021296788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1524376723}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018429652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1358, 'last_played': 1532131187}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997778509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 35582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6952, 'last_played': 1637534150}
review:
If you are a fan of the previous 2 Starpoint games, you should enjoy this one even more. If you aren't, what are you waiting for!!!

For this iteration, the campaign storyline thus far is fantastic - much moreso than the previous two games. The ships designs are amazing. Combat is...bigger (as are the ships! Seriously, the size difference between ships is one of the biggest changes in the game so far!) 

The "Risk"-like conquer-the-solar-system map is huge, and though sometimes feels a bit too easy to conquer, can become a bit challenging (and unfortunately a bit tedious sometimes) when the AI strikes back. I love that after conquering an area, it is absolutely possible to lose it again.

I recommend this strongly if you enjoy space flight games like freelancer or the X-series and such. This game is sort of a combination of those two specifically.  Be aware this is not a spaceflight-sim, so no physics (or not much - ships do have some small amount of momentum, but that's it).

author: {'steamid': '76561198052789053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1575041460}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001230727', 'num_games_owned': 486, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1967, 'last_played': 1528538584}
review:
Das Gameplay ist sehr flüssig und das Manövrieren und Kämpfen macht wirklich sehr viel Spaß, dazu muss ich anmerken, dass ich mit einem Controller spiele.

Zur Performance kann ich nur sagen, dass es bei mir mit, je nach Situation, 90-120 FPS läuft und das auf 2560x1440 mit allen Settings auf Max. Auf diesen Settings sieht das Spiel wirklich sehr gut aus und vermittelt eine schöne Atmosphäre.

Nun sei noch gesagt, dass es mein erster Teil dieser Reihe ist und ich somit sagen kann, dass es auch für einen "Noob" durch das kurze aber verständliche Tutorial sehr zugänglich ist.

Wenn man auf Space-Games steht und auch mit Sandbox Gameplay etwas anfangen kann, ist es sein Geld auf jeden Fall Wert! Und im Zweifel kann man es immer noch zwei Stunden testen und zurückgeben, aber ich denke, mal eben zwei Stunden wird in dem Spiel eher schwierig, wenn es einen erst einmal gepackt hat. ;)

Zu meinem System:
i5 6600 (non-K)
GTX 980Ti
16 GB RAM

author: {'steamid': '76561198001899379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 5003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1451, 'last_played': 1679674078}
review:
Jeu surprenant par sa profondeur, il mérite vraiment de s'y installer un bon moment.
Pour les combats qui peuvent surprendre, faire confiance aux tourelles en tir auto et surtout apprendre à maitriser la camera, notamment l'utilisation du lock sur la cible, et des touches de ciblage. Ce sont des combats de vaisseaux capitaux, pas de chasseurs à la xwing. Bien utiliser les touches du clavier pour jongler entre ciblage et gestion de camera est très important.

Par rapport au précédent (starpoint gemini2) qui offrait déja une  superbe balade spatiale, mais où on pouvait tourner en rond assez vite, les développeurs ont mis le paquet sur l'extension du gameplay : gestion et amélioration d'une base, construction de vaisseau, flotte et mercenaires personnels, prise de territoire, recherche, gestion de points de ressources, flotte civile, etc etc etc... assez incroyable tout ce qu'ils ont pu rajouter.
Certaines choses manquent encore de polissage ou de profondeur,  mais on peu avoir confiance dans ce studio qui n'a de cesse d'améliorer ses jeux.
Sinon gaphismes magnifiques. et  on peut enfin atterir sur les stations ou les planètes, anecdotique pur certains, mais grand pour l'immersion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020658064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5844, 'last_played': 1663012455}
review:
With many games on Market One has to wonder- but what about quality? Excitment and pure joy?!

Well With the Warlords you have a solid value.

Its similar to Xseries but a lot smaller and you dont have to spend weeks to get decent progress. Its a Blend of mix arts- Rpg- 4x elements- Strategy- Simulator- Lore- roleplay etc and so on.

Ive been with Lgm for years now and what strikes me the most- its the communication between the community! A golden rule some companies on the Market tend to forget! In fact Community driven feedback and ideas and Developer investment has led to this 3ed installment of Starpoint game!

Is it bug free? Of course not. Does it have glitches? Sure it does! So why would I or anyone would want to buy it?

Well- If you were a kid and your dream was to play a Space game to get that big Behemot of space ship with Big guns- this game wont disappoint you! You can re-live your childhood and fulfill your long dreaded dream!

And its a good feeling when dreams do come true!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972448853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2508, 'last_played': 1590298563}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991317269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2269, 'last_played': 1495641225}
review:
This is a grindy game that keeps you doing mindless but still entertaining things and gives you the warm feeling of acomplishment through constant progress. This Progress comes from player leveling, skills and perks, bigger ships, weapon and system upgrades, leveling companions, building a star empire and a fleet that actively supports you.
 
I started this review with the words grindy and mindless, let me elaborate. I needed a game that lets me do stuff while I are hear music, a audiobook, the news... and SpGW is really good for that. I play it that way and really enjoying it. And yes the first 15min of gameplay in the tutorial needs some attention, but thats over quick.

But if you look for a game that needs real concentration, has a deep and interesting Story (based on the EA, the full released game has a Story. I dont know yet if it is good or not) and let you forget the world around you, maybe you should give this one a pass.  

A good comparison may be Mount and Blade gameplay, if you like the concept of fighting battle after battle, doing generic Quest after generic Quest, just to get stronger after every one and at the end rule over everything, this game could be for you.

All of the things I said are based of the EA where the Story mode wasnt playable.
I will update this review after I dived a bit into the Story

author: {'steamid': '76561198007236904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 9783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2681, 'last_played': 1667711103}
