author: {'steamid': '76561198124639321', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1549252421}
review:
Bom, vamos lá, depois de uma boa jogada, tenho boas novas sobre esse magnífico jogo.

Primeiramente, vamos falar sobre o jogo! Star Gemini é um simulador de combate entre naves capitais (de grande porte). Mas o jogo não se delimita apenas à capitais, possui Fragatas, Destroyers, porem, ambas são naves de baixa manobrabilidade, isso faz com que o jogo seja retratado como um simulador de naves capitais, fora o fato de que no último tier, você receberá a possibilidade de utilizar naves significativamente grandes, tais como reais Capitals Ships e Dreadnoughts. Um dos defeitos nessa parte é o fato das naves não parecem TÃO grandes ao seu ponto de vista, claro que eles mexeram na manobrabilidade para você sentir o efeito da lentidão, fora que se você colocar uma Frigate ao lado de uma Capital, irá notar uma diferença, mas não uma diferença como em jogos da série X3.

O jogo tem sido retratado como um tal de "Mount & Blade do Espaço", mas não é bem assim. As mecânicas do jogo são significativamente diferente de "Mount & Blade". Um dos únicos fatos que se assemelha é a possibilidade de você recrutar membros (naves) para o seu Fleet, sendo possível escolher entre os tipos de nave (Frigates, Destroyers, Battleships, entre outras).
Essa habilidade de poder escolher, te permite criar um certo "balanceamento" dentro do jogo, entre fleets. Eu digo isso, pois, o jogo te permite além de andar/voar em um esquadrão com o seu Fleet, comandar o mesmo ou um outro Fleet como um Fleet Tático e Independente pelo mapa, sendo assim, você poderia dominar 2 territórios ao mesmo tempo, atacando um deles com o seu Fleet e enviando o outro para capturar o outro, ou até mesmo, criar um Fleet de Fire Support, Fleet de Long-Range e por aí vai.

Fora à questão de Fleets, ainda temos os Warmasters que são tipo "Heróis", digo, NPCs que usam habilidades, os caras são foda, sério, as naves deles são significativamente boas, eles trocam de naves com o decorrer do tempo (quando evoluem de level), eles upam junto com você e sério, os caras são tipo o Ebony Warrior do Skyrim. Se eu não me engano existem em torno de 4 ou 5 Warmasters que você pode ter como aliado, os inimigos também possuem Warmasters, então não vá achando que o combate vai ser uma beleza, que você vai acabar tomando altas porrada. Apesar de você achar um tanto apelão quando retratei ele como um Ebony Warrior, eles morrem, diferentes desse ****** do Ebony Warrior. E é claro, além de você utilizar eles no seu Fleet, pode dividir (split) eles entre outros Fleets para ajudar no combate, etc. E sem eles, o jogo teria menos graça, é dahora pra caramba ver um Warmaster engajar no combate, tu fica: OMFG!

Existem mods pra dar mais significancia ao título de Warmaster deles. (imagina só, OMFG!)

Fora todas essas significantes diferenças, temos a questão que nem todas as naves são iguais, apesar das classes de cada uma, temos também um grande fator que é a "desenvolvedora" dessas naves, existem naves que possuem a mesma classe, exemplo, uma Fragata! Porem, entre 2 naves, apenas uma dela poderá ter suporte para 4 turrets, enquanto à outra, terá apenas para 2. Isso varia de acordo com a "desenvolvedora", quando eu me refiro à "desenvolvedora", eu digo a Fabricante.

Você pode utilizar TODAS as naves do jogo, independente da fabricante, porem, aí entra outro conceito muito diferente do "Mount & Blade". Esse conceito é aquele famoso em jogos RTS, chamado de Recursos (Resources). O jogo possui 3 recursos e 1 moeda, eu não lembro ao certo o nome dos recursos, mas você poderá capturar Estações de Mineração, Estações de Pesquisa e por aí vai. O dinheiro dentro do jogo é o mais fácil de ser adquirido, os recursos demoram um pouco, esse seria um dos problemas do jogo, pois é necessário um certo "grinding" por parte do jogador, isso torna o jogo massante, dá uma sensação de um progresso extremamente lento, porem! Pensando nisso, a desenvolvedora permitiu o uso da Oficina da Steam (SteamWorkshop) no jogo, sendo assim, existem mods que deixam o jogo mais dinâmico e acreditem, realmente funciona.

Voltando à questão dos recursos, você irá poder construir estações e todas elas irão possuir suas funções, irão permitir que você adquira melhorias para elas e até mesmo liberar novas funções e mecânicas dentro do jogo. Resumindo, no começo, você estará bem limitado, mas à medida que for desbloqueando, você notará uma vastidão de mecânicas, logo, possibilidades.

Ainda temos questões como o famoso "Boarding" que permite que você capture naves. O jogo também possui um sistema de Skills, trazendo um pouco do gênero RPG e também um sistema de Perks que dão buffs à habilidades, como por exemplo, aumentar a proficiência do "Boarding".

O jogo possui tanto uma campanha, como um modo Free que te permite começar em níveis diferentes, quando me refiro à níveis, digo níveis mesmo, do seu personagem, com naves diferentes, uma quantia de territórios diferentes. Porem, até então, você só tem um ponto de início, não mais que isso. Os desenvolvedores já deixaram claro que no futuro iremos receber mais pontos de partidas, em outras nações.

O aúdio do jogo (VoiceAct) não está perfeito, na verdade, ainda está um pouco longe do oque eu imaginava, mas ainda assim, está aceitável, diferente dos antigos SG, como o SG2 que possuia um VoiceAct horrível e tenebroso. Você acaba imergindo no jogo e durante uma missão, simplesmente sua imersão acabava devido ao horrível VoiceAct, as pessoas que dublavam os personagens não mostravam nenhum sentimento, um exemplo é no início do seu jogo em SG2 (Star Gemini 2), aonde seu Pai morre e você simplesmente reage de maneira estranha, sem emoção alguma. Fora que algumas emoções e até mesmo falas eram forçadas.

Quando um NPC interage com você, aparece a foto do lado, agora, imagina um cara que parece curtir Metallica aos auge dos 60 anos de idade, com a voz de um garoto de 19 anos com cirrose, pois é, não adianta tentar imitar um Adulto, não dá cara, quebra a imersão e chega à ser cômico.

Eu ainda noto a falta de emoção em algumas partes, raras, mas ainda notável. Fora que às vezes, a voz da pessoa que está dublando, não bate com a imagem do personagem (Character Portrait). Um exemplo é um Capitão de 50 anos de uma Capital foda pra caralho, com voz de um cara de uns 28 anos. Sei lá, é bizarro.

Fora isso, o jogo é bom, não podemos comprometer um jogo com tantas mecânicas por um detalhe como esse, fora que os DEVs se mostraram dispostos a tentar arrumar esse VoiceAct horrível e realmente o fizeram de SG2 para SGW. Posso dizer que está significavamente melhor, é claro que não podemos aguardar uma dublagem ao nível da Blizzard em "Wrath of Lich King" mas ainda assim, está bom, não perfeito, bom. Os efeitos estão com a mesma qualidade, não perfeitos, bons.

A HUD aparenta ser um pouco confusa, mas existem mods (bendita Oficina) que permitem corrigir isso. Fora isso, ainda temos alguns outros contras que são TAMBÉM corrigir pela Oficina de mods, como o balanceamento de dano entre naves, etc.

Por fim, gostaria de expressar meu contentamento quanto à comunidade que é administrada pela LGM (desenvolvedora da série SG). Sério cara, esse jogo tem uma das melhores comunidades que já vi, todo mundo é parceiro, sempre prontos à sanar duvidas, os DEVs escutam os players, todo mundo interage de maneira saudável, não existem haters ou uma galera tóxica. Eu fiz a Pre-Order pela Comunidade e pelo excelente desempenho dos Desenvolvedores em ouvir e administrar a Comunidade e acabei me impressionando com o resultado que eles tiveram no desenvolvimento, são melhorias gritantes quanto à SG1, SG2.

Em sí, seria isso, o jogo está agradável. Recomendo à compra.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023405614', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1488731747}
review: Pops out of full screen mode randomly, doesn't save settings or saves some settings and not all, buggy, crap interface, horrible voice acting, etc., I'm honestly getting really frustrated with Valve for letting games of this quality to proliferate throughout Steam.  Alpha games, beta games and games in "Early Release" for 2+ years? Come on. Do some QA on these games.
developer_response:
Hi and thanks for posting your review.
[list]
[*]The "popping out of full screen" usually happens if another program takes focus, like Teamviewer or similar. We'd love to get your game log.txt if you could send it over please.
[*]Config settings don't get saved - we'd love to hear which ones too. It would help us greatly.
[*]And I'm not sure what the 2+ years in EA relates to. We've entered EA on April 14th 2016.
[/list]
All in all, you clearly don't like the game and I'm sorry about that. Once the game is finished, I hope you'll give the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021755787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1541636064}
review: I joined early and have yet to have the program run smoothly.  It seems that they have higher requirements than their previous program and than they had stated earlier.   I can not run the program at all.  You might need to have a new high memory video card to have a chance.
developer_response: Hi. The system requirements are indeed higher than they were on Starpoint 2, but the minimum requirements listed on the store page didn't change since we entered Early Access. One thing we did implement is for the game launcher to display a warning if your computer doesn't meet the current specs. That doesn't mean you cannot start the game though. If you could, please send your game log.txt and generated DX diag report file to customersupport@starpointgemini.com with a short description of the issue for easier identification.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104394986', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 10616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2912, 'last_played': 1704084988}
review: SPG warlords is a fantastic game i have had many hours of enjoyment out of it, the combat for me had been the highlight of the game i played SPG 2 and played it for hours just trying to get used to the combat system but thanks to that i was able to get on SPG warlords and know the partly on what to do. the other fun thing about it is the fleet building your own fleets and sending them into combat has been the most exciting thing i have done in a space combat game. but it has a down side to it the conquest update that came out was a bit of a downer for me i started a war with another faction thinking that i should do ok considering i have a fleet that is 30k strong due to having 5 dreadnaughts with all of them MK2 and a heap of MK2 cruisers also having a battleship myself to add to the fire power of the fleet.  i went into a fleet battle and i was completely oblitorated my fleet was completely destroyed by the enemy fleet which was only 17k strong but other than that SPG warlords is a smooth game with a lot of great things going for it. And to end my rant i am going to say keep up the awesome work devs yes there are a few little downs here and there but keep doing what your doing and i beleive that SPG warlords will become on of the greatest space games created (in my opinion)

author: {'steamid': '76561197976900544', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 31229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26517, 'last_played': 1593389795}
review:
Starpoint Gemini Warlords updated review Current 23rd Nov 2017 - Latest DLC -Cycle of Warfare.

LGM are a small 15 – 20 staff development team, been making the SPG series now for quite some years, and Warlords is the third incarnation of the series. Warlords is a culmination of developer and community coming together with ideas to make what Warlords is currently. (I thank our community for being such a decent group of players with feedback, good bad and ugly in professional manor).

SPG Warlords is a capital ship combat and trade game with some side elements of a 4X game, in resource management to create fleets, build ore mining stations, gas mining stations, junk reclaimers and research further equipment, upgrades for your fleet and mines, and upgrades to your Head Quarters to improve all facets of your game play.

Beginning the game, you are giving a tutorial introduction giving you a run down on the basis fundamentals to get you going. (Controlling your ship takes a little practice, but once learnt is second nature). I recommend to all players to learn to use Turret View (V Key selects) as their main view point as it gives you a 360 degree view around your ship (Num Pad -/+ to zoom in and out) for travel and combat its very handy to be aware of your surroundings.

Once you have completed the tutorial, your free to go about your life in Gemini Space (Follow the campaign or freelance it). Be it a law abiding Captain, or a Mercenary who cares for no one but themselves, or a pure out and out Pirate and cares only for the loot from every ship you encounter. Getting your income generation is priority one, getting some missions done, sending your civilian fleets out to scavenge areas for materials to help along with your mines to get your fleets/HQ upgrades/Researching under way.

Once your income is starting to stabilise, you can begin taking over enemy territory to make it yours, this will increase your overall income of credits and materials, along with opening up more areas for Ore and Gas mines, and Junk reclaimers. Which in turn makes your ability to create fleets, upgrades, or do more research easier and faster. 

Conquest can be handled by you and your fleets can back you up in the battle for the region or you can send your fleets to regions and let them handle it themselves, LGM has implemented an "Auto Resolve" routine if you don't assist in the conquest of those regions. 

Trading and mining, You can turn a good profit from hauling certain items from one station to another, going out and mining and sell the wares at stations for profit (you can use the best sell/buy options for stations you have been to, to maximise profits if you so please – I am lazy and will sell at the closest station and head back out when mining). You can also hail Mining/gas/Reclaimer outposts and or other AI ships to communicate and sell wares as well.

Mission board (Jobs Board), has quite a few variations of missions, from Delivery, Timed Delivery, Search and Destroy, Station Destruction, Station Protection, Convoy destruction, Convoy Protection, Survey, Maintenance, Prospector and Salvage missions. These all pay according to your Rank, and as your Rank increases so does the payments and difficulty, These pay quite well and can get your quite a lot of credits quickly.

Skill and Perks system gives you the opportunity to customise your Captain and their abilities to quite a degree. Abilities covers your combat abilities and apply points on what skills your prefer to use. Perks allow you to tailor your skills in Ship Command, Weapons, Governing your regions, Personal (Covers dialogue options when communicating with AI ships), Engineering and Warfare.

Ship building and Station Construction is simple and functional to use. Select what you want to build confirm you have the resources and set its build queue. Ships are built and added to your combat fleets, Station upgrades are applied to your HQ and give bonuses to many things for your region, increased Fleet sizes, increase number of civilian fleets, etc.

Most stations and planets have a ship yard to purchase new ships as you acquire the rank to command them. These can be added to your Hanger (dependant on HQ upgrade on how many you can store). Currently most ships are available at your HQ for Early Access testing, this will change. 

Your able to pirate AI ships, board and take them over for your own use, want that upgrade but don't want to pay for it, go pirate it! (Hanger space permitting at HQ).

Star Chart is very functional and simple right click on the map to send your ship on its way to the destination you have chosen. AI combat fleets work the same way on the Star Chart. Civilian Fleets are directed on the Star Chart directly to their missions.


Travelling around in Warlords is simple, your ship has standard flight speed, and Sub-light Speed (a lot faster means of travelling, but weapons are disabled in this flight mode). On top of this you can use T-Drive equipment bought from stations in Dry Dock, these allow you to jump long distances very quickly if you require to do so, also handy for a "get me out of here" use.

Planetary Conquest is a lot of fun indeed. Get building your Hanger bay in your HQ and once at maximum tier you unlock the option to build the Proxima Hanger. From there, once you research all the extra components, Proxima is unleashed and available for planetary conquest...... "Long live the Emperor" you shall chant as you bring planets and regions to it's knee's, where you will benefit from increase resource income to fund your continued conquest and defence of your regions.

Does Warlords have everything we want in a Space game? No it doesn’t but then again I don’t think any Developer can make the perfect game in any genre. I still today send in emails to LGM about ideas and changes I would like to see, some have/may see the light into the game and others may not due to not suited to the game over all or game engine limitation. 

But the prime example of a great Dev Team that cares about their game and community is the way LGM take every piece of feedback on-board, good, bad and ugly and they process it and do what they can to make the game for the community. I wonder at times if they actually sleep, cause if they are not adding content, fixing bugs, etc the team is replying to posts on the forums in quick order.

Warlords has 3 DLC's out now which adds a ton more content to the game, Newest is Cycle of Warfare,  new game starts (Alien and Pirate starts are my favourite, but there is also new original faction starts as well to give a new look on the galaxy). Titans are now in game in the Titan's DLC which give the opportunity to gain Titan sizes ships and bring the pain to your enemies. Bounties were added in an update and additional bounties and content in the Deadly Dozen DLC. All these DLC are well priced and add in a lot of additional play time to your current or new game starts.

If Space gaming is a Genre you like, I can highly recommend SPG Warlords (and previous titles in the series) as something you will enjoy playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045030280', 'num_games_owned': 1330, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2437, 'last_played': 1487707987}
review:
[h1]Screenshot Simulator 2017 [/h1]
With:
[list]
[*]Space (Very BEAUTIFUL and BIG Space)

[*]Space Skills (Helps against Enemies)
[*]Space Asteroid fields (Mine for stuff to sell)
[*]Space Traders (Trade for profit)
[*]Space Wormholes (Jump to random wormhole and find yourself in random galaxy location or construct T-Gates and jump to other constructed T-Gates)
[*]And other cool Space things I forgot...
[/list]

[b]10/10 Would screenshot again![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198024853985', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 12557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4414, 'last_played': 1520017672}
review:
Well I guess I should finally write something for a review.

This game, while it does have its quirks and issues, is still a great game. The quirks and issues are partly due to it being an actively updated game to add content and fix bugs as they are found. The dev team is constantly in the forums responding to questions and taking stock of bug reports. Very friendly crew they have out there.

For me, the idea of flying through space and exploring regions not of my own, is always fun for me. I like to get into trouble with various sects and there are plenty of them, all with their various diplomatic status. 

There is a multitude of ships and weapons for customizing said ships. Can even take time and pain your ship with decals or paint schemes.

Plenty of things to do in this game and I am always looking forward to the next patch to see what is added, or fixed. Definately worth the money to me to buy this game.
developer_response:
Many thanks for posting the review general. We plan for the next update to include assaulting stations and hoping even planets. Also, boarding is on the agenda finally. It will take some time, but we'll keep everyone informed on our plan and progress.

Thanks again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116681596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 9342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5479, 'last_played': 1570088276}
review: This game is unique in that it's a sort of hybrid sim/strategy space game.  You build fleets and move them around a map to take territories, but you also have your own ship and you can get in on that fleet action yourself.  Send others to mine asteroids with the map strategy style or get in your ship and go mine them yourself (or both).  Not sure if your fleet will survive a battle?  Well get in your ship and go help them!  Not sure if you will survive the huge mistake you just made?  Well call your fleet in to help you!  This unique combination of guy-in-ship-blasting-stuff and guy-in-ivory-tower-telling-minions-what-to-do makes for some awesome gameplay.  The artists at LGM do a fantastic job of creating a solar system full of unique places that each have their own unique visual identity.  The guys at LGM do truly understand what Early Access is supposed to be and they work WITH the community and are constantly implementing changes suggested by us the players.  If you like space games with intense battles buy this game.

developer_response:
Hi Berzerker Jay,
I'm confused a bit. What do you mean with "the developer ramps up the system requirements"? We didn't do that. The game does gradually get more hardware consuming as it's getting content and it will go through optimization before final release. The specs noted on the store page should cover the current version in any case. If this is not the case, please do let us know. You can contact us directly on customersupport@starpointgemini.com . If you do please send us your game log.txt (installation folder) and your generated DirectX Diag report file.

I apologize for any miscommunication on our part, but we really didn't change the noted requirements other than the required disk space.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148403163', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1485536693}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047249631', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 11337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8530, 'last_played': 1650165052}
review:
I really don't know why people do not recommend this game.
It has good graphics a lot of content (for an early access game), a great design, friendly devs who respond to your questions/suggestions real fast and it has steam workshop with an active community.
Also the strategic aspect is implemented well into the fluent gameplay.

This is my favourite Early Access titles and one of my favourite games even in its current state of developement.

The only aspect you could rate it bad is the voice acting and the story, which will be improved/added later on.
And of course if you don't like spaceships, trading, exploring, freelancing (does this word even exist?) and epic space battles.

Big commendation to the devs for working together with the community so closely! This is what Early Access is about!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087933619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 4564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1603, 'last_played': 1497083948}
review:
Release review:
Congratulations! You guys seem to have fixed all my previous issues, I'm really enjoying the new experience. Looking forward to play your game!

[strike]
EA review:
I know this is EA, but i had high hopes you guys address the following issues reported earlier:
- poor looking starfield! yes, this is important part of a space game
- unconsistent UI designed to slow down your work
- horrible font choice. in addition the font size changes for each UI element. confusing to look at!
- radial menu still hides the action screen! seriously... is it that hard to use alpha?

Various performance issues in general when flying by huge objects. I mean why? How come in X:Rebirth those station complexes do not lag my gameplay?

I know my review sounds negative. Well, you need feedback to make your game better!
[/strike]
developer_response:
Hi Assailer and thanks for posting your review!
I'll go over the noted issues from your review if you don't mind.
- by starfield I believe you're referring to the skyboxes? I'm honestly not sure what more we can do other than upping the skybox textures to double resolution, but that will severely impact the required graphics RAM
- UI will receive further changes before the game is done
- is the problem with the font its size or the font in general?
- radial menu background and game pause are both things we said we'd take care of as an option for player to choose whether or not to use and we will. we simply had more pressing matters
- performance issues - we've done a first part of the optimization in this latest update by compressing all the models (this should have made loading times shorter). another step that will be done is compressing scripts which will reduce the "stutter" when something is going on (usually objects spawning). And finally, general optimization to increase performance. This last step can only come later, once everything or almost everything is finalized. Only then can we run detailed performance tests to see where the problems occur the most.

Thanks for the review once again. We do like and need the feedback :).

review:
Leider muss man einfach mal sagen, dass Warlords sicherlich ein gutes Spiel ist- aber (wie ich ) nur wenig Erfahrung in diesem Gerne habt (Elite:Dangerous und das wars dann schon), wird man in ein kompliziertes, von Gameplay und Grafik her erstmal wenig beeindruckendes Spiel geworfen. author: {'steamid': '76561198013558894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 11080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9316, 'last_played': 1518053485}
review:
This game is incredibly grind heavy. You're going to be spending most of your time just grinding out levels to get access to better ships because this uses a generic leveling system and locks ships like carriers and battleships behind level walls.

Combine that with the fact that as you level up, so do the enemies, and not only are you forced to grind levels for larger ships but you are forced to upgrade from smaller ships lest you get blown out of the water the instant you fight, say, a battleship with your frigate.

Edit: This review is on the current state of the game and will be updated as updates come out and my time allows.

Edit for Version 0.750: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=854557573

Yeah cool... I'm glad leveling goes at a better rate, i'm happy at the fact you can travel with your fleet. It's moronic that you can know the strength of an enemy fleet but not the composition of it until you engage. Lost my fleet of 1800+ fleet strength to one of 1400 because a single large ship that just doesn't take damage from anything that isn't a large ship class.

Edit: Now you can see enemy fleet composition 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=856676323

Unfortunetly, now i know that there are just certain enemy fleets that i just engage with my fleet for fear of losing some of my dreadnoughts even if i still have a higher fleet strength. I had consolidated my forces (1x Carrier, 4x Dreadnoughts, 8x Cruisers. All MKII) into a single fleet and accompanied them into battle against the shown, on the battle i accompanied them i lost 2(!!!) dreadnoughts and 5(!) cruisers. That was about 45k materials lost to fight a fleet that was supposedly 33% weaker than mine. 

On the occasion i sent them by themselves without me to join them, i lost 2 cruisers, which is about 10k materials. But besides that, i really wish that you could make it so that ships in a fleet can have the ability to withdraw to the closest friendly repair facility that isn't in the same region.

Another negative is that some of the research resource requirements are just really out there and are lack-laster for what you get. I spent 200k gas for the project to max out gas income, and maybe if i had more collectors it'd be more worthwhile, but as it is, it's rather meh.

Granted, i am having fun just cruising around in my dreadnought. The negative though is you level faster than your income. I luckily saved up enough from before this update when passive income from regions and stuff was bananas to be able to afford the ship and some basic equipment for it :P

Edit: New update added planetary assault and a new massive ship for you to build. BUT! it's only used to assault planets. Can't use that massive ship to backup your fleets and lower your losses, nope, game has to keep you losing you ships whenever you fight so you need to sink time into the game to build up resources. 

I mean, i guess it's a good thing the ship is pretty negligible when it comes to resource drain, otrherwise it'd be a complete waste. I'm not sure about the devs thought process behind this ship, but the whole fact that it's a massive weapons platform that just sits around for the majority of the time while your fleets take losses just does not sit well for me. 

But what do i know, i mean, i send capital ships with my fleets to prevent losses, i move on from gunships to prevent losses. I guess i've been doing fleet battles wrong this entire time, clearly i should just throw rocks at the enemy instead because actually using something that gives me an advantage isn't advised.

Edit 1/31/2018: Radiation is still a horrid mechanic. For some unknown reason it bypasses your shielding and does physical damage to your ships hull. You're forced into taking a perk if you want to really deal with it. Oh, and while you're affected by radiation, the AI ships are not.

Speaking of forced perks, if you want to board other ships in this game, you can! But as with dealing with radiation, you're forced into taking the related perks. There's about 10 perks for boarding that you need to invest points into. You get perk points every two levels.

Edit 2/1/2018: Forgot to mention this yesterday, but the UI is vastly improved compared to before.

Boarding btw, is a good source of income for the more combat oriented, which is also an improvement of the last time I played. Granted certain ships need to be worth more considering the pain of getting them. A carrier will net you 10 million if you sell it, but is a challenge to actually capture. Freightliners on the other hand, are much easier and get you 4.5m if you sell those. With my current boarding strength, no matter the layout of the boarding (RNG based layouts, joy oh joy) I will always capture a freightliner. Carriers though, that all depends on room layout, if the medbay is right after the cargo bay, i'll probably have 6-8% chance of capturing the ship, medbay before weapons however nets me a 40% chance or so. 

I've been playing a Carrier this time around, it's strength is the range of it's fighters, being able to engage targets 10km away or so. But the biggest negative isn't any of it's stats or armaments, but the fact that none of the classes you can choose really work well with the fact that it is capable of long range warfare. With weapon enhancements, my turrets are outranging some of my abilities. 

I'm now in the process of getting the only titan in the game you can pilot without buying the DLC. It costs 20mil and some resources to unlock the ability to buy, and then 110mil to actually purchase the ship. It's focus is on empire management it says and that it's not fit to fight. And at the same time, I'm also constructing the Proxima, a heavily resource intense planetary siege weapon that is unpilotable by the player last I knew. Unlikely I will be getting the DLC for this game so I won't be able to offer any insight into the other titans.
developer_response:
Hi.

We're aware of the unbalanced state in the current game version. If you can't beat a battleship with a frigate, that's clearly a problem and not something we "envisioned". I want players to be able to do that. Even using a corvette or even with a gunship with a heavy use of skills and equipment. That is the end goal, but we're not there yet.

The leveling system you noted is also something that will be changed precisely so it doesn't happen that a level 40 gunship is a much greater danger than a level 10 carrier (apologies for the silly example)

Thank you for posting the review and for pointing out the things that trouble you in the game. I appreciate it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079920657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1665074343}
review:
Das Spiel ist akt. noch im EA Status, deshalb bin ich vorsichtig auch im Vergleich zu SPG2.

Unter Strich finde ich SPG2 jedoch besser. Das mit dem Handling wie man hier im EA Basen bauen
oder erobern kann ist mir doch etwas "zu viel" des Guten.

Das wohl größte was am fehlen ist, ist eindeutig der Multiplayer und deutsche Sprachunterstützung.
Da der Multiplayer aber nicht kommt, sollte man das Spiel wenigstens in mehreren Sprachen aufsetzen.
Ich weis es ist kein Freelancer, doch selbst bei so einem alten Spiel wie FL sind gewisse Basic-Inhalte
besser gestaltet als bei SPGW. 

Den geplanten Multiplayer als MMO Titel rauszubringen halte ich für einen absoluten Fehler.
Es würde die gesamte Serie von Starpoint Gemini in den Dreck ziehen.

Positiv:
-Zich Galaxien und Sektoren die es zu erforschen gibt
-voller FP Support
-schickes Gameplay
-gute Story

Negativ:
-kein Multiplayer
-kein Sprachsupport
-zu wenig Ausrüstung/Schiffe
-zu viel "Basen erobern"

review:
This review is NOT a review on the game directly:
In January 2017 I wrote a negative review regarding the lack of content of the game at that point. Hereby I delete it and give you the reason for it. 
Since the dev's are working on the game and released a major update 2 weeks later I will post this as a positive review although I could not test the game yet again since then due to personal reasons. 
However the fact that the devs responded to this review individually shows that they take customer support very seriously! Also they released their update shortly afterwards (I take this as coincidence though) (1.2 GB, if you want to know the content, check dev post below)

THUMBS UP!!!

--- update as of december 2017: 
checked back and now it's what it was meant to become. bugs fixed, diverse and interesting content, playthrough took me roughly 30 hours (DLCs not included), but i didn't rush it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048339452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1677, 'last_played': 1498240073}
review:
Das Spiel mag nicht nur die Mutti!

Man kann im Strategie Bereich viel entscheiden, die Story macht Spaß...

+ Eigene Basis mit Forschung, Ausbau, Flottenmanagement
+ Eroberbare Gebiete
+ Mods sind einfach zu nutzen
+ Skillen des Charakters
+ Tuning/upgrades vieler schöner Raumschiffe
+ intuitive Steuerung

- Der Bereich Handel könnte spannender sein
- Interaktionen mit der Crew an Bord wären schön
- leider etwas unübersichtlich wer so alles um einen schwirrt

Daumen hoch!

author: {'steamid': '76561198174249937', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1506082631}
review:
现阶段不推荐入手，创意工坊内容还不够丰富。特别的游戏闪退较严重，虽然有自动存档但只能在停靠空间站之后存。在外面浪了许久本想回去保存突然游戏一个闪退，辛辛苦苦弄的进度全都没了是相当抓狂的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198006536056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1480696015}
review:
It's all been done before. Only better.

This should have been a mod for X3. Everthing in this game apart from story and the flexability of the universe (I'm assuming) is sub par. I've  seen better game mechanics, graphics, and interfaces in free online games. 

Camera control is terrible, combat frustrating, and the Voice overs 3rd rate. 

Don't buy this game unless you have the patience of a Saint. It's virtually unplayable in it's current form. Fingers crossed improvements will come soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033191021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1536735725}
review:
short version: 
I normally wouldn't go for ea titles but having played starpoint gemini 2 and felt satisfied with it, on top of seeing the friendly dev-team and community, i thought i should go for it.

so far only played the tutorial-esque prologue of the game and, keeping in mind the fact that this is only ea, the game so far felt nice. whatever the current state, the game is very promising and there's a huge potential in it to be a good one.

long version:
i'm writing this review right after finishing the prologue. i'll be missing a lot of aspect of the game in it but i plan to put in a few more hours to remedy that later. if i can do it, i'll update my comments accordingly. but so far, at a first glance:

-I generally liked the visual aspect of the game, it has a nice vivid presence. haven't traveled beyond the confines of the prologue so can't really comment much on the environment, but so far had a nice feeling of emptiness, reminding that i was in the great void. 

-the gameplay (flight and space combat-wise), for those who are familiar with it, is quite similar to SPG2, have to mention the the new context menu, i especially liked it. some might find that it interrupts ongoing action but in the chaos of the space combat i found it a welcome break. for the newcomers of this title I'd say be prepared to give the gameplay a little time to get a firm grasp. you can easily get disoriented, but you'll get used to it quickly.

-dialogues don't really shine but I don't have much grief with it, as it may get richer as the game develops. the voice acting however feels a little lacking. as a lay person to game development, commenting more on this feels like a disrespect for the dev-teams' hard work, so i'll leave it here. (p.s.: not talking about the amount of voiced dialogue, for a gamer at my age -who knows how things were before KOTOR :P - that's never a problem.)

-I'll comment more on the strategy aspect of the gameplay (base and fleet building etc) after playing around it a little more but at first glance I have a small remark: chances are i might have missed an already-dealt-with topic in forum dicussions, with that in mind, the instant construction feels a little lackluster. it feels like everything is already there but people in the station is holding out on me until I pay them. so it's more on the side of unlocking than actually building something.

anyhow, that's enough for now, all in all can't wait to play the complete version of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136461489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1591561198}
review:
Edit 12/27

After looking into the forums, the developer is more hands-on than I realized. I still wish there were more frequent, downloaded updates. It is great that the developers communicate with the fanbase, but physical updates demonstrate real progress. I will also mention that the game is not optimized at all. I understand this is EA, but I barely achieved 25 FPS on my gaming rig (which has a GTX 980M) on medium settings. I was able to acheive 60 FPS when the game first released (I purchased within 2 days of being in EA).

I hope optimization of the game continues.

However, I will update my recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076302278', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 6080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4845, 'last_played': 1551381406}
review:
[h1][b]Acknowledgement.[/b][/h1]

[b]Little Green Men aka LGM, an Indie studio comprised of 11 hardworking individuals has created an underrated chef d'oeuvre with their latest and most ambitious iteration to the Starpoint Gemini series; Warlords.[/b] While it can be daunting for newcomers of the series due to the complexity of its controls and rather steep learning curve, it is a very rewarding experience and addicting game that you can easily sink lots of hours into.

Aside from the game, the developers themselves are truly marvelous not only for the quality works they create for us to indulge in but their top-notch love and commitment to their fans. They are actively engaged with the community, always listening to player feedback and answering any questions they may have. LGM is exemplary in all facets of the video game industry and treat their fans even better still, something that is rare these days and is deserving of our support. With all this said, let me begin my review though I will note here that I may be slightly biased.

[h1][b]Suggestions for New Players.[/b][/h1]

[i]This game is not an action game or a space combat game like that of Eve or Elite Dangerous. If you go into Warlords expecting heavy dog fighting, you’ll be disappointed.[/i] The ships in this game are similar to that you’d see in Star Trek, massive freighter/carrier type vessels that house massive amounts of cargo, people, armaments and wings (fighter ships you can deploy to help you in battle). This game requires grand strategy, resource management, fleet and base construction and the expansion of both economic income and player territories. The beginning and mid stages of the game can feel drawn out but this game really shines in its late gameplay, something a lot of other games struggle with.

There is a lot for new players to take in when they first start their journey in the Starpoint Gemini’s expansive universe which can be frustrating and at times quite overwhelming. I recommend they take it slow, take the time to learn the complex controls from flight, camera control and combat. Watching all available tutorials will help players get a grasp on game play mechanics and overall functionality while referring to the Starpoint Gemini Wiki for background information on factions, ships and the overall universe will greatly improve the quality of gameplay and ensure a fun, rewarding experience.  

[b]Useful Links to Bookmark and Use for Warlords[/b]

[h1]Starpoint Gemini Wiki can be found [url=https://starpointgemini.gamepedia.com/SPG_Warlords]here.[/url]
Starpoint Gemini Warlord Video Tuitorials can be found [url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLCOQm55o2-yEVvaq8YMvNRmQRJm3sq9eR]here.[/url]
Starpoint Gemini Warlords Guide for New Players can be found [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/419480]here.[/url][/h1]

[h1][b]PROS.[/b][/h1]

[list]

[*]Massive, beautiful handcrafted game world. 
[*]In-game music. The scoring for this game is real treat. 
[*]Complex controls to learn, customize and master to cater to any playstyle. 
[*]Replay value! 
[*]Lots of lore to sink your teeth in. 
[*]There are over 60 unique factions to encounter and learn about, that respond differently depending on the players reputation with them.
[*]Large diversity of mission types to complete.
[*]Combat! While this is by no means a dog fighting space game, the combat is still very fun and satisfying, requiring mastery and strategy to come out victorious!
[*]A polished campaign that offers a gripping story with memorable characters, along with fully voiced cut scenes and a lot of missions for players to complete.
[*]Lots of customization options.
[*]Ships! Over 80 playable ships to purchase, build and capture. The ship models are incredibly detailed and are a delight to look at. 
[*]Ship building to create your own personalized fleet to follow you into battle or be sent off to patrol or capture an area. 
[*]Heavy influences from 4x game play. 
[*]Freedom of how the game can be played.
[*]Created by, in my opinion, by the best Indie studio in the business. 
[*]Ability to create and use mods!
[*]Graphics. Amazing maxed out.
[*]And much more!

[/list]

[h1][b]CONS.[/b][/h1]

[list]

[*]Travelling from one place to another can take time.
[*]Complex controls to learn, daunting for newcomers.
[*]Steep learning curve. 
[*]Early missions don’t give much credits. 
[*]Ship statistics and loadouts can be confusing at times.
[*]Combat! Until the player has mastered the controls and the use of the camera, this can be very off putting for some.
[*]Difficulty in the beginning stages of the game.
[*]Lack of descriptions and details regarding research for some of the available research options to invest resources into.
[*]Some of the conquest missions are hard to finish due to lack of information.
[*]Graphics. I think by default they are set too low.
[/list]

[h1][b]Final Thoughts.[/b][/h1]

[b]I highly recommend this game and truly believe it is worth every penny considering the replay value it has and the studio that is behind it.[/b] There is a lot to take in initially and it is not for the faint of heart, but once you make it past those early growing pains, you’ll see why this game is praised and loved by so many. Thank you for reading!

[i]-Your friend[/i],
     ZeroAffex

[i]PS: Big thanks to the LGM crew, keep up the hard work and please don’t stop delivering content for the game anytime soon! You guys are awesome, really appreciate everything you do. Cheers![/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198009006160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1481958502}
review:
Wow, purchased this as it sounded good. 

One of the most boring games I have ever played. Goto station, buy to trade or take mission to fight. Repeat 1000 times. Nothing but 5 minute waits between destinations.

Battles make you dizzy and are essentially. Click left button on enemy. Press auto fire. Hold down X.

Enemies dead. Go back to base and sell cargo.

Repeat.

The worst $24 I ever spent in my life!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969365538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 11530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1660576681}
review:
i maybe think the other reviewers had a different game from the one i'm testing, as mine plays nothing like there's, mind you i'm only 3 hours in, so i'll post about what i think of the version i have now.

layout and UI is above average and well easy to learn and simple to understand, controls are second nature to anyone who has played these sort of formts before, i haven't played the others in the series so can't comment if it's better and made progresssion or not, so comments are only regarding this one.

mod access from AE, well supported and easy to use and install, easy format to edit if you like to alter anything almost in game, looks and plays very well and you have atm 2 options, a path to follow or free roam, done both so can comment on both as well.

the story teachers you the basics or ship handling and the UI and about all you need to know as you progress through it, which is good as i tend to never read manuals or guides so as i was new to this, did the early ones to in game, then re started a new one and dod the free roam to see more later in game stuff.

amount of ships and equipment in game atm will keep any space sim geek in heaven for ages, and this is just the starting amount, as mid to late games it keep getting more and more, open world you can do as you like aka privateer kind of Elite type game.

options and menu's are easy to read and follow and everything i wanted was at hand, can't say i'd alter much but as it's EA i'm guessing the Developers will tinker with it for ever and a day until they are happy with it.

space is vast, the amount to do is well like most space games only limited bu what you wish to do in it, not sure if there's an ending or goals as such as tbh not got that far, but for ease of use, playability and looks alone, i'd recommend it an support it, just for the mods and free access to files it offers for you to edit and play with.

is it any different from any others?

well that's hard to say, it has bits that are from other games, but don't they all? it's different enough to not be a full on clone, but as space games are all in space, some will says some bit's are from this and that, can't also comment on sounds and music, as for me i play in totaly silience and listen to what i want to hear, not in game music or ship sounds, sorry music developers.

do i think it will make a AAA title once released, well for what i've seen so far with 3 hours in, i'd say yes, as the developers are long term, have enough experience from previous games and seems to support there games in the long and short term.

on the mod side, some stuff coming out for it atm does look really good, so this side can only make it better.

thanks for reading this, hope you enjoy the game.

ps, i'm a game tester, not a player so base my review and views on 20 odd years of experience of testing all sorts of game on all formats, covering all types of games...

review:
So it's been a year and I've sort of not been playing. However coming back has been pleasant as most of the bugs in early access and at first release are mostly worked out. Game has been a pleasure to play and have been happy since my return. Very similar to SPG2 with a few additions.

Thanks for all the hard work to the developers!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093342532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1524528099}
review:
Have you ever spent a long time looking for that right space game, you end up buying what ever you think will be satisfactory from titles to old to work on a new pc, you play them a bit but just cant get into them for what ever reason, from graphics issues, Ui issues to the all important space flight just doesnt feel right...

This game is the answer to all of this, the graphics are some of the best to date, they look smooth as hell and the artists should be given an award or something, and space flight is done right, it isnt a pure sim that needs a 20 step process to dock and calls that realism, it leans toward the fun action end but retains that real flying through space feel.

You should support this game becouse of the develapors track record and becouse this is a satisfying game that will fill the gap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097932072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4038, 'last_played': 1617435498}
review:
so now that this game has progressed far enough to give a proper review i will say that this one rocks. an instant classic even with the missing peices has that old school "freelancer" feel without so many loadinng screens and much more intricate universe politics. and really its about damn time someone gave us something like that again.
base building fleet management and sector conquering is just the beginning. and no being a simple fighter pilot the whole time is great because that gets so boorrrinng after a while....
Anyway would buy full price anytime 9/10 and its not done yet. i look forward to what the modding community brings to the table for this one :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198113124314', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 6751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3199, 'last_played': 1514337275}
review:
much to my excitement i received this game as an early christmas gift as this game genre has been my favorite since the 90's... over the past few years i've put many many hours into starpoint gemini 2 and so far THIS GAME SHOWS PROMISE.....

with that being said I wouldn't so much call it a game at this point as much as a glimpse as to what it could be .... and i wouldn't say it's just an incomplete game it's more of a incomplete shell of a core game, as core features of it have not been included yet....

UPDATE 4/3/17
Glad to see ship capturing is incorperated into the game this was one of my favorite features.... though still running into the issue of the game crashing anytime i use grapple.. which really is a big deal for my play style.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969419017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1507436986}
review:
If you're a fan of open-ended space games with a massive world to explore, factions to assist or wage war with, conquering territory, upgrading tech and infrastructure; aswell as ship combat(and subterfuge), mining/trading, piracy, etc this is hands down the game to have.

The developers are amazing; they're active on the forums and they respond all the time to fan feedback to help shape the games they make to their fanbase.  If more developers were like these guys, there'd be a lot better features and sequels made.

Fun fact:  This game was made because the community wanted to be able to conquer space in Starpoint Geminin 2; but it wasn't possible to add it to the base game; so the devs made a whole new game with that concept in mind.

They also open their games up to the mod community and actively encourage it; which means the game will have a flourishing community for years to come thanks to modders able to implement new models, art, sound/music, etc.(New ships, stations, backdrops; total conversions are entirely possible.)

Amazing game that's still in early access; and I look forward to really delving into it upon release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036140268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1705127542}
review:
So I know I'm late to the early access party, I just wanted to play the heck out of SPG2 first. So right off the bat let me just say so far things are looking amazing. Warlords brings back almost everything I loved about Starpoint2 and adds onto it by including what the community voiced about additions or fixes to the previous titles. Still in early access, I have to say it's still pretty polished here and there and and definitely playable for hours and hours of fun. But, I have not seen anyone mention the lack of artsy bloom of background space that made SPG2 so beautiful. Warlords is more "realistic" and stars in the backdrop look....well,like flat and empty space. Is this intended or something in the works to do later? Also, firing railguns from my praetorian are so tiny I can't even tell I'm firing at some angles. Making the tracers thicker will definitely be a welcome fix.
In the meantime, pick it up on sale or full price. Play it. Love it. Because there are no other games like this series, so stop comparing it to what's out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134751576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 16907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5866, 'last_played': 1572235097}
review:
Overall this game is worth the money. The Devs have a lot of work to do yet but are actively updating. With such a huge map there is plenty to do as an early access but it is in dire need of a campaign and currently lacks depth because of it.

Pro’s

-	Ship designs are some of the best I’ve seen in a while
-	Large map many planets/substations to visit and/or conquer
-	Trading system isn’t nerfed so much so you feel your coveted few daily hours of gameplay   are forced to do nothing but grind endlessly for a ship or weapon you want.
-	Fleet creation and HQ upgrades give you additional support you’re willing to work for
-	Other means are provided to aid in long distance travels, at a cost, but are available non the less to avoid sitting in front of your screen for hours traversing the galaxy.

Con’s (more detailed with hopes of fixing, granted some of these issues may be present due to the lack of scheduled development)

-	Ship customizations seem to change after saving, logging off, then back on and changing ships. 
-	Fleets need to be accessible for support on freelance missions
-	Trading can gain you so much experience you will find yourself outgunned without any support even with a multi-million $ vessel with fantastic weapons
-	Fighters need to be more effective to make carriers worth the money
-	Some areas don’t have garrisons possibly on purpose but without an active diplomacy system or wiki it’s hard to tell
-	Hailing some structures in hostile areas causes crashes
-	No use for ore or gas at this time other than upgrading HQ
-	Skill points invested in say trading, don’t actually change the prices of items as advertised. Other skill points do have effects. Hopefully an option will be present later to Re-Apply skill points to change the style of gameplay
-	Power drops dramatically even after buying an extremely expensive dreadnought and equipping it with high end weapons systems. I don’t see how any ship could sustain ample attack without being quickly drained and forced to retreat.
-	No campaign (yet)
-	No diplomacy system (yet)
-	Needs a cockpit view to add realism

Even with all these cons I still played and play the game. I don’t want to discourage anyone from buying it. It’s in its early stages and has amazing potential. I can’t wait for more content to add character and bring life to this thing. I wanted so badly to get a big ship and make some people pay for flying within sensor range, which for the most part is true. However try a freelance mission at lvl 70 something and you’ll get your ass handed to you. Regardless Starpoint Gemini Warlords is fun, and worth the money on sale or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992414922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1529277009}
review:
Итак на фоне полупустого SG2 в игре появилось разнообразие геймплея, что не может не радовать. Завезли систему управления, строительства кораблей, баз и модернизации станций. Корабли можно объединять в звенья и посылать на задания или войну  с враждебными регионами.
В принципе это Mount&Blade только в космическом масштабе при чуть больших возможностях, но меньшем количестве армий.

Из минусов: графику завезли частично. Полигоны с текстурами завезли, а вот дальность видимости почти нулевой (думаю в релизе доведут до уровня SG2 если не больше).
Настройки лаунчера и игры не совпадают, так в лаунчере вы ставите 2к, 4к, а в игре выше Full HD разрешение не выставляется. Тени в настройках игры всегда выключены, без разницы что у вас в настройках лаучера. 

Но не надо забывать что игра сырая, это Early Access, и все что с ним связано присуще этой игре на данный момент.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074672646', 'num_games_owned': 6653, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1495201054}
review:
[h1]Starpoint Gemini Warlords est un jeu de stratégie spatiale[/h1]

Avant tout, je tiens à signaler que j’ai testé le jeu alors qu’il était en accès anticipé.

L’histoire fait suite au jeu Starpoint Gemini 2.

A la tête d’un vaisseau colonisateur, vous fuyez avec les derniers humains les forces extra-terrestres. Vous vous installez sur une nouvelle planète et vous vous fixez pour objectif de remettre sur pied la puissance humaine. Vous savez qu’un moment ou l’autre, il vous faudra affronter de nouveau les extra-terrestres et vous comptez bien ne pas être le perdant cette fois !

Vous aurez à gérer les ressources, le commerce, la recherche, votre flotte de guerre, etc, mais aussi votre planète de base ainsi que celles que vous coloniserez petit à petit... bref, vous allez gérer un vrai empire interstellaire !

[url=www.graal.fr/2016/08/18/test-starpoint-gemini-warlords-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour lire l'ensemble de mes impressions sur Starpoint Gemini Warlords.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198064384065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1572705994}
review:
I feel like this game really deserves all the support we can give. The game is part of a multi-game series(Starpoint Gemini) which means lore is a given. While some of the game's features are somewhat lacking(research, more player ship chassis) because of early access, the Developer support from what I've seen has been outstanding. They've actually been listening to their playerbase's suggestions and addressing requests from players.

The game itself is amazing for an early-access game. The space battles were more than entertaining, and the Devs are saying that they'll be getting improvements soon. Even with what appears to be your starter ship, a pilot who knows what he's doing can take on enemy fleets fairly easily.

The best aspect that I cannot stress enough is the fact that unlike many companies, the developers actually seem to care about player concerns. They've actually read players' suggestions and feedback(unlike 90% of game companies out there).

I paid $25 for this game, and I feel like I'm underpaying even for an early access game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992206547', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 5571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5148, 'last_played': 1551731791}
review:
Hard to review this game! At one hand the game has many things and features I like, but on the other hand a few parts falls short on the implementation side of things.
 
Graphics and design is nicely done. As someone that played the MMO EVE a lot I felt right at home in the SGW universe. Okay it does not look just as great as EVE, but considering their budget/manpower/time I think they have done a very nice job on creating a beautiful immersive universe. All the weapon and shield effects of the ships are nicely done as well. Pew pew!
 
If you play this game vanilla without mods and cheats the game it can be grindy and slow progress to get to the 'end game'. I personally think it's alright. I have grinded for years in EVE, nothing is more boring than that so SGW is fine :)

So I mentioned mods. Yep this game is modable and has workshop integration! The modding community is not huge, but there is some nice stuff on the workshop. I have my own modded Star Trek theme going on in my modded game :)  It is also possible to edit your own 'save file' that lets you mod quite a few things. If you would feel that  the game is to grindy than it's just a matter of modding your save file to change that.
 
The game has a lot of features and game mechanics that I am not all going to describe, but I am positve about most of them. The devs have tried to setup real balanced out gameplay with enough diversity and features to keep the game fun and challenging up to the end.  There are some things that should/could be improved and just don't feel greatly implemented yet, but I am happy to see that the devs are passionate and devoted and are still actively working on the game.

I personally don't like how I control the ships in this game, it just feels to wonky. And specially in 1st person/cockpit camera mode space battles makes me dizzy and disoriented. They have improved it already as how it was in Early Access, but I still don't like it. 
 
An other thing that could have some improvement is the whole fleet mechanic. It works, you can form and fly with an AI fleet of ships. The mechanic is not fleshed out enough and has rough edges as it is. For one thing the AI ships constantly bump into you and there is not a mechanic to give them a tactical formation or even devide the fleet into long/short range combat.
 
Overall, Considering that this is not some high budget AAA title, but an indie title, I think this is an underestimated game that is overlooked by to many people. I can see that the devs are trying with passion to create the best game as possible within their power/budget/limits. Devs like that should be supported so don't hasitate to buy this game :)

Verdict: 
75/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198013363272', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1474912376}
review:
I hope there is graphical improvments it was like halo one! It's not a bad game so far but very buggy! It is alpha and that is the risk and it doesn't bother me but the whole time I am trying to do a hail or try and kill the ships marked red it would bug out, kind of annoyng! If you are looking for a pass time game something like this is great but at it's state i can not say you should get this game, unless you are able to not give a dam about the small things, I will how ever keep playing this game because I have been looking for a game like this, sadly I have no hopes for this game (Or the acting) that is another thing you will be wihout much sound since the game has very little voice acting and only in the first seen will you see much! 

They have got a good baby here though I like most of the game the ship control is crap I mean really bad, I would like mouse movement and when I need to use my mouse I would like to use ALT that is something else that gets on my tits. I would like to see this game go under a good phase of graphic and UI enhancements.

All in all this is a good game I like it a lot, how ever I would say to wait a little while, just so they can fix some game breaking bugs and so we all can see them game makers do good! If you can put up with bugs and lower then normal visuals then this is not a bad game.

I would rate this game 6/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015113686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1593258105}
review:
Ich habe wirklich versucht dieses Spiel zu mögen, aber es ist einfach nur eine Aneinanderreihung von Fehlern. Hier mal ein paar, die auf Dauer jeglichen Spass am Spiel verderben:

- es werden nur 2 der 4 Schildgittern des eigenen Schiffes berücksichtigt, wodurch nur diese beiden Seiten den Schaden nehmen und somit schnell am Ende sind
- intensives grinden ist nötig um weiterzukommen, jedoch lassen sich 2 von 3 Missionen nicht erfolgreich abschließen (Fortschrittsanzeige bei Reperaturen bleibt immer auf dem gleichen Wert stehen; Missionen brechen ohne Grund von selbst ab; keine Waypoints um zu den Missionen zu kommen; ...)
- mein HQ wurde mir gegenüber feindlich
- Energieverteilung bleibt nach "alle Energie zum Antrieb" auch nach dessen Abschaltung bestehen, wodurch Waffen und Schilde nicht mit Energie versorgt werden und sich nicht regenerieren
- Taktisches Qverlay schaltet sich außerhalb von Kämpfen ab, wodurch die fehlende Schildenergie erst zu spät bemerkt wird
- markieren von Zielen sehr schwierig (je kleiner das Ziel / Wrack, desto unmöglicher)
- Feuerautomatik sucht ständig ein neues Ziel, wodurch die Zerstörung von Feinden eher Glück als beabsichtigt ist

Es gibt viele weitere Probleme, die ich aber jetzt nicht alle aufzählen will. Obwohl meist ein laden des letzten Spielstandes ausreicht, ist das Spielerlebnis deutlich gestört. Für 5 Euro könnte man das Spiel durchgehen lassen. Es bedarf allerdings noch einiger Updates um den derzeitigen Preis auch nur ansatzweise zu rechtfertigen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007098206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1486856886}

At this point I'm not dissapointed with purchasing of SG: Warlords.
So, if you liked SG2, and there is discount on SG: Warlods (that often accures), I can recommend this game even on EA state.

BUT DON'T FORGET TO INSTALL LATEST VIDEO CARD DRIVERS!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074229252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1474794115}

author: {'steamid': '76561198100151261', 'num_games_owned': 904, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 6210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1661247310}
review:
This is the space simulator I've been hoping for since Freelancer. This game is a jewel, even in the Early Access state. Nice gameplay mechanics. Sadly, the alpha has no story, only player progression so far. 

Pros: 
- Huge universe to explore
- Challenging space fights, some of them randomly appear as you are rushing towards objectives
- You can sometimes find huge spaceship battles graveyards, which contain tons of loot, as long as you got the cargo for them all
- The ship designs are really nice, at least for the battle ones.
- Beautiful graphics, better than other space simulators, and it's Alpha, therefore some textures polishing might come in the future

Neutral:
- While I really like the combat system, you will find out that your ship's shield has four sub-divisions, front, left, right and rear. 100% of the time the enemies will hit your sides, which is really annoying, especially when you see the projectiles hit you from the front. My front shield only drops because the sides are on 0%, and the enemies destroyed my shield generator
- Upgrading your HQ takes quite a while, resource gathering can be rushed by micro-managing your fleets to do tasks.

Con:
- For a game that likes to show-off with the commander aspect, the fact that you cannot bring the fleet you spent resources on to create to aid you in combat is pretty silly. The only time you will be needing your fleet is for capturing space stations.
- While the camera is nice while flying, during combat it becomes your worst enemy, because you are zoomed into your ship, and the enemies just keep flying around ou. The worst part is that looking at the enemy you are aiming for is a bad idea, since only your front weapons will hit it.

Overall, this game is a jewel. Please purchase it, support the game, and enjoy it when it launches 100%. The devs should give players a way to share their ideas for the game openly, not via steam reviews, or comments to their posts. Sometimes a brilliant idea might arise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064454917', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1477347005}
