author: {'steamid': '76561198070537433', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1750, 'last_played': 1551305108}
review:
Před posledním updatem z 13.9.2016 to byla super hra, strávil jsem na ní několik hodin. Na to že je to hra v předběžném přístupu, má velké možnosti. A po poslednim update je ještě lepší. Přibyl další obsah, nahodné mise, porovnaní cen na různých místech v galaxii, které máte pod svou správou. Možnost nabarvit si svou loď, ikdyž to řadím k méně duležítým věcem, ale je příjemné tuto možnost mít a další. Zatím jsem vše neprozkoumal.

Nějaká chybička se najde jako byl nejed pád hry do windows (to bylo pře updatem hry 13.9), ale jak by řekl klasik to se stane maximálně jednou za 10let :-) (z filmu Jáchyme, hoďho do stroje).

Kdo rád oběvuje, buduje, bojuje, obchoduje, vylepšuje a to vše ve vesmíru. Tak tuto hru můžu vřele doporučit.

Ovladaní hry je intuitivni a ikdyž jsem na některé ovládaci prvky přicházel postupně, musím řict že je dost povedené.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007393566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1756, 'last_played': 1498409984}
review:
Moin,

Macht laune auf mehr ^^
Tolle Grafik tolle Steuerung.
Sehr schöne Schiffe und Stationen.
Nach 5 min spielzeit ist die Schiffsteuerung gelernt super ding.
Warte nur noch auf die Deutsch fassung um es richtig geniessen zu können.

Und wer nicht begreift das ein Erly Access Spiel nun mal ein in entwicklung befindliches Spiel ist der sollte nochmal nachschlagen was Early Access bedeutet.Bevor man dauernd irgendwelche negativen bewertungen schreibt.
(Die schilde funzen nicht richtig,die storry ist noch nicht fertig )blablabla 
Wie im Kindergarten 
Ihr könnt gern schreiben das und das muss noch verbessert werden aber Daumen runter weil noch nicht fertig ???????

Also "EARLY ACCESS" bedeutung "SPIEL NOCH IN DER ENTWICKLUNG" klar !!^^

Wird zeit das es in Deutsch übersetzt wird !!!!! 
Ist schon 10 Monate in Early Access da kann man schon erwarten das grundsachen übersetzt werden!!
Daumen noch hoch,nach 12 monaten Early Access ohne übersetzung aber leider nicht mehr.
Nächstes Early Access Spiel werde ich wohl nicht kaufen da es immer hinausgezögert wird bis es raus kommen soll.Nur noch mit nem festem termin.
Ich unterstütz entwicklung von Early Access Spiele gerne nur werden die meisten dann immer leicht größenwahnsinnig,und wollen noch dieses und das einbringen und dann wird es nie fertig oder ist schon wieder veraltet.
Siehe Star Citizen.Ich bin ein Sponsor „backer“ der ersten Stunde das war 2012

1 Jahr rum sry Daumen runter bis Deutsch einführung.

Daumen wieder hoch^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198111936141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1519911293}
review:
Good: 
The story was very nice told for its 5 minutes, if you can keep it up longer then 5 minutes(so she said) this will be a wonderfull story.

The audio response of various ship tasks like moving to waypoint, fire at will ect.
Though what would make it perfect is small picture of officer responsible appearing for 2 sec.

Ship design, looks of bases/planets ect is well done.

Wonderfull music, which is very important!^^


Subject of improvement:

No docking Animation, was bothering me in previous game alrd. It breaks immersion if you click on dock and this window just appears, nothing in between, it reminds everytime its just a game and throws you out of the ingame universe. Just a small 2 second animation of a small fighter flying from your ship to station without any actual docking would work miracles!


The Fleet managment system is very contra intuitive and tedious, instead of a simple list of all your fleets you need to find that fleet on map! 
This needs to change, first a simple menu with all your fleets listed and their positions so you´ll find them on map.
Second every Fleet needs assignible Admiral with picture, perks and background story like the bosses in the previous game. 
Perks should be Fleet max power and Fleet Speed, mirrowed. For example, always 50% in total it can be 3% power 47% speed or 36% power 14% speed. This would balance big slow fleets vs small fast fleets.
Background/picture, you could make 2 kinds of admirals, one that you hire in small side quests with fixed picture/background, and others that you can hire from your HQ with custom picture/self written background.
And the fleet operations itself, too fast too low reward, make fleet actually need flying time to reach objective the further it is from HQ, and ofc the operation itself should need around 10 minutes with max distance from HQ on other side of gemini map 30 minutes. Since itll take longer increase rewards accordingly.
Additionally possible big event missions with fleets: like defense of a planet where you need to position your fleets around the planet and incoming enemys attack from all sides and you need to move fleets to intercept, and ofc you yourself participate there too defending one spot.
Possibility to edit your fleet name with default name: "Fleet of admiral "name""
The more you can name/edit yourself the more it feels like yours. Thus game drags you deeper inside its universe, and thats what seperates good games of bad, how deep can it drag you inside its universe.

Another thing is fog of war in conquered territory, it doesnt lift, while in hostile/unknown is fine, but if i conquer a station all hexes should be visible of that territory else its kinda strange not be able to see your own territory or even worse need to fly around personally to see your territory.

The heavy weapons dont feel heavy at all, well was this way in previous game, but here you have the chance to improve! increase damage of heavy weapons by x10 and cooldown by x5, with this you could put a small voiced everytime a heavy wep is launched with: "missle on its way to greet our neighbour", "heavy weapon launched", "Bada boom", "fire in the hole!"
Because right now a limited ammo heavy weapon feels totaly wasted.

The Light weapons dont feel different, the special dmg from lasers on shields and railguns on hull could use a raise to x3 times. It would also be nice if we had more hardpoints to put different sets of weapons on it like one set laser, other set railguns and then toggle them during fights. This would make alot more possibilitys for taktical combat. Because right now with so few dmg difference Lasers are best because they always hit.
Additionaly all weapons could use double dmg boost, as combat is abit slow, and with hull regeneration skill player itself is never in danger of being destroyed. Feels like an invul cheat.

Hardpoints! in some other games there are destroyable hardpoints of engine/shield/generator/weapons ect, now there are even subsystem hitpoints seen in game as you equip your ship, however they seem of no use at all. Are they used for hacking? well hacking is not used at all either. Change them better to be targeteble by weapons/wings.

Mercenarys, in prev game they were just following and shooting. It would be great if you could actually assign them commands like target that enemy first, target those hardpoints, use traktorbeam on that enemy ect, and an icing on top: voiced! same as audio response on your own ship tasks. Would make the feeling as you with actual mercenarys in a fleet and not mindless drones followin you.

Wings, fighters, interceptors and bombers! They feel unreal, as you cant target enemy wings nor can your wings target enemys wings. The word interceptor looses its meaning.
It would be great if you could actually assign your wings to: intercept enemy wings, attack hardpoints and if the heavy weapons are improved make those destructable too so you could assign your wings to intercept rockets from enemy or protect your own rockets from enemy wings! voiced icing on top XD.

Cargo, there are so many cargo items with wonderfull descriptons, however those are not used at all but "collect all"/"sell all" wasted! You could do so many missions with Cargo! like: 
Theres a epidemic on planet X, get medicine from station Y and bring it to the planet on time! 
An mining operation on asteroid X is in dire need of enviromental suits! 
An upcoming race on planet X is in need of landrovers!
The outcome of upcoming democratic vote on planet X is in danger! To avert the attention of population bring in a mass of hologames!
A revolution group on a planet is in need of heavy weapons! smuggle them!
Note on cargo missions: always tell where from you can buy that specific cargo..or those missions will be a big fail.

Last a dream: Bridge combat! 
Atm most of times i dont even see all the targets autofire fires at, and theres little motivation to turn since weapons autotarget up/down/behind anyway. This doesnt feel right.
A bridge where you see all your officers you hired working on consoles, and you sitting before a 360 degree screen that shows all of combat left/right up/down and behind you with weapon zones marked so you know how to turn to get most of your weapons firing on target!
Screen:
.................////up////
behind//left//Front//right//behind
................/bottom/

As we at dream part: walkable interiors! spaceships, spacestations, surface of asteroids and ofc planets! with beatiful horizon few out of the panorama window! Ofc with a few npcs with special quests.


ps, i did enjoy previous game, though story only there was no point of staying longer in free mode. I hope it changes with this edition cause id really like to change this to positive soon XD

Edit:
pps: how to get dev attention: write negative review XD no but honestly for the price tag its a worthy game as soon story is finished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038091715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1660267176}
review:
Treilers look like EvE online grade

In game max settings not even close

There is not ton of content

Also it is not clear why I'am conquering the regios ... I wen with my wing fought got reket yet conquered the region....

the flying controls uuuugh horible

==============================

Yes, so after two years I came back to see whats going on in here, and yes not much,
the controls for fighting are terrible as was before, if you are unsure how to make good controls for dog fighting take a look at X3-X4. This game is way more oriented into the strategic aspect than on the piloting of your own ship. - This is a big killer, because the X3 and X4 fill that gap just fine and better too. Now one may say that X4 creators are way bigger so compersion is unfair. 

Fine, look at Spaceburne, made by one man, controls way more fluid with options to strafe where as here you just go forward up down left right with key controls. the AI can implement perfect rolls that allows it to stay on you and out of your view field so you have to charge forward and then lance back. 

Mining salvaging and all else is shoot at the rock with your main weapons and then collect a box of loot ... again checkout Spaceburne done by one man which does this way better ... sorry but thumbs down stay in place. 

As to the person indicating that my past review was for Alpha and not fair, I ve played enough games from dev stage and into release and I pointed out the things that in vast number of cases do not get addressed, yes because no one will re-program the controls which is the basis of the games and all "balance" is pinned on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028937847', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1519749192}
review:
It has the nostalgia of the old X-wing Vs Tie Fighter space combat for me, coupled with the base building x4 games like Civ V. (Or Xcom if you prefer.)  

Granted its comparing apples to oranges but, the spirit is there. Yet its done in such a way it doesn't seem stale or boring. 

The world is, beautiful. It seems to capture the vastness of space without being too drab like Elite Dangerous. It feels -big- but not too big. 

Lastly the game doesn't feel like early access. I've paid a whole lot more for a whole lot less content. 

So if you loved X-wing Vs Tie Fighter, you'll probably love this. 
My only complaint... I now have to buy a flight joystick. Mouse and keyboard just doesn't cut it for a game like this. At least in dogfights.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034867742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1942, 'last_played': 1508920834}
review:
For a pre alpha, this is suprisingly good.  It's clear that a lot of features are not yet installed, there are some bugs that need to be squashed, but none of which so far are game breaking.  It's actually quite enjoyable in a repeatative way.  

Alot of people have compare this to x series, and while the graphics does remind me more of X2 than other X series, it isn't.  The combat is very different, maybe I am just a filthy casual, but most of the time I have to set up combat using auto attack and just spin the ship round and round to trying to dodge shots while positioning so auto gunners do their thing.  If the combat is more like the X series  I would have found space sim heaven..I think, LOL.  Regardless, I am taking this as it's infant form, and it is already quite fun  with the limited things to do and nerfed state(I took over sectors with a fleet of 9 ships, before I realized their defensive value is the equalivant of 1 basic ship(78), my 9  is over 900), but I can see or hope that they can easily increase these values to make things more of a challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989254794', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 428, 'playtime_forever': 9025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1535239899}
review: Starpoint Gemini 2 was an alright game, I generally don't touch this genre but the guys behind this respond to community feedback and certainly seem to care about making something worth sinking your time into. Warlords is essentiaklly mechanically superior to the last game by a mile, prominently featuring galactic conquest mechanics. Building fleets and taking over territory is what really takes this iteration to a whole new level. With the Steam Workshop on top of that, who knows what this can become.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137866454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1658505405}
review:
首先先感谢开发者的努力和汉化，游戏较一年前有了很大的不同，我来说说这具体是什么样吧。我虽然点的是推荐，但并不推荐给所有人，具体原因请看下面。
Thanks for your hard work !

首先说，它并不是everspace或者COD13那种偏向射击狗斗的风格，它更像是加入了技能和装备系统并换了移动方式的EVE，一款有探索元素的角色扮演类游戏。
接着再容我吐槽下汉化，我怀疑汉化组有点偷懒，我估计对话文本是人翻的，然后所有界面文本都是机翻的，例：进游戏那个大大的“播放”。
画面方面，飞船和特效是到位了，空间站的贴图显然很粗糙，不过在精致的星云下，不算硬伤。
战斗系统有点迷离，它似乎并不希望你进行手动射击，而是想让你通过按F自动锁定目标射击，然后腾出你的鼠标来点技能点装备。但这就引出来两个问题：
一：炮台目标问题，你不难发现一个情况，那就是你锁定的是一个目标，而你的炮台却在同时攻击附近的其它目标，甚至在一打三。。只要你的攻击范围内存在多个目标，你几乎不能指望你的炮台进行集火，这就要求你还得手动瞄准。
二：既然要手动瞄准，那对视角的要求必然要高，但这游戏最迷离的地方就特么的在这个视角！在进行攻击时，如果你要进行走位，你势必就要按K进行视角锁定，但这个锁定视角离你自己的飞船相当近，这就导致了你的目标大部分时间都会被你的飞船遮挡。。。这你让我的意大利炮往哪打？？但如果不依赖这个锁定，你的目标会分分钟离开的你视野范围。什么？你想站桩输出？不存在的，敌人是会跑的！没错，会跑的！还跑得很快！
那么实际打起来就是，一边WSAD控制方向环绕，一边忍耐着你的飞船以极近的距离占据屏幕中央一大块区域抢镜的同时用鼠标进行瞄准，同时按鼠标右键进行射击，并随时鼠标滚轮加减速，再同时还要时不时去按屏幕右下角的几个技能，最后，飞船特么的还不会自动翻滚，得你自己QE来调整倾斜度来让你炮台全部面向目标开火！想想累不累！
战斗技能什么的由职业决定一共四个，玩的不深我先不做评价，但就这几个问题可真是整的人焦头烂额。。如果你再有个3D眩晕症什么的，上手肯定就是痛不欲生。

总结：
这一切我都觉得是因为这个游戏开发者的想法很多，但是没想清楚这个游戏到底要弄成啥风格而导致的。如果要弄成RPG，你就应该放掉飞船的控制交给系统来进行处理，什么跟随啊环绕啊，都交给系统去做，然后就让玩家选择目标，丢技能，组combo。如果你想弄成动作，你就应该把飞船的物理特性弄好，惯性啊，加速减速啊，并且调整好你的视角，我就是给你一个正前方的视角，然后炮台瞄准的就是你鼠标指针的中心，也是飞船的中心。打个比方，这就像：我刚开始想做个巫师类的半动作游戏，然后我看，诶，龙腾世纪的技能也不错啊，然后就做了维京人：人中之狼这么个反人类的奇葩出来。简单的说，现在真的有些四不像，而且操作和视角真的不舒服。
不过游戏总体不难，上手很快，画面和飞船设计也算精美，太空迷们可以等打折入一波玩玩。
但是，如果你不是太空类游戏或者该系列游戏的忠实粉丝，强烈不推荐入手，就这样

author: {'steamid': '76561198324124189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1476872365}

author: {'steamid': '76561198051644638', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1495635158}
review:
Starpoint Gemini 2的评测
http://steamcommunity.com/id/zomblekingdom/recommended/236150/

与上一代打怪升级开好船不同，这一代在战斗玩法基础上增加了类似X3的空间站建造玩法，玩家建造的空间站可以采集附近的特殊资源，特殊资源除了扩建空间站让空间站具有更快的采矿速度与防御外敌突袭的能力外，还可以允许玩家建造战舰和研发新科技，然而建造的战舰只能给AI用，也可能是有玩家驾驶的选项我没有找到。但这也有个好处那就是玩家在执行什么任务的时候可以先派AI战舰，同时你也可以扩建AI舰队，增加任务成功率和完成效率，相当于上一代的雇佣兵战舰的升级版。
画面方面，与上一代疯狂叠粒子搞的整个游戏场景像北京雾霾不同，这一代在粒子特效方面做了很多阉割，但这并没有导致游戏画面变得低端简陋，同时这一代的战舰建模和贴图有了很大改进，游戏增加了一些新战舰，并且新战舰在设计上有了很大改进，比如新护卫舰不再是上一代末世废土一般的臃肿违和外观设计，而是更偏向赛博朋克。不过上一代部分设计违和的战舰仍然保留了下来，但不是所有战舰都继承了下来比如上一代的大型旗舰没有出现战舰购买和建造当中，也可能是因为EA阶段的原因官方没有开放更多战舰。
战斗方面与上一代相比基本没变，也就是说上一代那根本分不出不同类型武器伤害以及手动不如自动开火的玩法在这一代也没怎么改。整个游戏最核心的环节官方居然从未在意，这游戏的DEV是有多自信。。。
其他方面，游戏的各种细节和上一代相比并没有本质提升，剧情模式下依然如流水线一般，角色说话同时视角绕着战舰移动，仅此而已，战舰没有任何细节可以为整个剧情对话有一丝衬托，这种愚蠢的设计让我想到了魔兽3里玩家的自制剧情地图，玩家自己这么搞情有可原，但DEV这么搞就显得没设计水准了。

与其说这是新游戏，不如说是DLC，总之观望吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198115171309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1470278597}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050335577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1551771749}
review:
I hate to make overused bad puns, but "this game boldly goes where few games have gone before". At least to my knowledge. You would usually either have a full on RPG space simulator (of various degrees of immersion) or an RTS version of the space genre. Granted, I do admit that this is the first game from the series that I tried, so perhaps this is not new to Starpoint Gemini itself, but on the plus side, this means I went in without any prior expectation one way or another.

So what's it like? You want to think "freelancer" gameplay for the player as the pilot, where your ship is actual spaceship size that needs more than a single pilot to fly (meaning you do have the option of having your crew fire multiple lasers at multiple enemies at the same time), while putting the player in charge of not just the ship itself, but an entire system in hostile territory as one would expect an RTS title to do, whereby the player needs to gather resources to build up that system with structures, upgrade the base unlocking further improvements in the base's "tech tree" so to speak, all the while working towards upgrading their own ship while exploring the stars, trading goods, mining, doing missions and so on. I'm struggling to find a comparison here, simply because I can't think of any game similar in that concept.

Needless to say, the possibilities for where this can lead are quite literally endless. And based on the direction it seems to be heading, I would chance that the developers are taking full advantage of that notion.

[h1]The Good stuff first:[/h1]

[b][u] Gameplay & Concept [/u][/b]
As above, the concept is amazing, the gameplay is solid, for what it is; a pre-release, there are very few bugs, and a lot of content and features that are clearly simply not implimented yet, rather than simply 'missing'. The game plays like a pre-release alpha, it feels incomplete, but it also gives you a very obvious direction of where the developers are going with it, and what you would expect later on. 

[b][u] Storyline & Replayability  [/u][/b]
At this point, the story is severely lacking. You start off with a prologue that acts as a tutorial to give you the gist of things, before putting you into a 'sandbox' type universe. That said, what has been done so far looks very promising, and I'm looking forward to finding out "what happens next". In the meantime, I'll happily traverse the stars exploring the map in the sandbox setting. 

[b][u] Graphics [/u][/b]
Not the best, but good enough. Smooth on crappier systems, and you have all the fancy shadows and effects to enable on higher end systems. Just don't expect anything close to Star Citizen level of eye candy, and you'll be more than happy. The most notable and annoying thing here, is the pretty short view distance to objects. Space stations and asteroids would just magically "disappear" behind you in their near full size glory, rather than fade into the distance. Though I do admit other than cranking every detail to "max", I haven't played around with the settings. 


[h1]Now for the Not so good stuff:[/h1]

[b][u] Controls and UI [/u][/b]
Best way to put it is, too simplistic and basic. You get less HUD information than you would in an arcade game, and what little you do get is just ugly. The controls are likewise extremely basic and limited, similar to a very very bare and stripped down version of "Freelancer" - and when it comes to controls that's [i]not[/i] a good thing.  You don't even get vertical or horizontal thrust control, let alone doing things like putting your engines offline or using built up inertia for maneuvers. The camera view is a bit clunky too if you want to try and use anything other than the default third person view. Granted this may still improve as the game gets developed further, but I won't hold my breath as it looks to be intentionally designed. 

[b][u] Ship design [/u][/b]
If you expect to get into the game and see fleets of ships that were showcased in the videos and the screenshots, like I did, you would be disappointed as this is far from the case. A lot of the designs - especially earlier on - are very much underwhelming. To the point of feeling completely out of place, to the same extent that a car made by a three year old out of mismatched lego blocks and playdoh would be out of place as a boat. This is not a problem with graphics, or textures or anything like that - just pure cringe design.

The game CAN do it right, as showcased by the decent looking ship models and designs in the videos and screenshots promoting it. It's just that sadly, a percentage of the designs - especially early on, are simply on a completely different level down from there. 


Overall, if you can overlook the absolutely cringeworthy ship designs, enjoyed games like "Freelancer" mixed in with some RTS, and you like the sandbox space genre, you would have a blast with this game, and will anticipate each patch and update as the game progresses further with joy and excitement. The game doesn't try to hide the fact that it is nowhere near complete, and it doesn't need to when it's ambitions for the genre. 

Similarly, if you really enjoy space RPGs, you would likely love it when more of the story is released. 

On the flip side, if you are looking for something with Elite Dangerous' flight mechanics and controls, Star Citizen's graphics and detail, this is probably not for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006784691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1534106117}
review:
Конечно это пока ранний доступ, и я могу где-то заблуждаться т.к. видел только начало игры, и не очень хорошо помню SG2, но на данный момент я не заметил в игре чего либо, ради чего в нее хотелось бы вернуться. А это самое главное.

Далее, боевка осталась такой же как в SG2. Она никак не похожа на битвы массивных кораблей, и общее впечатление о ней: "ни то, ни се".

Затем - очень долгие перелеты, реально утомляют. Лететь куда-то далеко просто невыносимо. Разве что применять одноразовые T-Jump модули по 35К за штуку. 

Ну и раз в варлордах отрезали многое из SG2, то вот вам и новое - элементы стратегии. На данном этапе это выглядит слабо: можно апгрейдить базу, строить флоты и отправлять их на завоевания. И ладно что (пока?) эти флоты присутствуют чисто виртуально (во время полета по карте вы их не встретите), так вам надо лично выполнять задания чтобы апгрейдить свой персональный корабль за свои личные деньги, лично надо разведывать территорию неприятеля чтобы иметь возможность туда послать свой флот, лично прилетать в штаб чтобы заказать там какой-то новый апгрейд. Не будь дальние перелеты столь утомительными, то наверное было бы еще приемлимо, но в текущем виде это просто непонятно.

Мир же совершенно искуственный. Встречи с кораблями например - чистый случай.

Вобщем идея игры максимально далека сейчас от того, чтобы строить свою империю, и иметь при этом возможность лично поуправлять в бою любым из своих кораблей.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973152564', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1532750931}
review: I purchased and have been playing since the early alpha was released.  Excellent progress for early alpha!  The game has been fun from the beginning, with each update bringing more features online and squashing more bugs.  If you enjoyed Freelancer or have enjoyed other titles such as Rebel Galaxy, Starpoint Gemini Warlords will be everything you're looking for.  Give LGM some time to really polish this diamond if you don't have patience for early alpha bugs and you'll be happy you did!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033647674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1523290639}
review:
Very engaging, has the basis of an absolutely amazing game; the game is in early access but there is still plenty to be getting on with, there are some minor bugs but that is to be expected, I am incredibly excited for the progression of this game as it has the 3rd and 1st person ship battles working really well and a strategic element to the game aswell with the fleets, conquest, hq upgrading, mining, resource collection and micro-managing missions. LOVE the levelling and upgrading system, there are some really cool perks in the list.

There is quite a lot of travelling around to do in this game but they are working on a faster way to traverse the landscape without ruining the game by making sub-light travel pointless.

So excited for the development of this game, hope this helps!

Overall a fantastic start to a game that had me excited from the offset, keep an open mind with the fact that it is early access but look and what the developers are saying to us gamers, they're a great bunch with a very friendly and forthcoming view on their take and our input for the game, so the more constructive feedback you can give the better the end product!
 
Loving the game even down to the space-like music so far! keep up the good work :).

author: {'steamid': '76561198060863711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 5188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4446, 'last_played': 1510367742}
review:
I'm now 7 hours into the official release and I must say, the developers did a really great job here. It is a beautifull game full of atmosphere. There is lots to do, like ;freeroaming, jobs, mining, story missions, research, shipbuilding, etc but most of all, expanding. 

There are 3 resources needed to build everything, that is ore, gas and materials. You can collect these by constructing collectors around your territory on predetermined spots aswell as through civilian missions among others. Surrounded by other (unfriendly) empires you must take over territories to expand your color across the map (Important). Not only are you turning the map a better color, your color, you can also then build new stuff in those area's. 

It is also important to defend your territories with fleets you build. As a matter of fact, I just took over a territory, then decided to go on a main mission. Within 4 minutes I saw an enemy fleet approaching and taking back my newly conquered territory. They don't sit still!

I will edit this review as I get more playtime. For now though, it's definitely recommended if you're into space, rpg, strategy. A great mix!

author: {'steamid': '76561198204507888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 32470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1609, 'last_played': 1548776422}
review:
I'm about 25 hours in the game and oh boy this is amazing. I played Starpoint Gemini 2 so I might be a bit biased, but that just means that I can vouch for this team. They said they will give us a bigger universe to explore but this is overkill, this map is huge! They said graohics will be a bit better. A BIT BETTER?! I'm this close to buy 4K monitor and new graphic card for this!!! It looks amazing. Seriously, I understand all the people that think this is AAA title. It's not, as far as I know, but it sure looks like one! 

And it's Early Access, something many Steam players don't understand. 

As it says on this store page:

IMPORTANT: This game is EARLY ACCESS ALPHA. Please do not PURCHASE it unless you want to actively SUPPORT DEVELOPMENT of the game and are prepared to handle with SERIOUS ISSUES and POSSIBLE INTERRUPTIONS of gameplay.

That means giving a negative review based on game performance or bugs only makes you look funny. If you don't like the concept, if you don't think list of features are interesting or cool, ok. But I went through all these reviews and even the negative ones are not negative. The all talk about how good the game looks and how interesting the concept is but they give it thumbs down because of instability. It's Early Access, it's supposed to be unstable. But the opportunity to give ideas and watch the game grow during Early Access is a unique one and I applaud the team for giving us that opportunity cause it's a rarity. 

So if you want a stable game, don't buy it yet. Keep an eye on it, watch it grow and buy it later in Early Access or wait for full release but the price will go up then. If you want to be involved in the process of development and share your ideas but don't mind the bugs or crashes, then I highly recommend it. It's a rare gem nowadays with space games that offer nothing but promises. This one is a keeper.

author: {'steamid': '76561198309622431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1469649218}
review: Still work in progress but going forward in big hyperspace jumps every update. If you know this team, I don't need to say they deserve support. If you don't know them, come on forums, watch some videos and give them a chance. One thing is sure. This is a diamond in a rough that will become one of the few bright stars in the indie space game market.

author: {'steamid': '76561198309063753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 19684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1189, 'last_played': 1548776422}
review: 能够描述此游戏的评论有很多。成熟，剧情化，精致......但是总体来说，绝对是玩不厌的一款游戏！ 如果你细数以前的几个版本，这是此系列的第三个游戏了，你能够从以往的游戏中看到此版本在各方面的进步。 这本来是一个社区项目，而且一年的时间以来都只是呈现一个早期访问的模式。最后的结果，可以说是令人惊喜万分。它是几种游戏类的结合体，是一个大胆的作品，像是在往4X发展却也不是4X，它使用了RPG元素来丰富和加强游戏体验。背景音乐也是更上一层楼。画面绝对精致，你只需要去看看小行星带就会有所体会。地图巨大！总的来说，超其所值。 不好之处：版本不多，而且有一些小错误。舰队中的船只可能会有点笨重，时不时会撞到你。有时自由职业任务会变成主线任务。我只有一次碰到过此情况，所以在这儿提一下...... 总体上来讲是一个很出色的游戏。你可以见到自己的总部，循序渐进地规划你的行程，征服地域并且在双子星上扩张你的势力，这类的游戏体验给我留下了深刻的印象，绝对要向大家推荐。 DLC同时也值得购买因为他们在游戏中添加了非常大量的新鲜元素。赏金任务十分有趣，并给你提供了双子星上的一些传奇级别的船只，泰坦可以说是美丽的野兽，能够最终提升终极火力来征服敌军的残余。 百分十一百绝对要再去征服一次双子星！

author: {'steamid': '76561198309815871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1469647675}

author: {'steamid': '76561198051713704', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 3988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1642704748}
review: Купил не играл толком на данный момент, но скажу вот что, ребята стараются и не отправляют под штампом ГОТОВО, проект они показывают свое развитие над каждоый каждой мелочью игры, они реально работают, нет 10 месячных апдейтов есть реальный факт поправили поставили протестили на сервачке у себя и потом пользователям нет скрытых "АПДЕЙТОВ" аля мы что то сделали а вы гадайте. Кто пишет типо ждал стратегию ГОСПОДИ ты хоть понимаешь что это отдельная вселенная И НЕ НАДО нам стратегий каких под штампом Хом фронт спамят под каждой игрой. Если хочешь стратегию так выбирай Соответствующий раздел в стиме или твои недальновидные действия при покупе не способны сообразить поставить пару галочек? Зачем писать не рекомендующий комент если вы реально Хотели стратегию но купили Санд Бокс РПГ? Что за Гении что за господи где такие люди рождаются откуда такие вообще появляются.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996368567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2144, 'last_played': 1557062447}
review:
(Review Early Access Beta 24/04/2017)

Le moins qu'on puisse dire, c'est que cet Early Access a fait du chemin ! Très lent au début, et soudain: BOUM ! Toutes nos features cheries sont arrivées ! Un mini-jeu pour le boarding, une gestion de structures, de territoires et de flottes : Les flottes et les structures sont désormais visbiles et vous pouvez même les solliciter pour vous appuyer !

Bref, de longues heures de jeu en perspective avec un multitude de nouveaux vaisseaux par-rapport à SPG2... Et une communauté Workshop qui démarre en douceur.

OUI !

author: {'steamid': '76561198007207141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1498339680}
review:
Completely fricking pointless.

At the moment, while the idea is solid, and shows potential, the control system is so erratic, with the control method switching without rhyme, or reason, and the damage output switching without telling you why (seriously, I maxed out my weapons output, and spent 5 minutes pumping damage into a target to get it down one tick of damage, meanwhile I have no shields, I'm almost dead, and my low level target is giggling all the way to the bank)

I'm not sure if this is me sucking, a game mechanic I don't understand, or a bug in the code. Some insightful combat tutorial that actually explained something (as opposed to what you get... tab A into slot B) might actually help alleviate this. At the moment, this game sucks from the basement to the ground floor, and fllors 1, 2, and 3 aren't looking to promising either...

A game on it's 3rd go through should be this lacking in polish, even in an alpha form.

I will fix this review at a later date.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120967354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4558, 'last_played': 1499388002}
review:
This game is designed by motivated and enthusiastic developers. They want the player to have both an original gameplay and a challenging space. Visuals including background, planets, space ships, and headquarters always get improved with every update. Updates are regular and always full of new content. 

Bugs can be found but rarely and mostly don’t bother the gameplay. Flying and maneuvering are unique. I loved Rebel Galaxy but this game takes this genre to another level by adding vertical flight, challenging controls, and a variety of weapons. All controls can be mapped to shortcuts which after couple of hours makes you feel as a real captain activating ship modules on the fly, shields, speed boosters, devastating expensive torpedoes, railguns, lasers, missiles; all this while trying to avoid challenging alien AI ships and managing your equipement.

This game has both fast and slow playability. Fast combats excel in engaging weapons, ship speed, maneuverability, shields, and power management. Slow gaming is mostly discovering new space zones, asteroid fields, clocking and escaping large swarms of alien AIs. Relaxing gameplay is a sure thing, but if you are hungry for destruction and tactics you wont get disappointed.

Bigger ships come with higher experience level of your character, hence nastier swarms and smarter AI. Get bigger weapons, more shields and bad ass fighter wings that you can launch into combat whenever you feel you need help or otherwise want to decimate your opponents.

Finally, there is conquering new territories, making alliances, sending civilian fleets to survey, scrap ores, collect gas and more. War fleets are also for you to control, helping you attack AI enemy garrisons. Make civilians engage in collecting material so you could build bigger war fleets, upgrade your headquarters and build bigger ships.

Yes all this and more are already playable in Early Access. 

Cheers Captains

author: {'steamid': '76561198083608100', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1469374318}
review: i got this game cause i thought it would be good but i could not play it cause of a error message i kept on getting allso i tryed to send in a suport tick but it would not work so i recommend you  hold off on buying this game for a while maybe it will get better thank you steam for the refund

author: {'steamid': '76561198023542892', 'num_games_owned': 2391, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1497927298}
review:
Все тот же Starpoint Gemini только с возможностью улучшать станцию, строить флот и захватывать территории. Но летаем мы все так же на своем корабле, а не управляем как в стратегии. Можно отметить низкую цену, так как сейчас даже на инди игры лепят ценники в 1к руб и больше. И отсутствие русского перевода, опять перед релизом прикрутят кривой  Prompt перевод. В остальном же ничего нового.  

Если вам понравилась предыдущая игра Starpoint Gemini 2 то эта часть вам точно понравиться за счет улучшенных возможностей, если нет или вам нравятся серьезные  x4 стратегии, то проходите мимо, это вам не аналог Stellaris.

Негативный обзор, потому что ожидал от игры, что это будет полноценная стратегия по вселенной  Starpoint Gemini с глобальной картой и выбором стороны конфликта. Хотя игра в EA и может к релизу сделают еще сценарии.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055532498', 'num_games_owned': 679, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1608063373}
review: I would absolutely recommend this game. Even though, at the moment, its an alpha, its still a ton of fun. It took everything I loved about SPG2 and made it more indepth, and interesting. The combat can get absolutely crazy in this game. I've ended up in battles with 20 other ships at a time, and it is glooorious! I can't say much about the campaign since the only part there is the prologue, but it caught my attention and interest. So if you can afford it, again, I would recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210242761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1519672393}
review:
This game may run like a rock on my computer, mainly due to my computer's lack of ram, but the time put into the graphics makes up for it as it is awesome to look at and play. It also helps to not try and run this game at the ultra setting instead of the low setting. The difference in just the different settings helps me from not able to play it to being able to enjoy it, though at a lowered fps. If you have not played this game I personally recommend to play it even though it is a early game.

It is just like my personal view of a movie, if you go in with no expectations then coming out you will have had a generally better time compared to if you had high expectations and come out displeased with the movie.

(Update) I got a much better computer and I can now play this game like it was meant to be played and I'm still liking it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010408083', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1501877428}
review:
This could be the new "X"!

The tutorial took about an hour and was well explained and fun! After you finish it you are free to continue the freeplay scenario and take over the galaxy. All the elements that you would expect from the genre are here. The engine looks great and runs well - no crashes. I really like the HUD which is remeniscent of Starfleet Command, indeed a lot of the combat options are taken from such games (eg hail, tractor, transport troops). Combat plays like both spaceships (x-wing/freespace) and starships (I-war/Bridge Commander) depending on your ship, and pressing tab to change between first/third person/turret view. You get to select your characters backstory but I think that's as far as they've implemented the RPG mechanics so far, to be expected since this isn't the single player campaign. There's base building modules like Homeworld and station construction like X. The learning curve is pretty easy and nothing like Battlecruiser! 

All in all a solid alpha worth your time and money. 

Minor feedback for the devs:
Icarus is pronounced incorrectly with a hard IKE.
The starfield seems bland, maybe because all the stars are the same brightness.
Combat is a little too fast and too precise which makes it hard to get kills.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026767411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 3482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3482, 'last_played': 1497582407}
review:
Updated!!!!! 6/10/2017

Updated Bit: THe finished product is great and only has 2 issues. Sounds in large battles and not being able to customize your own Fleets colors/weapons. Other than that the game is everything the last was but then some.  

This game is amazing. IT is with out a doubt in my mind gonna turn out to be like Sins of a Solar Empire and Star Point had a A baby and taht baby had a baby with civ 5 and created this wonderful thing. You get to control and work an empire in control of your own ship also and actually fight.

To the devs of this game. Yous are doing something special with this game and are going to have one hell of a hit of a game.


FIGHTING:::
So the fighting in it is perfect. You can either have it be auto or your choice as you fly around ships in circles and master your ability to pilot at at level 1 take out a lvl 10 ship. 

This game is a perfect example of needing skill to Fly and shoot unless you use auto aim. But by the time you start getting into it you will get the combat down and be the warlord that you want to be.

SUPPORT WISE::
They are FUCKING AMAZING WITH IT.  You got a bugged game? NP send them your save and tell them whats wrong and BAM you get it back within an hour or so. They have great Customer support and techincal support going on.

The FInal Fontier "Prob spelled that wrong"
YOU CAN FLY ANYWHERE the galaxy is huge and its just beautiful and amazing to be in.

JOBS:::
YOu have jobs either escort "pays 100k+"
You have Hunting down criminals "Pays 90k+"
Then you have the relaxing jobs of exploring new space.
You can also Mine.

This game is great People need to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048069011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1680041086}
review:
Los desarrolladores escuchan a la comunidad e implementan cambios en torno a las opiniones. Desde que adquiri el juego hasta el día de la fecha, han sacado varios parches con grandes cantidades de contenido. Si se fijan en los analisis de la gente, veran que respoden a varios analisis negativos con proposiciones, y las cumplen, y parche tras parche preguntan si se está satisfecho con el cambio.

Sinceramente, esto lo vi en pocos EA. 

En fin, como seguidor de la saga, estoy mas que satisfecho, es fiel a sus antesesores, y le agrega el plus de tener crafteos, conquistas y todo un nuevo sistema de alianzas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006939633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1642475522}

author: {'steamid': '76561198171972453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 31315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8784, 'last_played': 1551781297}
review:
Would you recommend this game? Yes, yes, a thousand times yes! 

LGM was always friendly and active dev team, but with this game they proved they lsitened to their community. I remember many features people were requesting in Starpoint Gemini 2 and they delivered. This is like a dream come true and I'm excited to see how the game will change in the following months! Call me a fanboy, I don't mind, I have almost 200 hours in the game already and I'm truly enjoying the vasteness of this universe and freedom I have.

10/10 Brilliant, beautiful, smooth, fun!

With around 40 ships in Early Access and 90 on release this is better then some AAA games that don't have 20 ships in full versions! Highly recommended!!!

Of course, this is Early Access game which means it will crash and behave strange at times, and there is plenty of content and mechanics that are not yet implemented. But if you truly want to participate in game development, with this team you can't go wrong, because they care and they listen. They've proved that a thousand times already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172039049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 11139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1518046614}
review:
Absolutely recommended. Just visit the forums and see for yourself how actively developers talk to their players. This is alpha version, devs are discussing features with players and implement their ideas. The way it's supposed to be in Early Access. There are bugs and ocassional crashes, but I do not doubt it will get polished until the final release. Game has big potential, it's core mechanics are similar to their previous title but with added features like owning your battlestation, manufacturing your own ships and conquring the universe. Can't wait to see what's coming next. 

Recommended for people who are used to alpha builds of games. 
Not recommended for people who want flawless final product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172017678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 19798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1548776423}
review:
First of all, this is not a final release, many people somehow miss that. But the potential is amazing, game is fun and it's growing rapidly from update to update. 

Pros: 
+ Amazing graphics
+ Many ships to choose from
+ Fantastic music
+ 4X element of conquering the universe
+ Fun and dynamic gameplay, unlike full 4x games that tend to be "slower"
+ Excellent discounted EA price

Cons: 
- Ocassional issues and bugs (perfectly fine for EA, but just wanted to mention it)
- Many features and mechanics are not in yet
- Space is not properly populated yet so it 
- No controller support (it will come but it's not in at the moment)

All in all, even the cons are not something that is definite, since game development is in progress, but for people that might expect a nearly finished Gama product, this is not it. LGM is well known for their activity on forums and direct inreaction with players and they listen to the community and implement community suggested features. And they finish their projects, unlike so many other Early Access titles. :(

This is the game in the making. If you want a final product, I can suggest their previous title Starpoint Gemini 2. Or just wishlist it and wait for the final release. I didn't. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198011256744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 5708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5009, 'last_played': 1671726576}
review:
Big fan of Starpoint Gemini 2 and the Devs. I dont leave good reviews often but i feel i should in this case. Mostly because of the Devs being very vocal and helpful which is very hard to find but also because i really like the game.

Its almost like a simpler X3 game, i think "casual" might be the right way to describe. Sure there are a few bugs etc and maybe your wondering if its worth the money. Well one way i like to look at buying games and if its worth it is how much gameplay can i get out of it. The answer is if you like X3 type games then ALOT. 

I took the wife to the cinema the other week and ended up spending almost £100 on a few hours entertainment. I bought this for idk £15 and i can see myself getting a good 100+ hours out of it so its worth it in my book.

So in short: Good Devs + Good Game = Good Investment

author: {'steamid': '76561197982000955', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1548904566}
review:
As much as I would like to love this game I dont think I can recommend it at this time.  I have made a few attempts to get into it and there are a few things that just keep getting in my way: 

* Graphics : Ship models are nice, combat effects are annoying and GUI is too bright
* AI: dumb as a brick
* Confusing interfaces: The various loadout options are poorly organized and are difficult to understand their strengths, there is almost no way to guage how effective a gun actually is until you buy it and use it.
* Had multiple situations where I couldn't figure out why I was soo weak I couldnt kill the mission target...I had civilian fleets but they apparently dont exist in the game and are mearly a map toy for getting resources.  I built ships at my station ...saw them once..they helped once...then were gone??

I never get the feeling that I'm actually controlling anything.  For whatever reason I have a station, I have the ability to do upgrades (which at this point are not fully implemented), and I can build ships..but none of it feels like it has any impact what so ever.

Perhaps this will improve whent he game gets out of Early Access ( but thats not a popular trend these days, most games like to sit on that status forever).

author: {'steamid': '76561198144643304', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 3767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2196, 'last_played': 1569456029}
review:
相对于2，军阀无论界面还是画质都比像2那样的多少年前的画质好多了。看这个宣传片貌似是2里面的帝国逃出来反抗，主角在的concordia就是原先帝国的逃难舰队（不过有一点...帝国在2里的残存势力不是已经被主角和战争狂肃清了吗）？目前还是测试阶段这个游戏很多问题还没有弄清，也希望开发商不要再犯上一代的错误，就是...剧情模式里头不要仅仅就对话---2里的剧情模式就是图片和对话，而且感觉剧情很多地方很尴尬，比如2里的主角对战争狂的态度很奇怪，2里的章鱼人到底是帝国自己的研究玩火自焚还是因为入侵，最不科学的是2里的帝国母舰是强的一笔护盾护甲都是倍数还防人传送为什么被章鱼的母舰搞垮了，何况帝国的船这么多而主角开着的双子星点的小破船进去平安无事了？？？（还有就是...2的宣传片我没看懂和游戏哪重要部分相关虽然做的挺棒= =）

不过有一点...为什么军阀里的菜单界面中间的指挥官是2的主角？？？？？？？

敌人显示还是略淡，敌人显示还是略淡，敌人显示还是略淡！重要的事情说三遍，看着眼睛累

感觉基本双子星点的世界观就是混乱，和无主差不多的那种（虽然听开发商他们做这个游戏根本没有投资，说是纯粹兴趣？）


最关键的一点是，LGM至少没有像辣鸡hello games一样没有素质，没错说的就是你no man's sky，SM辣鸡根本不关心玩家，还在一起看黑客军团根本没有打算继续开发这个游戏。也十分感谢LGM采纳了我对空间站室内动画的意见，星球和空间站着陆之后不再像2只有一副打模糊的截图或者是一张图片了（custom自定义飞船外观我实际上用来看空间站内饰的...嗯...---划掉涂黑），非常的用心，这一点比任何都要可贵。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971403658', 'num_games_owned': 533, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1020, 'last_played': 1520216800}
review:
July 10, 2016 - v .505

Loads of potential, as long as the devs keep up with it this could be a great space game. keep your eye on it

Feb 1, 2017 - v .750

Huuuge update. Still things to work on but its not out of EA yet. You can now fly around, do more missions, have your fleet accompany you wherever you go, upgrade your base of operations, trade. You can see where they plan on going with most of the map blacked out/inaccessible but this has been a big step in the right direction. There are still things to be improved upon like better control of fleet and more content etc but the devs are actively listening to the community and there's plenty more to come.

April 4, 2018 - 1.800.0

So the game has been out for awhile now and gotten quite a few large patches and DLC's added. While I do wish there was a better or alternate mode for pilotting, they do you have a couple ways, it doesn't stop me from recommending this game. Especially if you can get it on sale and pick up a couple of the DLC's as well. I haven't gotten all the DLCs but the ones I have gotten add a decent amount of content to the game and even without them the patches they have put out have optimized and added added more to the game in themselves. If you like this genre this is definitely one to try.

The amount of free-play is stunning even in this stage of early acces. If you like siencefiction series like Startrek Online, then you will want to get this game as well. Shooting down badguys for a bounty? Yes you can!
Trading goods with other stations? Yes you can!
Salvaging derelict vessels? Yes you can!
Building your own HQ? Yes you can!

10 / 10 rating if the developers keep this up during the regular updates!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995321994', 'num_games_owned': 1521, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1696768319}
review:
Starpoint Gemini Warlord is a 4x strategy, space trading/combat simulator as well as an RPG from Little Green Men Gaming. In the game, you play as the commander of a human fleet trying to expend humanity’s control over the galactic world. Before I do any more comments keep in mind, the game is in early access therefore some features might be missing. 

The question many might ask is ‘’is Starpoint Gemini Warlord for me?’’ and the answer for now depends of your expectations. You often fight groups of two to three enemies quite often if you go in the rival’s area and the combat can be frustrating if you are not great at targeting. Luckily, there is a fire at will button that can be activated which negates this issue. On the other hand, combat can take quite a long time even for a few ships which could get tedious for some.

The skill system of the game is quite fun. You have a couple of trees and each level you can increase your attributes by selecting a skill. I was a bit disappointed in the amount of skills, since I expected a bigger variety. Right now the selection is pretty low.

While the game is in early access, it has quite some frustrating issues at the moment (which are to be expected). For instance, money is a big issue due to many bugged missions which can create tedious situations while trying to rank up in order to get better ships. On the same time, travel times can take a while due to the sheer size of the world. Upgrading the main base can be an issue as well since it takes millions while missions only award you 10-20k per mission. Unless the devs decide to increase the amount of cash gained through missions, the players will get bored eventually.

Another issue I found was the game’s campaign (which is not out yet). The prologue is the only part available for now and it amounts to about 40 minutes after which the game becomes a sandbox. Is it a bad thing? Yes, and no. While it is fun to go right into sandbox, Starpoint Gemini Warlords is a complex game therefore a campaign would have helped massively.

Despite all the issues discussed above, Starpoint Gemini Warlords is an excellent space simulator game. Yes, there are issues, the game is incomplete and lacks features and some issues can drive you crazy, but the developers are quite active on the forum and work constantly in order to improve their game. For anyone willing to support the developers and their hard work, I recommend this game.

For our popular daily giveaways and similar reviews head over to http://www.steamified.com/

To begin your journey through our myriad of social media join our Steam Group

author: {'steamid': '76561198043250032', 'num_games_owned': 2464, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 1055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1483454117}
review:
[h1]Become the galactic warlord you’ve always wanted to be. [/h1]

Starpoint Gemini Warlords is the latest Starpoint Gemini game, a series of space RPGs, from Little Green Men Games. Warlords takes the SPG series to a larger scale and offers some 4X elements due to the fact you play as a commander of the human fleet, you have your own war fleets and you even have your own station that acts as your faction’s headquarters. SPG Warlords is still in the Alpha phase of its development so while most of its core mechanics are in place they are often barebones and there’s still a few things which aren’t in the game at all, for example the story doesn’t extend further than a twenty-thirty minute prologue mission before you’re left to play in the game’s enormous sandbox.

It’s worth remembering that Warlords is still very early in its development. Most of the planned features are in (minus a campaign, the more complex conquest features and a few other bits and bobs) but they can feel a little barebones at times. It’s still an enjoyable game, especially for fans of the series or other space sandbox games, but if you’re looking for a more fleshed out experience it might be worth waiting a few more months before you pick it up.

The whole idea of Warlords is to offer players a similar style of gameplay (with added 4X elements) as the previous SPG games but on a much larger scale. Part of this is having much larger ships and the new ships are awesome, though just as with SPG2 you’ll be starting with a rather weak ship. Conquest is what really takes the game up a level though. Since you’re now the leader of your very own faction it’s up to you to capture surrounding sectors (you start with two). 

While the conquest mechanics are a welcome addition, they are still fairly basic at the moment. That said it’s still fun/rewarding to take over other sectors. I have two problems with the way conquest/sector mechanics are currently implemented. My first problem is that you begin surrounded on all sides by hostile sectors and it takes a long time to get a ship powerful enough to start attacking garrisons (taking over garrisons is how you take over sectors) without getting absolutely destroyed. This severely limits your options for trading and to some extent mining so early on you’ll have to do Job Board missions to begin with. My other issue is that the fleet mechanics are incredibly basic at the moment. As far as I’ve seen you only get one fleet which is rebuilt automatically when destroyed. Having one fleet isn’t too bad, the problem is it seems to have a Fleet Power cap at 350 and there’s no way (currently) to upgrade your fleet further. While this may be okay for some garrison attacks, I’ve seen a certain type of ship at a couple of different garrisons which is capable of destroying my entire fleet as well as my ship, making it impossible to capture new sectors. This issue will obviously be dealt with as fleet mechanics are updated but right now it’s pretty frustrating.

Currently, Job Board missions are the best way to make money. There are quite a few different types of jobs such as convoy escort, convoy raid, delivery, search & destroy, salvage etc. The more combat-focused missions generally pay better though they’re also a lot harder (especially with early-game ships). Generally the only difference between one mission and the next of the same type is the location you’ll be going to and this applies to most if not all of the jobs so the only way to keep them interesting is to mix up what kind of jobs you’re doing.

As you’d expect from a space game, Warlords has an absolutely huge map. Even travelling within an individual sector can take a while so I can’t imagine how long it would take for you to go from one side of the map to another. The map size is great but just like with SPG2 I do find the long journey times (especially with the slower early-game ships) to be fairly tedious, though travelling through enemy sectors does lead to a lot of enemy encounters (not necessarily a good thing, depends on how much you like the game’s combat).

Combat hasn’t really changed since SPG2 but it’s definitely a case of if it ain’t broke don’t fix it. I can’t remember if this was in SPG2 or if this is new but there’s a fire at will command in game now which automates your attacks, I was never any good at combat in SPG2 and I haven’t really improved so I like to use this whenever I get into combat. For those looking to use manual fire during combat it’s fairly straightforward, just point and shoot. The real challenge from combat comes from managing your power between propulsion, shields and weapons. Generally speaking you fight groups of enemies but occasionally you’ll only be fighting one or two. 

You can also develop skills and perks to help you in and out of combat. Currently there’s no choice over what skills you have but there’s a good bit of variation between the four of them. Your skill points are used to improve the different effects of that skill. You can focus on making one effect of one skill really powerful or you can spread out your skill points across the four different skills so you have more, albeit weaker, options during combat (though some skills have effects which are beneficial outside of combat too). If you want to, you can activate all four skills at once but using skills consumes energy and the more you have active at once the faster your energy drains. There’s quite a lot of variation when it comes to perks. They’re split up into several different categories and each category has several different skills, most of which have several levels. There are basic perks that improve your ability to use a certain class of ship while others improve Trader prices, weapon damage etc. 

Visually, Warlords is great. I’m only playing on Medium settings but it looks as good, if not better than SPG2, it’s undoubtedly even better on higher settings. The ship design is absolutely fantastic, just like it was in the previous game. I haven’t come across a single ship that doesn’t look cool yet, even the Freighter class ships look great! The UI has also been improved from SPG2’s, it’s more basic now but it’s a lot easier to use. 

[h1]Verdict [/h1]

Warlords is on course to be a bigger and better version of SPG2 but its journey to get there is still in its infancy. It’s already a lot of fun to play but as it can feel a little barebones at times. If you’re a fan of the Starpoint Gemini series or space sandbox games in general then I’d say it’s worth picking up, if not you may want to wait until it’s been fleshed out more before you pull the trigger on it.

[i][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/lonerangerreviews]Lone Ranger Reviews.[/url][/i]

El K.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105885393', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 10338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7440, 'last_played': 1609842418}
review:
First off, if all the signs aren't clear enough... THIS GAME IS IN EARLY ACCESS
Secondly, updates are monthly, where they drip feed us content
That is till last week or so where we were blessed with 2 within a week or so

So anyhoes onto the game:
Freaking amazing on paper, currently implemented well, Devs are really onto it online with helping out with queries and the like, as well as taking suggestions.
Building your spacestation is amazing. I currently own like almost 1/6th or so of the map.
Conquering is easy if you have a solid fleet. Areas are packed with ships sometimes, overwhelmingly enemy ships.
As long as you constantly look at your map, you can find places of interest as well as enemy structures. 
If you work heaps like me I recommend a little afk gaming, just to help with getting resources, because it can be very expensive.
Missing plenty of content but as I said earlier Early Access game so yeah
Screw all that pen is mightier than the sword crap... Imma bash some alien skulls or whatever they are

Oh and kudos on the ships, they look freaking sick. I didnt like a single ship design in SG2 (not that I played it long enough to see them all) so I'm loving the new art direction. 

Ps. Devs youre amazing keep up the good work





Updated: 27.05.20
Came back to this game and it runs like shit. The game was pretty cool but theyve gone ahead and released another game instead of finishing this one.
Do not recommend it now

author: {'steamid': '76561198073931344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 13335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2064, 'last_played': 1676725096}
review:
The only other starpoint game I have played was starpoint gemini 2, and I haven't gotten that far into the game but I still liked it. When I heard that Warlords was available I went to buy it at the first opportunity, after checking the system requirements because of my slightly obsolete pc (3.2GHz). In the first 50 minutes of playing this game on the lowest quality, I was amazed by what I had played so far. The only complaint I have is the fact that the game was somewhat laggy even on the lowest settings but since this is an early access game I will let that slide as I hope for some optimisation updates in the future. Or I get enough money for a better CPU. Either way works.

EDIT: Turns out it was my GPU, not CPU. Still need an upgrade but the game runs MUCH better, making the game even more enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061690258', 'num_games_owned': 2809, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1473836852}
review:
[h1]Ah... The immensity of space! So many quantum implications, many unified theories (!), so many possibilities, so much potential.[/h1]

Starpoint Gemini Warlords is going to be really all that the description shows.

I make this review at v 0.504, in early access. And the game is amazing. Admittedly it’s too early to know how a game will be, but, already impressive. There are some bugs, nothing to panic!
Now the game contains the prologue and some missions. In this point I Make my character with motivations, personality, avatar and some features of background.  Usually in Spacial Strategy games you are in charge of a fleet or even an empire. And the game begins this way. Something a little impersonal, I think. And then, the accident! The escape pod. A survivor!  I was happy to see that I was a character with a background that could be chosen as authentic RPG's. Now the game started to me. 

You can make many types of work: search and destroy, salvage, escort, trades… just stop at planets or space stations. All very well explained. The missions have a level suggested, but if you are strong and fearless, you can try at any level. 
Your ship is all automatic, but you also control what you want to manually. Everything can be manipulated: the weapons, navigation, scan. I know, I tested. I went to enemy territory and died. But I got some rewards and experience. And you can hit a ship or meteor.

When your ship is docked you can trade, buy equipment (your ship is completely customizable), accept jobs. You can read the news in the Holocom news. (I went a satellite and saw the Holocom!) That tells you about space situation, and possible jobs.

The look of the game is wonderful. The scenery is beautiful and varied, even though we are in space: Colored nebulae, meteorites, planets, dark zones. The ships are very detailed and functional. With a nice design that escapes from the cliché. The animation and movements are fluids and realistic. There are many graphic options. Thanks! So your pc will be fine.

The music is immersive and gracious, proper. That music that reminds you that you are in space. The sound effects are professional and proper too. Like movies. No Star Wars. The voice actors are better now. I remember someone complaining about it in another game Starpoint Gemini. So I went to check,… and yes, they are better now.
I confess that my first game Starpoint Gemini and I suggest this game to beginners like me. Much. And to veterans too, of course! 

There is not storyline yet, and yet it seems so fun. When to ready to release: more ships, more characters, more weapons, more everything! Man, It will be the game! Serious.


   Art: 9/10               Sound:9/10                     Gameplay: 9/10                  Fun: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198011873284', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1399, 'last_played': 1643060089}
review:
Dies ist meine erste Bewertung eines Spiels hier bei Steam, also habt ein wenig Nachsicht, falls ich nicht so strukturiert schreibe wie andere. Danke

Starpoint Gemini Warlords.

Ich konnte das Spiel nun endlich mal die ersten 10 Stunden antesten und ich sehe jede Menge Potential.

Vorab, es ist genauso malerisch wie Starpoint Gemini 2. Die Hintergründe beim Flug durchs All geben dem Spiel ein ganz besonderes Flair.

Hier in der "Alpha" des Spiels sind viele Elemente noch nicht eingebunden, das Leveln, Geld verdienen und erleben des Spiels geht aber schon. Ebenso gibt es eine schöne Auswahl an Schiffen.

Die Missionen sind derzeit meiner Meinung nach die Haupteinnahmequelle. Vor allem da man meinem Empfinden nach im Moment nur mit Missionen genau richtig Levelt und Geld verdient. Dabei geht die Palette von schnöden Transportaufträgen (Waren werden automatisch aufs Schiff verladen) hin zu Zeitaufträgen oder einer Verbrecherjagd, und zu guter letzt bis hin zu Assaultaufträgen, bei denen man eine Basis sammt Schutzflotte vernichten soll.

Der Basis-Bau existiert imo nur als rudimentäre Ausführung ohne spieltechnischen Effekt, Schön anzusehen ist es dennoch. 

In Bezug auf Diplomatie, Sektoreroberung und der gleichen kann ich leider noch nichts zu aussagen, da hier wohl auch noch nicht viel möglich ist. (korrigiert mich, wenn ichs nur nicht gefunden habe ^^)

Besonders vermisse ich im Moment die komfortable Tabelle (in der Mapübersicht) und die Farbanzeigen beim Handeln mit Stationen und Planeten. Als Händler mit Stift und Papier jeden Preis zu notieren, ist bei der Anzahl der Handelswaren nicht sonderlich erbaulich. Auch hoffe ich, dass die Hintergrundbilder in der Planetenansicht wieder eingeführt werden.

Fazit für mich: Unglaublich viele Möglichkeiten und ein wirklich gut gelungenes, großes und schön anzusehendes Universum (für den Anfang)

author: {'steamid': '76561198069025017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4944, 'last_played': 1666067961}
review:
Great game so far has real potential an its still early access... is it worth the money for me yes it did not take long to get sucked in to it... there is a lot of things you have to figure out on your own yes but the do cover all the basics with the guide and the devs are responsive and from wat I’ve see do try the best to respond to your Q with  As... i enjoy all of the space frontier games. an I have feeling if the team keeps it up this game will go far...  Ill edit an add more later.

UPDATE 5/24/2017

So, I’ve been on and off the game during early access and have seen all the different aspects of the game change but they still keep to the core of Starpoint titles. I keep seeing all these negative reviews about how they were hoping for this game or that game style I think you need to read the title and do some homework before complaining about the game I keep seeing these .3 and 1.4 hours game reviews with no substantial remarks other than the usual “I played the game it was too difficult for me so I’m going to give it a bad rating and say false thing about game instead of admitting that I suck at gamming”. The best part about this game are the DEVs and GMs are always monitoring threads on forums and respond to your support help questions. This game has come a long way and the DEVs have listened and talked with the active players throughout the Alpha, Beta, and early released state of game and I believe they will continue to do so. 
	So, to close this thing off with one simple request of all who read this and for those who are entering this game fresh give it a shot it’s a great game with future updates just waiting to be released. If you have questions ask them. If you find and issue in game address it by following the proper steps there are support tabs on the launcher menu as well as forums the DEVs will answer your questions. If your new and like a good challenge then come give this game a shot as for the gamers who’ve played the predecessors to this game than its same base with a twist that you will enjoy and hours of fun and mayhem… that’s all for now ill update again at later date

author: {'steamid': '76561197969458821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1551572817}
review:
What I've seen of this, I love the idea of. I've already spent a fair amount of time with this game, and while I do share some of the common complaints about things such as Travel and enemy fleet density, I find that for an Alpha, this is extremely well done. 

First of all, the environments are outstanding visually. I would however like to see a slightly more dynamic background. A Static flat image the show the greater deep space just kind of kills the illusion of depth and makes it feel like your kind of playing in a box. Meanwhile the debris and asteroids are well placed and kind of offset the distance issue a bit. 

Combat feels pretty fluid for the most part, I would however like to see a turret view where you can Aim the turret manually while the ship flies on it's own pattern. Minor detail there. Target cycling feels a little cluncky, but I've been using manutal click targeting for the most part anyway so I can't really say much on that one. 

What voice acting there is, seems believeable, though I do hope for some variations in the sound design a bit to make them sounds like they are coming from a com system as opposed to a person right inside the ship. 

Navigating the menu's is pretty easy, though the one complaint I have there is that when trying to leave say the docking menu, I tend to his esc and hit the main menu instead of being returned to space, so that might be something worth considering for the final version. 

In terms of hard suggestions, I'd probably say to dial back the Docking request distance of planets a bit, as the textures seem to lose all Their effect at that close range, perhaps impliment some kind of gravity well that prevents players from coming in that close to help maintain some degree of illusion that they are near a planet. 

The game seems pretty heavily reliant on the context sensitive menu, so perhaps a quicker transition to the menu would help to maintain immersion in the game. As it stands now it's semi Disruptive to the immersive feel of the game (Deffinatly don't eliminate it though, it's a nice touch)


All in all I like where this is going. I'm eager to see the direction this game goes, and what happens to it's overall development. I'd recommend this game very much because I feel that this will be one massive beast of a space game. From what I see at the Alpha level, I can only imagine what's set to be in the final release. 

If the game ends with the scale and depth that this Alpha alludes to, It'll be a top notch game no matter what kind of player you are.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004059762', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2820, 'last_played': 1480877151}
review:
To be honest I have never played starpoint gemini 1 and 2 , but my friend has recommended me this game since I like early access games.

Although this is early access alpha I did not encounter any major problems while playing the game, only a crash here and there which is completely normal in this development stage. But you don't have to worry about losing your progress because auto save is doing its job perfectly fine.

If this is your first time playing starpoint gemini I would strongly recommend to read quick start guide which you can find on game launcher window. In-game tutorials are not finished yet so this guide helped me a lot.

Game content and features in short:
 [olist]
 [*]Only one scenario is available for now.

 [*]One of four character classes available (Marshal) others will be available in the future. Every class has 4 own skills and every skill has 5 modifiers. Each time you level up you get one skill point to redistribute it how you see fit.
 Every 5 levels you get one perk point which gives you additional bonuses (not yet implemented).
 
 [*]Huge open world map, random encounters and lot of exploring.

 [*]Earn credits by trading, mining, salvaging. Or take a freelance job like salvage, search and destroy, escort, trade, delivery and many more. Amount of credits you will receive depends on a mission difficulty and your successfulness to do it. Check potential reward and distance to see if it is even worth the risk.

 [*]There is around 40 ships available for you to command and a lot more to come. You can buy ships in shipyard but not all ships are available everywhere. For some ships you will need to have specific rank to be able to fly it. In drydock you have options to repair, rearm, mount, buy/sell weapons, enchantments, equipment  and customize your ship.

 [*]Construction panel allows you to build your own headquarters and upgrade it. Every time you upgrade your hub module you will get more turrets, more storage room, options to build hangar module, tactical ops, salvage depot, trade center, production plant and many more.
[/olist]
LGM developers are friendly and very active on steam discussions and on their official forum. They are listening to community and trying to fix problems as soon as they can. Updates are coming out exactly when they say it will while fixing the existing problems and bringing in new content.
